description: I regard every wine we try as a treat. But our next wine is one that I especially love: fino sherry from Jerez de la Frontera in the Andalusia region of southern Spain. It is completely different in several ways from any of the wines weve examined before.

title: Aglianico, a Red With a Sense of Place
description: Good wines are never just one thing. They are instead an expression of two parts, grape and place, with the help of a third, producer. If each of these three things is well suited to the others and in proper balance, then they combine to reveal a fourth, terroir, which transcends the other three. That, above all, is the elusive quality we strive to find here at Wine School.

title: Affordable Timepieces for Watch Snobs
description: Six timepieces under $1,000 that get props from watch connoisseurs.

title: Egyptian Officials on Defensive Amid Uproar Over Police Brutality Cases
description: LUXOR, Egypt  Scarcely half an hour after police officers arrested Talaat Shabeeb at a cafe here last week and accused him of selling drugs, his body was returned to his family with signs of torture, marked by broad blue bruises, his relatives said.

title: S.E.C. Charges 3 Options Traders With Spoofing
description: Three Chicago-based options traders are under scrutiny over a manipulative form of electronic trading called spoofing that has garnered increasing attention by regulators.

title: Is There a Doctor in the Marriage?
BTG Pactual and the Perils of Supervoting Stock
description: BTG Pactual offers a case against companies issuing multiple classes of stock. The investment banks former boss, Andr Esteves, who is incarcerated, has ceded voting control in a stock swap with his partners. Its a neat fix, but reveals yet another risk of supervoting stock. Investors in companies with similar structures  like Google, Moelis & Company and nearly every major media firm  should take heed.

title: Lyft Joins With Asian Rivals to Compete With Uber
description: The anti-Uber global alliance of ride-hailing companies has now officially taken shape.

title: TV May Be Bad for Your Brain
description: Watching television may be bad for your brain, a new study suggests.

title: Israel Arrests Young Jews Suspected of Terrorism Against Palestinians
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli government has in recent days been arresting young Jewish extremists suspected of being a part of a terrorist network that carried out a deadly attack against Palestinians, the national security agency Shin Bet said on Thursday.

title: Living With Cancer: Hurry Up and Wait
description: A hostile letter from a reader made me stop and think about the torments of waiting that cancer patients endure: waiting for a doctor, waiting for radiation, waiting for the delivery of chemotherapy drugs, waiting through interminable infusions or transfusions, waiting for a scan or a biopsy, waiting for the results of a scan or a biopsy, waiting (sometimes starved and unclothed on a gurney in a hall) for surgery.

title: Officers Lawyers Try to Shift Blame in Freddie Grays Death
description: BALTIMORE  Defense lawyers for Officer William G. Porter sought Thursday to shift blame for the death of Freddie Gray to another officer  the driver of the van in which Mr. Gray injured his spine  as they painted a portrait of a bumbling police department with outmoded systems and a lax attitude about adhering to its own rules.

title: Meeting on Reforms, FIFA Also Flirts With a 40-Team World Cup
description: ZURICH  Hours after the police arrested two more high-ranking FIFA officials on corruption charges here, the other leaders of world soccers governing body agreed on Thursday to a wide array of governance reforms while also discussing the possibility of expanding the World Cup field to 40 teams from its current 32.

title: In His Homecoming, Stephen Curry Is King
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  More than an hour after Stephen Curry had turned another road arena into a cozy backyard with the friendliest of rims, he mingled with those who had come hoping for or expecting no less. And still he had astonished them with a 28-point third quarter, including an exhilarating flurry of long-range exactitude, 19 points over 3 minutes 42 seconds that turned an 8-point lead into a 21-point blowout.

title: Dance on Camera Festival to Offer 20 Feature Films
description: The Dance on Camera Festival  an eclectic celebration of ballet, jazz and contemporary trends  will return in February withappearances by the ballerinas Natalia Makarova and Merrill Ashley.

title: Germany Rebukes Its Own Intelligence Agency for Criticizing Saudi Policy
description: BERLIN  The German government issued an unusual public rebuke to its own foreign intelligence service on Thursday over a blunt memo saying that Saudi Arabia was playing an increasingly destabilizing role in the Middle East.

title: Some Employers Insist Workers Retire at 65; Is This Legal?
description: A reader asks: There are lots of employers who require workers to step down when they are 65 years old. Doesnt this violate anti-discrimination laws?

title: Streetwear for Men Who Are Too Old for Streetwear
description: For a certain class of conspicuous consumer, the badge of honor is a red rectangle stamped with a single word: Supreme. The New York-born skate brand inspires fealty like the greatest and toniest labels, those that charge 10 times what it does and more.

title: How to Feel Like a Castaway
description: When Alvaro Cerezo, a Spaniard with an unslakable wanderlust and a sun-bleached man bun, dedicated his life to exploring the remotest islands on Earth, he could not have predicted how many hours he would have to spend indoors, making uneasy small talk with local authority figures across Southeast Asia. Recently, I went with him to the office of a provincial government minister in northern Indonesia. (Because Cerezos business depends on obscurity, I am at liberty to name neither the province nor the minister.) Cerezo was there to see about an island. But first came the obligatory schmoozing.

title: Meet the 19-Year-Old Designer Twins Worn by Rihanna
description: When they were children, Chet and Betts DeHart, the twin brothers who created the streetwear line Lucid FC, struggled academically. They had so much trouble in the school system, but it was so apparent to my husband and I they were going to be brilliant in some other way that wasnt going to be on a piece of paper, said their mother, Jessica DeHart.

title: Ryan Throws Down Republican Gauntlet in Outlining House Agenda for 16
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin drew a striking contrast between Republicans and Democrats on Thursday and vowed to pursue legislation that would frame a stark choice for voters in 2016.

title: Andreessen Horowitz to Invest in Nootropics Start-Up
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Since its inception, Andreessen Horowitz has bet big on investments that became home runs, including Facebook, Skype and Airbnb.

title: Works Sighted: Profiting From Mass Shootings
description: Mass shootings can increase demand for guns, Lee Fang at The Intercept reports, as people worried about new gun-control measures rush to buy firearms. And some gun manufacturers knowingly capitalize on this trend. Mr. Fang writes:

title: Uber Valuation Put at $62.5 Billion After a New Investment Round
description: Ubers fund-raising efforts are showing no signs of slowing down.

title: Latest Justice Department Indictment of Soccer Officials
description: The Justice Department unsealed a 236-page indictment on Thursday that described charges against some of the most powerful leaders of international soccer.

title: A Rousing End Lifts a Program of Jrme Bel Dances in Paris
description: PARIS  I had booked my trip to this city before the Nov. 13 attacks. Inevitably, Ive found myself asked by friends in other countries to supply reports that will somehow reveal the shock and grief through which Paris has passed in the last weeks. There are indeed heavily armed policemen on the streets and security inspections upon entering theaters and department stores; but I had no expectations of encountering symptoms of trauma or recovery in the performances I was due to see. I began, though, with an unpleasing study in banality, choreographed and directed by Jrme Bel, that nonetheless ended with a great Paris moment, an exhilarating sequence that was uninteresting as dance and immaterial as art but that managed to release and express the resilience of the Parisian  and the human  spirit.

title: Bigger Than Ever, Art Basel Miami Beach Takes a Conservative Turn
description: Even taking into account 22 satellite fairs and countless off-site projects, pop-ups, performances and parties, Art Basel Miami Beach remains the nucleus of Miami Art Week. Though its often described as the gaudy foil to the prestigious annual Swiss art fair, the atmosphere at this years Miami iteration is decidedly more conservative, perhaps due to the fairs efforts to invest in the quality of its pre-existing programs rather than establish new ones. Annual programs like Art Basel Miami Beachs Conversations and Salon series and its Edition sector have become anticipated attractions instead of gimmicks.

title: The Ghosts of TV Christmas Specials Past
description: If you love television Christmas specials, your list of whats great about them probably includes their shameless sentiment, their schmaltzy outfits and their incongruous bills of comedic and musical fare. If, on the other hand, you think television Christmas specials exist mostly to be mocked, your list of whats mockable about them  well, its probably the same list.

title: Sundance Expands Virtual Reality Offerings
description: LOS ANGELES  The Sundance Institute said on Thursday that it will expand its avant-garde New Frontier section at the coming Sundance Film Festival to include 30 virtual-reality experiences, more than double the number offered last time.

title: The Soccer Officials Indicted on Corruption Charges
description: The 16 men arrested Thursday include five current or former members of FIFAs ruling executive committee and the current presidents of Concacaf and Conmebol.

title: Boos Overtake Laughs as Donald Trump Stumbles on Jerusalem Before G.O.P. Jews
description: WASHINGTON  For a few minutes this afternoon, Donald J. Trump played the beltway like it was the Borscht Belt.

title: N.F.L. Week 13 Previews and Picks
description: Heres a look at the best games of N.F.L. Week 13, and who we think will win them.

title: Dont Make San Bernardino a Victory for ISIS
description: Washington  I am an American Muslim. I have spent my adult life teaching and advising senior military leaders in the fight against terror. On Wednesday night, as I watched representatives of the American Muslim community in San Bernardino, Calif., denounce the shooters who had just killed 14 people in their city, I recognized in their bearing and words their feelings of humiliation, horror and loyalty to the United States  alongside a great fear that a new round of Islamophobia will now follow.

title: Hillary Clinton Renews Call for Tough Gun Measures After California Shooting
description: Hillary Clinton on Thursday called for gun control measures and reiterated President Obamas statement that terrorism had not been ruled out as a motive in the mass shooting the day before that left 14 people dead.

title: Raising Cynics, or Raising Hope: Talking With Older Children About Mass Shootings
description: After I picked up my oldest son, 14, from hockey on the day of the San Bernardino, Calif., shootings, just before I turned on the car, I gave him the news I knew would immediately come out of the radio. Another shooting, I said. He asked, Like Paris? I said: I dont think so. The other kind. No one knows, though.

title: Review: In The Rape of Lucretia, a Woman Done In by Self-Blame
description: Loft Opera aims to break down barriers between performers and audiences by presenting immersive productions in alternative spaces in Brooklyn.

title: An Early Blast of Christmas Cheer, From Tree Lightings to Holiday Concerts
description: Given New Yorks long history as a cultural incubator, it shouldnt come as a surprise that some of the most ubiquitous Christmas traditions and lore were invented here.

title: A Friendship Rocked
description: I have had a close friend for 20 years. Our husbands have been friends since kindergarten; we double-dated in college. Eventually, our husbands returned to their hometown to start a business together. We live a street away from them, and our children are best friends, too. A year ago, my friend and I hit a bump in our relationship. I was sure we would weather it with some distance and time. But then a couple more incidents cropped up with our children; now, feelings are hurt. We both reach out, but seem to feel conciliatory at different times, so we are not mended. What do we do?

title: Data Storage on DNA Can Keep It Safe for Centuries
description: SEATTLE  Computer data has been depicted as microscopic magnetic smudges, electric charges and even Lilliputian patterns of dots that reflect laser beams. It may ultimately move into the fabric of life itself  encoded in the organic molecules that are strung together like pearls to form strands of DNA.

title: Jon Stewart and Lindsey Graham Improvise on Retirement and 9/11 Responders
description: Jon Stewart, the former host of The Daily Show, was in Washington on Thursday, pushing, yet again, for Congress to adopt a law that would aid first responders suffering from health ailments related to the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attack in New York City.

title: Pictures of the Day: Greece and Elsewhere
description: Greece and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Dec. 3, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Greece, India, Russia and the United States.

title: Remembering a Wise Man of Paris
description: PARIS  Sitting on the terrace of a cafe, near where Islamic State gunmen killed scores of people who were guilty only of enjoying themselves on a Friday night, I kept thinking of one wise old Parisian and what he would have made of this horror so close to home.

title: Lindsey Graham Assails Ted Cruz and Warns of Voters Deserting Republicans
description: His poll numbers hovering near 1 percent, Senator Lindsey Graham took a page from the Straight Talk Express playbook on Thursday, warning Republicans that they risked losing another presidential election because of what he called extreme views on abortion and immigration.

title: Marcus Klingberg, Highest-Ranking Soviet Spy Caught in Israel, Dies at 97
description: Marcus Klingberg, an Israeli scientist and the highest-ranking Soviet spy ever caught by the Israeli security services, which regarded his activities as so damaging that they imprisoned him in secret under a false identity and barred the Israeli news media from writing about certain aspects of his case for 25 years, died on Monday in Paris. He was 97.

title: Coldplay Will Play Super Bowl 50 Halftime Show
description: The Super Bowl halftime show is all about star power, with multiple top-tier pop acts joining forces in recent years for maximum wattage. Among the performers scheduled for Super Bowl 50: the British rock band Coldplay, whose new album, A Head Full of Dreams, has the kind of all-star guests that the big stage commands.

title: Toyota Asks for Ideas About How to Use an Ultrasmall Vehicle
description: AS a rush of innovation reshapes the automotive industry, from ride-hailing apps to autonomous driving technology, automakers have joined in rethinking the future of transportation.

title: Starbucks Prospers by Keeping Pace With the Coffee Snobs
description: Angus Maxwell, 27, works in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. He describes himself as an installation and performance artist and is a member of the Boom! Theater Company. He grew up in Seattle and wears a beard and wire-rim glasses.

title: Christies Veto of Gun-Control Bill Is Upheld as Assembly Halts Override
description: One day after a mass shooting in California left 14 people dead, Republican lawmakers in New Jersey declined on Thursday to override Gov. Chris Christies veto of a gun-control bill they had unanimously supported in June.

title: Oprah Winfrey to Release Memoir in 2017
description: It might seem a little early to predict the biggest book of 2017, but there is already a leading contender: Oprah Winfreys memoir.

title: Movie Review: Creed
description: The Times critic A. O. Scott reviews Creed.

title: Movie Review: Chi-Raq
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews Chi-Raq.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Creed
description: Ryan Coogler narrates a sequence from Creed, featuring Michael B. Jordan and Sylvester Stallone.

title: Movie Review: The Good Dinosaur
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews The Good Dinosaur.

title: Mx.? Did The Times Adopt a New, Gender-Neutral Courtesy Title?
description: Philip B. Corbett is the associate masthead editor for standards.

title: I Think About It Daily: Life in a Time of Mass Shootings
description: Times readers responded by the thousands to a simple question: How often, if ever, do you think about the possibility of a shooting in your daily life?

title: Mister Finchs Fabric Mushrooms
description: The photographer Patricia Heal captures the work of the textile artist.

title: In Each Child, an Inner Choreographer
description: Its just after dark on a November afternoon in a dingy studio on West 14th Street. Ten girls and two boys, all 11, are putting together a dance inspired by space invader movies with their teacher, Ellen Robbins. Ms. Robbins switches on a CD of Edgar Varses Arcana, an unruly snarl of blaring brass, dissonant strings and booming percussion, from 1927. Do you hear that crash of drums there? she asks. Several heads nod enthusiastically. Thats when youll start running.

title: Things to Do in New Jersey, Dec. 4 to 20, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: The Worlds Most Elegant Toadstools
description: Mushrooms generally arent very beautiful  but at the hands of the textile artist Mister Finch, they become something elegant, and otherwordly. For a new series of photographs, which will go on view next week at the Steven Kasher Gallery in New York, the photographer Patricia Heal has teamed up with the curator Michael Reynolds to create stunning images of Finchs toadstools. At first glance, the carefully composed arrangements look like images of living mushrooms. But upon a closer look, the viewer realizes that theyre old textiles, expertly arranged and set against against dark velvet backgrounds. An everyday object, infused with a little fairytale magic.

title: Review: In Robert Hughess The Spectacle of Skill, an Aesthetes Unsparing Eye
description: When the art critic Robert Hughes died in 2012, at 74, he left behind an unfinished memoir, portions of which are published for the first time in The Spectacle of Skill, a plump new anthology of his writing.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day, including the latest on the San Bernardino shooting.

title: Call Her Maybe: Erykah Badus New Mixtape in Brooklyn
description: Erykah Badus new mixtape, But You Caint Use My Phone, would seem to be about connectivity and unavailability, about needing the phone to communicate on a meaningful level or using it so much that you stop communicating on a meaningful level.

title: Scientists Seek Moratorium on Edits to Human Genome That Could Be Inherited
description: An international group of scientists meeting in Washington called on Thursday for what would, in effect, be a moratorium on making inheritable changes to the human genome.

title: Doctors Without Borders Says Clinic Hit in Yemen Was Known to Coalition
description: CAIRO  A military coalition led by Saudi Arabia that bombed a Doctors Without Borders clinic in Yemen on Wednesday had regularly been provided with the coordinates of the clinic, the medical charity said in a statement on Thursday.

title: Weapons in San Bernardino Shootings Were Legally Obtained
description: The suspects in the San Bernardino shootings used semiautomatic rifles that were legally obtained despite gun laws in California that were intended to ban assault weapons and are widely regarded as among the strictest in the country.

title: Your Thursday Evening Briefing: San Bernardino, Combat, Oscar Pistorius
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Ryan Coogler Narrates a Scene From Creed
description: With Creed, the writer and director Ryan Coogler (Fruitvale Station) adds a new chapter to the Rocky story.

title: Things to Do in Connecticut, Dec. 4 to 20, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Review: Tyler Duncan Salutes Eccentric Patrons of Surrealists
description: The outrageous, eccentric Vicomtesse Marie-Laure de Noailles and her husband, Charles de Noailles, were two of Surrealisms most important supporters, the patrons of artists like Man Ray, Luis Buuel, Alberto Giacometti, Salvador Dal and Francis Poulenc, whom the vicomtesse called Poupoule. So it made sense that a concert commemorating their influence on Wednesday at the Baryshnikov Arts Center would start off with some contemporary Surrealism.

title: Francis Bacon: Late Paintings, at Gagosian, Is a Vivid Narrative
How Many Mass Shootings Are There, Really?
description: On Wednesday, a Washington Post article announced that The San Bernardino shooting is the second mass shooting today and the 355th this year. Vox, MSNBCs Rachel Maddow, this newspaper and others reported similar statistics. Grim details from the church in Charleston, a college classroom in Oregon and a Planned Parenthood clinic in Colorado are still fresh, but you could be forgiven for wondering how you missed more than 300 other such attacks in 2015.

title: Humans and Animals: A Complicated Bond
description: Jayanti Seiler looks at the contradictions of human-animal relationships, photographing them at circuses, shelters and even taxidermists.

title: Packers and Lions Are Trending in Opposite Directions
description: The Green Bay Packers and the Detroit Lions had very different Novembers. How they fare during the first game of December might decide the fate of the N.F.C. North.

title: At Art Basel Miami, a Mix of Parties and Business
description: MIAMI BEACH  The rap on the annual contemporary art fair here is that much of the art has already been presold and most of the collectors come only for the parties.

title: Lawyers in Cosby Case Seek to Question His Wife
description: Lawyers for seven women suing Bill Cosby for defamation in a Massachusetts federal court case have served notice that they hope to question Camille O. Cosby, the entertainers wife, under oath next month, but Mr. Cosbys lawyer said he would fight the request.

title: Faced With Many Crises, Brazil Focuses on Dilma Rousseffs Impeachment Case
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazils economy has lost more than one million jobs this year in the most severe recession in decades. Families are still searching for people missing in the  sludge released when a dam burst, one of the countrys worst environmental disasters. Police officers are clashing with students on the streets of So Paulo over school closings.

title: Review: Arabian Nights Offers Satirical Fabulism Amid Economic Austerity
description: The stories that make up Arabian Nights, the anxious, ambitious new film by the Portuguese director Miguel Gomes, are nestled inside two distinct frames. One is what the title would lead you to expect: Scheherazade, daughter of the grand vizier of Baghdad, invents tales to prevent her fearsome new husband, the sultan, from taking her life. Each vignette in this three-part movie belongs to one of Scheherazades 1,001 nights.

title: Roots of Conceptual Art, Caught by a Cameras Eye
description: Learning, like looking, takes time. It took until well into the 20th century for photography to be fully accepted as art, longer for color work to make the cut. (People thought color belonged in advertising.) And its only fairly recently, in the digital present, that hard lines separating photography from painting, sculpture and performance have evaporated.

title: RushCard Called Uncooperative in Debit Card Inquiry
description: The federal regulator examining technical issues at the prepaid debit card firm RushCard says the company has not lived up to its pledges to cooperate in an investigation that began in October, shortly after a systems malfunction blocked thousands of customers from access to their money.

title: Things to Do on Long Island, Dec. 4 to 20, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Review: In The Lady in the Van, Maggie Smith Homesteads in the Driveway
description: Those eyes. Theyve seen it all and taken its measure. And woe be to someone or something that displeases the critical spectator.

title: Wagner Collection at the Whitney, 25 Years of Astute Buying
description: More collectors of contemporary art should follow the lead of Thea Westreich Wagner and her husband, Ethan Wagner. They are neither building a private museum to house their holdings nor sending their trove off to auction hoping for headline-grabbing profits, although this is partly because their purchases have not especially encompassed the so-called trophy art that earns such profits.

title: Review: Macbeth, Starring Michael Fassbender, Awash in Gorgeous Carnage
description: Theres no doubled trouble in the slickly handsome new version of Macbeth with Michael Fassbender. The double, double, toil and trouble is among the plays most memorable passages, the one with three witches, a bubbling caldron and an eye of newt. A gang of weird sisters still roams the foggy Scottish moors, periodically speaking in riddles and giving Macbeth the evil eye. Yet the movie mutes the dark magic that swirls in the play, an alteration that itself stirs the pot, complicating the question of Macbeths freedom, his will and his guilt.

title: Things to Do in the Hudson Valley, Dec. 4 to 20, 2015
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Staffing Crisis Threatens Secret Service Mission, House Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  The Secret Service is plagued by persistent security breaches and a staffing crisis that poses perhaps the greatest threat to the agencys mission, according to a highly critical report released on Thursday by a House committee.

title: Locked Out in Pennsylvania
description: Allegheny Technologies has locked out 2,200 workers at 12 plants in six states in in what has become one of the nations largest and longest work stoppages in years.

title: In Pennsylvania, a Steel Mill and Its Workers at a Crossroads
description: BRACKENRIDGE, Pa.  For two years, Chris Cummings, a maintenance mechanic, worked 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. six days a week to help prepare for the opening of a gigantic $1.2 billion steel rolling mill that was supposed to bring hundreds of secure, well-paying jobs to the Allegheny River Valley.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Defends Structure of His Philanthropic Outfit
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Mark Zuckerberg wrote a post on Facebook on Thursday to defend his plans to transfer 99 percent of his familys Facebook stock to a limited liability company that would pursue various community projects.

title: Pierre Klossowski Drawings Explore Eroticism and More
description: The polymath Pierre Klossowski was a venerable figure of the last century: novelist, translator and hero of the philosophers Michel Foucault and Gilles Deleuze. In the art world, however, he remains a lesser-known quantity, especially on this side of the Atlantic. Though his airy Mannerist-influenced drawings have appeared in museum retrospectives in London, Paris and Cologne, Germany, as well as in major group exhibitions like Documenta, Klossowski has been overshadowed in the United States by his younger brother, the painter Balthus (n Balthasar Klossowski).

title: Meriem Bennanis Gradual Kingdom Focuses on Morocco
description: Meriem Bennanis first show at Signal, Gradual Kingdom, might not be as funny as her other projects, which have appeared on sites like Instagram and included a reality show parody (now under actual development) about a hijab designer whose zany head scarves function as purses or Carmen Miranda-like apparatuses. Instead, this exhibition focuses on her hometown, Rabat, Morocco, and how it fits, sometimes depressingly, into global networks of commerce and real estate.

title: Airbnb Says Data Dump Shows Misuse of Service Is Rare
description: With its release of a trove of data this week, the short-term rental company Airbnb sought to underscore how the majority of its hosts in New York City are playing by the rules. The point is a critical one for the company, valued by investors at about $24 billion, as it tries to pacify skeptical lawmakers and regulators.

title: Corruption: Everybody Knows , Think Pieces From E-flux
description: E-flux began in 1998 with an emailed news release for a one-night group show in Chinatown. Since then, it has grown to include a monthly journal and a wide-reaching distribution system for art world information, and its become one of the few galleries in the city to present politically minded global fare consistently. Its current show, Corruption: Everybody Knows , will be the last in the organizations Manhattan space  e-flux is moving to Brooklyn in 2016  and is very much in its signature think-piece mode.

title: Review: In Night Owls, Staying Up Late Leads to Surprises
description: Meet the fun couple of the year, and watch them go at it tooth and nail. Not since Michael Douglas and Kathleen Turner did battle in The War of the Roses has a screen pair fought with the gleeful ferocity with which Rosa Salazar and Adam Pally attack their roles in Charles Hoods acrid romantic comedy Night Owls. When first glimpsed, Madeline (Ms. Salazar) is a drunken grown-up unreformed girl gone wild determined to consummate a hookup with Kevin (Mr. Pally) as quickly as possible.

title: Yale Buys Collection of Scattered Medieval Pages
description: For centuries, antique prints, drawings and manuscripts were sliced apart, a standard practice that created individual pieces of vellum and paper for sale or display, in the hopes of drawing attention to the art forms. Institutions are now trying to reassemble the dispersed pages and fragments.

title: Review: In River of Fundament, Matthew Barney Contemplates Waste
description: To say that Matthew Barney makes art movies is not to provide a genre descriptive. A conceptual-performance artist, Mr. Barney makes films completely out of the Hollywood system. His meticulous works, gargantuan in scope and length, follow ostensibly linear paths, but arent really narratives. Concerned with the human body and bodily function  his most famous work, the Cremaster cycle, is named for the muscle that controls the rising and lowering of the testes  they are appreciated best as pieces rather than movies.

title: Germany May Offer Model for Reining In Fossil Fuel Use
description: BERLIN  If negotiators in Paris reach an agreement next week on a global plan to rein in the use of fossil fuels, the next question becomes this: How can the participating countries fulfill their pledges to do their part?

title: Sheldon Silver, Found Guilty, Moves to Collect State Pension
description: ALBANY  Among his various post-conviction activities  mulling an appeal, for certain, and even ditching his trademark charcoal hat in favor of a simple baseball cap while avoiding reporters  former State Assemblyman Sheldon Silver has apparently found time to file for his state pension.

title: Theater Listings for Dec. 4-10
description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are here. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Barnes & Noble Wants to Become More Than Books
description: When Ron Boire was growing up on a dairy farm in upstate New York, helping out around the property for $2 an hour, he saw new books as an out-of-reach luxury.

title: Review: After the Terrors of the Blitz Comes A Royal Night Out
description: The aggressively charming A Royal Night Out, is a grown-up fairy tale for audiences whose hearts go pitter-pat at the mere mention of anything to do with the British royal family. Sorry to be a spoilsport, reader, but my heart sinks at the sight of people bowing and scraping before aristocrats with titles they havent earned. It all seems so silly.

title: Origami Heaven Unfolds
description: At first, Kumi Yamashitas work Origami looks like nothing more than brightly colored squares of paper, each slightly crumpled along one edge, arranged on a white wall. And then you notice the shadow that each paper casts  the profile of a face, each one unique.

title: Avon Said to Be in Talks to Sell North American Business
description: Avon Products is in discussions to sell its North American business, where its army of Avon ladies first called, to a tough-nosed private equity firm as part of the cosmetics makers efforts to turn around its fortunes, people with direct knowledge of the matter said on Thursday.

title: Illinois: Chicago to Release Second Police Video
description: Under pressure after the release of video of a white police officer shooting a black teenager, Mayor Rahm Emanuel of Chicago said Thursday that the city would reverse course in a separate case and release video from another police shooting that it had fought to keep private. The family of Ronald Johnson has called for the police dashboard video from his fatal shooting to be made public, saying it will show that he was unarmed and moving away from officers when he was shot in the back. The police have said that Mr. Johnson, 25, pointed a weapon at officers. The shooting occurred on Oct. 12, 2014, eight days before the shooting of the teenager, Laquan McDonald, whose death was captured on a video that has outraged residents and led to the firing of the citys police superintendent.

title: Review: Sorrentinos Youth: A Euro Buddy Film
description: The setting of Youth, Paolo Sorrentinos new film, is an Alpine resort  a picturesque place rich with cultural associations and full of rich, cultured guests. Even if most people in the audience have never been to such a spot, it may nonetheless ring a few bells and jog some literary and cinematic memories. Weve been here before. Was it The Magic Mountain or The Grand Budapest Hotel? The Good Soldier? Last Year at Marienbad?

title: Texas: Parole Denied for Transgender Inmate
description: Passion Star, a black transgender woman who has served 13 years in mens prisons, was denied parole last week. The Texas Board of Pardons and Paroles cited the nature of her offense, although her co-defendant  also convicted of aggravated kidnapping and sentenced to 20 years  was released over two years ago. Noting that the co-defendant was white and not transgender, Lambda Legal, the group that represents Ms. Star, said it found the disparity a troubling illustration of the injustice that runs throughout the criminal system. Ms. Star, 32, was the subject of an article about prison rape in The New York Times; she is suing corrections officials for failing to protect her against sexual victimization.

title: Kazakhstan Moves to Tighten Control of Internet Traffic
description: Government officials in Kazakhstan are borrowing a page from China, quietly devising their own version of Chinas so-called Great Firewall to unscramble encrypted web and mobile traffic as it flows in and out of Kazakh borders.

title: At Eastern Connecticut Ballet School, a Link to Balanchines Nutcracker
description: In a sunlit dance studio on a recent Saturday, Gloria Govrin, draped in black clothes and wearing soft leather shoes that made her appear barefoot, gracefully demonstrated a dance sequence to a young ballerina. They were the steps that marked the entrance of Coffee, the slinky, Arabian dance character who appears in Act Two of The Nutcracker.

title: Review: Chronicling an Outsider in Almost There
description: I think as a journalist  I dont think as a filmmaker, one interviewee says, almost off-handedly, late into Almost There. This first feature from Dan Rybicky and Aaron Wickenden demonstrates that these documentary filmmakers might do well to think more like journalists sometimes.

title: Review: In Krampus, the Holiday Involves a Demonic Santa
description: Occasionally funny, intermittently scary, but mostly hectic and sloppy, Krampus tries very hard to be a different kind of Christmas movie. It wants to have its store-bought fruitcake and eat it too, to satirize the meanness and materialism of holiday-observing Americans and also connect with the vaguely defined real meaning of the season.

title: U.S. Media Mocked Abroad for Reporting False Name of California Shooting Suspect
description: Major American news outlets, including The Los Angeles Times and Fox News, were ridiculed online on Thursday for apparently falling victim to a hoax as they reported that a suspect in the deadly shooting rampage in San Bernardino, Calif., had been identified as Tayyeep Bin Ardogan, 28, of Qatar.

title: Lifting Their Voices, and Spirits, at a Bronx Nursing Home
description: Muriel Palley has been a shower singer for as long as she can remember.

title: At the Rye Arts Center, Learning New Ways of Creating
description: Julian Clemente sits at a laptop in a 3-D printing class at the Rye Arts Center, using the track pad to design a geometric container. A freckled 10-year-old with a mop of red hair, he stretches the squat cylinder with a virtual dragging tool, making it taller on the digital graphing paper. Now it resembles a vase. He spins the on-screen design, then flips it upside down to see if all the sides are even.

title: JPMorgan Wrote Complaints After Firing a Whistle-Blower
description: Johnny Burris, a former broker at JPMorgan Chase, might have known he was walking into a minefield when he decided to go public with his concerns about his former employer.

title: Review: Bikes vs Cars Explores the Debate in Cyclist-Friendly Cities
description: Breezy, intelligent, diffuse but uncluttered, Fredrik Gerttens documentary Bikes vs Cars could be called a tale of congestion-plagued cities. The film, which examines the high cost that urban centers, especially Los Angeles and So Paulo, Brazil, pay for accommodating automobiles, benefits greatly from a range of viewpoints. Though its most persuasive speakers are politically involved bicyclists, car enthusiasts receive screen time as well.

title: Tribute and a Reunion for Dick Cheney in Capital
description: WASHINGTON  Before making a rare return visit to the nations capital on Thursday, former President George W. Bush said he mentioned to his father that he would be attending a ceremony honoring his vice president, Dick Cheney.

title: Chris Froome Releases Test Results but Does Little to Silence His Critics
description: In a bid to silence critics who claim that his two Tour de France wins were products of either conventional or so-called mechanical doping, Chris Froome on Thursday released results of several physiological tests that demonstrated he was in top physical condition.

title: Joseph F. Girzone, Who Created Christlike Figure in Joshua Novels, Dies at 85
description: The Rev. Joseph F. Girzone, a retired Roman Catholic priest whose popular inspirational novels starring a Christlike figure named Joshua were lauded and condemned in equal measure for their theological perspective, died on Nov. 29 in Albany. He was 85.

title: Testimony at Trial Details No-Show Job of Dean Skeloss Son
description: Writing a performance review can be a tricky, thankless task, but few posed the quandary that senior management at Physicians Reciprocal Insurers faced in June 2013: What should they say about Adam Skelos?

title: Review: Dementia, Where Misery Is Company
description: Mike Testin has dozens of cinematography credits, but the psychological thriller Dementia is his first try at directing a feature. Youd never know it, though. Its an assured, deftly acted movie that builds its creepiness slowly and keeps its secrets well hidden till the end.

title: Review: In Wim Wenderss Every Thing Will Be Fine, Nothing Is
description: Something is off with Every Thing Will Be Fine. Even for a movie about a writer detached from his emotions, its ponderous, like a lucid dream gone bad.

title: To Crush ISIS, John Kerry Urges Deft Removal of Syrias Assad
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus  Secretary of State John Kerry said Thursday he believes that if an agreement can be reached to ease President Bashar al-Assad of Syria from power, a coalition of Americans, Russians and Syrian forces could wipe out the Islamic State in a matter of literally months.

title: Restaurant Review: At the Wooden Spoon, Letting the Home Fires Burn
description: Despite its contemporary trappings  exposed, opaque lights snaking over steel rods on the ceiling, horizontal barn wood covering the lower parts of several walls, exposed brick running along another  there is something nostalgic about the Wooden Spoon, a six-month-old restaurant in New Rochelle.

title: A Century Later, Jack Johnson Awaits a Nations Absolution
description: Why is the United States still afraid of Jack Johnson?

title: Wanting More Than a Veto and a Prayer After Mass Shootings
description: Any decent person might want to pitch in thoughts and prayers after a mass shooting, even if it is hard to keep up. (Did you offer thoughts and prayers for the nine people killed at Umpqua Community College in Oregon in October, or did that one slip by when the next news cycle arrived with yet another shooting?)

title: Review: The Messenger Documents Avian Struggles
description: Jewel-colored birds flapping their wings in languid motion draw the viewer into this lush but ultimately grim assessment of our planets future: Climate change and development are altering habitats more rapidly than birds can adapt, and that doesnt bode well for people.

title: Restaurant Review: At True North, a Focus on Homemade
description: Finding ones true north translates roughly to following the right path. In September, Paul Miranda, former executive chef of Swallow in Huntington and Montauk, continued along his chosen path by opening, with Stuart Kritz, the aptly named True North in Huntington Village.

title: Review: An Exploration of Race and Class in My Friend Victoria
description: As drifting and dreamy as its searching heroine, My Friend Victoria takes a graceful but unsatisfying stroll through the life and longings of a young black woman in contemporary Paris.

title: Leaving Irans Nuclear Past a Mystery
description: VIENNA  The Iranian nuclear crisis began a decade ago when Tehrans leaders refused to answer questions from international inspectors about evidence that a secret team of scientists, working in a complex organization that sprawled across military and university laboratories, were experimenting with the technology to build a nuclear weapon.

title: Review: Orion Tells an Elvis Tale
description: The story of Jimmy Ellis, a singer blessed and cursed with a voice that sounded too much like Elvis Presleys, is strange and tragic, a piece of musical history that says worlds about the fickleness of fame and ends with a jolt that makes it even sadder. Its deftly told in Orion: The Man Who Would Be King, a documentary by Jeanie Finlay.

title: Where They Shared Their Working Hours, and Their Dying Moments
description: Struck down at an office holiday party, almost all the victims of the mass shooting Wednesday in San Bernardino, Calif., were friends and colleagues. And in a notable difference from some other highly publicized rampages, some of them also knew their killer, Syed Rizwan Farook, who opened fire on the group with his wife, Tashfeen Malik, the authorities said.

title: FIFA Case Upends Soccer Politics in Latin America
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  No one epitomizes the ups and downs of Brazilian soccer quite like Ricardo Teixeira.

title: George Sakato, 94, Dies; Awarded Medal of Honor Long After It Was Denied
description: George T. Sakato didnt think he would be much of a combat soldier. He was only 5 feet 4 inches tall, and he couldnt hit the target on the rifle range in Army basic training.

title: Review: In The Wannabe, Drugs, Money and Aspirations to Join the Gotti Circle
description: Boardwalk Empire fans can celebrate that The Wannabe, Nick Sandows modest, assured and cautionary gangland character study, has players they may have been missing (if not the post-World War I setting).

title: Review: Open Door Helps Open Alvin Ailey Season
description: Theres always some risk when a dance company unveils a premiere, especially on gala night, when the crowd is full of donors. Will they like it? But that risk is lower when the choreographer is like an old friend of the company, with a knowledge of the dancers built up over years.

title: Restaurant Review: At Chengdu 1 Palace, Getting Her Chili-Oil Fix
description: When Chengdu 1 restaurant in Cedar Grove closed last summer, I went into mourning.

title: Steven Vogel, Biologist Who Studied How Things Move, Dies at 75
description: Steven Vogel, a biologist whose research and writing on how living things move in air and water helped define and popularize a new scientific field, comparative biomechanics, died on Nov. 24 in Durham, N.C. He was 75.

title: Bush Super PAC to Tell Jebs Story in 15-Minute Documentary
description: Voters will soon get 15 unfiltered minutes of the Jeb Bush story.

title: Fear in the Air, Americans Look Over Their Shoulders
description: The killings are happening too often. Bunched too close together. At places you would never imagine.

title: Review: In The World of Kanako, the Old Ultraviolence
description: Tetsuya Nakashimas thriller The World of Kanako might be filed under what some cineastes call extreme cinema. But screen overkill  and I mean kill  is more like it.

title: Review: In Life, Photographing James Dean, the Rising Star
description: Anton Corbijns Life is one of those Great Encounters in History dramas, the kind that seeks to recapture (and remythologize) a magic moment. In 1955, a photographer for Magnum, Dennis Stock, shadowed and snapped an ascendant James Dean for Life magazine, a few months before Dean died in a car accident. Mr. Corbijn picturesquely frames the back story to the shoot, but his muffled retelling drifts with Dane DeHaans murmurous impersonation of Dean and Robert Pattinsons almost perversely listless turn as Stock.

title: Does Motive Matter in Mass Shootings?
Review: The Letters, a Biopic of Mother Teresa
description: The Letters doesnt preach to the converted, or to anyone else, for that matter. Instead, this fairly standard biopic about Mother Teresa tells its tale with a minimum of flourish, resisting most opportunities to grandstand. Thats not high praise, but its also not an insult.

title: Museum & Gallery Listings for Dec. 4-10
description: Museums and galleries are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of recent art shows: nytimes.com/art. A searchable guide to these and many other art shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Comedy Listings for Dec. 4-10
description: For news about comedy, including critical commentary: nytimes.com/arts. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Review: In Steel Hammer, a Man and a Train in a Race and a Legend
description: Julia Wolfes galvanizing score  alternately clamorous, haunting, exhilarating and sometimes all three simultaneously  provides a sturdy musical spine for Steel Hammer, a theatrical meditation on the legend of John Henry being presented at the Brooklyn Academy of Music through Sunday.

title: Fox Neighbor
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Weve discussed constructor signatures over the past few days, and I have to admit that seeing David J. Kahns byline occasionally sets off a knee-jerk response in me that sounds something like this: Oh dear, who died?

title: The Right Stuff
description: Administrivial Poor Excuse For a Blogger Alert! Hi all, I apologize for the mix up, which delayed the blog for Martin Ashwood-Smiths post and inadvertently published another one with spoilers. I was sick yesterday and messed this up. Additional apologies to Mr. Ashwood-Smith for delaying his post, and lets just pretend you didnt see the Saturday post, which comes out tonight.

title: Review: In David Mamets China Doll, Al Pacino as an Urban Warrior in Winter
description: No matter what his salary is, it seems safe to say that Christopher Denham is the most underpaid actor on Broadway. Mr. Denham  a young man with, I sincerely hope, a very resilient nervous system  is one of a cast of two in China Doll, the saggy new play by David Mamet that was finally opened to critics on Wednesday night at the Gerald Schoenfeld Theater, and he is onstage for almost the entire show.

title: Review: Dream/Killer, a Fathers Battle to Free His Son in a Wrongful Conviction
description: I wont reveal the end of dream/killer, but I will predict what youll feel after watching it: This documentary elicits large measures of incredulity, frustration and astonishment.

title: Donald Trump and Ben Carson Face a Foreign Policy Test Before a Republican Jewish Group
description: WASHINGTON  Donald J. Trump and Ben Carson may not have reduced doubts about their seriousness as leaders and their understanding of global affairs on Thursday as they delivered meandering speeches to one of the countrys most influential Republican Jewish organizations.

title: Dreaming of a Southern Life, but First, Her Education
description: Moments of calm are rare and fleeting in Tomar Cokes home in the Bronx. If her two sons are peacefully watching television or playing with action figures, getting along in any way, she knows a clash is imminent.

title: Connecticut Craft Distillers Are in a Growth Spurt
description: On the list of Connecticut-made food and drink, already bulging with cheese, eggs, beer, beef and bacon (to name just a few), one category is often overlooked: handcrafted liquor.

title: Automation Is a Job Engine, New Research Says
description: The fear that technology is poised to kill jobs in unprecedented numbers is widely prevelent these days. Nothing is likely to ease that anxiety much, but a new research paper might prompt some second thoughts.

title: An Officer Who Trained for the Worst and Faced It: This Was Actually Happening
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif.  He had trained for active-shooter situations. He recalled the drills where trainers barraged officers with everything they could  sounds, bright lights, smells  to overwhelm them.

title: Spare Times for Dec. 4-10
description: Information on events for possible inclusion in Spare Times should be sent to weekend@nytimes.com by Friday at 5 p.m. for publication that week. Longer versions of Around Town and For Children listings are in a searchable guide at nytimes.com/events.

title: Weekend Entertainments From the Archives of The New York Times
description: John Martin became the first full-time dance critic at a major American publication when he joined The New York Times in 1927. Before his appointment, music or theater critics wrote on dance, the stepchild of the arts, satisfying no one.

title: This Weeks Movies | Dec. 4, 2015
description: The New York Times film critics review Chi-Raq, Creed and The Good Dinosaur.

title: Spare Times for Children for Dec. 4-10
description: When you consider the ingenious ways that marine creatures maneuver, you have to feel sorry for humans. Walking seems so, well, pedestrian.

title: Bill to Repeal Health Law Passes Senate
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate approved legislation on Thursday night that would repeal President Obamas landmark health care law, a goal of Republicans since the law was adopted in March 2010.

title: Dance Listings for Dec. 4-10
description: Full reviews of recent dance performances: nytimes.com/dance. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Pop, Rock & Cabaret Listings for Dec. 4-10
description: For full reviews of recent concerts: nytimes.com/music. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Jazz Listings for Dec. 4-10
description: Full reviews of recent jazz performances: nytimes.com/jazz. A searchable guide to these and other shows is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Classical Music & Opera Listings for Dec. 4-10
description: Full reviews of recent classical performances: nytimes.com/classical. A searchable guide to these and other performances is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Movie Listings for Dec. 4-10
description: Ratings and running times are in parentheses; foreign films have English subtitles. Full reviews of all current releases: nytimes.com/movies.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | gentry
description: gentry  \jen-tre\  noun

title: Dietrich & Riefenstahl, by Karin Wieland
description: The German historian Karin Wieland buries useful information on the acknowledgments page of Dietrich & Riefenstahl: Hollywood, Berlin, and a Century in Two Lives. She reports that her original manuscript contained at least three additional books before her German editor set about pruning.

title: Frank Stella: A Retrospective, by Michael Auping
description: A professor I know teaches that a work of art will give clues to how it wants to be discussed: It will suggest whether to dwell on its sense or its structure, whether to meet it with passion or calculation.

title: Aftermath of the Massacre in San Bernardino
description: Police officers sorted through evidence and mourners gathered after the shootings in San Bernardino, Calif.

title: New Yorks Week in Pictures: Dec. 4
description: Photographs from the past week in New York City and the region include a ceremony for birds, the trial of Sheldon Silver and a museum of feelings.

title: Presidential Candidates on Gun Violence
description: All of the Democratic candidates want new gun laws, while nearly all Republicans are against additional restrictions they see as harmful to Second Amendment rights.

title: Notorious RBG: The Life and Times of Ruth Bader Ginsburg
description: Clark Kent had Superman. Ruth Bader Ginsburg has Notorious R.B.G. For 80 of her 82 years, the Supreme Court justice was known for being brilliant, reserved and a little dry. Then in 2013, the Internet gave her a super-hip-nerd alter ego. On a Tumblr created by a law student, Shana Knizhnik, fans posted photoshopped tributes to Ginsburg. In one frequently shared image, she wore a crown with the caption Cant Spell Truth Without Ruth. She also appeared as a bobblehead doll, a tattoo on a bicep, a decal on a fingernail, and a baby wearing a huge pair of glasses.

title: Molly Crabapples Drawing Blood
description: As her fast-paced autobiography attests, the artist Molly Crabapple was a quintessential wild child, irrepressible, pouty and proud, born determined and angry. At 12, she discovered punk rock. At 17, she traveled to Europe alone, slept in the famous Shakespeare & Company bookshop in Paris, walked the streets of Fez with her sketch pad, an artist-wanderer, claiming for herself the space formerly reserved for men.

title: Food Whore, by Jessica Tom
description: Please allow me to introduce Michael Saltz, a man of wealth and no taste. Not bad taste  no taste at all. One day he finds that he can no longer detect sour, salty, sweet and bitter. This is inconvenient because he is supposed to be the restaurant critic of The New York Times.

title: About Women, by Lisa Alther and Franoise Gilot
description: About Women should inaugurate a series in which accomplished women of different backgrounds talk candidly about their lives. This book pairs an American novelist, Lisa Alther, the author of Kinflicks, and a French-born painter, Franoise Gilot, the author of another masterpiece, Life With Picasso.

title: The 613, by Archie Rand
description: Lets hear it, in the pages of this liberal, freethinking bastion of progress, for God.

title: What to Watch Friday
description: Stream, sing along, repeat: Bill Murray and company serenade the holidays in A Very Murray Christmas. A heartbroken Christmas-tree salesman searches for love in Brooklyn. And Kristen Stewart adds another award to her mantel for Clouds of Sils Maria.

title: My History: A Memoir of Growing Up, by Antonia Fraser
description: When she arrived as a boarder at the Godolphin School in 1944, at the age of 12, Antonia Pakenham  who would grow up to be the novelist and historian Lady Antonia Fraser, Dame of the British Empire, mother of six, grandmother of 18, wife of the Tory M.P. Hugh Fraser and, later, wife of the playwright Harold Pinter  made the startling discovery that she was not really a girl. That is, having just spent four years learning Greek and Latin at a school for boys (mostly) called the Dragon, next door to her familys home in Oxford, England, she excelled at ancient languages and at the knock-em-sock-em sport of rugby, but was completely unschooled in conventional girlish behavior. In her new memoir, My History, she recalls, I was like Kiplings Mowgli in The Jungle Book, the feral child who had been brought up by wolves and had difficulty adjusting to existence among human beings.

title: Bee Wilsons First Bite: How We Learn to Eat
description: For a long time, the British food journalist Bee Wilson automatically craved something indulgent before boarding a train. In First Bite: How We Learn to Eat, she traces this instinct to a ritual she had with her father when she was a teenager. Her parents had just split up, and whenever her dad would send Wilson on a train back to her mothers house, hed buy her a magazine and a box of chocolate-coated malted milk balls, something that, before her parents divorce, would have been deemed a special-occasion treat. She felt powerless to refuse the candy, even as she was struggling with a disconcerting weight gain. It took Wilson years to realize that her fathers gesture was as much about making him feel like the generous provider as it was to reward her with a happy sugar high. She writes: To give a child the things she loves to eat bestows a heroic glow. It feels almost as wonderful as eating.

title: Chapter and Verse: New Order, Joy Division and Me, by Bernard Sumner
description: The glamorous rock-star life, circa 1983: The gawky Manchester kids in New Order visit the legendary New York disco Funhouse to shoot a video for their new single, Confusion. They hang with their producer, Arthur Baker, and the superstar D.J. Jellybean Benitez, watching from the booth while the crowd moves. Its poignant how dazed New Order looks in this video  a couple of years earlier, they were your basic mopey indie twits, and here they are making the scene as their music plays at the worlds hippest dance club. Yet the most poignant sight is that of the singer Bernard Sumner, who spends the first half of the clip wearing deck shorts and white tube socks. Its impossible to imagine any other British new wave singer of the MTV era dressing this way for a quick dash to the hotel ice machine, much less for a video.

title: Hear My Sad Story, by Richard Polenberg
description: Long before she died in 1952, Frankie Baker was quoted as saying, Its funny, but most people think of me as being dead a good many years. Most people today would probably be surprised to learn that she was ever alive.

title: Sinatra: The Chairman and Sinatras Century
description: Anyone who wants to contend with 20th-century popular music, or popular music, or the 20th century, has to contend with Frank Sinatra.

title: The 6:41 to Paris, by Jean-Philippe Blondel
description: If you travel alone on French trains, the seat next to you in second class is either empty or occupied by someone you dont know. Or do you? Given the choice of standing for over two hours from Troyes to Paris, Philippe Leduc excuses himself and takes the last free seat in the carriage. Only then does Ccile Duffaut look up to see who has invaded her space.

title: The Big Book of Animals of the World, and More
description: Even as children these days are beckoned by new forms of digital storytelling, nothing quite equals the immersive experience of a bigger-than-usual book enriched with visual, tactile and even the occasional kinesthetic extras. These five large-format books invite young readers to look and touch, linger and explore. (Grown-ups welcome, too!)

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Just as I naturally consider how I would survive if there was an earthquake, now I have added mental contingencies for a shooting  and THAT is a sad state of affairs!

title: Corrections: December 4, 2015
description: NATIONAL

title: Aftermath of the Shooting in San Bernardino
description: Police officers sorted through evidence and mourners gathered after the shootings in San Bernardino, Calif.

title: Scott Weiland, Singer Who Helped Found Stone Temple Pilots, Dies at 48
description: Scott Weiland, whose mercurial vocal style was a signature of the rock band he helped start, the Stone Temple Pilots, and later of the band Velvet Revolver, died on Thursday in Bloomington, Minn. He was 48.

title: Humans and Animals: A Complicated Bond
description: Jayanti Seiler is not shy about expressing her feelings for animals. But when she meets the subjects of her project Of One and the Other, she keeps those feelings to herself.

title: Worthy Tax Breaks for Housing and Clean Energy
description: To the Editor:

title: The Latest Site of Carnage: San Bernardino
description: To the Editor:

title: Hungry, Homeless and in College
description: THREE months after starting college, Brooke Evans found herself without a place to live. She was 19.

title: Republicans Climate Change Denial Denial
description: Future historians  if there are any future historians  will almost surely say that the most important thing happening in the world during December 2015 was the climate talks in Paris. True, nothing agreed to in Paris will be enough, by itself, to solve the problem of global warming. But the talks could mark a turning point, the beginning of the kind of international action needed to avert catastrophe.

title: No, Donald Trump Wont Win
description: A little while ago I went rug shopping. Four rugs were laid out on the floor and among them was one with a pink motif that was dazzlingly beautiful. It was complex and sophisticated. If you had asked me at that moment which rug I wanted, I would have said the pink one.

title: Russias Fury Over Montenegro and NATO
description: It is a measure of how cold the Wests relations with Russia have become that NATOs membership invitation to Montenegro  a small, poor Balkan state with a military force of 2,000 and no strategic significance save putting the last bit of Europes Mediterranean coastline under the alliance  would provoke furious cries of provocation and encirclement from the Kremlin.

title: A Battle in San Bernardino
description: Riverside, Calif.  IN the spring, I was asked to write a story called Bang or Whimper, about the end of the world.

title: Tough Talk and a Cowardly Vote on Terrorism
description: Investigators now believe that what initially seemed a workplace shooting in San Bernardino, Calif., was a well-planned attack by a married couple with at least some contact with Islamic extremists.

title: The Latest Attack on Climate Science
description: Earlier this year, scientists at the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration published research contradicting earlier reports that global warming had slowed in the past decade. But Representative Lamar Smith, Republican of Texas and chairman of the House Committee on Science, Space and Technology, is accusing the agency of rushing data to publication, and is demanding access to the internal communications of its employees.

title: 9 Samsung Executives Are Subject of Insider Trading Investigation
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korean financial regulators on Friday said they were investigating whether nine executives from Samsung, the countrys largest conglomerate, used insider trading to profit illegally from a merger of two subsidiaries.

title: Audi Executive Resigns After Suspension Over VW Emissions Scandal
description: FRANKFURT  An executive linked to Volkswagens emissions scandal has resigned his post as a top manager of the Audi luxury car division, the company said late Thursday.

title: 1965: An American Space Odyssey
description: The European edition of the New York Herald Tribune tracked the flight of Gemini-7, a spacecraft manned by Frank F. Borman and James A. Lovell Jr. that blasted into orbit on Dec. 4, 1965. When it returned nearly two weeks later, Gemini-7 had set 11 records for manned spaceflights. Below, a few clips from our archives, from before liftoff to the spacecrafts return.

title: Americas Next Top Model Winners: Where Are They Now?
description: See what Adrianne Curry, Eva Marcille and Brittani Kline did after their Americas Next Top Model win.

title: How a Conservative-Led Australia Ended Mass Killings
description: In the continuing debate over how to stop mass killings in the United States, Australia has become a familiar touchstone.

title: Can a Christmas Sweater Be Fashionable? Gucci and Prada Say Yes
description: The holiday season allows for sartorial excessiveness. Break out the ugly sweater with the nog.

title: New Apps and Services for Renters
description: Of the many things that make New York renters miserable, hunting for an apartment ranks pretty high. Getting out of a lease early is up there, too.

title: Robust Jobs Report All but Guarantees Fed Will Raise Rates
description: Consider it a done deal.

title: Americas Next Top Model, Deconstructed
description: And so it has come to an end. After 289 episodes, 22 seasons and 12 years; after airing in 100 countries, and inspiring 20 foreign spinoffs from Brazil to Finland to Taiwan; after acquiring 7,903,827 likes for their Facebook page and 254,000 Instagram followers; after providing the Urban Dictionary with assorted new verbs and adjectives, including smize (smile with your eyes) and flawsome (awesome because of the flaws), after Friday night, Americas Next Top Model will be done.

title: Ryan Seacrest: The Mogul Next Door
description: Is he ever not working? Kevin Systrom, the 31-year-old chief executive officer and co-founder of Instagram, recently asked about his good friend Ryan Seacrest. The question, to be clear, was rhetorical.

title: Aishti Foundation Puts Shimmering Works Amid the Turmoil of Beirut
description: BEIRUT  On a warm evening this fall, the cultural scene here was in full bloom. Members of the international art world, Lebanese government ministers and fashion executives had gathered to celebrate the grand opening of the Aishti Foundation, a private museum showcasing the growing contemporary art collection of Tony Salam, the founder of Aishti, a Lebanese luxury retailer.

title: The Modern Meeting: Call In, Turn Off, Tune Out
description: The minute Marvin Avilez gets on a conference call, he is on his hands and knees.

title: How Do You Try to Reduce Your Impact on the Environment?
description: For the world to slow down or stop human-generated climate change, governments and corporations will need to enact major policy shifts. But still, each of us plays a small role in Earths overall health  through our everyday decisions like turning on or off the lights, buying and reusing clothing or electronics, littering and recycling, or turning up or down the air-conditioning and the heat.

title: The Washingtons, by Flora Fraser
description: One of the great challenges of setting down the history of marginalized people is how to amass enough information to provide a clear picture of subjects who didnt write letters themselves or only appeared in the letters of others, who didnt enter the public realm through the legal system or gain notoriety in other ways. Its hard to imagine two people less marginalized than George and Martha Washington, a couple at the very pinnacle of society in the nation George helped to create. Martha lived this very public life with him, garnering enormous respect.

title: Patti Smiths M Train
description: Many people, especially those who came of age in the 1970s, view Patti Smith as an inimitable punk-rock poet with an edgy, unforgettable voice. But she is also a regular person. Her new memoir, M Train, can be seen as a plea to acknowledge her as one. Like the rest of us ordinary folk, she endures the frustrations and banalities of everyday life  keeping despair at bay with TV crime shows, cats and caffeine. She identifies unapologetically with the detectives on The Killing and CSI: Miami. I adopt their ways, she explains, suffer their failures and consider their movements long after an episode ends, whether in real time or rerun. Her cats are not cuddly and decorative but authentic. One wakes her in the morning by throwing up on the edge of her pillow. Her drug of choice is black coffee. Much of M Train takes place in different cafes, and the reader can map the effect of the substance on her imagination. With each sip her mind awakens and her ruminations deepen.

title: St. Marks Is Dead, by Ada Calhoun
description: New York breeds mourners. If you grow up anywhere in the city, there is a good chance your childhood memories will be bundled with tangible goods and sold to the highest bidder before you reach adulthood. You wont be invited to the memorial service  New York runs a red light past sentiment. The city grows on the frictional power of millions chasing The Now. Money is New Yorks longest-running Now, and it probably just ate your favorite sandwich shop, the apartment you first rented or your go-to record store. Mine disappeared a few weeks ago  it was on St. Marks Place and was unassuming in aspect and name: Sounds.

title: The Catskills: Its History and How It Changed America
description: In 1824 a group of businessmen opened the Catskill Mountain House, Americas first grand resort hotel, in a spectacular but logistically challenging location at the top of a ledge about 1,500 feet above the Hudson Valley hamlet of Palenville, N.Y. Not long after, the promising young British-born painter Thomas Cole, sent to the environs of the Mountain House by a patron, produced The Falls of the Kaaterskill, a dramatized rendering of the leading natural wonder in the hotels vicinity. This was a big event in the cultural history of the United States. Finally, half a century after the Declaration of Independence, there was a distinctively American form of artistic expression: the depiction of pristine and forbidding wilderness.

title: Roger Angells This Old Man
description: The author and editor Roger Angell, who has had a long, distinguished career, is principally celebrated for his unparalleled sports writing. Angell writes about baseball the way M.F.K. Fisher did about food, as a metaphor for lifes complexities of desire, defeat, utility and beauty.

title: Chief of House Science Panel Picks Battle Over Climate Paper
description: In Paris, representatives from nearly 200 countries are discussing how to fight climate change. But in Washington, some congressional leaders continue to wage a battle over climate science itself.

title: Ask Well: Is Tooth Polishing Necessary?
description: Question:

title: Health Quiz: Beer, Prunes and Jogging
description: Take the Quiz

title: Your Friday Briefing: San Bernardino, OPEC, Scott Weiland
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Clementine: The Life of Mrs. Winston Churchill, by Sonia Purnell
description: When Winston Churchill took office as prime minister of Britain in May 1940, Nazi Germany had brought Continental Europe under its domination, and it seemed as if, barring a miracle, Britain would be next. Churchill couldnt promise a miracle, he told the House of Commons: I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat. He forgot to mention a possibly more potent weapon: his wife, Clementine, the subject of Sonia Purnells thorough and engrossing (if occasionally overdramatized) biography.

title: As Aging Population Grows, So Do Robotic Health Aides
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The ranks of older and frail adults are growing rapidly in the developed world, raising alarms about how society is going to help them take care of themselves in their own homes.

title: Renewal of Export-Import Bank Stings Conservative Republicans
description: Score one for the Republican establishment.

title: New York Today: Space Invaders
description: Updated at 8:30 a.m.

title: Online Classes Appeal More to the Affluent
description: Free online educational courses may not be democratizing education as much as proponents believe, a new study reports.

title: German Parliament Votes to Send Military Assistance to Fight ISIS
description: BERLIN  The German Parliament voted overwhelmingly on Friday to send reconnaissance planes, a frigate and midair fueling capacity to the Middle East to support the campaign against the Islamic State in Syria, although German forces will not be involved in direct combat like airstrikes.

title: In The Wiz Live! on NBC, a Search for More in the Emerald City
description: Empire syndrome has now become so dire that NBC finally went and got its own lion. This one didnt run a record label, suffer a major medical misdiagnosis, or spend an hour of television in prison alongside a cannibal.

title: Britain to Extend Lloyds Share Sale for 6 Months
description: LONDON  The British government said on Friday that it would extend a plan to sell its stake in the Lloyds Banking Group for six months as it prepares to exit ownership of the lender as early as next year.

title: Morning Agenda: Avon Said to Discuss Selling North American Business
description: AVON SAID TO DISCUSS SELLING NORTH AMERICAN BUSINESS | Avon Products is in talks to sell its North American business to Cerberus Capital Management, the private equity firm,Michael J. de la Merced and Leslie Picker report in DealBook.

title: How To, Variations on a Rectangle and The Art of Typewriting
description: Although they take different approaches, these three books are profoundly enmeshed in words, images and meanings. While two are wide-ranging compilations by contemporary masters of commercial graphic design, the third explores the visual possibilities offered by the most rudimentary of typographical tools. As a young designer, I was taught that everything communicates, that nothing is mute. These books raised new questions for me about meaning  whether it is fundamentally local and whether it is indeed possible to cleave meaning from words.

title: A Few House Democrats to Attend Prayer Services at U.S. Mosques
description: A small number of House Democrats will attend prayer services at mosques on Friday in what is intended to be a show of solidarity with American Muslims.

title: Bribery Confession in China Calls Into Question Integrity of College Admissions
description: HONG KONG  The children of the wealthy and well-connected in China enjoy enormous educational advantages, gaining access to elite kindergartens, primary schools and tutors beyond the reach of most Chinese families. But strict meritocracy was thought to reign at one crucial stage: college admission. To gain a spot in a top Chinese university and a ticket to a prosperous life afterward, a student needed a high score on the countrys famously difficult national college entrance examination, not a father with a thick wallet.

title: Firebomb Attack on Cairo Nightclub Kills at Least 16
description: CAIRO  A firebomb attack on a nightclub in central Cairo early Friday killed at least 16 people and wounded three others after a dispute involving staff members at the club, Egyptian security officials said.

title: Donald Trumps Speech to Jewish Group Is Criticized in Israel
description: Presidential candidates flocked to Washington to express their solidarity with Israel at the Republican Jewish Coalition presidential forum on Thursday, and their remarks did not go unnoticed on the other side of the world.

title: Taliban Say They Will Release Recording of Leader to Prove He Is Alive
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Taliban officials on Friday strenuously denied claims that their leader, Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour, had been killed or wounded and promised to soon release an audio recording of him to prove he is still alive.

title: Ted Cruz to Discuss Gun Rights at Iowa Shooting Range
description: Against the backdrop of another national mass shooting, Senator Ted Cruz of Texas plans to appear on Friday at an Iowa shooting range to demonstrate his dedication to the Second Amendment and gun rights.

title: The 11.22.15 Issue
description: WOMEN IN HOLLWOOD

title: A Guide to Shopping Americas Biggest Malls
description: Malls are ever-popular standbys when it comes to holiday shopping, but some are so expansive in their offerings that they have become tourist destinations in and of themselves. With that in mind, weve shared the scoop on the five biggest malls in the country (as measured by square feet of gross leasable area according to the International Council of Shopping Centers, the global trade association for the shopping center industry). Here is the lowdown on the shopping, the amenities and where to eat and sleep during your retail getaway.

title: Familiar Ground
description: In August, I went back to Italy for a family reunion. Im part Welsh and part Italian, but growing up I lived in Italy. My earliest memories are of the farm where we lived and of the piazza at Vernole: There were horses and carts and Lamborghinis, barking dogs, leather-faced men and women dressed in black. My father had died recently, and in keeping with Italian inheritance law, our property in Salento, right on the heel of Italy, had to be split among all the siblings. There are six of us, and its not often that we can all get together. Because my son, Sean, was about to go to college, I thought it would be nice to bring him along as well, an opportunity to spend some time together.

title: Snowflakes
description: Poetry and walking each invite a kind of meditation. In this poem, the contemplation of snowflakes  the precise seeing of the external landscape  gives way to the landscape of the speakers psyche.

title: How to Skin a Cat
description: Go with the grain of the hair, says Anthony Eddy, a taxidermist who has worked on house cats, bobcats and mountain lions.
