description: The Park Avenue Armory announced Monday that it would use its cavernous 55,000-square-foot Wade Thompson Drill Hall in March for the North American stage premiere of De Materie by the Dutch composer Louis Andriessen, directed by Heiner Goebbels and featuring the International Contemporary Ensemble and a large cast that will include a flock of sheep.

title: Ted Cruz Tops Donald Trump in New Iowa Poll
description: DES MOINES  For the first time, Senator Ted Cruz of Texas took the top spot in an early-state poll, pulling ahead of Donald J. Trump in Iowa in a survey released on Monday by Monmouth University.

title: Winston and Mariota Are Rare Rookie Quarterback Success Stories
description: In the 2015 N.F.L. draft, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and the Tennessee Titans owned the top two picks. The teams selected Jameis Winston and Marcus Mariota, making them just the sixth pair of quarterbacks to be selected first and second since 1970. Each player is having an excellent season by rookie quarterback standards, and both showed their long-term potential in exciting wins on Sunday.

title: CPR Survival Rates Can Differ Greatly by City
description: If you have a stroke, your odds of survival are similar whether you are in Boston or Boise. But not so if you fall victim to cardiac arrest.

title: Nikolaus Harnoncourt, Early-Music Pioneer, Announces Retirement
description: The great Austrian conductor and early-music pioneer Nikolaus Harnoncourt announced his retirement this weekend, as he celebrated his 86th birthday.

title: Elizabeth Warren Shows Support for Hillary Clintons Wall Street Plan
description: Hillary Clinton, hearing criticism for her ties to the financial industry, received the critical support of Senator Elizabeth Warren on Monday for her proposal to expand the Dodd-Frank regulatory structure and urging of President Obama to veto any legislation that would weaken Wall Street regulation.

title: What Would You Ask Bernie Sanders?
description: Bernie Sanders, the junior senator from Vermont and a candidate for the Democratic presidential nomination, will visit the editorial board on Tuesday. This is the board members chance to ask Senator Sanders their questions as they prepare to endorse a candidate for president.

title: An Enduring Musical Comedy Gets a Gender-Bending Twist
description: The opening lyrics of A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum briskly promise Something familiar, something peculiar, something for everyone: a comedy tonight! That pledge is nicely fulfilled by Two River Theaters unconventional staging of the musical in Red Bank.

title: Albuquerque, Revising Approach Toward the Homeless, Offers Them Jobs
description: ALBUQUERQUE  Will Cole steered an old Dodge van along a highway access road one recent Tuesday, searching for panhandlers willing to work. Four men waved him away dismissively at his first attempt, turning their backs on the van as it rolled past. By the third stop, though, nine men and one woman had hopped inside.

title: San Bernardino County Offices Reopen After Shooting
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif.  County offices in San Bernardino opened Monday morning for the first time since the mass shooting that killed 14 people at a disability center last week, with heightened security measures and a pledge by county leaders to try to return life to normal in this shattered community.

title: Daniel Bouluds Holiday Chocolate Pt and Other Treasures
description: Daniel Bouluds pastry elves have gone whimsical to produce this holiday chocolate pt, densely studded with pistachios, hazelnuts, bits of marshmallow, dried fruit and amaretti, covered in chocolate glaze and decorated with gilded holly. For a holiday buffet or to slice and serve, it also makes a splendid gift and does not require refrigeration: Chocolate pt, $59 to serve eight or more, $7 a slice, picerie Boulud, 1900 Broadway (64th Street), 212-595-9606, epicerieboulud.com.

title: No Charges for Chicago Officer in 2014 Shooting of Ronald Johnson
description: CHICAGO  For days, officials here have faced scathing criticism for taking too long to share what they knew about the death of Laquan McDonald, who was shot 16 times by a police officer in October 2014 as a dashboard video camera captured it all. On Monday, the authorities seemed determined to make a sharply different impression as they released video of another fatal police shooting of a black man from the same month, which has also become a source of contention in the city.

title: The Occupation Trilogy and More, by Patrick Modiano
description: I will not resist the temptation to read in Pedigree  Patrick Modianos 2005 memoir, newly translated in the wake of his 2014 Nobel Prize  the stuff of everything else he has ever written. Modiano has encouraged such conflation, for one thing, in interviews and essays and the like. But this on its own would be insufficient justification. Fiction or nonfiction  or, more accurately, something in between  Modianos more than 25 published works form a constellation of intersecting narratives that challenge any readerly desire for clarity or closure. The open-ended dialogue Modiano sustains among all of his writings frames the sketches and unsure rememberings that make up this autobiographical snapshot. Terse, yet somehow infinitely generous, Pedigree both enacts and accounts for Modianos fraught relationship with memory and the past  his own and those of his country. It outlines the stakes of his literary practice and reveals the specific sufferings this practice entails.

title: Marilynne Robinsons The Givenness of Things
description: A sense of wonder pervades the powerful essays in The Givenness of Things, Marilynne Robinsons new collection. Existence is remarkable, actually incredible, Robinson exclaims; even materiality is profoundly amazing, uncanny. Yet unlike physics, which has a strong sense of the givenness Robinson refers to in her title, neo-Darwinian positivism rejects anything  the self, the soul or God  that cannot be explained empirically. Robinson defines the given as something that presents itself, reveals itself, always partially and circumstantially, accessible to only tentative apprehension, which means that it is always newly meaningful. Calvin insisted that divine wisdom was one such given, perceived only within radical limits. Robinson does not say so, but here Calvin was deeply in tune with the great sages of the past, who all maintained that the transcendence we call God, Brahman, Nirvana or Dao must always ultimately elude us.

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch This Week
description: This week is as busy as last week was (relatively) quiet. The soccer editor and shameless Ajax supporter Andrew Das tells you what to watch:

title: Reds Aroldis Chapman Named in Domestic Violence Inquiry
description: NASHVILLE  Major League Baseball will investigate an allegation of domestic violence against Aroldis Chapman, the All-Star closer for the Cincinnati Reds, a league spokesman said late Monday night.

title: Period of Soaring Emissions May Be Ending, New Data Suggest
description: LE BOURGET, France  Industrial emissions of greenhouse gases rose only slightly in 2014 and appear to be on track to decline in 2015, according to new data that raise the possibility that a period of rapid global emissions growth may be coming to an end.

title: How to Build a Sustainable City
description: This is an article from Turning Points, a magazine that explores what critical moments from this year might mean for the year ahead.

title: Joe Biden Says U.S. Is Still Backing Ukraine
description: KIEV, Ukraine  The United States will not sacrifice Ukraine in pursuit of Russian cooperation in Syria, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. assured Ukrainian leaders on Monday, even as the Obama administration tries to manage complicated diplomacy with Moscow.

title: F.T.C. Sues to Block Staples-Office Depot Deal
description: For Staples, a merger with Office Depot is anything but easy.

title: Yemens Government and Houthi Rebels to Start Peace Talks
description: GENEVA  The United Nations special envoy for Yemen said Monday that the government and Houthi rebels would start peace talks in Switzerland next week and that the two sides appeared willing to accept a cease-fire in their nine-month-old war.

title: President Obama, Terrorism and Guns
description: To the Editor:

title: Autopsy of Ronald Johnson
description: This autopsy shows that Mr. Johnson was hit by two bullets fired by a Chicago Police officer. One entered the back section of his shoulder and severed his jugular vein; the other struck the back of his leg.

title: Adele Sells Another 1.1 Million Copies of 25
description: Never underestimate Adele, or the buying power of her fans.

title: Art Basel Miami Beach Street Style, Round Two
description: More of the coolest  and brightest  looks from Art Week.

title: Merger Mania in Hospitality Raises Competition Concerns
description: The travel industrys 800-pound gorillas have been bulking up, and consumers are getting nervous.

title: Prompt Medical Care May Have Saved Freddie Gray, Experts Testify
description: BALTIMORE  Freddie Gray might have survived had the police taken him to a hospital sooner, medical experts told a jury here Monday. Later, a paramedic recounted her fruitless struggle to save Mr. Gray when she arrived at a police station and found him unresponsive inside a transport van, with Officer William G. Porter and another officer cradling his head.

title: Small Kitchens, by Choice
description: SEATTLE  For many, the American dream kitchen has long been a grand showplace, filled with granite islands that stretch like aircraft carriers through a sea of shining appliances.

title: Push for Gun Curbs Tied to No-Fly List Puts Republicans on the Spot
description: WASHINGTON  The bloody attack in San Bernardino, Calif., last week revived fears about threats from groups such as the Islamic State in America and also fused two fraught policy debates central to the presidential contest: gun control and how far to go in the fight against terrorism.

title: Economists Criticism of Federal Reserve Policies Gains Ground
description: Many Fed watchers have warned about the upsetting effect Ben S. Bernankes aggressive central bank actions have had on emerging markets around the globe.

title: Tashfeen Malik,San Bernardino Suspect, Attended Conservative Religious School in Pakistan
description: MULTAN, Pakistan  The Pakistani woman who carried out the mass shooting in California along with her husband last week had earlier spent a year studying at a conservative religious school for women in this southern Pakistani city, officials said Monday.

title: Wall Streets Debt Restructuring Fight Heads to Washington
description: Proposed changes to an obscure Depression-era law are causing a ruckus among the Wall Street investment funds that are battling over the debt restructuring at Caesars Entertainment and other companies.

title: Inside One Grand in Narrowsburg, N.Y.
description: For his new store, the journalist and editor Aaron Hicklin asked a slew of creative people to share the 10 books they would want to take with them on a desert island.

title: Assemble Design Collective Wins Britains Turner Prize
description: LONDON  The architecture and design collective Assemble was awarded the Turner Prize, Britains leading contemporary art award, on Monday. The group was nominated for a project in which it refurbished derelict Victorian-era houses with the help of residents in a working-class neighborhood in Liverpool.

title: A Whale Sculpture in Paris Aims to Help Save Some Species
description: PARIS  A life-size installation of a giant blue whale has been erected on the Left Bank of the Seine, intended as a reminder to negotiators at the international climate conference here that the fate of threatened species is also in their hands.

title: A Bookshop Where Everything Is Recommended
description: On a recent Sunday afternoon, the journalist and editor Aaron Hicklin was standing among some still-empty shelves in his newly completed bookstore, One Grand, in a former mercantile building in the town of Narrowsburg, New York. In less than one week, he would open the doors to the shop, but at the moment he was still fretfully awaiting the final shipments of his stock. Ill be honest, I am really surprised by how many books you need to fill a space, Hicklin said. I have about a thousand in here, but youd never know it. Ive got to fill these damn shelves!

title: The Best TV Shows of 2015
description: The television critics of The New York Times  James Poniewozik, Mike Hale and Neil Genzlinger  share their picks for the best shows of the year.

title: Keurig Green Mountain Gets Help From New Kind of Deal Maker
description: Keurig Green Mountain is surfing the frothy merger market to a happy exit  and it has a new type of deal maker to thank for it.

title: Letters From the Pacific, From Pearl Harbor to Okinawa
description: On December 2, 1941, an Army private named Harold Grove Moss was a week away from finishing his Morse Code training to become a radio operator. He was stationed at Camp Roberts in California. Something seemingly a little unusual happened yesterday and that was all the Japanese boys were taken out of our battery, he wrote that day in a letter to his parents in Minatare, Neb. But he didnt dwell on it; he also mentioned that a homemade cake they sent wasnt broken a bit, and ended with a modest Christmas list, including a camera and a pair of brown civilian shoes (no two tone). Five days later, as news of the attack on Pearl Harbor was filtering through the ranks, he wrote again.

title: In Search of American Fascism
description: Last week I used my inaugural 2016 Campaign Stops columnto weigh in on the is Donald Trump a fascist debate, and came around to the conclusion that he is more fascistic, at least, thanmost of the populist candidates (Wallace, Perot, Buchanan) to whom hes reasonably been compared. But with the strong showings yesterday in France fora party with historical roots inactual, genuine-article fascism, it seems worth digging a little bit into the ways in which Trump doesnt deserve thefascist label, and what they say about the usefulness of the term in the American context.

title: Why Good Guys With Guns Wont Keep Us Safe
description: Its become a standard response to mass shootings in America: If only more good Americans were armed, the bad guys wouldnt have a chance to kill.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Killers Were Long Radicalized, F.B.I. Investigators Say
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif.  The couple who carried out the deadly attack that killed 14 people here last week had long been radicalized and had been practicing at a target range days before their murder spree, theFederal Bureau of Investigationsaid Monday.

title: Latvia Government Falls as Prime Minister Quits
description: RIGA, Latvia  Latvias first female prime minister said Monday that she was resigning after less than two years, a move that brought down the government and left politicians puzzling over what would come next.

title: Zombie-Themed Nativity Scene Causes a Stir in Ohio
description: For the second year in a row, a Cincinnati couple has constructed a zombie-themed Nativity scene against the objections of local zoning officials and religious groups.

title: Carl Icahn Makes Counterbid for Pep Boys
description: Carl C. Icahn, unhappy with Pep Boys decision to sell itself to Bridgestone, the tire company, is fighting back with his own takeover offer.

title: Todd Solondz, Spike Lee and Werner Herzog Will Bring Films to Sundance
description: LOS ANGELES  The Sundance Film Festival is mostly known for showcasing work by directors who are (very) wet behind the ears. But an unusually large number of well-known indie filmmakers  people like Todd Solondz, Spike Lee, Liz Garbus, Ira Sachs and Werner Herzog  will bring new work to the Sundance snow next month.

title: From Milan to Rome, Bikes and Beer
description: Bikes and BeerThe Oregon-based tour company Beercycling has expanded its geographical reach beyond Belgium and the Netherlands to tap into Italys growing craft beer scene. Its new Seven Day Italian Passion Tour debuts April 19, with a second departure on Oct. 4 and will visit at least five of the countrys breweries.

title: Brooklyn-Made Chocolate, in Downtown L.A.
description: Following the opening of its London outpost earlier this year, the cult New York chocolate company Mast Brothers plans to set up shop in downtown L.A.s Arts District in the spring. And with it will come a whole new set of flavors: We shouldnt just ship out chocolate from Brooklyn, the Williamsburg-based companys co-founder Rick Mast says. California should make chocolate for Californians. In the meantime, though, Mast Brothers has made an exception to fly in bars from Brooklyn for a 10-week pop-up shop.

title: Jessica Jones Episode 11: The Blues
description: This episode feels like a long, slow anticlimax after the last ones galvanizing conclusion. Hope Schlottmans suicide makes Jessica Jones see red: Jones promises to avenge Hopes death by murdering Kilgrave. That promise weighs on Jones throughout Episode 11, but much of that time is devoted to reassuring viewers that Jones isnt really a killer. Through unmemorable flashbacks to Trish and Joness childhood, and a drawn-out confrontation with a comically unhinged Will Simpson, the episode writers Scott Reynolds and Liz Friedman hold viewers hands, and instantly resolve a conflict that was just introduced.

title: Cameron Praises You Aint No Muslim, Bruv Remark in London Attack
description: LONDON  Two days after a knife attack in a London subway station left one man seriously injured and prompted a terrorism investigation, Prime Minister David Cameron praised the reaction of one bystander, who told the attacker, You aint no Muslim, bruv.

title: What Should Be Done to Prevent Mass Shootings?
description: The New York Times would like to hear from readers about what, if anything, should be done to prevent mass shootings.

title: Behind the Brackets as Paris Negotiators Shape a Climate Change Deal
description: Over the weekend, negotiators in Paris produced a slimmer, but still heavily-bracketed final draft of a proposed climate change [accord][protocol][agreement][anything but a treaty] aimed at doing what the first climate treaty, adopted at the Rio Earth Summit in 1992, failed to do: curb emissions of greenhouse gases and boost the capacity of poor countries to handle climatic and coastal dangers amplified by warming.

title: Prosecutor in Dewey & LeBoeuf Case Asks for Dismissal of Dozens of Charges
description: The criminal case against three former leaders of the once-mighty Dewey & LeBoeuf law firm is shrinking fast.

title: Nets Rondae Hollis-Jefferson Is Out Indefinitely
description: The reeling Nets received another blow on Monday when they learned that Rondae Hollis-Jefferson, their promising rookie small forward, would be out indefinitely with a broken bone in his right ankle.

title: U.N. Seeks Record Amount for Humanitarian Aid in 2016
description: GENEVA  Facing mass movements of refugees and human suffering on a scale unseen since World War II, the United Nations asked governments on Monday for more money than ever before to fund its humanitarian operations in 2016.

title: Review: Tesla Quartet Captures Playful Charms of Caroline Shaw
description: Near the end of Caroline Shaws Entracte (2011), a halting, Haydnesque minuet and trio for string quartet, Ms. Shaw asks the musicians to play notes that seem to fall away  to make a sound, as she writes in the score, like a little sigh.

title: Review: Jay Campbell, the Cellist, Displays Strengths at Weill Recital Hall
description: Throughout the adventurous program he played on Sunday night at Weill Recital Hall, it was clear that the prodigious 26-year-old cellist Jay Campbell performs music of our time not out of obligation but because it excites him so much.

title: Review: In The Reenactors, a Play About a Suicide Pact Has a Twist
description: I dont know how good the lead actress in The Reenactors is, but the one who filled in for her at Thursday nights performance, Rebekah Brockman, certainly did a phenomenal job under trying circumstances, and the substitution gave what was already an intriguing play about theatrical story-making an invigorating extra layer of real-life metaness.

title: Remaking a Manhattan Block, Right Down to the Ground
description: When was the last time you took a good look at the sidewalk? And not just while glancing away from your smartphone on a crowded Midtown street.

title: Donald Trump Calls for Barring Muslims From Entering U.S.
description: Donald J. Trump called on Monday for the United States to bar all Muslims from entering the country until the nations leaders can figure out what is going on after the terrorist attacks in San Bernardino, Calif., an extraordinary escalation of rhetoric aimed at voters fears about members of the Islamic faith.

title: The Gun Epidemic: The Making of a Page 1 Editorial
description: Not long after the latest mass murder, in San Bernardino, Calif., on Dec. 2, Arthur Sulzberger Jr., our publisher, was on the phone with Terry Tang, deputy editorial page editor, and me. What were we going to write about the killings?

title: Chi-Raq and the Myth of Chicago Gang Wars
description: Toward the beginning of Spike Lees new film, Chi-Raq, a gun battle erupts in a hip-hop club. Its the latest salvo in an ongoing war between two fictional Chicago gangs: the Spartans, clad in purple, and the Trojans, in orange. (Lees film is a sly retelling of Aristophanes Lysistrata, the Greek comedy whose heroine tries to end the Peloponnesian War by organizing women to withhold sex from their husbands.) In Chi-Raq, the leader of the Trojans is a cackling, piratical figure named Cyclops, bejeweled eye patch and all. Pitted against him is the rapper known as Chi-Raq, the boss of the Spartans. But as the conflict escalates, we never find out why the two gangs are warring  this, it seems, is simply what Chicago gang members do.

title: Gordon Brown and Ben Bernanke to Sit on Pimco Advisory Board
description: Pimco, the global bond giant, said on Monday that it was setting up a global advisory board featuring luminaries like Ben S. Bernanke, the former chairman of the Federal Reserve, and Gordon Brown, the onetime British prime minister.

title: U.S. to Open Shelters for New Surge of Youths Crossing Southwest Border
description: Reacting to a new surge in unaccompanied children crossing the southwest border illegally, the federal government is moving to open two shelters in Texas and one in California this month, adding at least 1,400 beds to handle the increased flow, senior Obama administration officials said Monday.

title: Remembering Holly Woodlawn, a Transgender Star of the Warhol Era
description: Everyone thinks Andy Warhol made me a superstar, but it was Paul Morrissey who put me in Trash, Holly Woodlawn was saying by telephone from West Hollywood, Calif., in the days after Lou Reeds death in October 2013.

title: A Model Who Knows How to Pour Concrete
description: Since signing on to New York Models roster a little more than a year ago, Marland Backus has appeared in runway shows for Gucci, Proenza Schouler and Burberry Prorsum, among others, and has posed for Cline and Jil Sander campaigns. But the 23-year-old, a recent Pratt Institute graduate, is also a budding industrial designer. In college, I always made sure that school was my top priority and since graduating Ive made the effort to my design work first, Backus says. Modeling, she notes, is impermanent, but I plan to be designing and creating for a long time.

title: Discrepancies Emerge Over Where Tashfeen Malik Grew Up
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia  As investigators work to determine the backgrounds and motivations of the married couple suspected in last weeks mass shooting in San Bernardino, Calif., contradictory claims have emerged from Pakistan and Saudi Arabia about where the wife, Tashfeen Malik, spent her formative years.

title: Eye-Catching Work at Art Basel Miami Beach
description: Pieces on view at standout galleries were literally eye-catching  incorporating neon, candy-colored hues and reflective surfaces.

title: The Brightest, Shiniest Trends From Art Basel Miami Beach
description: With 267 international galleries gathered under one roof, art fairs like Art Basel Miami Beach have the potential both to establish new market obsessions and to perpetuate them. Walking the aisles of the convention center this year, several trend-worthy patterns emerged, but the most prevalent among them might have been the flashes of neon that seemed to be around each turn  maybe a sly nod to Miamis native aesthetic.

title: Senate Democrats Offer Their Plans to Fight the Islamic State
description: Eager to put their own stamp on the fight against terrorism, Senate Democrats have scrambled and put together their own package of proposals to fight the forces of the Islamic State, also known as ISIL or ISIS.

title: Review: This Old Man Is Roger Angells Follow-Up to an Earlier Memoir
description: At the age of 95, the New Yorker writer and editor Roger Angell has seen an awful lot of changes in New York City. Horses have vanished from the city streets  unless you count the weary carriage horses transporting tourists around Central Park. Gothams old phone exchanges (BUtterfield 8, BRyant 9) long ago gave way to colorless seven-digit numbers and, more recently, to more unwieldy 11-digit ones. Old Yankee Stadium is gone, and gone, too, is its Voice of God, Bob Sheppard; and an original sweetie-pie, Don Zimmer, whose bald cannonball head and stumpy bod and jack-o-lantern grin and wisdom accrued from tens of thousands of innings made fans feel connected to baseballs storied and swiftly receding past.

title: Eagles of Death Metal Return to a Paris Stage
description: PARIS  Eagles of Death Metal, the California rock band that was onstage at the Bataclan when assailants opened fire on the crowd last month, appeared in Paris on Monday night, playing with U2 near the end of its show at an arena a few miles from the Bataclan.

title: Review: The Goodbye Studies Explores the Idea of the Crowd
description: The word crowd brings immediate images to mind: furious protesters, exhausted refugees and, now, trapped concertgoers. Throughout his career, the veteran choreographer Tere OConnor has been waging a vehement battle against assigning meaning to dance. But in The Goodbye Studies, he veers toward it  on his own terms.

title: Review: The Versatile Soprano Diana Damrau Sings at Carnegie Hall
description: The soprano Diana Damrau likes a good challenge. Over the past decade at the Metropolitan Opera, she has sung her first performances of difficult roles, played both Pamina and the Queen of the Night during a single run of The Magic Flute and turned cartwheels onstage in Bellinis La Sonnambula.

title: Review: Chen Shi-Zhengs Double It, Feats of Derring-Do, With Vignettes
description: Look over there! Is it a bird? Is it a plane? No, its a goofy teenager in a Superman suit, his cape flapping courtesy of a black-clad assistant. And hey, theres Catwoman. And Wonder Woman. And Darth Vader. And Neo from The Matrix. And also, inexplicably, a panda.

title: Donald Trumps Republican Rivals Condemn His Call to Bar Muslims From Entering U.S.
description: Donald J. Trumps call to bar Muslims from entering the United States has drawn swift condemnation from his Republican rivals for the nomination, raising the question of whether the billionaire businessman has finally gone too far.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Syria and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Dec. 7, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Syria, Kashmir, India and England.

title: Diplo on His Grammy Priorities: Winning, Snapchat and the Best Party
description: Diplo, the 37-year-old megaproducer and D.J. born Thomas Wesley Pentz, graduated long ago from the dance underground to working with artists like Madonna and Justin Bieber without losing his edge. On Monday, he was nominated for three Grammy awards, including producer of the year, best dance/electronic album for Skrillex and Diplo Present Jack  and best dance recording for Where Are  Now with Skrillex and Justin Bieber.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing: Chicago Police, Donald Trump, Grammy Awards
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Latest Draft Accord Hints at More Than a Political Gesture
description: Thursday nights draft text of a new climate change accord skates on the edge of historical significance.

title: Coaches New Overture: Limit Early Recruiting
description: College coaches are pushing the N.C.A.A. to end a largely hidden practice that has become increasingly common: the recruitment of young high school and occasionally even middle school students.

title: Pollution and Coal Mining in India
description: As the international community discusses climate change in Paris, an Indian photographer looks at his countrys reliance on coal to fuel both industry and the economy.

title: National Front Gets a Boost in French Regional Elections
description: PARIS  Sundays election results changed the political center of gravity in France.

title: New York Parking Alert: Alternate-Side Parking Rules Suspended on Tuesday
description: Because of the Feast of the Immaculate Conception, alternate-side street-cleaning regulations will be suspended in New York City on Tuesday. Other regulations will remain in effect.

title: Justices Weigh Power of Indian Tribal Courts in Civil Suits
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday seemed poised to limit the power of Indian tribal courts to hear civil cases against outsiders.

title: Interpublic Acquires Russian Advertising Agencies in Long-Sought Deal
description: The advertising giant Interpublic Group of Companies is gaining a stronger foothold in Russia.

title: Viacom Chief Addresses Concerns About Sumner Redstone
description: Addressing concerns about the health of Sumner M. Redstone, Viacoms 92-year-old executive chairman, its chief executive said on Monday that Mr. Redstone had an incredible will to live and an enjoyment of life with some physical disabilities.

title: Procter & Gamble, the Worlds Biggest Advertiser, Switches Agencies
description: Procter & Gamble, the biggest advertiser in the world, announced on Monday that it was moving the bulk of its North American media buying and planning business to Omnicom from Publicis Groupe, in a sweeping change that underscores the broader upheaval in the ad industry.

title: Yale Lecturer Resigns After Email on Halloween Costumes
description: A Yale lecturer who came under attack for challenging students to stand up for their right to decide what Halloween costumes to wear, even to the point of being offensive, has resigned from teaching at the college, the university said Monday.

title: Ex-Im Bank Is Reopened, but Big Loans Are Stalled
description: WASHINGTON  The announcement on the Export-Import Banks website proclaimed in big blue letters Ex-Im Bank Reauthorized  but the fight is not over yet for the governments embattled export credit agency.

title: Ray Gandolf, Sportscaster and Our World Co-Anchor, Dies at 85
description: Ray Gandolf, a genial sportscaster for CBS who went on to become co-anchor of the acclaimed but short-lived historical series Our World for ABC, died on Wednesday at his home in Manhattan. He was 85.

title: Iran: Deadly Swine Flu Outbreak Is Likely to Spread, Official Warns
description: At least 33 people have died from a swine flu virus outbreak in two provinces of southwestern Iran in the past three weeks, the countrys deputy health minister, Ali-Akbar Sayyari, said Monday. Mr. Sayyari also said the virus, known as H1N1, was likely to spread to other areas, including Tehran, the capital and Irans largest city with about 8.3 million people. Mr. Sayyaris remarks, reported by the official Islamic Republic News Agency, did not explain the precise origin of the outbreak or how the Iranian authorities intended to combat it. Swine flu is named for a virus that infects pigs, but the H1N1 strain, which first emerged in 2009, spreads via human-to-human contact and escalated into a global pandemic before it was contained after a year. The virus is now considered a human seasonal flu virus, according to the Department of Health and Human Services in the United States, and can be prevented with a vaccine.

title: Federal Transportation Bill Is a Boon for the New Hudson Rail Tunnel, Officials Say
description: Near the site where a new rail tunnel could one day run under the Hudson River, officials said on Monday that a recently passed federal transportation bill would make it easier to secure funding for the long-awaited project.

title: Travel Industry in Motion as Visas Are Reviewed
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama on Sunday blamed a special visa travel program for allowing one of the San Bernardino terrorists into the country, a chill swept through the American travel industry.

title: Russia Gives France a Puppy to Replace Police Dog Killed in Raid
description: In a ceremony in Moscow on Monday, Russia presented France with a puppy to replace a police dog killed in the aftermath of the terrorist attacks in Paris last month.

title: Alphabets Life Sciences Business Has a New Name: Verily
description: V is for Verily.

title: Oil Prices Plunge 5% After OPEC Stands Pat
description: HOUSTON  Crude oil prices slid a further 5 percent on Monday to fall to their lowest levels since the 2009 global recession, pummeled by the fading chance that Saudi Arabia would cut production to halt the commoditys yearlong slide.

title: To Judge, Lawyers Cooperation Doesnt Offset Corruption
description: To federal prosecutors, Anthony J. Mangone, a Westchester County lawyer convicted on corruption charges, was among their most important cooperating witnesses in years. His help has been credited with leading to the convictions of three current or former New York State senators as well as other public officials.

title: U.S. Will Add a Third Level to Warnings of Terrorism
description: WASHINGTON  The Department of Homeland Security plans to change the terrorism alert system so it can provide general advisories to the public about threats, national security officials said on Monday.

title: M.L.B.s Cuba Trip to Include Jose Abreu, Star Who Defected
description: A good-will tour of Cuba next week by Major League Baseball and its players union will include a prominent Cuban player who defected in 2013, a rare concession by a Cuban government that typically denounces such individuals as traitors and bars them from its national team.

title: Guns in Your 401(k)? The Push to Divest Grows
description: You probably own a stake in a gun manufacturer, whether you know it or not.

title: Janet Wolfe, Gothamite on a First-Name Basis With Her Era, Dies at 101
description: So. About Janet.

title: Mariuccia Mandelli, Italian Fashion Designer, Dies at 90
description: Mariuccia Mandelli, an Italian fashion designer whose long list of credits includes the shortest of achievements  she was widely described as having invented hot pants  died on Sunday at her home in Milan. She was 90.

title: Italy: Iraqi With Terrorism Ties Is Arrested in Illegal Migration Case
description: The Italian police arrested an Iraqi man with extremist ties on Monday who they suspect helped foreigners pass illegally through the southeastern port city of Bari. The police identified the man as Majid Muhamad, 45, who served 10 years in an Italian prison on terrorism charges, and who was released a year ago. He was a known terrorist who had been affiliated with Ansar al-Islam, a radical group often linked to Al Qaeda, said Michele De Tullio, an official with the polices special operations division in Bari. The investigation began in February, when Mr. Muhamad was found to be in contact with Ayachi Bassam, an imam in the Brussels district of Molenbeek, who was arrested  and later convicted  on terrorism charges in Bari. Mr. Bassam was released on appeal. Mr. De Tullio said that since Mr. Muhamads release, he had renewed his contacts to extremist affiliates.

title: U.S. Seeks to Avoid Ground War Welcomed by Islamic State
description: As the debate on how best to contain the Islamic State continues to rage in Western capitals, the militants themselves have made one point patently clear: They want the United States and its allies to be dragged into a ground war.

title: How an Effort to Close Loopholes in Californias Assault Weapons Law Was Thwarted
description: California has some of the strongest gun control laws in the nation, including the kind of ban on assault weapons that President Obama is calling for nationwide.

title: Terrorists Mock Bids to End Use of Social Media
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In the hours after 14 people were killed in San Bernardino, Calif., a familiar voice celebrated the attacks on Twitter: California, we have already arrived with our soldiers. Decide how to be your end, with knife or bomb.

title: Linking Brazil to French Guiana, a Bridge for No One
description: St.-GEORGES-DE-LOYAPOCK, French Guiana  From the canopied entryway of the border police headquarters here, where its commander, Pascal Rudeaux, goes to smoke a cigarette and watch the tropical rain pelt down, you can see the tall concrete pillars of the bridge that was meant to connect French Guiana, an outpost of France in South America, with neighboring Brazil. But ask Commander Rudeaux what the speed limit is on the bridge that his officers guard, and he laughs and makes a Gallic frown that expresses a begrudging acceptance of lifes essential mysteries.

title: Verbatim: Dick Cheney Criticizes Donald Trumps Muslim Policy
description: Dick Cheney, the former vice president, speaking to the conservative radio host Hugh Hewitt and referring to a proposal by Donald J. Trump to bar Muslims from entering the country.

title: Big Challenges Lie Ahead for a Delicate Winning Alliance in Venezuela
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  There were ear-to-ear smiles and a heady buzz in the hotel meeting room as the opposition leaders gathered here on Monday to discuss their stunning election victory. They had finally handed the government a major setback and they planned to announce that they had not only won a majority, but also a landslide of two-thirds of the seats in the legislature.

title: After Months of Lying in Wait and Watching Rivals, Ted Cruz Sees Payoff in Polls
description: Hours after Ted Cruz announced his presidential candidacy last March at an evangelical university, his team openly cheered his meager position in the polls, where his support registered at around 5 percent. You have to own a base in the Republican primary, the campaign manager, Jeff Roe, said then. If you own the base, then you can grow it.

title: Deron Williams Is Back in New York, Minus the Pressure
description: Late in the second quarter on Monday, the Knicks rookie Kristaps Porzingis guarded the Mavericks Deron Williams at the top of the key. Williams looked different from when he played for the Nets  with a closely shaved scalp, a blue headband and a bushy beard. He caught Porzingis with a pump fake, and then drove with his left hand through the lane and switched deftly to his right hand for a layup, avoiding a block attempt by Robin Lopez.

title: New York Education Dept. Clarifies Goals for Poor-Performing Schools
description: Amid growing criticism that New York City is demanding too little improvement from its lowest-performing schools, the Department of Education on Monday released a list of the education targets that schools in Mayor Bill de Blasios $400 million School Renewal Program are expected to meet.

title: Brooklyn Crash Victim Is Remembered for Flair, Especially at Holidays
description: Every year Victoria Nicodemus pulled out all the stops with her Christmas decorations, giving simple trimmings a flair informed by her art history degree. She was spending last weekend shopping for baubles for the fresh Christmas tree in her apartment, one of her brothers said, when on Sunday evening, a sport utility vehicle jumped the curb where she was strolling in Fort Greene, Brooklyn. Ms. Nicodemus, 30, died from the impact.

title: In France, the Political Fruits of Fear
description: The stunning gains made by Frances far-right National Front party in the first round of voting in regional elections on Sunday were clearly bolstered by fears arising from the Nov. 13 terrorist attacks in Paris, and from months of relentless news of the waves of foreigners arriving in Europe.

title: Giants Fail, Repeatedly, in the Final Countdown
description: If each Giants game this season had ended with 75 seconds remaining in regulation on the scoreboard clock, the teams record would be 9-3.

title: Paper Shows Evidence in Officer Randolph Holders Killing
description: A convicted drug dealer charged with killing a police officer initially denied he had shot anyone and claimed that the police had shot at him without provocation, according to a court documentfiled on Monday.

title: Review: David Bowie Songs and a Familiar Alien in Lazarus
description: Ice-cold bolts of ecstasy shoot like novas through the glamorous muddle and murk of Lazarus, the great-sounding, great-looking and mind-numbing new musical built around songs by David Bowie. These transfixing moments occur when Mr. Bowie feels most palpably present  that is, when one of the shows carefully stylized performers delivers a distinctly Bowie number in a distinctly Bowie style.

title: Motel Offering
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  We continue our eavesdropping on Will Shortzs clue discussion with his assistant, Joel Fagliano, and today it just so happens that they are editing a crossword puzzle by Neville Fogarty.

title: Mets Revival on the Field May Bode Well for Finances, Too
description: Mr. Met and a Coca-Cola polar bear stood on the podium above the trading floor at the New York Stock Exchange on Monday, silent stars in an entourage celebrating Cokes new deal to replace Pepsi as the official soft-drink sponsor at Citi Field. As a Coke executive pressed the button that triggered the bell, Mr. Met clapped his four-fingered hands together, and the Polar Bear pumped his left front paw in triumph.

title: Japans G.D.P. Grows, Avoiding a Recession
description: TOKYO  Japans latest recession turns out not to have been a recession at all.

title: New York Will Host Americas Cup Warm-Up Race in 2016
description: The next Americas Cup, in 2017, will be contested in the unlikely and isolated location of Bermuda, even though Oracle Team USA holds the trophy.

title: Mets Off-Season Plans Depend on Ben Zobrist
description: NASHVILLE  A horde of news media members waited in the hotel hallway outside the Mets winter meetings war room Monday afternoon, waiting to speak with the assistant general manager John Ricco, when two representatives of Ben Zobrist exited the room.

title: Kristaps Porzingis Evokes Dirk Nowitzki but Cant Beat the Real Thing
description: Janis Porzingis, whose younger brother was about an hour from taking the court for the 22nd game of his N.B.A. career, stood along the baseline at Madison Square Garden on Monday night and watched as Dirk Nowitzki of the Dallas Mavericks warmed up.

title: Todd Bowles and Jets See Win Over Giants as Affirmation
description: The Jets five losses this season have run the gamut of despair: miserable first halves and fourth-quarter implosions and turnover-filled debacles, each more nauseating than the last.

title: Fargo Season 2, Episode 9: Going Undercover
description: A couple of weeks ago, FX gave the green light to a third season of Fargo, further extending an enterprise that was originally intended as a 10-episode limited series. Coincidentally or not, Mondays episode introduced a misguided framing device (narrated by Martin Freeman, from the shows first season) that casts the events of Season 2 as the bloody middle chapter in a much broader crime story.

title: Illness Shakes Mother Who Rebuilt Her Life
description: For more than a month, Anglica Diaz refused to acknowledge the contents of a letter from her doctor. She kept it from her employer.

title: Amir Aczel, Author of Scientific Cliffhanger, Dies at 65
description: Amir D. Aczel, a science writer who took readers on a mathematical mystery tour in Fermats Last Theorem, his account of how a famous 300-year-old problem in number theory was finally solved in the 1990s, and went on to write more than a dozen popular books on intriguing scientific ideas and discoveries, died on Nov. 26 in Nmes, in the south of France. He was 65.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | syllogism
description: syllogism  \si-l-ji-zm\  noun

title: LeBron Jamess Deal With Nike Becomes Contract for Life
description: Nike said Monday that it had signed the Cleveland Cavaliers superstar LeBron James to a lifetime contract, confirming the marketing value of sticking with James well into his postplaying career.

title: Red Sox Acquire Carson Smith From Mariners
description: NASHVILLE  The Boston Red Sox further bolstered their bullpen on Monday, agreeing to a trade with Seattle for Carson Smith and Roenis Elias. In 70 games with the Mariners last season, the right-handed Smith had 13 saves and a 2.31 E.R.A., with 92 strikeouts in 70 innings. He will serve as a setup man to Craig Kimbrel, a closer acquired last month from San Diego in return for prospects, with Elias as a long reliever and insurance for the rotation.

title: Robbery Suspect Fatally Shot by Off-Duty Police Officer in Queens
description: An off-duty police officer responding to an automobile ad on Craigslist fatally shot one of two men who tried to rob him when he showed up to buy the car on Monday in Queens, according to the police.

title: What to Watch Tuesday
description: Asif Kapadia ponders the cost of celebrity in his documentary about Amy Winehouse; the Huangs pad Santas biography in Fresh Off the Boat; and the Victorias Secret angels strut their stuff in next to nothing.

title: Beijings Red Alert for Pollution Rekindles Anger and Confusion
description: Families in Beijing waited anxiously on Monday evening to hear whether schools would shut the next day, posing unexpected child-care challenges, after the city issued its first-ever red alert for heavy smog about 6:30 p.m. and advised school closings in an effort to protect students health and reduce traffic on the roads, among other measures.

title: Corrections: December 8, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Until we are able to determine and understand this problem and the dangerous threat it poses, our country cannot be the victims of horrendous attacks by people that believe only in jihad.

title: Jon Stewart Returns to The Daily Show as a Guest
description: Just a few months after his retirement, Jon Stewart made a visit to The Daily Show on Monday to talk about a health care act for 9/11 emergency responders that he had helped champion when he hosted the program.

title: Clean Sailing
description: Ships like the Perla del Caribe are fueled by liquefied natural gas, which can reduce carbon dioxide emissions compared with the heavy tarlike fuels used on most ships.

title: Building Greener Ships, to Keep the Sea From Rising
description: SAN DIEGO  With its cavernous cargo holds and gleaming white superstructure, the 730-foot Perla del Caribe, which is nearing completion at a shipyard here, looks like any midsize container ship.

title: Climate Change and Coal Mining in India
description: Within hours of his arrival in Jharia, a remote corner of Indias Jharkhand State, Souvid Dattas eyes teared up and his lungs burned. Swirling clouds of coal dust and toxic fumes from dozens of fires ablaze in open seams made him dizzy. Jharia is in the main coal belt in the region that supplies the highest-quality coal fueling Indias rapid economic expansion.

title: What Bill OReilly Gets Wrong About Ronald Reagan
description: HAVING served for almost seven years as Ronald Reagans secretary of state, I reacted to Bill OReillys and Martin Dugards latest book, Killing Reagan: The Violent Assault That Changed a Presidency, with surprise and dismay, and some alarm. The book, which currently occupies the No. 1 spot on The Timess nonfiction best-seller list, portrays the president as a weakened man who struggled through almost eight years in office with physical and intellectual limitations brought on by the brutal assassination attempt of March 30, 1981.

title: A Penis Transplant Recalls a Novel
description: To the Editor:

title: The Dirty Work of a Coal Baron Exposed
description: Five years after a West Virginia coal mine explosion killed 29 miners, a federal jury has convicted Donald Blankenship, a powerful Appalachian coal baron, of criminal conspiracy to violate mine safety standards through his profit-obsessed mismanagement.

title: Solar or Wind vs. Nuclear
description: To the Editor:

title: Housing Prices in New York
description: To the Editor:

title: How ISIS Makes Radicals
description: After the terrorist attack in San Bernardino, some peoples minds flew to the materialistic element of the atrocity  the guns that were used in the killing. But the crucial issue, it seems to me, is what you might call the technology of persuasion  how is it that the Islamic State is able to radicalize a couple living in Redlands, Calif.? What psychological tools does it possess that enable it to wield this far-flung influence?

title: What if Going Viral Matters More Than Iowa?
description: The candidates have posed next to a life-size butter cow in Des Moines, ridden motorcycles down the streets of Boone, bought 3,500 ears of sweet corn in Windsor Heights and given helicopter rides to state fair attendees. This is just what it means to run for president: ritual fun, meat-on-a-stick and all, in the great state of Iowa.

title: Why Supreme Court Justices Should Celebrate College Diversity, Not Reject It
description: Amid protests over racial discrimination on college campuses, the Supreme Court will hear oral arguments for a second time Wednesday in Fisher v. University of Texas. The case revolves around the question of whether the universitys modest consideration of an applicants race as part of a comprehensive admissions process is constitutional.

title: Helping Hungry College Students
description: To the Editor:

title: The Assault on Climate Science
description: State College, Pa.  WITH world leaders gathered in Paris to address climate change, most of the planet seems to have awakened to the reality that the Earth is warming and that were responsible.

title: Bizarre Responses to a Plea for Reason
description: President Obamas address to the nation Sunday was intended to reassure anxious Americans that the United States will defeat the Islamic State, known as ISIS or ISIL, by being strong and smart, resilient and relentless, and by drawing upon every aspect of American power. But success, he noted, wont depend on tough talk, or abandoning our values, or giving into fear. Thats what groups like ISIL are hoping for.

title: Where Jihadism Grows
Decriminalizing Drugs: When Treatment Replaces Prison
description: If one of my children were a drug addict, what would I want for him?

title: Animated Life: Mary Leakey
description: Forty years ago in Laetoli, Tanzania, an elephant dung fight between a couple of paleoanthropologists led to a discovery: a fossilized animal print, at least 3.6 million years old. But the site had an even bigger surprise in store. After years of excavation, the team discovered the unmistakable footprints of early hominids  possible human ancestors.

title: News Qs | A Side Serving of Science for Your Next Birthday Party
description: Before Reading A Side Serving of Science for Your Next Birthday Party:

title: Examining a Voting Rights Case
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court hears arguments on Tuesday in an important voting rights case. The justices will consider a question so fundamental that it is surprising that the court has never addressed it before. Here is a look at the case, the arguments advanced by the two sides and the practical consequences of the possible rulings.

title: What Are the Best Books Youve Read This Year?
description: As we near the end of the calendar year, The Times Book Review section has been rounding up its lists of best books of 2015.

title: Shala Monroques Caribbean Beauty Tips
description: The art-world and front-row favorite Shala Monroque, 36, is living life at a different pace since moving from New York to her native St. Lucia. A former art gallery saleswoman, Ms. Monroque is now working as an editor-at-large for Garage magazine, editing a coffee-table book of images of her favorite Caribbean islands and serving as the ambassador of the newly introduced online fashion retailer 151Luwolt. Below, learn how she balances island and city beauty.

title: When the Narrative Becomes the Story
description: When did a plain story become a perpetual narrative? It used to be that after something happened, our leaders, or would-be leaders, would simply debate whatever occurred. It was not always elegant or polite. But the exercise was at least direct. Politicians would unfurl their platforms and attacks and (if they wanted to get all lofty about it) their visions. The media would cover it, and then we could all go on with our lives without having to endure an endless belch of rapid reactions and step-back analyses.

title: Trudeaus Canada, Again
description: On Tuesday, Nov. 10, six days after Justin Trudeau, leader of the Liberal Party, was sworn in as prime minister of Canada, I was shown into his office on the third floor of the Parliament building in Ottawa. A dark oak-paneled room, it contained a jumble of outsize furniture chosen by the previous occupant, Stephen Harper, whose Conservative Party was in power for a decade. The office had the air of a recently abandoned bunker  shelves bare, curtains drawn, personal effects hastily removed. Trudeaus father, Pierre, occupied the same office for 16 years during the 1960s, 70s and 80s, and the new prime minister would shortly install his fathers old desk, a symbol of restoration but also an emphatic rejection of his predecessor. The squat, bulldoglike bureau left by the departing prime minister, Trudeau implied, was a reflection of Harpers autocratic manner.

title: Potential Power Shift as Court Weighs One Person One Vote
description: WASHINGTON  A closely divided Supreme Court on Tuesday struggled to decide what kind of democracy people wanted, as Justice Stephen G. Breyer put it during an argument over the meaning of the constitutional principle of one person one vote.

title: Few Wins but Much Chaos at Rutgers After Move to the Big Ten
description: It has been hard to pass a highway or a tollbooth in New Jersey over the past three years without a billboard declaring Rutgers Is Big.

title: Oscar Pistorius Granted Bail Ahead of Sentencing
description: A South African court on Tuesday granted bail to Oscar Pistorius, the Olympic star known as the Blade Runner, pending his sentencing for the killing of his girlfriend.

title: Twain and Stanley Enter Paradise, by Oscar Hijuelos
description: Shortly after the explorer Henry Morton Stanley died in 1904, Samuel Clemens, known to the world as Mark Twain, sent condolences to Stanleys widow: I have lost a dear and honored friend, ... a tried and proved hero. ... How far he stretches across my life! Twain counted Stanley as one of his oldest friends, claiming, I knew him when his work was all before him.

title: The Year of Lear: Shakespeare in 1606, by James Shapiro
description: When I was reading Shakespeare in school, he was the heir to the author of the 15th-century play Everyman in more ways than one. All we could know about him as a man was in the plays, or in his will, or in the few, few things his peers said about him. He was not Anon., but almost, and so his work seemed to come from nowhere  pure genius manifesting itself.

title: Ask Well: Running With Osteoporosis
description: Question:

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Donald Trump, San Bernardino, Dallas Cowboys
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: December Warmth
description: Updated 8:49 a.m.

title: Democrats Begin Fund-Raising Off Donald Trumps Proposed Ban on Muslims
description: Hillary Clintons campaign is using Donald J. Trumps proposal to ban Muslims from entering the United States as a fund-raising and list-building tool.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Bernie Sanders to Tour Baltimore Neighborhood Where Freddie Gray Riots Broke Out
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont will meet today with black pastors and leaders in Baltimore, and will tour the neighborhood where the death of a young black man in police custody this year sparked riots.

title: House Readies a Bipartisan Press to Tighten Visa Waiver Program
description: The House is set on Tuesday to make its second major statement on national security changes in the aftermath of recent terrorist attacks by tightening aspects of the visa waiver program that, if certain conditions are met, eases entry into the United States for citizens of 38 countries.

title: Morning Agenda: A Push to Divest Stakes in Gun Makers
description: A PUSH TO DIVEST STAKES IN GUN MAKERS | You probably own a stake in a gun manufacturer, whether you know it or not, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook column.

title: Season 2 of Transparent Expands Its View of the Pfefferman Clan
description: What is being queer if not questioning everything? asks Ali Pfefferman (Gaby Hoffmann), during an argument with her lover. Ali, who may be attracted to another woman, argues that she wants to avoid forcing a heteronormative model on their relationship. Her lover suggests that Ali, who only recently came out, is being perhaps a little self-serving. Listen to yourself, she says. Youve been queer for, like, 30 seconds.

title: 2015 New York City Real Estate Quiz
description: Record prices, skinny skyscrapers, celebrity listings and architectural debuts: Its been an eventful year in New York City real estate. Test your memory with this quiz.

title: N.H.L.s Backup Goalies, Living in the Moment, Thrive at Stepping In
description: If Rangers goaltender Henrik Lundqvist stays in one piece, and Coach Alain Vigneault sticks with his plan, Antti Raanta will not play until Saturday.

title: His Last Year Looming, Obama Is Stuck in the Middle
description: Approaching his final year in office, President Obama faces a public stubbornly divided between supporters and critics.

title: Jacques Ppins Food Memories
description: Jacques Ppin, who will turn 80 on Dec. 18, exudes an air of perennial youth. Having worked his way up the rungs of rigorous Paris kitchens before coming to New York, he became the youngest in a circle of influential cooks (including Julia Child, Pierre Franey, James Beard and Craig Claiborne) who helped ignite a new enthusiasm in the United States for food and dining. In this essay, taken from a piece Mr. Ppin wrote for a birthday celebration in October, he looks back to his earliest years.

title: Qualcomm Is Accused of Violating Antitrust Rules in Europe
description: The European Commission on Tuesday filed antitrust charges against the chip maker Qualcomm, the latest in a growing number of competition investigations targeting American technology companies.

title: Smog So Thick, Beijing Comes to a Standstill
description: BEIJING  Residents across this city awoke to an environmental state of emergency on Tuesday as poisonous air quality prompted the government to close schools, force motorists off the road and shut down factories.

title: ISIS Extends Recruitment Efforts to China With New Chant
description: BEIJING  The Islamic State has been recruiting far and wide for members to join its ranks on the battlefields of Iraq and Syria or elsewhere. Now those efforts are extending to China.

title: Learning From Terrorism Past
description: MILAN  EUROPE has been in full panic mode since last months terrorist attacks in Paris. But while the deaths of 130 people, mostly young, in those attacks is mind-boggling, this is not the first time Europe has been racked by violence. If the European Union has recently appeared an oasis of tolerance and security in a troubled world, its because the previous two generations of Europeans didnt lose their cool.

title: Cartoon: Chappatte on the Environment
description: Do what I say, not what I do.

title: Outcry Over Donald Trumps Muslim Comments Is Loud, but With an Uncertain Refrain
description: I dont care.

title: Will It Be a Music Documentary or One About War Criminals?
description: Its been a week since the Academys documentary branch selected its long list of 15 documentary finalists, five of which will go on to compete for the final prize, and already its looking like 2014 all over again.

title: Dance This Week: Alina Cojocaru, Liz Gerring and an Alternative Nutcracker
description: Alina Cojocaru and the Romanian Ballet

title: The Dangler Zone
description: As Ive noted before, usage experts debate how ruthlessly the grammar police should enforce traditional rules against dangling modifiers  modifying phrases, often at the beginning of a sentence, that arent directly adjacent to the word being modified.

title: The Non-Quarterback, Non-Running Back Heisman
description: Last night, the Washington Redskins brought their much-debated appellation to Monday Night Football.

title: Venezuelas Opposition Shouldnt Celebrate Yet
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  President Nicols Maduro could not hide his disappointment after Sundays legislative elections. In an address on state TV, he spoke slowly, taking long pauses, it seemed, to find the strength to admit a painful truth: His United Socialist Party of Venezuela had suffered a crushing defeat. At first, Mr. Maduro delivered what sounded like a coherent speech that would lead to a message of acceptance and reconciliation among Venezuelans. But after a few minutes he awoke from the temporary spell of common sense and went on to blame an economic war waged by the right wing in Venezuela and abroad for the ruling partys loss.

title: Donald Trump Postpones Interview With Yahoos Katie Couric
description: Donald J. Trump postponed a planned interview with the former network news anchor Katie Couric, as the debate raged over his call to bar Muslim immigrants from entering the United States, a producer with the program confirmed.

title: In Ukraine, Joe Biden Pushes a Message of Democracy
description: KIEV, Ukraine  Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. urged Ukrainian leaders on Tuesday to curb the power of the business moguls dominating society and to fulfill the promise of the popular revolution that pushed out a pro-Moscow government last year.

title: Farewell, 2015 | A Year-End Special News Quiz
description: Updated | Dec. 31

title: In Testy Exchange, Donald Trump Interrupts and Morning Joe Cuts to Commercial
description: Impatience with Donald J. Trumps unusual style of interviewing  calling in by phone and talking over the anchors asking him questions  earned him an on-air rebuke on Tuesday from Joe Scarborough of MSNBCs Morning Joe program.

title: I Love You (Can I Crash?)
description: Dear Diary:

title: The Tricky Business of Treating Altitude Sickness
description: When the pop band Panic! at the Disco played in Colorado at the Red Rocks amphitheater more than a mile above sea level, the frontman, Brendon Urie, joked that his drug of choice was oxygen.

title: Trying Something New on New Years Eve
description: New Years Eve doesnt have to mean the usual been-there, done-that celebration. A number of hotels around the country have created packages that include everything from dancing to a fireworks show. Prices below are for two.

title: An Insiders Guide to London Theater
description: What works on Broadway wont work in the West End. Here are 12 tricks to getting the most out of your theater trip to London.

title: New Chicago Police Video Prompts Rebuke From Mayor Rahm Emanuel
description: CHICAGO  The Chicago police, facing almost daily protests and a newly announced Justice Department investigation, released footage Monday night showing a 38-year-old black man being shocked by a Taser and dragged down a hallway by officers in 2012.

title: Norfolk Southern Railway Snubs Canadian Pacifics Bid
description: Canadian Pacifics pursuit of Norfolk Southern has gotten personal.

title: 1940: A Pale Copy of Axis Economy
description: TOKIO  Following much public criticism and a series of conferences of government officials during the last few weeks, the Japanese Cabinet approved yesterday a national economic structure which bears a rather weak resemblance to the totalitarian economic systems of Germany and Italy but retains, fundamentally, a capitalistic basis. As such, it may represent something of a victory for Japans business men, who have resisted vigorously attempts by extremists to nationalize the countrys industry and finance.New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 9, 1940

title: How to See What Windows 10 Just Installed
description: Q. I know Windows 10 automatically performs software updates, but when I get a notification saying, Updates were installed, Id like to know what exactly was installed. Is there a way to find out?

title: Daily Report: Tech Companies Pressured on Terrorist Content
description: When Hillary Clinton, the presumptive leader in the race for the Democratic presidential nomination, called on tech companies to do a better job of scrubbing their services of terrorism-related content, she was hardly the first politician to do so. Just a few days ago, President Obama made similar comments, and various members of Congress have been saying the same thing for the better part of a year.

title: Living a Frontier Dream on the Outskirts of Chinas Capital
description: JACKSON HOLE, China  Yearning to breathe untainted air, the band of harried urbanites flocked to this parched, wild land, bringing along their dreams of a free and uncomplicated life.

title: Selling Guns on a 24-Hour TV Network
description: Two television entrepreneurs in California think they have just what America needs: a 24-hour shopping channel for guns.

title: If It Owns a Well or a Mine, Its Probably in Trouble
description: The pain among energy and mining producers worsened again on Tuesday, as one of the industrys largest players cut its work force by nearly two-thirds and Chinese trade data amplified concerns about the countrys appetite for commodities.

title: Eagles of Death Metal Return to Bataclan for First Time Since Paris Attacks
description: Members of the rock band Eagles of Death Metal returned on Tuesday to the Bataclan concert hall in Paris for the first time since their performance on Nov. 13, when gunmen stormed the building and killed 90 people.

title: Working Families Party Endorses Bernie Sanders for President
description: The Working Families Party, the labor-aligned third party that originated in New York and has sought to become a national force, endorsed Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont for president on Tuesday, handing him a symbolic boost from the state that twice elected Hillary Clinton to the Senate.

title: Republicans Face an Unusually Uncertain Race Before First States Vote
description: WASHINGTON  In this Republican presidential campaign, mid-December is not as late as it used to be. Stand by for changes.

title: Nobodys in a Hurry to Win the N.F.C. East
description: Last week, we wrote that although it might seem difficult to believe, some team was going to win the N.F.C. East and make the playoffs.

title: VSPs and the FN
description: Kevin ORourke weighs in on the big showing of Marine Le Pen and friends in the French elections; like me, he argues that it has a lot to do with Europes economic failures.

title: Obamacare and the Cockroaches
description: In policy discourse, zombies and cockroaches are somewhat different.

title: 1965: Replacing American Jazzmen
description: PARIS  The Paris Musicians Union, with French government backing, has launched a campaign to replace many American jazz performers here with French musicians. The drive, aimed at foreigners in general but largely affecting American Negro musicians, is violently opposed by some of the owners of leading jazz clubs. Intended to provide permanent work for French players, it has already resulted in orchestra changes in some clubs and in the surveillance of nightspots by Ministry of Labor inspectors counting foreigners. The campaign would allow one or two foreign headliners to continue playing in each club. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 9, 1965

title: Pro-Jeb Bush Ad Assails Donald Trump and Two Other Rivals
description: Right to Rise, the super PAC supporting Jeb Bushs candidacy, has created its first negative ad of the cycle, attacking Donald J. Trump, Senator Marco Rubio and Senator Ted Cruz.

title: Unilever Chief Calls for Climate Funding
description: Paul Polman, chief executive of Unilever, called for private sector financing to address climate change during The International New York Times Energy for Tomorrow conference in Paris.

title: Pope Francis Calls for Gods Mercy at Start of Yearlong Jubilee
description: VATICAN CITY  Pope Francis on Tuesday ushered in a yearlong celebration dedicated to the theme of mercy, intoning the ceremonial versicle, Open unto me the gates of justice before pushing open the bronze doors in St. Peters Basilica that are kept bricked up until the start of a Jubilee, or Holy Year.

title: Bret Easton Ellis on Living in the Cult of Likability
description: This is an article from Turning Points, a magazine that explores what critical moments from this year might mean for the year ahead.

title: Granola Is Enriched With Popped Quinoa
description: In December I make double and triple batches of granola to give as Christmas presents, party favors and host gifts, my customary mix of oats, oat bran, coconut chips, spices and lots of nuts and seeds.

title: Pursuing Gender Equality as a Competitive Advantage
description: Hadley Mullin was already an anomaly as a female investor at TSG Consumer Partners, the private equity firm she joined in 2004. Six months later, she found out she was pregnant.

title: Jeremihs Late Nights Receives Less Fanfare Than Hed Expected From Def Jam
description: In the five years since Jeremih last put out an album, his slinky voice has been everywhere. A radio fixture since his debut in 2009, the Chicago R&B singer has had four Top 10 Billboard hits, including the platinum-selling Dont Tell Em, which in June 2014 became the first official release from his new album and peaked that fall at No. 6.

title: Margaret Atwood Writing a Series of Graphic Novels
description: Margaret Atwood, who has written poetry, childrens literature and fiction and nonfiction, is adding another genre to her repertoire: graphic novels. Dark Horse Comics will publish Angel Catbird, written by Ms. Atwood and drawn by Johnnie Christmas, in the fall of 2016.

title: Prostate Cancer Treatment Tied to Alzheimers Risk
description: Hormone therapy, a common treatment for prostate cancer, is associated with an increased risk for Alzheimers disease, a new study has found.

title: Airpocalypse: Beijing Smog Red Alert on Social Media
description: As Beijing enacted emergency measures on Tuesday to cope with the citys first red alert over air pollution, images and stories of woe on social media documented the smog that is keeping schoolchildren and factory workers at home and some vehicles off the roads.

title: A New (Very Tiny) Bucket Bag
description: In 2008, Jake Sargent and Daniel Corrigan started the mens wear brand Simon Miller  a New York-based premium denim and ready-to-wear label that utilizes Japanese fabrics. Last year, they debuted a womens collection.

title: Report Details Systemic Failures in Communication Between New York Police and Housing Authority
description: Failures in required communications between the New York City Housing Authority and the citys  Police Department are partly to blame for the disproportionately high crime rates that have plagued the public housing projects, according to a city investigation.

title: Chicago Will Get Its Own Hamilton  Production
description: Hamilton, the smash Broadway musical about Americas first Treasury secretary, will have an open-ended production in Chicago starting next fall, the shows lead producer said Tuesday.

title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens Fans Are Already Lining Up
description: LOS ANGELES  Marilyn Monroe and Freddy Krueger were trying not to look annoyed. But their mood was obvious on Monday afternoon as tourists paid little heed to the celebrity impersonators on Hollywood Boulevard, instead focusing their curiosity on more than 100 people camped out in the courtyard of the historic Chinese Theater.

title: On Twitter, San Bernardino Shooting Divides More Than Unites
description: It is an emerging national ritual: Word of a killing, like the one last week in San Bernardino, Calif., spreads. Information trickles out. A torrent of tweets is undammed.

title: On Artificial Turf Issue, U.S. Women Dig In at Last
description: The United States womens national soccer team took one look Saturday at the artificial turf field that was to be the playing surface for Sunday nights friendly against Trinidad and Tobago and said, enough.

title: Forget Trumps Noise: Heres What Hes Signaling
description: Much of the reaction to Donald Trumps call for a total and complete shutdown of Muslims entering the United States casts him as a cynical populist who is simply supplying the sorts of proposals an Islamophobic electorate demands. By this view, were learning about the ugly side of America. But economics offers a different and arguably more optimistic lens for interpreting Mr. Trumps statement. And it suggests that his statement is less a calculated attempt at feeding a demand for bigotry and more an effort to fuel the hunger for authenticity.

title: Donald Trump Deflects Withering Fire on Muslim Plan
description: Repudiated across much of the political spectrum but defended on conservative talk radio, Donald J. Trump on Tuesday stood by his call to block all Muslims from entering the United States. He cast it as a temporary move in response to terrorism and invoked President Franklin D. Roosevelts authorization of the detention of Japanese, German and Italian immigrants during World War II as precedent.

title: After Breastfeeding Struggles, a Frenectomy, and Support. Which Helped More?
description: Like many women, I struggled to breastfeed. My daughters shallow latch was unbearably painful, and I worried she wasnt getting enough milk. We kept trying and trying, but it wasnt improving. But unlike many women, I was able to find a solution. In our case, a frenectomy  a simple outpatient procedure to snip the membranes under my 5-week-olds top lip and below the tongue (a.k.a. the frenulums)  seemed to change everything. But frenectomies are controversial, and even now, not everyone would agree that it was the procedure that made the difference.

title: Paul Ryan on Donald Trump: This Is Not Conservatism
description: Speaker Paul D. Ryan condemned on Tuesday the proposal by Donald J. Trump that Muslims be barred from entering the country, saying it is not what this party stands for.

title: Conviction of Former Jefferies Trader Is Overturned
description: A federal appeals court has overturned the 2014 conviction of a former Jefferies Group trader, Jesse C. Litvak, striking a blow to the governments efforts to crack down on abuses in bond trading.

title: An Art Installation You Can Wrap Around Your Wrist
description: The fine jewelry designer Monique Pan has always felt a strong connection with sculptors; I work with natural, raw materials and strive to create a balance between organic textures and geometric structure, she tells T in an email. Upon seeing the multidisciplinary artist Walter De Marias 1979 work The Broken Kilometer at Dia Art Foundations West Broadway site, she was struck by his use of line to create an awe-inspiring vision of grand scale.

title: Donald Trumps New Hampshire Endorsers Stand by Their Candidate
description: As much of the Republican Party rallies against Donald J. Trump and his plan to bar Muslims from entering the United States, his top supporters in New Hampshire  the first state to hold a primary election  are standing firmly behind him.

title: Solomon & Kuffs Flavors of the Caribbean in Harlem
description: Solomon & Kuff Just when the weather is starting to make island-hopping appealing, along comes a taste of the Caribbean near the Hudson River in Harlem. The chef, Christopher Faulkner, a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America, worked at Patroon, Melbas and Colors. He plans to feature dishes like peppered goat pie and fried fish with yucca chips, mostly as small plates. To accompany them, two bars carry more than 100 rums, with Karl Franz Williams, an owner and cocktail whiz, in charge. There are also two D.J. booths. The name of the restaurant refers to the sons of a slave, Venture Smith, who was bought for four gallons of rum. He eventually secured their freedom, and his own, and settled on Long Island and then in Connecticut. The restaurant, a generous 5,000 square feet, occupies a building that has been home to a number of other dining venues. (Opens Friday): 2331 12th Avenue (132nd Street), 212-939-9443, solomonandkuff.com.

title: False Positive Breast Tests Tied to Increased Cancer Risk
description: Women with a false positive mammogram or breast biopsy result have an increased risk of breast cancer over the next 10 years compared with those with a true negative result, a new report has found.

title: Head of U.S. Soccer Apologizes for Cancellation
description: Sunil Gulati, the president of U.S. Soccer, said the last-minute cancellation of a womens national team exhibition game over the weekend in Honolulu because of an unsafe artificial turf field was absolutely a black eye for this organization. He apologized to the teams fans, players and support staff for the federations series of mistakes in failing to ensure that the field was suitable for an international match.

title: Joe Biden, His Son and the Case Against a Ukrainian Oligarch
description: WASHINGTON  When Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. traveled to Kiev , Ukraine, on Sunday for a series of meetings with the countrys leaders, one of the issues on his agenda was to encourage a more aggressive fight against Ukraines rampant corruption and stronger efforts to rein in the power of its oligarchs.

title: Police Chiefs Say Scrutiny Over Videos Has Radically Changed Their Work
description: Anthony W. Batts, Baltimores police chief, was fired in July when rioting broke out after video footage emerged of the police arresting an African-American man who later died of an injury sustained in police custody.
