description: Alex Gansa answered questions here.

title: Treats for College and Beyond at Mondel Chocolates
description: Mondel Chocolates in Morningside Heights has ruined the holiday diets of generations of Columbia and Barnard students, who keep coming back long after graduation.

title: Where Katharine Hepburn Got Her Chocolates
description: The sign does say Mondel Chocolates. But the display window, a collection of boxes, posters and a neon sign that repeats the store name, shows no sweets. Habitual customers, however, ignore the arrangement and walk into Mondels with the same intention they have had for years.

title: Hundreds Evacuated From Rebel Foothold in Homs Under Cease-Fire
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Hundreds of people were evacuated on Wednesday from the last rebel-held pocket of Homs, the Syrian city devastated by years of bitter fighting and blockades.

title: First Dengue Fever Vaccine Approved by Mexico
description: A dengue fever vaccine developed by the French pharmaceutical giant Sanofi has been approved for use by Mexico, the first approval in the world for any vaccine for the disease, which afflicts tens of millions of people around the world and is becoming an increasing threat.

title: Ted Cruzs Disturbing Views on Climate Change (and Other Things)
description: Ted Cruz gave a long interview on Tuesday on NPRs Morning Edition, and I made a good-faith effort to understand his points. I failed.

title: Graham McNamee Wins Frick Award for Baseball Broadcasting
description: The Baseball Hall of Fame announced Wednesday that Graham McNamee, who it said called 12 World Series on radio from 1923 to 1934, had won its Ford C. Frick Award for broadcasting.

title: The Internets Loop of Action and Reaction Is Worsening
description: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton said this week that we should think about shutting down parts of the Internet to stop terrorist groups from inspiring and recruiting followers in distant lands. Mr. Trump even suggested an expert whod be perfect for the job: We have to go see Bill Gates and a lot of different people that really understand whats happening, and we have to talk to them  maybe, in certain areas, closing that Internet up in some way, he said on Monday in South Carolina.

title: Mens Wear, With a Little Shine
description: Plastic pants, vinyl shirts and metallic jackets  modeled by some of Instagrams favorite male models.

title: The Best Dance of 2015
description: Dance took off in a number of unexpected directions this year. The dance critics of The New York Times  Alastair Macaulay, Gia Kourlas, Brian Seibert and Siobhan Burke  look back at some of the biggest surprises.

title: The Best Classical Music of 2015
description: The classical music team of The New York Times shares its picks for the best performances of the year. Also read our list of the best classical recordings.

title: Arthur R. Taylor, Ex-CBS President Who Sold Yankees to Steinbrenner, Dies at 80
description: Arthur R. Taylor, a former corporate wunderkind who became president of CBS at 37, unloaded an underperforming network-owned property, the New York Yankees, and then, as a sometimes nettlesome overachiever, was fired by William S. Paley, the imperious CBS chairman and founder, died on Dec. 3 in Salisbury Township, Pa. He was 80.

title: The Best Movies of 2015
description: The film critics of The New York Times  Manohla Dargis, A. O. Scott and Stephen Holden  share their picks for the best movies of the year. The Golden Globe nominations were announced on Thursday.

title: A New 70s Throwback Bar in Bushwick
description: It may look like an old-man dive bar, but the scene inside Birdys is super young. Opened in September by members of the local rock band Weeknight (Holly MacGibbon and Andy Simmons), the bar channels 1970s-era rock with kitschy touches like pinball machines, a bust of Elvis lording over the bar and a vintage Colt 45 advertisement with Billy Dee Williams.

title: SantaCon Fights for the Right to Party, Responsibly
description: On a recent Friday night, upstairs at a dark bar in the East Village, six Santas checked their list: buy a snowmaker, decide whether to hire the figure skaters, and email Community Board 3 to apologize in advance.

title: App Smart | Holiday Helpers
description: The Santas Bag app can help organize holiday shopping, IBM Watson Trend keeps track of the most popular gifts and Elf Yourself can liven up any gathering.

title: Video Feature: Apps, Like Elves, Help Make the Season Bright
description: THE holidays are approaching, meaning gifts, budgeting, parties and other events  in other words, a hefty dose of stress. Fortunately, there are many apps that may help restore some holiday cheer.

title: Vast Collection of Second Empire Art to Be Sold by Christopher Forbes
description: PARIS  Christopher Forbes, vice chairman of Forbes, is to sell his vast collection of French Second Empire art and memorabilia at an auction in Fontainebleau, near Paris, next year, according to the auctioneer Jean-Pierre Osenat.

title: The Best Albums of 2015
description: The music critics of The New York Times share their picks for the best pop and jazz albums of the year.

title: Ted Cruz Adds Two More Endorsements From Social Conservatives
description: Senator Ted Cruz, ascending in state and national polls on the strength of social conservative support, won two more endorsements on Wednesday, including the backing of the National Organization for Marriage.

title: Teenagers Arent Getting Enough Exercise at School, or Anywhere
description: Teenagers can be a notoriously sedentary group. Now a new study showed that school may be a big part of the problem.

title: Affordable Care Act Plans Get 1 Million New Subscribers
description: WASHINGTON  A million new customers have signed up for health insurance during the Affordable Care Acts third open-enrollment season, Obama administration officials said on Wednesday, and call centers have been deluged with requests from others eager to enroll.

description: To the Editor:

title: Policy and the Art of the Possible
description: Andy Karsner, the chief executive of Manifest Energy, discusses the future of OPEC at The New York Times Energy for Tomorrow conference during a panel moderated by the Op-Ed columnist Thomas L. Friedman.

title: Jimmy McMillan, Rent Is Too Damn High Candidate, Is Retiring From Politics
description: Jimmy McMillan, the whiskered political showman who became a viral Internet star when he ran for governor of New York in 2010 as a candidate of the Rent Is Too Damn High Party, has announced his retirement from the political arena, citing a lack of public support for his agenda.

title: Policy and the Art of the Possible, Part Two
description: Hal Harvey, the C.E.O. of Energy Innovation, speaks at The New York Times Energy for Tomorrow conference during a panel moderated by the Op-Ed columnist Thomas L. Friedman.

title: John Kasich Rules Out Being a Running Mate
description: Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio, who is often mentioned as a potential vice-presidential candidate if his White House bid fails, vowed on Wednesday that he would not be anyones running mate in 2016.

title: Pandering to Plutocrats
description: Jeb Bush is not going to be the Republican nominee, so its somewhat unfortunate that the invaluable Tax Policy Center chose to make his proposals the subject of its first analysis of candidate tax plans. Still, its useful, if only as an indicator of what passes for responsible, establishment policy in todays GOP.

title: C. Gerald Fraser, Longtime Reporter for The Times, Dies at 90
description: C. Gerald Fraser, who covered the aftermath of the bloody Attica prison uprising in upstate New York and the pioneering presidential campaign of Shirley Chisholm in his 24 years as a reporter for The New York Times, died on Tuesday in the Bronx. He was 90.

title: Marissa Mayer Has a Year to Fulfill Yahoos Potential
description: Yahoo remains stuck in the deal cycle, putting off what looks like an inevitable sale for another year.

title: Review: Konstantin Lifschitz Takes a Liberal Approach to The Baroque Keyboard
description: There was a time, not all that long ago, when a program called The Baroque Keyboard would have meant a recital played on anything but the piano. Works of the 17th and 18th centuries were, at the height of the early-music movements influence, the preserve of harpsichordists.

title: The Banality of Trumpism
description: Brian Beutler has a good piece about the liberal reaction to Trumpism  which is that the phenomenon

title: The Best in Art of 2015
description: The co-chief art critics for The New York Times on the most notable themes of the year.

title: Hillary Clinton Says Donald Trumps Muslim Proposal Harms U.S. Antiterror Efforts
description: WATERLOO, Iowa  Hillary Clintons campaign has used Donald J. Trumps proposal to bar non-American Muslims from entering the United States as a fund-raising and organizing tool, selling a special edition Love Trumps Hate bumper sticker and texting supporters a link to a letter from Mrs. Clinton declaring her support for religious freedom.

title: Institute of Contemporary Art in Boston Gets Gift of Works by Women
description: The philanthropist and collector Barbara Lee is giving the Institute of Contemporary Art in Boston 20 works by 12 female artists with a value estimated at $42 million, the largest gift by value in the museums history, officials said.

title: Possible Suitors for Yahoo
description: Yahoos core business might fit with Barry Dillers menagerie.

title: Volkswagen Terms One Emissions Problem Smaller Than Expected
description: WOLFSBURG, Germany  It was the corporate equivalent of saying never mind.

title: Thomas Piketty to Indias Elite: Learn From History
description: MUMBAI, India  Many people in the room were seeking Thomas Pikettys attention, but what caught his eye was a small photograph of Bill Gates in a newspaper. My friend, he said with a chuckle.

title: Chicago Mayor Apologizes
description: In a rare speech before the Chicago City Council, Mayor Rahm Emanuel said the police shooting of Laquan McDonald happened on my watch and called for complete reform to restore trust in the police.

title: A Night Out With Solange Knowles at Art Basel
description: MIAMI BEACH  One thing Solange Knowles has learned in her brief time in the spotlight is to deflect assumptions about exactly who she is.

title: A Restaurant Designers Home Decorating Tips
description: Jeanette Dalrot takes T on a tour of her downtown New York City apartment.

title: Syria and More  Pictures of the Day
description: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere

title: A Restaurant Designers Do-It-Yourself Home
description: Jeanette Dalrot doesnt hide her obsessive attention to detail. Instead, the Swedish restaurant designer energetically puts it on display in the inviting interiors she creates for her clients.

title: Shipyard Accused of Botching Coast Guard Repairs Settles Case
description: WASHINGTON  A Louisiana-based shipyard has agreed after a nearly decade-long fight to pay the federal government $8.5 million to settle claims that it fraudulently covered up fundamental flaws on ships it was retrofitting for the Coast Guard. The patrol boats had to be abandoned after work on only the first eight was completed.

title: Rainstorms Batter the Pacific Northwest
description: Heavy rains that began Sunday night have inundated the Pacific Northwest, making roads impassable, severing power for tens of thousands of people and killing at least one person.

title: Argentinas Next Finance Chief Meets Debt Dispute Mediator
description: Argentinas incoming secretary of finance met this week with the arbiter of a bitter decade-long legal dispute between the country and a group of New York hedge funds, opening a new path toward a potential resolution.

title: Dec. 9, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Syria, Germany, China and India.

title: In Southwest Germany, Charming Day Trips From a Charming Town
description: When you find out youre just seven miles from the largest unearthed Roman latrine north of the Alps, you cant just sit idly by. Especially if said latrine (and the museum its a part of) is in Rottenburg, already recommended to me as a storybook medieval town. And if Rottenburg was just a pleasant seven-mile bike ride down the Neckar River from Tbingen, itself a storybook town.

title: New Policy Strands Thousands of Migrants in Greece
description: For the past several weeks only Syrians, Iraqis and Afghans have been allowed across the border into Macedonia.

title: Thousands of Migrants Stranded in Greece as Route North Is Narrowed
description: IDOMENI, Greece  There has been a rough triage taking place the last few weeks along the barbed-wire and chain-link fence separating Greece from Macedonia.

title: Jeb Bush Jumps In at a Life of the Party Event
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  Jeb Bush  party animal?

title: What Do Campus Protesters Really Want?
description: A wave of campus protests against racial discrimination has drawn intense media attention. But how well did the media capture what students were actually saying? Not too well, according to the students themselves  and our own analysis.

title: Tech Toys to Inspire a Childs Imagination
description: Still looking for the perfect holiday gift for that little someone on your list? A lot of todays technology is geared toward adults, but there are exciting new tech toys for children, too. Here are some good options to help a child on your list create, learn, explore and have fun.

title: Mets Acquire Neil Walker and Asdrubal Cabrera, Reshaping Middle of Infield
description: NASHVILLE  A day after losing out on Ben Zobrist, their top free-agent target, the Mets refashioned their infield on Wednesday. They traded their fifth starter, Jon Niese, to the Pittsburgh Pirates for second baseman Neil Walker and acquired the free-agent shortstop Asdrubal Cabrera, a two-time All-Star with the Cleveland Indians who played for Tampa Bay last season.

title: Chinese Justice System Relies on Torture, U.N. Panel Says
description: GENEVA  Torture remains deeply entrenched in Chinas criminal justice system, United Nations experts said Wednesday, calling for an end to the widespread use of secret detention in black prisons and to the punishment of lawyers for representing clients.

title: Wrap Skirts to Build a Holiday Look Around
description: Plus: Ferragamos new shoes, in time for the holidays; a new collection of fashion-focused workout clothes and the winner of the British emerging accessory designer award riffs on his popular heart-shaped ring.

title: Israel Holds 5 Arab Israelis Suspected of Supporting ISIS
description: JERUSALEM  Five Palestinian citizens of Israel have been arrested in recent weeks on suspicion of supporting the Islamic State, acquiring rifles and practicing shooting in a forest, according to Israeli officials.

title: Good News: Mets Lose Out on Ben Zobrist
description: Ben Zobrist, the apple of the Mets eye this off-season, decided to spurn the family Wilpon and sign with the Chicago Cubs.

title: Sam Mendes Leaves Chocolate Factory on Its Way to Broadway
description: Sam Mendes is withdrawing as the director of the Broadway-bound musical Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, allowing the producing team free rein to rework the commercially successful but critically divisive show before it opens in New York.

title: Studios Blamed in Directors Guild Study on Hiring of Women and Minority Filmmakers
description: The long established paucity of women directors in Hollywood has not only led to a federal investigation into gender discrimination, at the behest of the A.C.L.U., it has also spurred one of the industrys most important groups to take aim at the discrepancy  and take studios to task for failing to effect change.

title: Happy Birthday Copyright Case Reaches a Settlement
description: After more than two years of litigation, Happy Birthday to You  often called the most popular song in the world, but one that has long been under copyright  is one step closer to joining the public domain.

title: In Beijing, a Day Off School for Smog Is No Fun for Anyone
description: BEIJING  Wu Yiling, a 15-year-old student with a love of hamburgers and Hello Kitty, celebrated when she heard that her school was canceling classes for three days because of air pollution. Finally, she would be able to stay up late watching her favorite Korean soap operas, she imagined, and playing computer games with friends.

title: When Seeking Better C.D. Yields Can Be Costly
description: If the Federal Reserve acts as expected next week to raise interest rates, savers will be on the lookout for certificates of deposit offering better yields.

title: Apple Names Periscope the Top iPhone App of 2015
description: The live-streaming video app Periscope was named the iPhone app of the year, according to the Apple editors who discover, select and promote the apps and entertainment in the App Store and on iTunes.

title: Tylenol Is Ineffective Against Flu Symptoms
description: Tylenol is a popular remedy for treating the symptoms of flu. But a randomized trial has found that the drug is no more effective than a placebo, with no discernible effect at all on reducing fever or other flu symptoms.

title: Study Finds Director Pay Rising Sharply
description: It pays to sit on the board of an oil, mining or energy company.

title: Suspect in Colorado Planned Parenthood Rampage Declares Im Guilty in Court
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  Im guilty. Theres no trial, Robert L. Dear Jr. told a startled courtroom here on Wednesday. Im a warrior for the babies.

title: Prefab Goes High End
description: Architects, designers and artists create collectible architecture.

title: Review: Cam, on Untamed, Mingles Roots and Radio Appeal
description: Untamed

title: Review: Samuel Blaser Quartets Spring Rain Recalls a Ghost
description: Spring Rain

title: Defense Lawyers Point Out Holes in Case Against Dean Skelos and Son
description: Defense lawyers for State Senator Dean G. Skelos and his son told jurors at their federal corruption trial on Wednesday that the case against the two men amounted to little more than distractions, snippets of conversations taken out of context, and self-serving lies from two of the prosecutions central witnesses.

title: Tiny Homes You Can Collect
description: Inside the rain-battered tents of last weeks Art Basel Miami Beach art and design fairs, there were bears made from feathers, a painting made from shoes and shoelaces, and a stabbing incident involving an X-Acto knife that was not a performance piece. Among these and other, expected curiosities were two architectural prototypes: an aluminum and steel dining pavilion designed by Zaha Hadid with Patrik Schumacher, which sprouted like a kind of Martian flower over a molded timber table and chairs, and a 350-square-foot white box sheathed in laminated plywood designed by Gluckman Tang as an art pavilion. (It would certainly make an appropriate container to house ones art fair purchases once home.)

title: For Indians, Smog and Poverty Are Higher Priorities Than Talks in Paris
description: MUMBAI  Under a fingernail moon at Sassoon Docks, Parumati Mangela, a fisherwoman, sat on her haunches, grimacing. Something strange is happening over the Arabian Sea, she said: The sky is getting hot more and more, perhaps because something has angered the goddess Lakshmi.

title: Review: R. Kellys New Album, The Buffet, Offers Sex and Sentiment
description: You dont need to know that R. Kelly wrote, by his own count, 462 songs in preparation for The Buffet, his 13th album, to understand that he is a protean character. (Its nice to know it, though: 462 is a comical number.) The spirit of not getting stuck is an integral part of Mr. Kellys work, even more than his specialization in super-sexed subject matter.

title: Derek Jeter on His Second Act, as a Sports Media Mogul
description: Now hes the competition, said Efraim Grinberg, the chief executive of Movado watches, chiding a reporter in his companys West 39th Street showroom on Tuesday, waiting for Derek Jeter to arrive.

title: Review: Larry Keigwin Gives Young Choreographers a Break at the Joyce
Christmas Trees, Good and Bad
description: A survey of holiday greenery in New York City.

title: Review: Matthew Welch Offers Ethereal Chamber Music at the Stone
description: The music of Matthew Welch, who began a weeklong residency at the Stone on Tuesday, draws on a world of influences. His opening set, performed by the ensemble Cantata Profana, packed in references to Highland bagpipes, Balinese funerary rites, Minimalism, Borges, Beckett and Buddha. Yet much of the resulting chamber music is exquisitely ethereal, made up of delicate, transparent textures that hum with expressive tension. If Mr. Welch were a chef, hed be the kind who pushes the boundaries of molecular gastronomy, transforming earthy ingredients into translucent beads of pure flavor.

title: Review: Handels Messiah, With Heightened Drama
description: Its kind of like the lighting of the Christmas tree at nearby Rockefeller Center: For many New Yorkers of a classical bent, the holiday season officially begins with the two performances of Handels Messiah at St. Thomas Church Fifth Avenue, featuring the St. Thomas Choir of Men and Boys and the period-instrument band Concert Royal.

title: Manhattan as Tinsel Town: Holiday Decorations Traditional and Weird
description: For large segments of the resident Grinch population, holiday time can be a period of ambivalence, malaise, Bing Crosby overload and eggnog-induced regret. It is tough enough inducing jollity when looming at months end is what amounts to a calendar blackout  consecutive days of holy observance when little or nothing gets done  followed by the New Year and lots of credit-card debt.

title: Debbie Harry and Keira Knightley Honor Valentino Designers
description: At what was billed as an evening honoring Valentino at Lincoln Center on Monday, it should not come as a surprise that many guests wore Valentino.

title: Blendle, a Journalism Payments Start-Up, Targets a U.S. Start Date
description: Blendle, a publishing start-up that aims to simplify the way that people pay for journalism online, will be introduced in beta form in America in early 2016, the company said Wednesday.

title: Deborah Kass: No Kidding
description: The artists new exhibition at Paul Kasmin Gallery offers social critique by way of references to pop culture.

title: Art as Social Critique  With a Little Help From the Rolling Stones and Katy Perry
description: When you walk into No Kidding, the artist Deborah Kasss exhibition opening tonight at Paul Kasmin Gallery, be prepared for a strange sensation: you can almost hear Kasss new mixed-media paintings in addition to seeing them. The thing about music is that its so democratic, and art isnt, Kass said when T visited her studio last month. Throughout the show, the artist alludes to popular song lyrics from a wide swath of eras, from the 1895 waltz The Band Played On to Fats Wallers 1929 (What Did I Do to Be So) Black and Blue to Katy Perrys 2010 Teenage Dream. The references are diverse, but taken as a whole, their message is clear: a deep-seated, and deeply droll, cynicism about the present political and artistic climate, and about our capacity to fiddle while Rome burns. Other pieces in the show ironically deploy phrases like GOOD TIMES and, in several three-panel works, WHO BLUE WHO, to much the same effect.

title: Christmas Shows Are TVs December Comfort Food
description: At the very least, the War on Christmas is not being waged on television.

title: With Meet the Composer, Nadia Sirota Illuminates New Music
description: The violist Nadia Sirota, the daughter of a composer, was born into the world of contemporary music. At Juilliard, she set aside Bachs sonatas in favor of commissioning pieces from classmates like Nico Muhly. And now she has made an entire career  a sustainable one, at that  of championing new work.

title: Obama Calls for End to Bigotry, in Implicit Rebuke of Donald Trump
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday called for Americans to reject bigotry in all its forms and keep pressing for equality no matter what ugliness might bubble up, appearing to use the 150th anniversary of the constitutional amendment abolishing slavery to challenge the incendiary anti-Muslim politics espoused by Donald J. Trump.

title: How to Value Yahoos Core Business
description: With Yahoo exploring a separation of its core business, the world may soon know what the company  minus its lucrative stake in Alibaba  is worth.

title: Fantasy Football Week 14: Vikings at Cardinals
description: Fantasy football analysis for Thursday nights game between the Minnesota Vikings and the Arizona Cardinals. Check back Friday for analysis on Sundays games and Mondays matchup between the Giants and the Miami Dolphins. You can also follow the Sablich brothers on Twitter at @5thDownFantasy.

title: Senate Republicans Introduce Bill for Puerto Rico Relief
description: Under pressure to help Puerto Rico avoid a bond default on Jan. 1, Senate Republicans introduced a bill on Wednesday to extend several forms of assistance to the island.

title: Vincent Gray, Former Washington Mayor, Wont Be Charged in Federal Inquiry
description: Vincent C. Gray, the former mayor of Washington whose tenure was frequently overshadowed by a federal investigation into his 2010 campaign, will not be charged in connection with the inquiry, prosecutors said Wednesday.

title: House Republicans Denounce Obamas Handling of Prisoner Exchange
description: WASHINGTON  After months of secret talks in early 2014 on a potential deal to swap five Taliban detainees at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, for a captive American soldier, Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, an agreement seemed near that May. But the chief American negotiator sent an email to the Pentagon warning that any leak could scuttle it.

title: Review: The Verdict Speaks in a Grisham-esque Tongue With a British Accent
description: Readers who enjoy having curveballs pitched at them are sure to appreciate Nick Stones hyperactive throwing arm. Mr. Stone, an award-winning mystery writer who is much better known in his native Britain than he is here, has come up with a legal thriller called The Verdict. It may well find an American audience without a helping hand, but comparisons to John Grisham will ease its way. Theyre valid, and not just because of the blunt title. The Grisham feeling persists, even though this books courtroom scenes are set in the Old Bailey and feature white horsehair wigs.

title: 1926 | Draw, She Said
description: Dont tell Erick Erickson  the blogger who objected graphically to our front-page editorial, The Gun Epidemic  but guns had a place in the corporate culture of The New York Times long before his parents were born.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: San Bernardino, Donald Trump, Rahm Emanuel
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: ESPN and College Football Playoff Agree Not to Air Daily Fantasy Ads
description: ESPN and College Football Playoff officials have agreed that there will be no advertising for daily fantasy games during the telecasts of the national semifinals or the national championship game this season, the latest move by college athletics to distance itself from an increasingly controversial business that critics say constitutes gambling.

title: As U.S. and Europe Pass the Hat at Climate Talks, China Clings to Developing-Nation Status
description: PARIS  Last week, China was trumpeting its arrival as one of the worlds great economic powers, as the International Monetary Fund elevated the renminbi to the ranks of leading currencies, alongside the dollar, euro, yen and British pound.

title: First Draft Focus: Hanukkah at the White House
Transgender, and Embraced, on the Red Carpet
description: Two years ago, while Jared Leto was busy collecting awards en route to his Oscar win for playing a transgender woman in Dallas Buyers Club, the independent filmmaker Sean Baker was unwittingly making history shooting Tangerine.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: The Best Performances of 2015
description: Whatever goes into a performance  talent, grit, wit, endurance, inspiration, exhaustion, happenstance  was part of these, which I present in no particular order and with total indifference to whether they were part of a hot single, streaming show or live sports.

title: Software Maker Atlassian Sets Its I.P.O. at $21
description: This year has proved a tough one for stock market debuts. But the year is poised to end on a high note, thanks to a software company born in Australia.

title: Great Bowerys Umbrella Covers Many Artists
description: A brief sample of the agencys top-level talent.

title: Photographing the Refugee Trail by Drone
description: Rocco Rorandellis life has been shaped by immigration. But when he decided to photograph the migrant crisis in Europe, he took a step back and went above, using a drone.

title: The Man Who Would Make the World a Prettier Place
description: Matthew Moneypenny (his real name) is Hollywood handsome, with a dressed-down wardrobe of Saint Laurent and an easy patter somewhere between pitchman and showman.

title: Hillary Clinton Outlines Plan to Overhaul Corporate Taxes
description: URBANDALE, Iowa  At a town-hall-style meetings across Iowa, Hillary Clinton on Wednesday seemed as if she could hardly wait to pivot from Donald J. Trump to her plans to overhaul corporate taxes.

title: Lawyer for PACs Backing Jeb Bush Asks F.E.C. to Investigate Donald Trump
description: The campaign finance lawyer for the outside groups supporting Jeb Bush has accused Donald J. Trump of improperly mingling his corporate business with his campaign work and has asked the Federal Election Commission to investigate.

title: Race and College Admissions at the Supreme Court
description: Racial diversity is essential in carrying out the missions of institutions like universities, corporations and the United States military. Affirmative action is one tool thats useful in achieving that diversity. Some Supreme Court justices, however, seem unable to accept this fact, despite decades of experience and evidence showing its value.

title: Competing Authorizations for Military Force
description: President Obama challenged Congress on Sunday to pass new legislation authorizing the use of military force in the fight against the Islamic State, also known as ISIS or ISIL. The following documents include four different proposed versions of that legislation.

title: Four Plans Compete to Authorize Military Force Against the Islamic State
description: WASHINGTON  Members of Congress have criticized President Obamas response to the Islamic State  also known as the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant, ISIL, or ISIS  but have been slow to authorize the use of force against the group.

title: Happiness Doesnt Bring Good Health, Study Finds
description: Go ahead and sulk. Unhappiness wont kill you.

title: Wool Baseball Caps for the Chilly Off-Season
description: Sporty, warm looks are a winner.

title: Chicagos Mayor Demands Sweeping Police Reform
description: CHICAGO  Facing sharply escalating criticism of him and his Police Department, Mayor Rahm Emanuel used an unusually emotional address on Wednesday to call for sweeping changes in the ways the police use force, treat black residents and discipline abusive officers.

title: Kenneth Griffin, Richest Man in Illinois, Endorses Marco Rubio
description: The billionaire hedge fund manager Kenneth C. Griffin is endorsing Senator Marco Rubio of Florida for president, adding another major Republican donor to Mr. Rubios roster.

title: New York State Attorney General Takes Control of Inquiry Into Fatal Police Shooting
description: The New York State attorney generals office has taken control of an inquiry into the fatal shooting on Tuesday of an unarmed man in a wooded area in Westchester County by a New York City police officer.

title: Canada: Cabdrivers Stage Uber Protest
description: Cabdrivers seeking a legal crackdown against Uber, the ride-sharing service, snarled traffic on expressways and downtown streets in Toronto on Wednesday. The disruption began during the morning rush hour with slow-moving convoys of taxis. Later, cabdrivers blocked a major downtown intersection. A police officer on a bicycle suffered minor injuries when he was clipped by a taxi. A television crew also recorded a taxi driver pounding on a small sedan carrying an Uber passenger. John Tory, the citys mayor, said that the city was enforcing current laws against Uber while developing additional regulations. But Mr. Tory condemned the protest. Dangerous and divisive tactics do nothing to address these issues, he said.

title: West Bank: Attackers Wound 4 Israelis
description: Gunmen presumed to be Palestinians fired more than 20 bullets at an Israeli car in a drive-by shooting in the occupied West Bank on Wednesday, wounding an Israeli couple, according to the Israeli military and news media. The Israelis were identified as Shaul and Rachel Nir. Mr. Nir was a leader of the so-called Jewish Underground that carried out attacks against Palestinians in the 1980s. He was sentenced to life in prison for his role in a gun and grenade attack on the Islamic College in Hebron, in which three Palestinian students were killed, but his sentence was commuted and he was released after about seven years. Earlier on Wednesday, a Palestinian stabbed and wounded two Israelis in the West Bank city of Hebron, the Israeli authorities said. An Israeli security guard fatally shot the assailant at the scene.

title: Thursdays Matchup: Vikings (8-4) at Cardinals (10-2)
description: 8:25 p.m. Eastern, NFL Network

title: New Jersey Officials See Hope for Jobs in Seton Halls Medical School Plan
description: New Jersey was once so chock-full of thriving pharmaceutical companies that it was known as Americas medicine chest. But that dominance eroded as one major drug company after another abandoned corporate campuses that had provided thousands of high-paying jobs.

title: Donald Trump Loses Luster When Words Reach the Middle East
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates  At Lifestyle, an inexpensive home furnishings store tucked inside the Mall of the Emirates here, shoppers on Wednesday examined lamps and picked up picture frames.

title: Venezuelas Defeated Ruling Party Riven by Conflict and Scorn
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  There they were, two of the gray-haired confidants of Hugo Chvez, Venezuelas late leftist leader, voicing their indignation at the government bumbling that led to Sundays stinging electoral defeat of his United Socialist Party.

title: Chief of Sprout Is Leaving the Company
description: Cindy Whitehead, who oversaw a long, but ultimately successful, effort to bring to market the first prescription drug to enhance womens sexual drive, is leaving her post as chief executive of Sprout Pharmaceuticals.

title: Using Song and a Dose of Laughter to Ease a Familys Pains
description: Food pantries supply Vivian Green and her 88-year-old mother, Helen Taylor, with most of their meals these days. Ms. Green does not let any of it go to waste.

title: Gucci Opens at Brookfield Place and Other Shopping Events
description: Ready to kick-start your holiday shopping? This week theres a spate of holiday bazaars and pop-ups and a few major retail openings. Youll find the Gucci designer Alessandro Micheles hit accessories, like a floral print leather shoulder bag ($2,700), at the labels new Brookfield Place store. At 200 Vesey Street.

title: Regulator Is Said to Fine Fiat Chrysler $70 Million
description: Fiat Chrysler is expected to pay the federal government as much as $70 million in penalties for significantly underreporting the number of death and injury claims tied to potential defects in its cars, according to a person briefed on the fine.

title: Senators Condemn Big Price Increases for Drugs
description: Senators from both parties on Wednesday denounced huge overnight price increases for decades-old drugs that have been made by some pharmaceutical companies lately, calling them unconscionable and detrimental to patients.

title: Suit Claims Weeknd Song Infringes on Copyright of Film Soundtrack
description: The Weeknds song The Hills became one of the biggest hits of the year with a slithery electronic bass line. But according to a copyright infringement lawsuit filed on Wednesday, that bass line was taken without permission from the soundtrack of a little-noticed science-fiction thriller.

title: Report Traces Ebolas Spread in Liberia
description: Ebola viruses that sickened many people during the height of the epidemic in Liberia can be traced back to a single case of the disease probably introduced from Sierra Leone, according to a report published Wednesday in the journal Cell Host and Microbe. The data are consistent with the vast majority of cases in Liberia coming from a single event, said Jason T. Ladner of the U.S. Army Medical Research Institute for Infectious Diseases. The virus then spread from Liberia back into Guinea, where the current epidemic was first identified. Scientists analyzed genomic sequences from 140 blood samples, nearly 2 percent of all reported cases in Liberia, collected over 11 months, after a smaller outbreak had been controlled. Liberia had no new Ebola cases last week, and a recent cluster was most likely linked to a rare case of transmission from a survivor, officials said Wednesday.

title: CVC Capital Plans So Paulo Office
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The private equity firm CVC Capital Partners plans to open an office in So Paulo and take on a prominent Brazilian investment banker to run it.

title: Kerry in Familiar Spot: Trying to Coax Deal in Meetings Closing Days
description: PARIS  For the second time this year, Secretary of State John Kerry has settled into a grand capital of Europe for talks that could shape the globe, not to mention his own reputation, for decades to come.

title: Mike Rice, Disgraced Rutgers Coach, Returns to the Sideline
description: METUCHEN, N.J.  For more than two and a half years, Mike Rice had receded into the shadows after Rutgers fired him because of a scandal that wrecked his coaching career and turned him into a pariah.

title: John Trudell, Outspoken Advocate for American Indians, Is Dead at 69
description: John Trudell, whose outspokenness and charisma made him a leading advocate of Native American rights, and who channeled his message of righteous defiance into poetry and songwriting, died on Tuesday at his home in Santa Clara County, Calif. He was 69.

title: In Pursuit of Victory, the Diamondbacks Show No Sensitivity to Costs
description: NASHVILLE  Dave Stewart let the question hang thereon Wednesday, like a poorly thrown split-finger fastball, the kind he rarely delivered during his heyday as a pitcher.

title: F.B.I. Chief Says Texas Gunman Used Encryption to Text Overseas Terrorist
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, said Wednesday that investigators could not read more than 100 text messages exchanged by one of the attackers in a shooting this year in Garland, Tex., because they were encrypted, adding fuel to law enforcement agencies contention that they need a way to circumvent commercially available encryption technology.

title: Fatema Mernissi, a Founder of Islamic Feminism, Dies at 75
description: Fatema Mernissi, a Moroccan sociologist who was one of the founders of Islamic feminism, whose work included studies of the sexual politics of Islamic Scripture and a book based on her childhood in a domestic harem, died on Nov. 30 in Rabat. She was 75.

title: Fan Injuries Spur M.L.B. to Call for Netting at Stadiums
description: After several gruesome incidents in which fans were struck by balls and shattered bats at games last season, Major League Baseball on Wednesday issued a recommendation for all 30 clubs to erect protective netting in front of the most exposed field-level seats from one dugout to the other.

title: Hate Crime Inquiry Opened Into Vandalism of Sikh Temple in California
description: The police in Buena Park, Calif., said on Wednesday that they had opened a hate crimes investigation into the vandalism of a Sikh house of worship after its members found expletive-laced graffiti referencing Islam and the Islamic State just days after the San Bernardino terrorist attack.

title: Lawmakers Rush to Cram Pet Projects Into Spending Deal Ahead of New Deadline
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional negotiators are lurching toward a year-end deal that could combine a $1.1 trillion omnibus spending bill with a slate of more than $750 billion in tax breaks for businesses and low-income workers, setting off a frenzied push by lawmakers, lobbyists and interest groups to attach pet provisions to the catchall legislative package.

title: Finding Voice Again, Joe Biden Sees Time Left to Make a Difference
description: KIEV, Ukraine  As he stood next to Ukraines fresh-faced prime minister one day this week, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. looked like a stern uncle admonishing a recalcitrant youth.

title: Review: Andrea McArdle and Kip Gilman Puzzle Out Love in 2 Across
description: Catch a subway home from the San Francisco airport at 4 a.m., and youd think you could have a quiet ride, just you and your crossword puzzle, duking it out. Thats not the way it goes, though, in 2 Across, a meet-cute, sitcom-style two-hander starring Andrea McArdle as Janet, a puzzle aficionado in need of cheering up  but maybe not right this second, O.K.?

title: Review: The Golden Bride Walks Down the Aisle Again
description: The Russian shtetl in the long-lost, newly reconstructed Yiddish operetta The Golden Bride has a dreamy look about it, all latticework and whitewash, like the setting for a garden party. The people here may dream of riches  who doesnt?  but theyre doing all right. If they leave this place for America, its only because an even better life awaits.

title: Obstacles
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Hands up if you remember the Mazola margarine television commercial with the First Nations (I hope) actress who said, You call it corn, but we call it maize

title: A Congress That Doesnt Want to Weigh In on War
description: WASHINGTON  Shortly after Paul D. Ryan became speaker, the chairmen of the House Armed Services and Intelligence Committees went to him with a difficult request: to help them put a bill on the House floor to authorize a war against the Islamic State extremist group.

title: Arab-Israeli Parliament Member Sees Prospect for Peace
description: A prominent Arab-Israeli member of Israels Parliament whose party alliance made strong gains in the last election expressed optimism on Wednesday about the future of a more inclusive Israeli democracy and the creation of a Palestinian state.

title: Yankees Trade RelieverJustin Wilson for Luis Cessa and Chad Green
description: NASHVILLE  Because of their bullpen depth and the value he might bring in return, the Yankees have explored trade possibilities involving their closer, Andrew Miller, this off-season. On Wednesday, though, they traded a different left-handed reliever.

description: Call it failure to yield to a mayor.

title: South Korean Labor Leader Leaves Temple to Surrender to Authorities
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A fugitive labor leader who had taken refuge in a well-known Buddhist temple surrendered to the authorities on Thursday, ending a 24-day standoff that had set off a rare police raid within the temple complex.

title: Photographing the Refugee Trail by Drone
description: Immigration is a deeply personal matter for Rocco Rorandelli: He was born in Florence to a mother from the Bronx and a father from Italy, married an Indian woman and now lives in Rome raising twin boys who are part American. Yet when it came time to photograph the current refugee crisis in Europe, he took a decidedly impersonal approach: Rather than be wedged in among desperate migrants, he used a drone hovering over them.

description: THE No Child Left Behind law will soon be consigned to the dustbin of history. With a rare display of bipartisanship, Congress has overhauled federal education policy. The laws successor, the Every Student Succeeds Act, is headed for the presidents desk, and he has signaled his intention to sign it.

title: In Venezuela, a Triumph for the Opposition
description: On Sunday, voters in Venezuela delivered a stinging rebuke to Nicols Maduro and his ruling party by electing a coalition of opposition lawmakers to Parliament that is large enough to challenge his socialist policies and could conceivably cut short his term in office.

title: Guns and Thunder on the Supreme Courts Right
description: The Supreme Court turns down new cases at the rate of 150 a week, and only rarely does one of those denials break through the fog to become news. It happened this week with the courts refusal to hear an appeal challenging a Chicago suburbs ban on the sale and ownership of assault weapons. Over the dissenting votes of Justices Clarence Thomas and Antonin Scalia, the court let stand a lower courts ruling that the ban, adopted in 2013 by the city of Highland Park, was consistent with the right to gun ownership under the Second Amendment, as interpreted by the Supreme Court.

title: The Trump Effect, and How It Spreads
description: Go ahead, deplore Donald Trump. Despise his message. Reject his appeals to exclusion and hatred. But do not make the mistake of treating him as a solitary phenomenon, a singular celebrity narcissist who has somehow, all alone, brought his party and its politics to the brink of fascism.

title: bell hooks: Buddhism, the Beats and Loving Blackness
description: This is the last in this series of 2015 interviews with philosophers on race. This weeks conversation is with the scholar, critic and public intellectual bell hooks, who is currently the distinguished professor in residence of Appalachian studies at Berea College. She is the author of many books, including Writing Beyond Race: Living Theory and Practice  George Yancy

title: Pentagon Seeks to Knit Foreign Bases Into ISIS-Foiling Network

title: As Heisman Trophy Finalists Experience a Milestone, So Do Gamblers
description: The race for the Heisman Trophy is one of college footballs most engaging contests. Take a large pool of contestants, throw them into the rollicking up-and-down of the three-month regular season and then hang the finalists out to dry, sitting uncomfortably in suits in an oak-panel room in New York, until one of them lifts the hefty bronze statue.

title: Delegates at Climate Talks Focus on Saving the Worlds Forests
description: LE BOURGET, France  The climate deal being negotiated here is meant to begin a transformation of the worlds energy systems, but it has another goal that has received far less attention: a sweeping effort to save the worlds forests.

title: What is Your Reaction to Donald Trumps Proposal to Bar Muslims From Entering the Country?
description: Donald J. Trump called this week for the United States to bar all Muslims from entering the country until the nations leaders can figure out what is going on after the terrorist attacks in San Bernardino, Calif.

title: VW Says Emissions Cheating Was Not a One-Time Error
description: WOLFSBURG, Germany  The chairman of Volkswagen said on Thursday that the decision by employees to cheat on emissions tests was made more than a decade ago, after they realized they could not meet United States clean air standards legally.

title: The Mark and the Void, by Paul Murray
description: Paul Murrays satirical novel of the Irish banking crisis, The Mark and the Void, takes place primarily at the International Financial Services Center, a section of Dublin that functions as a tax haven for multinational corporations, a place where billions in assets hide behind brass nameplates in the Transaction House and shadow banks operate hidden from the prying eyes of regulators. Its anonymous by design. As one of Murrays characters explains: Were in the middle of Dublin, where Joyce set Ulysses. But it doesnt look like Dublin. We could be in London or Frankfurt or Kuala Lumpur.

title: The White Road, by Edmund de Waal
description: A friend of mine inherited a Bavarian coffee set from her maternal great-grandmother, a woman who fled Europe in the late 1930s, carrying little more than the purpose-built, velvet-lined case that still holds it. That family is scattered across the globe and the way of life the coffee set embodied has vanished, but the dainty china pot and matching cups remain flawless. Porcelain is like that. We all know that the sweep of a careless elbow can shatter it into unmendable bits. But take some basic precautions and in a hundred years it will look as good as new  its colors undimmed, its whites snowy  after you and your children are dead and gone. It is fragile, and it is strong.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Hillary Clintons Gun Ad Got Big Fanfare but Little Play
description: When Hillary Clintons campaign unveiled a stark campaign ad in early November urging a change in gun control laws, the move was seen as unusually bold for a candidate who has been criticized in the past for being overly cautious. The ad would be put into the rotation of her existing television reservations in Iowa and New Hampshire, her campaign said at the time.

title: Bowe Bergdahl Case at Center of Serial Season 2

title: Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, From Captivity to Courtroom
description: Sometime after midnight on June 30, 2009, Pfc. Bowe Bergdahl walked away from a remote Army outpost in eastern Afghanistan. Within a day, he was captured by the Taliban and held prisoner for five years, setting off a furious search and high-level diplomatic negotiations, and ending with his exit on May 31, 2014, aboard a helicopter flown by American commandos.

title: Arthur Millers Lost Play: His First
description: LONDON  This week, in a tiny theater nestled above the Old Red Lion Pub here, the first play that Arthur Miller ever wrote is having its world premiere.

title: Donald Trump Pushes Back at British Petition to Bar Him

title: Great Performers Above It All
description: The years best actors  as chosen by A. O. Scott  in a series of photographic tributes to classic flight scenes from the movies.

title: Behind the Scenes of Take Flight
description: Some might imagine that all the magic happens in postproduction these days, but so much of it is actually done on the set. For several of our short films, special-effects technicians strapped the actors into harnesses and worked these rigs in three-person teams, pulling them to and fro, almost like marionettes. Even from that perch, the actors had to do an incredible amount of work to complete the illusion: to convincingly look weightless or airborne, even when they were strung up somewhere in Los Angeles. I had no idea just how physically demanding the work is. Its not easy to fly.

title: Congress Gives Itself 5 More Days to Reach Spending Deal
description: Congressional leaders officially threw in the towel on Wednesday on trying to meet a Friday deadline to pass a funding deal to keep the government open.

title: Editors Letter: Take Flight With Virtual Reality
description: Movies are one of the few forms of illusion to which we regularly submit ourselves without skepticism or scorn. They transport us with visual effects, and we are happy to enjoy the journey without scrutinizing too hard how it was accomplished. Never is this more true than when the illusion is one of flight, which may be Hollywoods most enduring and iconic form of movie magic. When Superman blazes through the sky or Mary Poppins floats away, few moviegoers stop to ask how they achieved liftoff.

title: The Art of Flying in the Movies
description: At 10:35 on the morning of Dec. 17, 1903, on the sand dunes of Kitty Hawk, N.C. ... Do I need to finish the sentence?

title: Chinese Rights Lawyers Trial Over Online Comments to Begin Soon
description: BEIJING  One of Chinas feistiest and most prominent civil rights lawyers, Pu Zhiqiang, will stand trial on Monday over charges related to his combative online comments, his lawyers said on Thursday, after months of uncertainty about when the contentious case would be heard in court.

title: Letter of Recommendation: SmartWool Socks
description: In recent years, I have taken note of a creeping subversive streak in sock culture, from the outrageously patterned stockings peeking from beneath the cuffs of straphanging bankers to the pot-leaf-printed numbers worn by skateboarders. Like a paper bag around a can of Coors Banquet, the lowly sock seems to have become a vehicle for safe transgression. Even those of us hemmed in by dress code can still challenge societys strictures, from ankle height. And although my home office makes no particular demands on my wardrobe, I, too, have been protesting quietly with my feet.

description: Skiers know that the trail map is an essential part of coming up with a game plan for a day on the mountain. Its the best way to make sure that an advanced beginner, say, doesnt get stuck at the top of a double-black-diamond mogul run that looks for all the world like the side of an elevator shaft with bumpy walls. Or that an expert doesnt inadvertently wind up on a side of the mountain that she could ski backward in her sleep.

On Monday, the day after President Obama gave an Oval Office address endorsing restrictions on assault weapons, Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas argued that such categorical bans on firearms that millions of Americans commonly own for lawful purposes are unconstitutional.

title: Trying to Beat My 25-Year-Old Self
description: I set my personal record of 22:12 for a 5K when I was 25, in the first race I ever ran. I went through 12 weeks of training to prepare for it because a magazine I was writing for had asked me to run, and then write about, the experience.

description: The New York mens store debuts its first collection produced entirely in-house.

title: 1940: Britain Bars Food Relief Plan
description: The British government, through its Ambassador to Washington, the Marquess of Lothian, rejected yesterday [Dec. 10] former President Herbert Hoovers plan for feeding the 37,000,000 inhabitants of occupied Finland, Norway, the Netherlands, Belgium and central Poland this winter. The British Ambassador, however, expressed his governments willingness to arrange for passage through Britains blockade, covering virtually the whole of continental Europe, of medical supplies destined for distribution in territories occupied by Germany and in unoccupied France by approved bodies.New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 11, 1940

title: Polluted Skies Heighten Challenge for Chinese Government
description: BEIJING  Red has been considered the color of prosperity and good fortune in China for centuries, and it is also the color of the Communist Party. But this week, it took on a darker meaning here, as it began to symbolize the failure of the party to rein in toxic smog that regularly endangers the health of hundreds of millions of people in the countrys north.

title: Ted Cruz Questions Donald Trumps Judgment to Be President
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, who has carefully avoided public criticism of Donald J. Trump, said this week at a private fund-raiser that the real estate developer was facing a challenging question about whether he has the judgment to be president.

description: That the Internet is full of terrible things is not exactly a revelation, but a point worth noting.

title: Virtually Using Windows XP
description: Q. I use XP Mode on my Windows 7 Professional edition machine to run older programs. Im considering upgrading to Windows 10 and would like to know if XP Mode is available in that operating system.

title: Golden Globes 2016: TV Snubs and Surprises
description: You can count on the Golden Globes to throw a few curveballs when it comes to television, and this years nominations were no exception. An Amazon comedy came out of nowhere, while a PBS war horse and previous Globes favorite was ignored as it approaches its final season. And a two-time Emmy nominee who was considered a lock in the supporting-actress category wasnt nominated, proving that even Cersei Lannister doesnt frighten the nominators.

title: A Mens Wear Staple Expands its Offerings
description: For the past five years, Sweetu Patel has been hunkered down in his sub-level shop on Bond Street, quietly selling some of the best men's wear in New York City. C.H.C.M. has become widely respected for its unique mix of brands  a tight edit that somehow always has something you need, without overwhelming you with options. Its a philosophy as much as it is a sales strategy.

title: Opera News Awards Focus on Singers
description: The winners of the 2016 Opera News Awards, which recognize the achievements of leading figures in opera, will be Joseph Calleja, Elina Garanca, Waltraud Meier, Anna Netrebko and Jos van Dam, the magazine announced on Thursday.

title: Let Israel Fight ISIS
description: TEL AVIV  In 1990, when Saddam Hussein invaded Kuwait, he provided President George H. W. Bush his finest hour as a leader, a diplomat and a commander in chief. Among Mr. Bushs accomplishments was bringing together more than 30 countries to oppose Iraqs aggression. But the United States president knew what hed have to do to build the kind of broad international coalition that he wanted: Keep Israel out of it.

title: Harvard Poll of Millennials Finds Integrity Means More Than Experience
description: The millennial voting bloc is coalescing around the candidates running outsider, insurgent campaigns, according to a new poll released by Harvard University.

title: Rijksmuseum Removing Racially Charged Terms From Artworks Titles and Descriptions
description: AMSTERDAM  The Rijksmuseum is in the process of removing language that could be considered offensive from digitized titles and descriptions of some 220,000 artworks in its collection. Words that Europeans once routinely used to describe other cultures or peoples, like negro, Indian or dwarf will be replaced with less racially charged terminology.

title: Muhammad Ali Defends Islam After Trumps Proposal to Bar Foreign Muslims
description: Muhammad Ali, one of the most famous athletes in American history and a convert to Islam in the 1960s, returned to the public spotlight Wednesday night to say that political leaders had a responsibility to foster understanding about his religion.

description: We are never so defenseless against suffering as when we love.

title: 2016 Ojai Festival to Feature Kaija Saariaho Premieres
description: The Ojai Music Festival in California has an unusual model. It hands the reins to a new music director each year. For 2016 the task has fallen to Peter Sellars, the opera and theater director, who announced Wednesday that the 70th festival this June would include works by Kaija Saariaho, Caroline Shaw and Tania Len, among others.

title: Golden Globes 2016: Film Surprises and Snubs
description: You guys, Lily Tomlin  76 years old and wickedly funny in Grandma  was nominated for two Golden Globes! One for movies, one for TV! She hasnt been nominated since 1985, when she was up for All of Me. (Were not counting the best ensemble cast Golden Globe she and dozens of others won for Short Cuts 21 years ago.)

title: Climate Talks and a Smoggy Beijing
description: To the Editor:

title: Mayor de Blasio Seeks to Rebuild Momentum for Affordable Housing Plan
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio declared that affordable housing would be the cornerstone of his second year in office, a sweeping effort to generate tens of thousands of new homes and preserve the fabric of neighborhoods in fast-gentrifying New York.

title: 1965: Gemini-7 Stresses Medical Side
description: HOUSTON, Tex.  On Gemini-7, the medical doctors are figuratively sitting in the astronauts laps. Short of going along for the ride, they are attempting to monitor by radio the two mens vital functions in great detail for 14 days. More than any other manned flight in the American program, Gemini-7 is focusing on the human reaction to prolonged exposure to weightlessness, confinement and the psychological pressure of flying in orbit. We dont think someone will come down with jellied bones, Dr. Charles Berry, the chief flight surgeon, said before the flight. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 11, 1965

title: Trade an End to Sanctions for Putin's Help Against ISIS?
From the Editor
description: A Russian friend recently shared a witty observation about his country: In two years, everything changes; in 200 years, nothing changes. That is certainly true for Russia, a nation whose every lurch forward seems to leave it farther behind. Is it also true for what we call progress? Are all the dazzling technological inventions and social transformations of our time nothing more than superficial variations on an unchanging template?

title: Death and Sandwiches
description: How do you eat a sandwich after pronouncing a man dead?

title: Still in a Crib, Yet Being Given Antipsychotics
description: Andrew Rioss seizures began when he was 5 months old and only got worse. At 18 months, when an epilepsy medication resulted in violent behavior, he was prescribed the antipsychotic Risperdal, a drug typically used to treat schizophrenia and bipolar disorder in adults, and rarely used for children as young as 5 years.

title: N.F.L. Playoff Scenarios: Watch Week 14 Like an Expert
description: If youre a serious N.F.L. fan, youre probably spending a nontrivial amount of time scouring the Internet for information about your teams playoff chances. What you will find are complex clinching scenarios, full of long logical chains like PIT loss or NYJ tie.

title: Seeking to Reduce Debt, Glencore May Pursue I.P.O. of Agricultural Business
description: LONDON  The Swiss mining company Glencore said on Thursday that it was considering selling a minority stake in its agriculture business or potentially seek an initial public offering of that business as it pursues additional asset sales to further reduce its debt.

title: When the Car Reviewer Buys a Car
description: DURING my automotive journalism years, Ive praised, pummeled and puzzled over some 700 vehicles, but the last time I bought one was a quarter-century ago. Between my ancient Miata and a test car most weeks, why bother?

title: Bank of America Gets Feds Approval of Resubmitted Capital Plan
description: Bank of America executives can breathe a sigh of relief.

title: Patrick Chappatte: (Next) Year in Review
description: The news that will definitely happen in 2016.

title: Planning a Ski Trip? Where to Go to Find Snow
description: What are warm and welcome conditions for stringing up holiday lights to some are anxiety-producing for travelers with ski plans, as temperatures have remained mild in much of the country this month. While resorts in the eastern half of the country are counting on snow-making, some in the West say conditions are fine, including Beaver Creek Resort in Colorado, which has reported over six feet of snowfall this year to date, the most this early since 1992. Michael Berry, the president of the National Ski Areas Association, answered a few questions about this years snowfall or seeming lack thereof.

title: A Top 10 Wine List So Good, It Takes 12 Bottles to Hold It
description: Its my privilege over the course of a year to encounter a fair number of rare, profound bottles. Just as important is the search for distinctive wines for drinking any time.

title: Mauricio Macri, Argentinas New President, Is Sworn In Amid Feud With Predecessor
description: BUENOS AIRES  Mauricio Macri was sworn in as president of Argentina on Thursday in a ceremony that was boycotted by his predecessor, Cristina Fernndez de Kirchner, after a bitter argument over how and where to hold it.

title: Madonna Performs Impromptu Acoustic Set in Paris to Honor Terror Victims
description: Following a sold-out show at a Paris arena on Wednesday night, Madonna took to the streets to play some more. Im singing some songs in place de la republique, the pop star wrote on Twitter after her concert. Meet me there now.

title: U.F.C. Says Holly Holms Next Fight Will Be Ronda Rousey Rematch
description: Holly Holm will apparently not be able to defend her Ultimate Fighting Championship title until Ronda Rousey recovers from the beating she gave her.

title: Salman Khan, Bollywood Star, Wins Appeal in Hit-and-Run Case
description: NEW DELHI  A court in Mumbai acquitted the Bollywood superstar Salman Khan in a hit-and-run case from 2002 that left one person dead and four injured.

title: Luis Miguel Returns to Madison Square Garden
description: Luis Miguel is celebrated across several continents as an irresistibly suave balladeer  an expert delivery system for imploring boleros and rancheras romnticas, strong of voice and single-minded in purpose. Born of Mexican heritage in Puerto Rico, he has been an arena headliner for long enough that his devoted fans have come to expect clockwork efficiency from him: tailored suits, soaring entreaties, a slick and potent performance.

title: Luther, With Idris Elba, Returns to BBC America
description: His beard is flecked with gray now, his soul bedeviled by the ghost of Alice Morgan (who, alas, has run off with Noah Solloway in The Affair). And you cant help wondering whats lurking in his pretty head as he gazes into the beyond from the White Cliffs of Dover, where he has alighted during a self-imposed exile.

title: Tracing Diane Simpsons Structural Evolution in Boston Exhibition
description: In 2013, the New York art world was reintroduced to the impeccably structural, richly referential sculptures of Diane Simpson by JTT, a tiny gallery on the Lower East Side, in her first solo show here since 1980. Ms. Simpsons work, best known in and around her hometown, Chicago, is distinctive for the way it elegantly parses the components of garments like aprons, samurai armor, Amish bonnets, muffs and evening attire to create strange yet recognizable wonders of articulated form. Her materials of cardboard, fabric, metal and wood enhance the familiar formality of the work as well as the evocations of buildings and bodies and of the human mind at work.

title: Handels Messiah? Its Complicated
description: Handels Messiah gets pigeonholed as a cozy holiday staple, capped by the rousing Hallelujah chorus. But it is also a seething, disturbingly deep reflection on faith and suffering, one that disorients with its perpetual, sudden shifts of tone.

title: The Unknowable Trump Vote
description: My Campaign Stops columnthis week tries to explain how the current intersection of national security and immigration in the headlines (including in todays Times) has left the Republican establishment particularly defenseless against Donald Trumps demagoguery, because the combination of Bush-era foreign policy failures and the party elites consistent dissembling on immigration policy (against amnesty in even-numbered years,otherwise for it) has eroded voter trust to a point where a normal partisan pitch on this issues falls on quite a fewdeaf ears.

title: Jury Begins Deliberations in Trial of Dean Skelos and His Son
description: The jury in the political corruption case against Dean G. Skelos, the former State Senate majority leader, and his son began its deliberations on Thursday, after a nearly four-week trial in Federal District Court in Manhattan.

title: The Savage Eye Wanders Through Los Angeles at the Museum of the Moving Image
description: Apparently the National Legion of Decency didnt much care for The Savage Eye when it came out in 1960. The film has been given a Class C, or condemned, rating by the group, The New York Times reported that June, because it involves blatant violations of Judeo-Christian decency. The legion found the film morally unacceptable in a mass medium of entertainment.

title: How Deal Between Dow and DuPont Could Create Value
description: Combining two chemical giants, Dow Chemical and DuPont, which are each worth nearly $60 billion, would be complicated. A three-way split thereafter might not unlock much value, either.

title: Lois Smith Returns to the Stage With Marjorie Prime
description: Though crowns have never been part of her professional headgear, Lois Smith is indisputably royalty in the American theater. Ms. Smith, who improbably turned 85 last month, has been one of our most adventurous and prolific actresses since she made her Broadway debut in 1952. Her very presence evokes a host of tantalizing memories of fabled productions, from Tennessee Williamss Orpheus Descending (in which she played the fey, phantasmal Carol Cutrere) to the Steppenwolf Theaters The Grapes of Wrath (as the indomitable Ma Joad).

title: Marissa Mayer of Yahoo Announces Birth of Twin Daughters
description: Just hours after Marissa Mayer announced a plan to spin off Yahoos core Internet business, the chief executive gave birth to identical twin daughters.

title: California and Germany, Opposites With a Common Energy Goal
description: PARIS  One is a European country known as the powerhouse of Europe that struggles against soggy winters and seemingly endless gray skies. The other is a digitally driven American state, known as the Golden State, for its abundant sunshine and year-round growing season.

title: Save the Planet. Eat Ugly.
description: PARIS  Lets eat ugly!

title: An Old Alsatian Museums Modern Makeover
description: Every December, the streets of Colmar, one of the prettiest towns in Alsace, are scented by cloves, cinnamon and nutmeg  the aroma of the vin chaud (spiced wine) ladled out to the cheerful crowds who visit its five Christmas markets. Within pine bough-draped chalets, everything from wooden toys and hand-blown glass ornaments to gingerbread houses and farmhouse jams are on offer. And this season, the little French town will also celebrate the newly renovated and expanded Muse Unterlinden when it opens on Saturday. Located in a cloistered 13th-century Dominican convent, the museum is one of the most visited small museums in France and is best known for its Isenheim Altarpiece, which was sculpted and painted by the German artists Niclaus of Haugenau and Matthias Grnewald respectively between 1512 and 1516.

title: Hugo Barra of Xiaomi on the Companys International Plans
description: BEIJING  In 2013, the Chinese smartphone company Xiaomi hired Hugo Barra, a Brazilian-born, M.I.T.-trained former senior executive of Google.

title: The Best Performances of 2015
description: Wesley Morris, critic-at-large, weighs in on performances we will still be talking about next year.

title: Rattled by Terror and Floods, Britain Enters Era of No Quick Fixes
description: LONDON  It has seemed, almost, a land of two narratives, one in fear of jihad, the other confronting an older hazard: rain.

title: Mark Zuckerberg of Facebook Reassures Muslim Users
description: The millennial innovator who got the world to share sonograms, goofy wedding photos, relationship statuses and innermost thoughts on Facebook is doing a lot of sharing himself these days.

description: To the Editor:

title: France Drops Karim Benzema Amid Sex Tape Scandal
description: Striker Karim Benzema has been suspended from the French national soccer team until an investigation into possible blackmail involving a teammates sex tape is concluded.

description: To the Editor:

title: Alice Cazenaves Honesty Pictures
description: The photographer uses leaves that have been stripped of pigment as photographic negatives to create delicate, ghostly pictures of plants inner workings.

title: Connecticut to Ban Gun Sales to Those on Federal Terrorism Lists
description: With the mass shooting in California last week focusing attention on terrorism and guns, Gov. Dannel P. Malloy of Connecticut announced on Thursday that he intended to sign an executive order barring people on federal terrorism watch lists from buying firearms in the state.

title: Delicate, Magical Portraits of Plants Inner Lives
description: Do plants have souls? With her Honesty Pictures series, the artist Alice Cazenave aims to find out, by capturing the delicate inner workings of leaves and stems. Inspired by her background in molecular science as well as her family history of craftspeople (her relatives have included cabinetmakers and draftswomen), Cazenave employs experimental, camera-free techniques to get at the essence of plants. She strips the leaves of pigment by washing them in chemical solutions that transform them into translucent, glassy structures, then uses them directly as negatives, placing them onto photosensitive paper and then exposing them to light. She doesnt use lenses or screens, in an effort to create images as a direct consequence of an interaction between light and object, she says. This series is intended to capture a sense of shadows peeled off the real  and to restore a sense of wonder and mystery to a medium that has become almost universally accessible. Much of my work comments on the growing disengagement with the natural world, and aims to re-establish a sense of magic and alchemy to photography, which I feel in recent times has been lost.

description: To the Editor:

description: Earlier this week, Mr. Trump called for a shutdown on Muslims entering the United States until everyone can figure out what the hell is going on.

description: HONG KONG  As Chinese authorities intensify their scrutiny of the financial industry, the billionaire chairman at one of the countrys biggest private conglomerates is missing, a local financial news magazine reported on Thursday.

description: ISTANBUL  Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu on Thursday announced a set of reforms that will grant greater rights to the countrys Alevi minority, including the legal recognition of their houses of worship.

title: Russian Families Seek Information on Plane Crash in Egypt
description: MOSCOW  Relatives of people killed in a Russian airplane blown up over Egypt in October have filed a legal complaint to compel investigators to reveal their lines of inquiry into the cause of the crash. The complaint, filed in a Russian court, is the first sign of anger over an investigation that critics say has been influenced by politics.

description: Computer researchers reported artificial-intelligence advances on Thursday that surpassed human capabilities for a narrow set of vision-related tasks.

description: John Thain once spent $1.2 million of Merrill Lynchs money remodeling his office there, including $35,000 for an antique commode.

title: New York Business Leaders Full-Page Ad Praises Citys Immigrants
description: A prominent group of New York business leaders took out a full-page New York Times ad praising the citys immigrants regardless of their place of origin or religious affiliation amid the increasingly harsh statements being made during the presidential race.

title: Yahoos Spinoff Plan Does Not Change Its Tax Risk
description: Does the direction of the spin matter? Not for tax purposes.

title: When a Gift Goes Unmatched
description: My husband and I were childless for many years. During that time, we gave overly generous gifts to my brother-in-laws three children for the holidays. Now that we have a 5-year-old, I am amazed at how little reciprocation there is. They spend about $35 per gift for our child, while we spend from $50 to $100 on each of theirs. I dont want to buy gifts for them like I used to because my spending is never matched. How can I politely convey that they should be spending as much as we do?

title: How to Stop Mass Shootings in America: Times Readers Respond
description: The attack in San Bernardino, Calif., that left 14 dead and 21 injured last week seemed to confirm for many people that such shootings, regardless of whether they are related to terrorism, are now an almost a daily part of living in America.

title: The Stunning Hypocrisy of the Planned Parenthood Attack
description: Robert L. Dear Jr., the man accused of killing three people at a Planned Parenthood clinic in November, left little doubt about his motivations in a court appearance on Wednesday.
