But with a purpose: she was trying to prepare us to interact with men who wouldnt always be supportive of our presence. So this fall, before Secretary of Defense Ashton B. Carter announced that women would be allowed into all military occupations, I looked to the Marine Corps yearlong experiment to integrate women into ground combat jobs to see if attitudes had changed.

title: For Ben Simmons, Lifting L.S.U. May Be Too Tall a Task
description: College basketball has often been enlivened by stars who turn average teams into world-beaters. Larry Bird took Indiana State to the national finals in 1979. David Robinson and Navy made it to the round of 8 in 1986. Elena Delle Donne led Delaware to the round of 16 in 2013.

title: Jane the Virgin Season 2, Episode 8: Christmas Time
description: Christmas is the perfect setting for a Jane the Virgin episode. Its a holiday that, especially on television, emphasizes happiness, togetherness, family and tradition. The midseason finale is no exception, though it does contain a few wonderful (and dark) twists.

title: In New Ad, Marco Rubio Appeals to Supporters of Trump and Cruz
description: Senator Marco Rubio has gone on the attack recently against Donald J. Trump and Senator Ted Cruz, who are leading in the polls nationally and in Iowa. But with this commercial, which began running on Tuesday, he instead appeals directly to their core supporters: people who feel disaffected from American politics.

title: What to Wear for Free Nights at MoMA
description: Visitors to the Museum of Modern Arts free Friday nights were worldly with their outfits.

title: What to Wear for Free Nights at MoMA
description: On a recent Friday, the Museum of Modern Art quietly welcomed the millionth visitor to its Uniqlo Free Friday nights, when admission is free from 4 to 8 p.m. There was a parade of students, tourists and bargain-seeking New Yorkers (many on date nights) who braved a chilly night waiting in line.

title: Montserrat Caball, Former Star Soprano, Is Fined in Tax Case
description: A Spanish court on Tuesday ordered the soprano Montserrat Caball to pay a fine of 254,000 euros, about $278,000, for avoiding taxes by falsely claiming residency in Andorra.

title: Heilemann and Halperin to Join a Political Program on Showtime
description: One week after striking a deal with MSNBC, John Heilemann and Mark Halperin have signed a deal for a weekly show for Showtime, the premium cable channel announced on Tuesday.

title: Ben Carson Says Muslim Civil Rights Group Has Ties to Terrorists
description: Ben Carson, the Republican presidential candidate who has been fading in the polls, accused a leading Muslim-American civil rights group of having ties to terrorists on Tuesday as he laid out a new national security plan.

title: Never Again? Dont Be So Sure: Readers on Donald Trump and Fascism
description: European readers offered warnings, conservatives offered defenses, and others condemned what they described as bigotry in parts of the Republican party, in response to recent articles about Donald Trumps anti-Muslim statements.

title: Best New York Restaurants 2015
description: Pete Wellss picks for the top dining in the city this year.

title: Top New York Restaurants of 2015
description: The new restaurants I reviewed this year gave me a very deep bench from which to pick this year-end list. Ruthlessly, this ranking of my favorites was capped at 10, but I could have stretched it to 15 without any noticeable drop-off in quality.

title: Valeant Makes Distribution Deal With Walgreens
description: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International has agreed to distribute many of its drugs through Walgreens stores in a new way and, in some cases, for lower prices, the companies announced on Tuesday.

title: Immigrants in America
description: To the Editor:

title: Police Say Threat Made to New York Schools Was a Hoax
description: An email that threatened attacks against the New York City school system on Tuesday, nearly identical to one that prompted officials in Los Angeles to close schools there, was a hoax, New York officials said.

title: Transparent Season 2, Episodes 4 and 5: Raffles and Mee-Maw
description: When Ali and Syd are in the stacks of the Malibu library, Ali stumbles upon the concept of epigenetics, the idea that trauma can actually get baked into a family gene pool and pass down from generation to generation. If this theory is true, then there is something buried deep in the Pfeffermans past that might be able to explain  or at least partly account for  the current mixed-up nature of the family, with no one quite able to chart a path toward happiness.

title: Chris Christies Rubio Dilemma
description: The official Big Story of tonights Republican debate is Donald Trump versus Ted Cruz, but since Trump tends to back off in debates and save his barbs for his rallies and Twitter the smart money is on Ted Cruz versus Marco Rubio offering the more interesting fireworks. But the even smarter money (I know, I know, how smart can you get?) might tell you to watch out for aChris Christie assault on Rubio, since how that attack turns out could shape the primary campaign more than whatever slings and arrows Cruz and Trump and Rubio exchange with one another.

title: Putin Gambit Over Syria Proves to Be Dual-Edged Sword
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Eleven weeks after Moscow launched its first airstrikes in Syria, the scream of Russian warplanes has become so familiar in rebel-held areas that even children recognize it. But the military map of the conflict has changed little, and the Kremlins forces have become another set of players in a civil war that seems to defy solution.

title: The Tax Acrobatics in the Dow-DuPont Deal
description: Investors cheering the planned merger of Dow Chemical and DuPont should raise a glass to the lawyers. Last weeks deal might never have come together without rarely exploited fine print in the United States tax code that should allow the companies to avoid any tax on capital gains.

title: House Reaches Accord on Spending and Tax Cuts
description: WASHINGTON  Republican and Democratic negotiators in the House clinched a deal late Tuesday on a $1.1 trillion spending bill and a huge package of tax breaks.

title: Restricting Toxic Chemicals
description: To the Editor:

title: Fenway Parks Neighborhood Changes, but Keeps Its Character
description: BOSTON  The Fenway neighborhood is most closely associated with Fenway Park, the Red Sox and baseball-themed taverns.

title: How To | Wrap a Gift
description: The beauty guru and stylist Linda Rodin quickly shares how to package a present  without paper.

title: The Era of Jihadist Amateurism Might Be Over
description: LONDON  When it comes to terrorist plots, Britain has been lucky more than once.

title: Leslie Uggams Drops Out of Off-Broadways Dot
description: Leslie Uggams has dropped out of the Off Broadway play Dot, which opens at the Vineyard Theater on Feb. 23, in favor of a recurring role on Foxs Empire.

title: First Draft Focus: Welcome to America
French Court Acquits Marine Le Pen of Hate Speech
description: PARIS  A French court on Tuesday acquitted the far-right leader Marine Le Pen of charges that she incited religious hatred against Muslims with comments made in 2010.

title: How to Watch the Republican Debate
description: Check out how we analyzed the fifth Republican debate by Nick Confessore, Maggie Haberman and Alan Rappeport, and as well as our fact checks.

title: N.H.L. This Week: Rangers Look to Right the Ship
description: Every Tuesday, The New York Times will look at the week ahead in the N.H.L., highlighting hot  or not so hot  teams and players.

title: Afghans See Taliban as a Key to U.S. Aid Projects, Study Finds
description: WASHINGTON  The United States spent $64,597 to build a wall around a school in Qala Nazir Baba, a village in Logar Province in Afghanistan. It spent an additional $41,792 to rehabilitate an irrigation system in Zoya, a village in Wardak Province.

title: Review: In Yours in Haste and Adoration, Terry Southerns Thoughts Spill Out
description: It must have been a gas, to borrow one of his favorite terms, to get a letter from Terry Southern. Each was its own little acid trip, streaked with innuendo and poached in a satirical kind of intellectual flop sweat. He used thin, expensive paper and sealed some of his letters with wax. People were said to read them aloud to whoever was in the room.

title: World Powers Relax the Process for Picking a U.N. Leader, Slightly
description: UNITED NATIONS  For decades, the secretary general of the United Nations has been chosen by the worlds five most powerful countries  and always behind closed doors. The only clear qualification for the job was that the permanent members of the Security Council agreed on him  and, yes, it has always been a him.

title: Crispy Winter Squash Pastries for a Holiday Party
description: I try to get ahead not only with sweet holiday baking in December, but also with savory hors doeuvres that I can freeze until I need them for a party. Baked Greek phyllo triangles  tiropites  are my favorite in this department. The crispy filled pastries are always impressive, and while they take some time to make, they are not at all difficult.

title: Thaw in China-Russia Relations Hasnt Trickled Down
description: BLAGOVESHCHENSK, Russia  Lured by warming relations between the two countries, Li Lihua, a Chinese entrepreneur, has invested all of her money in this frigid Russian outpost on the border with her country. She has opened Chinese restaurants, purchased factories and started a $120 million housing project to build affordable apartments aimed at young, upwardly mobile Russians.

title: Ebola Stigma in Liberia
description: To the Editor:

title: A Guide to Delaware Countys Thriving Craft Culture
A Slavery Monument?
description: To the Editor:

title: Russia and Montenegro
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: F Is for Family, Netflixs Ribald Portrayal of a 70s Household
description: There have been several 1970s in TVs imagination. Weve seen the brightly plumed 70s of the last season of Mad Men, the innocent mood ring of That 70s Show, the consciousness-raising 1979 of Fargo, whose characters grasp at U.F.O.s and self-help programs to levitate them out of malaise.

title: Russell Wilson Has Seahawks Back in the Playoff Picture
description: The Seattle Seahawks lost to the Arizona Cardinals on Nov. 15, and fell to 4-5. The offense was struggling, and the star running back Marshawn Lynch was dealing with an abdominal injury.

title: Gilbert Taylor, New York City Homelessness Chief, Quits Post
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio, still struggling to manage near-record levels of homelessness, announced on Tuesday that his homeless-services chief was stepping down in another shake-up of the administrations antipoverty efforts.

title: Spoiler-Free Reviews of Star Wars: The Force Awakens
description: No one wants to see a spoiler.

title: Preparing to Raise Rates, Fed Underestimates Benefits of More Inflation
description: This is going to sound like anathema to all those economists who lived through the inflation of the 1970s, but theres a good case for trying to double the inflation rate.

title: Mysterious Website Aims to Shed Light on Soccer Dealings
description: The press officer for F.C. Twente, a professional soccer club in the Netherlands, received a telephone call one morning last month while driving to work. A colleague had just seen a strange post on Twitter.

title: Under Fire, Debt Restructuring Amendment Is Pulled
description: The spending bill on Capitol Hill no longer includes an amendment that had hedge funds and other investors in Caesars Entertainment at loggerheads.

title: Man Arrested in VTech Breach of Childrens Data
description: Police in England said they arrested a 21-year-old man on Tuesday in connection with last monthsbreach of VTech, a Hong Kongelectronic toy maker, which exposed personal data for 12 million people, including 6.4 million minors.

title: Retailers Feel the Heat of Lost Winter Clothing Sales
description: High above the pedestrians milling about Herald Square in light coats and jackets, Stuart Greenberg, a seller of luxury furs, fondly recalled chilly Decembers past.

title: The Search Is On for Missing Public Art in England
description: LONDON  A two-ton bronze. Four, seven-foot fiberglass bulls. A 300-foot metal tube. A spiky, rusted metal pineapple-shaped fountain. These are some of the unlikely artworks that have disappeared from public places since 1945, says Historic England, a government service that protects English heritage. On Tuesday Duncan Wilson, chief executive of Historic England, issued a call to arms to the public to help search for some 40 missing works of public art, some by major figures like Henry Moore and Barbara Hepworth.

title: Tyler Perry to Host Live Musical About Jesus on Fox
description: Fox is to broadcast a live musical in March about Jesus Christ, titled The Passion, the latest live music special to appear on network television. The Passion will be hosted and narrated by Tyler Perry, and broadcast live from New Orleans on Palm Sunday.

title: Fed Rate Move May Not Hurt Eurozone, but It Wont Help Much, Either
description: FRANKFURT  Cheap oil. A weak euro. Money printing by the central bank.

title: Jue Lan Clubs High-End Chinese in the Flatiron District
description: Jue Lan Club Upstairs and down, indoors and out, this elaborate collection of dining areas is the showcase for the high-end modern Chinese food from Oscar Toro, who was at Buddakan. Some of my food, like the crystal shrimp dumplings and hot and numbing crispy beef, are traditional, but Ive interpreted other dishes, he said. So his bao buns are filled with sloppy oxtail, and hes come up with a bone marrow and prawn dumpling, and filet mignon with green Sichuan peppers, black bean aioli and taro fries. There is a raw bar, which will be expanded in the garden in the spring. Stratis Morfogen, the managing partner, has created one dining area as a homage to Limelight, the church building and former nightclub that houses the restaurant. (Opens Thursday): 49 West 20th Street, 646-524-7409, juelanclub.com.

title: Hopes Dashed Again in Hunt for Fabled Nazi Gold Train in Poland
description: WALBRZYCH, Poland  Experts from the Krakow University of Science and Technology said on Tuesday that, contrary to 70 years of local folklore, there is no trace of any armored Nazi train filled with looted treasure buried near Walbrzych in southwestern Poland.

title: The Latest Wave of New Yorks Food Districts
description: Food neighborhoods emerge in mysterious waves. Here, we track some of New York Citys more interesting developments in 2015.

title: A Tantalizing, Mysterious Art Book (or Is it Book Art?)
description: The artists book, a medium that originated in France at the turn of the last century, gets a digitally inspired reboot with RadioPaper, a project launching today at Studio Leigh in Hoxton, East London.Taking its title from the electronic paper that replicates the physical page in Kindles and other e-readers, the exhibition provides a showcase for the debut book work by the British artist Mary Ramsden, which will also be available to buy in an edition of 30. Framed in fluorescent-edged Perspex boxes, each of the copies of RadioPaper contains a series of abstract artworks by Ramsden, and perhaps more surprisingly, submerged within their French folds, five specially composed super-short stories by the Granta award-winning novelist Adam Thirlwell.

title: Vote at Atomic Agency Officially Ends Inquiry Into Irans Nuclear Past
description: WASHINGTON  The nations controlling the worlds nuclear inspection agency voted on Tuesday to close its decade-long investigation into the work it suspected Iran of conducting to design a nuclear weapon, and instead to move ahead with fulfilling the deal signed in July to limit Irans production of atomic material for at least 15 years.

title: Curing Hepatitis C, in an Experiment the Size of Egypt
description: SHABAS EL SHUHADA, Egypt  Abdel Gawad Ellabbad knows exactly how he was infected with hepatitis C.

title: Donald Trump to Meet G.O.P. Megadonor Sheldon Adelson Before Debate
description: Donald J. Trump was scheduled to meet with the casino magnate and megadonor Sheldon Adelson at the Venetian Hotel in Las Vegas, the site of Tuesday nights Republican debate, according to people briefed on the meeting.

title: A New Education Law, and the One Left Behind
description: To the Editor:

title: 3 Held in Connection With Paris Attacks in January and November
description: PARIS  Three people are being questioned by French investigators in connection with terrorist attacks in the Paris area this year, including two suspected of supplying the guns used in the deadly siege of a kosher supermarket in January, the Paris prosecutors office said Tuesday.

title: Should Schools Err on the Side of Caution When It Comes to Bomb Threats?
description: Schools across Los Angeles were shut down and arriving students sent home on Tuesday after the police received what officials described as a credible bomb threat against many schools, not specifically identified and their students. Some 640,000 students enrolled in over a thousand schools were affected, along with their parents, by the sudden morning shutdown. Many parents were already on the way to school with their children, or had already put them onto buses, which were instructed to turn back. Students already at schools were sent home and arriving families turned away.

title: Mets Re-sign Reliever Jerry Blevins
description: The Mets announced Tuesday that they had re-signed reliever Jerry Blevins, whose 2015 season was cut short by injuries, to a one-year deal. He is likely to enter next season as the teams left-handed specialist, a position they lacked this year.

title: Ski Issue: On the Right Path
description: A selection of photography shot for this years ski issue, including stunning views from Aspen, Telluride and more.

title: Pictures of the Day: Greece and Elsewhere
description: Greece and Elsewhere: Pictures of the Day

title: Dec. 15, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Greece, Indonesia, Kazakhstan and India.

title: Remaking Dow and DuPont for the Activist Shareholders
description: The proposed combination of Dow Chemical and DuPont shows that in todays markets, financial engineering prevails and that only activist shareholders matter. Whether that is good for the rest of us remains to be seen.

title: Argentine Prosecutor Seeks to Reopen Case Against Ex-President
description: BUENOS AIRES  A federal prosecutor is trying to revive a criminal complaint filed by Alberto Nisman, a prosecutor who died in mysterious circumstances earlier this year.

title: Everything You Ever Wanted to Know About Top 10 Lists
description: December means a flood of Top 10 and Top 100 lists, year-in-review essays and special issues dedicated to summations of one kind or another. Blake Wilson, a senior editor in Culture, talks about his departments contributions to the torrent.

title: Shiite Muslim Sect Alleges Massacre by Nigerias Military
description: KADUNA, Nigeria  Representatives of a Shiite Muslim sect in northwestern Nigeria said on Tuesday that hundreds of its members were killed by the military in a massacre over the weekend.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Jeb Bush Begins The New Hampshire Project to Try to Resurrect His Chances in the State
description: Jeb Bush will next hit the campaign trail for a packed day of town-hall-style events in New Hampshire at 8 a.m. Saturday in Contoocook, and finish up nearly 12 hours later in Nashua. Then he will return to the state, again and again.

title: Facts & Figures: Ted Cruz, Proud Partisan
description: Ted Cruz is near the bottom of the Bipartisan Index, a ranking based on how often lawmakers sponsor or co-sponsor bills introduced by members of the other party. Of those in the Senate for at least 10 months between 1993 and 2014, he ranked 224th out of 227. And if you look at current senators, hes third from the bottom.

title: Quentin Tarantino, Jennifer Jason Leigh and Channing Tatum at The Hateful Eight Premiere
description: Stars of Mr. Tarantinos new 190-minute-long film attend the screening and after-party at the Rainbow Room.

title: Quentin Tarantino, Jennifer Jason Leigh and Channing Tatum at The Hateful Eight Premiere
description: Is there a director in Hollywood besides Quentin Tarantino whom actors are dying to work for, in scenes too violent to be described in a newspaper?

title: The Operatic Tenor Juan Diego Flrez Shifts His Tone, and His Persona
description: BARCELONA, Spain  The boyish pluck is still there, but middle age seems to have sneaked up on Juan Diego Flrez.

title: What Donald Trump Has Built
description: As the 2016 electoral contest slouches toward actual voting, I wonder whether Donald Trump is happy with the results of a campaign that he has built almost entirely on hatred, fear and personal invective. Does he have any remorse over what hes created, or is it all just part of the show for him?

title: Pete Rose Just Doesnt Get It, So the Hall Wont Get Rose
description: With two outs and the bases empty in the bottom of the eighth inning on Aug. 17, 1986, Pete Rose inserted himself into the Cincinnati Reds game at Riverfront Stadium. Rose, who was the last active player to be his teams manager, struck out against Goose Gossage of the San Diego Padres. He never played again.

title: How Unpopular Is Trumps Muslim Ban? Depends How You Ask
description: Donald J. Trumps proposal to bar Muslim noncitizens from entering the United States, at least temporarily, does not appear to be broadly popular with Americans. But exactly how unpopular it is depends on what question a pollster asked, and possibly on whether a human or a machine asked it.

title: Donald Trump Makes Megyn Kelly a Target Again
description: Most presidential candidates spend debate days brushing up on their policy points, getting in a bit of exercise or trying to relax before steppinginto the spotlight.

title: Health Insurance Enrollment Deadline Is Extended to Thursday
description: Hours away from a deadline, the government announced on Tuesday that it was extending an enrollment period for full-year health insurance in 2016 under the Affordable Care Act.

title: Evening Briefing
description: Tuesday Evening Briefing

title: 2015's Most Noteworthy Dressers
description: Taraji P. Henson, Caitlyn Jenner and Adele, among others, made waves this year with elegant looks and bold experiments.

title: Venezuelan Official Is Said to Be Charged in Drug Case in U.S. Court
description: On social media, Nstor Reverol, the head of Venezuelas National Guard, has bragged about seizing large shipments of cocaine in raids against drug cartels.

title: MoMA to Organize Collections That Cross Artistic Boundaries
description: Within the Museum of Modern Arts announcement on Tuesday of coming exhibitions were signs of a seismic shift underway in how it collects and displays modern and contemporary art  changes that are expected to have a powerful impact on the museums renovation.

title: Chinese Adoptees at Home in America
description: A chance encounter with several Chinese girls being raised in Montana led Meng Han to explore the world of Chinese adoptees in the United States.

title: Jurors in Freddie Gray Trial Tell Judge They Are Deadlocked
description: After roughly 10 hours of deliberations, jurors in the trial of Officer William G. Porter, on trial for manslaughter in the death of Mr. Gray, announced that they were deadlocked. But the judge told them to continue deliberating.

title: Review: In The First Noel, a Forlorn Girl Longing for Holiday Gaiety
description: The little girl is called Noel, and you can tell shes a doodler from her shoes, decorated with tiny drawings and snatches of words. Noel the 2nd, shes spelled out along one side, and there it is: the wound shes been carrying through her childhood.

title: Holiday Lights Around New York City
description: The photographer Natan Dvir captures some of the best holiday displays from Fifth Avenue to Dyker Heights (dubbed Dyker Lights).

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing: Donald Trump, Congress, John Kerry
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Luther Returns, With Idris Elba Reprising His Role as Tortured Detective
description: After a recent screening of the very compact new season of Luther (two hourlong episodes, being shown back to back on Thursday on BBC America), a fans question knocked Idris Elba off his stride for a moment: Why are you such a badass? She wasnt talking about John Luther, rogue detective, or Stringer Bell, the drug dealer Mr. Elba played on The Wire, or James Bond, the secret agent much of the world wants him to play. She was going to the source. Badassery follows Mr. Elba around, and in the age of the incredible shrinking movie star, hes the rare performer who sells a production based on his own considerable charisma.

title: A Sumptuous Surrealist Moment in Manhattan
description: The Carlyle Hotel is having a Surrealist moment. Two art galleries on the premises have mounted sumptuous shows on the subject, and they play off each other beautifully.

title: Goldman Sachs Names a Third M.&.A. Co-Chairman
description: At the close of a year filled with merger deals, Goldman Sachs has named John Vaske a third co-chairman of global mergers and acquisitions, alongside Tim Ingrassia and Paul G. Parker.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Colorado Springs Deals With Mass Killing as Nation Moves On
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  It had been just five days since a visit to a Planned Parenthood clinic put Kentanya Craion in the middle of a massacre that left her cowering in a back room and her boyfriend among the three dead.

title: Essay Contest to Determine New Ownership of Maine Movie Theater
description: Tired of commuting 150 miles each way, the owner of a movie theater in Maine is holding an essay contest to give away his restored, nearly 100-year-old cinema.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Baltimore Mood in 12 Tweets
description: Many Baltimoreans were disappointed yet unsurprised at the outcome of Officer William G. Porters trial  though some are urging those fighting for change not to give up.

title: A Dreamer Activist Becomes a Citizen, but Her Fight Is Not Over
description: WASHINGTON  Lorella Praeli has not always been happy with President Obama.

title: Review: The Emperors New Clothes, a Documentary About Income Inequality
description: Free-market fundamentalism  the belief that the economy, if left to its own devices, will self-correct in times of stress  is the source of all evil in Russell Brand and Michael Winterbottoms inflammatory documentary, The Emperors New Clothes. And the economist Milton Friedman, whose laissez-faire economic theories were embraced by Margaret Thatcher and Ronald Reagan, is portrayed as a kind of Antichrist foreshadowing the global meltdown of 2008.

title: A Conversation With Klara Madlin
description: Ms. Madlin, 68, is the president of Klara Madlin Real Estate, a boutique residential brokerage firm that she founded in 1984. The single-office firm specializes in properties on the Upper West Side of Manhattan.

title: Review: Generations of Music by the Carter Family, Documented
description: American royalty gets a well-deserved encomium in Beth Harringtons fond documentary, The Winding Stream: The Carters, the Cashes and the Course of Country Music.

title: Review: Dreams Rewired, a Futuristic Look at the Past
description: Dreams Rewired, a montage of clips from nearly 200 vintage films, is a lively, visually enthralling attempt to gaze into the future by remembering the past. The snippets  mostly obscure excerpts from dramas, cartoons and scientific and educational films  are seamlessly fused into a whoosh of images, many of them zany, all from the 1880s to the 1930s. The later ones have sound.

title: Global Payments to Buy Heartland Payment for $4.3 Billion
description: Global Payments said on Tuesday that it planned to buy Heartland Payment Systems, a fellow payment processor focused on small to midsize businesses, for about $4.3 billion in cash and stock.

title: Physicists in Europe Find Tantalizing Hints of a Mysterious New Particle
description: Does the Higgs boson have a cousin?

title: Hillary Clinton Asks Tech Companies to Help Thwart ISIS Online
description: WASHINGTON  Hillary Clinton on Tuesday accelerated her call for technology companies to cooperate with the government and develop a unified national strategy in cyberspace to stop the Islamic State from using the Internet to recruit members in the United States and around the world.

title: A Park to Sop Up Pollutants Before They Flow Into the Gowanus Canal
description: At the foot of Second Street in Brooklyn, hard by the Gowanus Canal, is a tiny green space with a very big job.

title: Group Calls Israelis Foreign Agents for Work on Behalf of Palestinians
description: An ultranationalist Israeli group was accused of incitement on Tuesday for labeling the leaders of four of Israels most prominent human rights organizations foreign agents in a widely viewed video that equates their work on behalf of Palestinians with support for terrorism.

title: Undertakers Discovery Turns a Brooklyn Death Into a Murder Case
description: On a morning in November, the New York police officers who had been called to check on an 82-year-old woman found her lying on her kitchen floor, her body partly under a table. She was dead, the authorities said, and had probably been there for days.

title: San Diego Vows to Move Entirely to Renewable Energy in 20 Years
description: Last weekend, representatives of 195 countries reached a landmark accord in Paris to lower planet-warming greenhouse gas emissions. On Tuesday, local leaders in San Diego committed to making a city-size dent in the problem.

title: School Segregation Persists in Gentrifying Neighborhoods,Maps Suggest
description: The segregation in New York City elementary schools is often assumed to be a simple consequence of where people live: If neighborhoods are racially divided, so too will be their neighborhood schools.

title: Plaintiff and Lawyer Ordered to Reimburse New York in False-Arrest Suit
description: Nearly three years ago, a woman reported being abused by her husband. He was arrested, only to have the charge dropped after the wife recanted. The man, Patricio Jimenez, then sued New York City last year for false arrest.

title: Judge to Appoint Monitor for Mold Repairs in New York Public Housing
description: A federal judge, frustrated by the slow pace of New Yorks efforts to curb mold in public housing, will appoint a special master to ensure the city complies with an agreement to address the problem faster and more aggressively.

title: What Youve Missed So Far in the Debate
description: Check out how we analyzed the fifth Republican debate in real time, as well as our fact checks.

title: Glen Sonmor, 86, a Brawling N.H.L. Coach
description: Glen Sonmor, an explosive hockey coach who guided the Minnesota North Stars to their first Stanley Cup finals in 1981, died on Monday in Brantford, Ontario. He was 86.

title: Battered, Apologetic and Still Pitching Their Hedge Funds
description: It has been a bruising year for hedge funds. Not even billionaire managers with sterling records were able to escape heavy losses, and several among them have made the industrys list of worst performers. Some lost so much of their investors money this year that they have written apology letters.

title: Army Names Woman to High Post
description: Weeks after the military opened all combat roles to women, the Army on Tuesday named Brig. Gen. Diana Holland as the first female commandant of cadets at West Point, the service academy that has produced some of the countrys most famous officers. General Holland, who is currently the deputy commander for support of the Armys 10th Mountain Division, graduated from West Point in 1990. The commandant oversees the cadets at West Point, while the dean, also a one-star general, is in charge of academics. Both report to the academys superintendent, who is a three-star general. General Holland joined the Army Corps of Engineers after leaving West Point, and she deployed to Iraq in 2004 and later did two stints in Afghanistan.

title: Graduation Rates Reach a High
description: The graduation rate for American public school students is at its highest ever, according to data released Tuesday by the United States Department of Education. In the 2013-14 school year, 82 percent of students who started ninth grade completed high school within four years. The increase held true across all demographic categories, including low-income students and students with disabilities or limited English proficiency. The largest gains were among black students, for whom the rate rose 5.6 percentage points since 2010-11, when states began using a uniform measurement, to 72.5 percent in 2013-14, and among students learning English, among whom the rate increased 5.6 percentage points in the same period, to 62.6 percent.

title: Hague Court Orders Retrial for 2 Aides to Milosevic
description: PARIS  United Nations appeals judges on Tuesday ordered a new trial for two top aides of former President Slobodan Milosevic of Serbia, saying that they had been wrongfully acquitted in 2013.

title: California: 2 Children Found Dead
description: Police officers in Northern California who were investigating a case of torture and abuse of a child this week found the bodies of two children inside a storage unit. The Plumas County sheriffs office said in a statement on Tuesday that it was asked by the county child protective services agency on Friday to conduct a welfare check on a 9-year-old girl living in an apartment in Quincy. It said that two people, Gonzalo Curiel, 17, and Tami Joy Huntsman, 39, were arrested after the girl was found with numerous injuries. They were being held on torture, mayhem and child abuse charges with bail set at $1 million. The case turned into a homicide investigation when the bodies of two children were found in a storage unit in Redding, about 100 miles away.

title: Tennessee Woman Tried Coat-Hanger Abortion, Police Say
description: A Tennessee woman has been charged with attempted murder after she reportedly tried to abort a 24-week-old fetus with a coat hanger, a case that has raised passions about abortion and womens autonomy.

title: Report Finds Less Misuse of Painkillers by Teenagers
description: A new federal report suggests that misuse of prescription painkillers among teenagers is decreasing, news that heartened officials who remained concerned at the steady numbers regarding marijuana and e-cigarette use.

title: In Lower-Tier Debate, Republicans Warn About Choice for President
description: Remember us?

title: The Republican Debate in Las Vegas
description: Republican presidential candidates gathered for their final debate of 2015 on Tuesday night in Las Vegas.

title: Slack Aims to Become a Control Panel for Your Job
description: What if you could run your whole job from a messaging app? Imagine doing your expenses or requesting human resources forms through a simple chat interface, or using an instant message to respond to customer complaints or to start a conference call with your colleagues.

title: A Bad Call on the Bergdahl Court-Martial
description: The decision by Gen. Robert Abrams, the head of Army Forces Command in North Carolina, to refer Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, a soldier who was held hostage by the Taliban for five years, to a general court-martial was an odd call. Lt. Col. Mark Visger, the military officer who oversaw Sergeant Bergdahls preliminary hearing, recommended that the soldier not face jail time or a punitive discharge, and found that a different process called a special court-martial would be appropriate. General Abrams did not explain his thinking.

title: U.S. Defense Chief Ashton Carter Prods Gulf States to Take Larger Role in ISIS Fight
description: INCIRLIK AIR BASE, Turkey  Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter flew to this strategically positioned air base in southern Turkey on Tuesday carrying an appeal for allied nations to do more to combat the Islamic State.

title: Dont Blame Mental Illness for Gun Violence
description: Those who oppose expanded gun-control legislation frequently argue that instead of limiting access to guns, the country should focus on mental health problems.

title: Dance This Week: Misia Sert, Meredith Monk and Anne Waldman
description: While New York dance this week is dominated by the continuing and annual seasons of George Balanchines The Nutcracker (New York City Ballet at the David H. Koch Theater) and Alvin Ailey Dance Theater (at City Center, where the Balanchine Nutcracker had its premiere in 1954), two other events occur this week only. Though not primarily dance events, they connect music, theater and dance in various ways.

title: Transcript: Republican Presidential Debate
description: Following is a transcript of the undercard Republican debate, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

title: Fifth Republican Debate: Analysis
Review: In These Paper Bullets!, a Chance to Twist and Shout
description: Try to forget Shakespeare, and its easy enough to have a goofy good time at These Paper Bullets!, a lively if labored update of Much Ado About Nothing that the Atlantic Theater Company opened on Tuesday.

title: Cul-de-Sac
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  When we last saw Paula Gamache, she was reminding us to keep our ears clean, but today she offers us a puzzle that shows us that the DEAD can pop up just about anywhere, so please make sure that you are prepared for the zombie apocalypse, which is apparently upcoming.

title: Muslim Parents on How They Talk to Their Children About Hatred and Extremism
description: A Muslim parent in Tokyo tells her children to work 100 times harder and be 100 times kinder. A father in Ontario advises his teenagers to be wary of anyone reaching out to them over the Internet and claiming to be Muslim. ISIL is trying to recruit you, he tells them, referring to the Islamic State.

title: Faith Is Sustaining Family Through Mothers Tumor
description: There is no doubt in Victoria Gonzalezs mind that her Christian faith is responsible for her very survival. And she hopes her children will benefit from it in equal measure.

title: Rookies Fill Void on Defense and Give Rangers a Boost Against the Streaking Oilers
description: Just 23 seconds after serving a slashing penalty, Rangers defenseman Marc Staal skated right back to the box for clobbering Edmonton Oilers forward Leon Draisaitl in the face with his stick. The Rangers were squatting on a one-goal third-period lead, a rarity lately.

title: John Kerry Visits Moscow to Prepare for Talks on Syria
description: MOSCOW  Secretary of State John Kerry pressed ahead on Tuesday in the effort to organize a new round of talks aimed at ending the Syrian civil war that could also align the United States and Russia more closely in strategies for fighting the Islamic State.

title: Luigi Creatore, Songwriter and Producer for Presley and Sam Cooke, Dies at 93
description: Luigi Creatore, a songwriter and record producer who teamed with his cousin Hugo Peretti to create hits for Elvis Presley, Sam Cooke, Perry Como and others, died on Sunday in Boca Raton, Fla. He was 93.

title: In Republican Debate, Donald Trump and Marco Rubio Become Targets
description: Donald J. Trump came under sustained attack from Jeb Bush and other Republican presidential candidates on Tuesday night as they united against his plan to bar Muslims from entering the United States while tussling over who would be toughest in protecting Americans from terrorist threats.

title: Transcript: Republican Presidential Debate
description: Following is a transcript of the main Republican debate, as transcribed by the Federal News Service.

title: Cruz Blusters and Trump Sulks at Tense Republican Debate
description: Someone needs to explain carpets to Ted Cruz.

title: Executions by States Fell in 2015, Report Says
description: Executions in the United States in 2015 fell to their lowest number in nearly 25 years, and new death sentences imposed by courts declined to levels not seen since the early 1970s, according to a report released Wednesday.

title: What Happens When the Fed Raises Rates, in One Rube Goldberg Machine
description: Exactly seven years ago, the Federal Reserve cut interest rates to almost zero in order to nurse the ailing economy back to health. Recently it changed direction. This is how it works.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | peremptory
description: peremptory  \p-rem(p)-t(-)re\  adjective

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I know how theyre feeling. I know exactly how theyre feeling.

title: Living in NoMad
description: In the neighborhood north of Madison Square Park, office buildings are still prevalent, but some have gotten the condo treatment.

title: Square Merchants Bought Shares During Its I.P.O., With a Start-Ups Help
description: Tushar Bajaj, 35, and his wife, Leena, 42, have casually bought and sold stocks for years. Until last month, they had never been able to buy shares in an initial public offering.

title: A Losing Debate for Donald Trump
description: Something must have gone rightin Tuesdays Republican debate, because Donald Trump complained it was unfair. Which meant, of course, that his opponents put a few dings in The Donald.

title: Between Guilt and Innocence, an Evolution in Fire Science
description: A statue of a mythological Chinese supernatural beast called Hsieh-Chai, who was believed to have the ability to tell the guilty from the innocent by butting them, stands at the University of Pennsylvania Law School.

title: Brooklyn Prosecutors Revisit 3 Convictions in Fatal 1980 Fire
description: The two-alarm fire gobbled up the Brooklyn townhouse on Feb. 7, 1980, a night so cold that the firefighters water froze as they tried to slow the blaze.

title: What to Watch Wednesday
description: Sing it! Patti LaBelle and James Wright Chanel whip up some sweet potato pie. Buddy the Elf, voiced by Jim Parsons, deals with his daddy issues. And some cast members of Nashville hit the road.

title: The Fifth Republican Debate
description: At the CNN debate in Las Vegas, nine candidates tussled over who would be the toughest in protecting Americans from terrorist threats.

title: Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio, Alike in Many Ways, Collide at G.O.P. Debate
description: Dressed nearly identically, the two first-term Cuban-American senators had been circling each other for the first half-hour of the debate. At 33 minutes in, Senator Marco Rubio of Florida pounced, seeking to portray Senator Ted Cruz of Texas as someone who would leave the country defenseless.

title: Analysis of the Fifth G.O.P. Debate
description: The Times reporter Adam Nagourney analyzes key moments from the fifth Republican presidential debate in Las Vegas on Tuesday, as candidates sparred over issues such as terrorism.

title: Who Won the Republican Debate? Commentators Weigh In
description: The final Republican presidential debate of 2015 was marked by sharp exchanges between Senator Ted Cruz of Texas and Senator Marco Rubio of Florida, and it featured a feistier Jeb Bush and a Donald J. Trump who seemed as if he was trying not to slip up. Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey and Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky also sought to seize the spotlight in an event that saw all the candidates trying to make a strong impression on Republican voters less than two months before the first nominating contest.

title: Success Academy Network to Shorten Its School Day Next Year
description: Success Academy, the high-achieving charter school network, told employees this week that it would shorten its school day next year, altering a feature that has distinguished the network from New York Citys regular public schools but has also made it hard to retain teachers.

title: Corrections: December 16, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: A Waterfront Home on Grenadas Southern Coast
description: The house, which has a pool and a private dock, is on the market for $2.2 million.

title: What You Get for $1,600,000
description: A Victorian in New Jersey and contemporaries in Texas and Illinois.

title: CVC Partners to Take Stake in Payments Security Provider
description: As CVC Partners looks to expand its push into so-called growth investments, the private equity firm is planning to take a stake in a payments security start-up.

title: Iraq Declines Offer of U.S. Helicopters for Fight Against ISIS, Pentagon Chief Says
description: BAGHDAD  Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi of Iraq declined to take up the Pentagon on its recent offer to speed up the fight against Islamic State fighters in Ramadi with the help of American attack helicopters, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Case Against Civil Rights Lawyer Tests Free Speech in China
description: BEIJING  Many Chinese Internet users are watching with great concern the case of the civil rights lawyer Pu Zhiqiang, in which prosecutors brought charges against Mr. Pu based on seven short posts he wrote from 2011 to 2014 on Weibo, a Twitter-like platform.

title: 2 Brooklyn Men Are Charged in Firing of Pistol at Waldorf Astoria Wedding
description: Two brothers who were arrested this summer after one of them inadvertently fired a pistol during a wedding at the Waldorf Astoria were indicted on felony weapons charges on Tuesday, according to court filings.

title: Ghostbusters Joins Library of Congress National Film Registry
description: Are you troubled by strange noises in the middle of the night? Do you experience feelings of dread in your basement or attic? Well, perhaps the Library of Congress can help alleviate those sensations when it adds Ghostbusters and 24 other classic movies to its National Film Registry.

title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens Delivers the Thrills, With a Touch of Humanity
description: The big news about Star Wars: The Force Awakens is  spoiler alert  that its good! Despite the prerelease hype, it wont save the world, not even Hollywood, but it seamlessly balances cozy favorites  Harrison Ford, ladies and gentlemen  and new kinetic wows, along with some of the niceties that went missing as the series grew into a phenomenon, most crucially a scale and a sensibility that are rooted in the human. It has the usual toy-store-ready gizmos and critters, but it also has appealingly imperfect men and women whose blunders and victories, decency and goofiness remind you that a pop mythology like Star Wars needs more than old gods to sustain it.

title: What Israel Tells Us About Affirmative Action and Race
description: THE Supreme Court heard oral arguments last week in Fisher v. University of Texas, a case that could decide the future of affirmative action in American higher education. When the court first heard the case, in 2013, the justices ruled that universities may take race and ethnicity into account in admissions only if race-neutral solutions have proved to be unworkable. Many legal scholars predict that this sessions decision is likely to pressure schools to find race-neutral ways of achieving student diversity.

title: Paris Climate Accord Is a Big, Big Deal
description: PARIS  I had low expectations for the U.N. climate meeting here and it met all of them  beautifully. I say that without cynicism.

title: Can This Really BeDonald Trumps Republican Party?
description: John Feehery, a prominent Republican lobbyist with roots on the South Side of Chicago, understands that he embodies the Republican predicament.

title: The Child Martyrs of Pakistan
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  A FEW days after the Pakistani Taliban gunned down 14-year-old Muhammad Shaheer Khan, along with at least 144 others, at the Army Public School in Peshawar last year, his mother received the black gloves he had worn to school that day.

title: The Urgent Need for Peace in Yemen
description: There is a chance now to end the civil war in Yemen as the government of President Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi and the Houthi rebels begin peace talks in Switzerland amid a cease-fire.

title: Is It Fair to Rate Professors Online?
Thinking Against Violence
description: This is an interview with Brad Evans, a senior lecturer in international relations at the University of Bristol in England. He is the founder and director of the Histories of Violence project, a global research initiative on the meaning of mass violence in the 21st century. His most recent books include Disposable Futures: The Seduction of Violence in the Age of Spectacle (with Henry Giroux), Resilient Life: The Art of Living Dangerously (with Julian Reid) and Liberal Terror.  Natasha Lennard

title: Chinas State Power Investment Corporation to Buy Renewable Energy Company
description: HONG KONG  Chinas State Power Investment Corporation agreed on Wednesday to buy Pacific Hydro, a renewable energy company, from the Australian pension fund IFM Investors for an undisclosed price.

title: Mass Layoffs in Chinas Coal Country Threaten Unrest
description: HEGANG, China  In the dank shower room where the miners soak, the coal dust from their bodies staining the water chocolate, a lone worker sat smoking a cigarette, staring at the floor.

title: R.B.S. Considering Sale of Williams & Glyn
description: LONDON  The Royal Bank of Scotland said on Wednesday that it was considering selling Williams & Glyn, the branch network it had planned to spin off in 2017.

title: News Qs | Where the Candidates Stand on 2016s Biggest Issues
description: Before Reading Where the Candidates Standon 2016s Biggest Issues:

title: North Korea Sentences Canadian Pastor to Life in Prison
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Koreas Supreme Court sentenced a Canadian pastor to hard labor for life on Wednesday, the latest punishment the isolated country has inflicted on outside missionaries, who have been vilified as spies or agents of subversive ideas.

title: When a Baby Dies
description: Ethan Butlers best chance to truly live was for his parents to accept the fact that their infant son would die.

title: Manhattan Condos Amid the Offices
description: For years, Manhattans NoMad neighborhood often seemed like the real estate equivalent of a shoal in the flow of buyers heading downtown, eager to find the next trendy neighborhood. They frequently circumvented the longtime office district, around Fifth Avenue in the 20s and 30s, leaving it high and dry.

title: How to Handle Your Finances as the Fed Raises Interest Rates
description: Now that the Federal Reserve has raised its benchmark lending rate, are you hoping that your savings account will start paying more than a mere fraction of 1 percent in interest? Worried that the monthly cost of your adjustable-rate mortgage might be about to rise sharply?

title: In Chile, Where Pablo Neruda Lived and Loved
description: The idea of paying a visit to Pablo Nerudas home in Santiago had come as an afterthought. My husband, Jim, and I had been traveling through Chile, with a single day to spend in the capital.

title: Cute Cocktail Napkins for Holiday Parties (Wine Stains Included)
description: The ubiquitous skull and crossbones seem to be finally on the way out. What was dark and daring once, the province of Keith Richards and later Alexander McQueen, became kind of Juicy Couture-cutesy before its final dilution.

title: A Sensible Makeover for the Ford Foundation
description: Going to see the president of the Ford Foundation was once the philanthropic equivalent of going to see the Wizard of Oz.

title: Chinese Adoptees at Home in America
description: Meng Han left China for Montana in the spring of 2014 to study English on a fellowship. Though she lived in a populous university town, she found it difficult to connect with her classmates and teachers.

title: What Are the Best Things You Ate in 2015?
description: What comes to mind when you think of the best things you ate in 2015? Are they foods you eat regularly, or were they new to you? Did you eat them at home or in restaurants or at a friends house?

title: Japans Top Court Upholds Law Requiring Spouses to Share Surname
description: TOKYO  Japans highest court on Wednesday upheld a law dating back more than a century that requires married couples to share the same surname, rejecting a claim that it discriminates against women by effectively forcing them to give up their names in favor of their husbands.

title: How Exercise May Help Us Fight Off Colds
description: Working out could help us fight off colds and other infections, according to a timely new study. The study, which found that regular exercise strengthens the bodys immune system in part by repeatedly stressing it, was conducted in animals. But the results most likely apply to people, the researchers say, and could offer further incentive for us to remain physically active this winter.

title: Hotel and Resort News: Keeping Cozy by the Fire Pit (and Pool)
description: IN INDONESIA, A SPA SAFARI (AND A TREEHOUSE)

title: Morning Agenda: All Eyes on the Federal Reserve
description: ALL EYES ON THE FEDERAL RESERVE | If the Federal Reserve decides to raise its benchmark interest rate today, as expected, it will bring an end to seven years of low interest rates.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Donald Trump, John Kerry, Star Wars
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Suspect in Xinjiang Mine Attack Spoke of Jihad, Chinese News Reports Say
description: HONG KONG  Chinas state-run news media has identified several people who the police say carried out a deadly knife attack in September at a coal mine in the northwestern Xinjiang region, releasing a televised confession this week in which one of the suspects said he had been carrying out jihad.

title: 1915: Austria Denies U.S. Allegations
description: LONDON  The Austrian governments Note in reply to the final word of the United States regarding the sinking of the Italian steamship Ancona, among whose murdered passengers were several Americans, is described by all evening papers here as of a most offensive tone. Aimed as direct defiance to the United States, the callous refusal of Vienna to be governed by the precedent established by Berlin after the sinking of the Lusitania  when Germany promised not to sink passenger ships without warning  is regarded as indicative that submarines of the Dual Monarchy will continue their piratical policy.  The New York Herald, European Edition, December 17, 1915

title: Abby Wambach Plays Final Game and Prepares for Future of Womens Soccer
description: NEW ORLEANS  The United States womens national soccer team has gone through roughly the same drill before almost every game it has played over the last several years.

title: Mitch McConnell Hints His Presidential Choice Is Tied to Centrist Voters
description: With three of his colleagues running for president and with ties to other contenders, Senator Mitch McConnell, the Kentucky Republican and majority leader, doesnt like to say much about who he favors.

title: New York Today: Where the Streets Have Two Names
description: Updated 8:40 a.m.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Must I Pretend to Like My Artist Friends Work?
description: A good friend of ours is an aspiring painter. Recently she held an exhibition at her studio of her latest efforts. We love her, but were not fans of her art, which is definitely a work in progress. She invited us to her party, but we knew that if we attended, wed be expected to buy one of her paintings, which cost a few hundred dollars each. Shes struggling and could use the money, but heres our question: Are we obliged, out of friendship or sympathy, to buy art from her even if we have no interest in it? Name Withheld

title: A New Winter Roast
description: We were eating dinner at Houseman, a restaurant opened by the chef Ned Baldwin on the once-quiet far-western side of SoHo, now called Hudson Square. It is a spare, welcoming room, with walls of white brick, warm lighting, smooth wooden tables the color of Bridgehampton sand  a neighborhood restaurant for those who live amid art and commerce, who travel widely, who want to eat simply and well.

title: Judge John Hodgman on Helicoptering Your Parents Babysitting
description: Dan writes: My partner thinks we should leave our 15-month-old son alone with my parents overnight. But I have witnessed some alarming behavior when they have taken care of my nephew. Once, rather than use the formula powder my sister-in-law had left them, my mom went into a random cabinet and used pancake mix instead.

title: Thai Players Move to the Fore of Womens Golf
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla.  Even after a record 10 players from Thailand advanced into the recent L.P.G.A. final qualifying tournament, their coach back home attempted to cushion their expectations.

title: Understanding El Nio
description: Rain in California. Fires in the tropics. Floods in the southern United States. Unseasonably warm weather on the Eastern Seaboard. All have followed El Nio events in past years.

title: A Training Ground for Untrained Artists
description: The artists arrived at the Creative Growth Art Center shortly after 9 a.m. Most come on East Bay Paratransit buses, which bring them from Alameda, Castro Valley and San Francisco, but a few travel independently. William Tyler takes the orange line BART from his group home in Union City. In 37 years, he has almost never been late. Terri Bowden takes the BART from Fremont, accompanied by a life-size matboard Fred Flintstone. It is a familiar sight to commuters in Oaklands 19th Street BART station: the legally blind woman with a mohawk and her inanimate sidekick. Bowden periodically replaces the dolls face; before Fred Flintstone, it was Abraham Lincoln, Michael Jackson, Robert Plant and, at some point, nearly every Creative Growth staff member. John Martin, who lives with his aunt 20 blocks away, walks to work, but not in a straight line. He stops at coffee shops, which fill his empty Gatorade bottles with coffee; at churches, which hand him donated cans of food; and at trash bins, where he rummages for plastic toys, sunglasses and flip phones.

title: Republican Debate Offered Several Standouts and More Substance Than Fireworks
description: The final Republican Fight Night of 2015 ended with a whimper, but there were plenty of bangs throughout.

title: Senate Confirms Robert Capers as U.S. Attorney for Eastern District of New York
description: The Senate on Tuesday confirmed Robert L. Capers to be the United States attorney for the Eastern District of New York, a high-profile office known for prosecuting terrorism cases, Mafia leaders, sex-trafficking and white-collar crimes.

title: U.S. Calls for Investigation of Shiite Deaths in Nigeria
description: LONDON  The State Department urged the Nigerian government on Wednesday to investigate reports of a large number of deaths over the weekend in clashes between the military and a Shiite Muslim sect.

title: Bo Ryans Retirement Ends an Era in Wisconsin Basketball
description: At his postgame news conference on Tuesday night after Wisconsins 64-49 win over Texas A&M-Corpus Christi, Coach Bo Ryan checked the nights stat sheet. He spoke for a minute about the game. Then Ryan, who has the most coaching wins in Wisconsin basketball history, announced his immediate retirement.

title: Michael Fassbender and the Robes of Royalty
description: In Macbeth, high medieval fashion gets a makeover befitting the rugged landscape of 11th-century Scotland. We avoided all decoration  the brocades and braids  anything youd associate with medieval style, Jacqueline Durran, the films costume designer, said. We wanted it to be almost primitive. Instead she relied on materials like bone, hemp and nettle to dress the mad and murderous characters of one of Shakespeares darkest stories.

title: Christmas Fiction: A Gift for Marian
description: STANDING in the kitchen, I was finishing the washing up when I noticed it had begun to snow. Not properly, just a few flakes. The lights were on over the way, theyve got their tree in the window: nicely decorated, all red and gold. I could see her  Marian  her face lit momentarily by the blinking Christmas lights, and she clocked me too, gave me a little wave.

title: Stick to Sanctions on Russia
description: LONDON  Ukraine and Russia are still at war. Since the Minsk II peace agreement came into effect on Feb. 15, nearly 400 Ukrainian soldiers and more than 200 civilians have been killed. Many more may die yet. As European Union leaders gather for a summit meeting this week, with the issue of whether to renew sanctions against Russia far from resolved, they cannot afford to ignore the continued violations of the cease-fire.

title: The Wests Best Ally Against ISIS
description: KIRKUK, Iraq  Whenever it can, the Islamic State strikes at the West through the attacks by terrorists inspired by its hateful ideology. The recent attacks in Paris and San Bernardino, Calif., are an all too painful reminder of the dangers of this despicable group.

title: The Mayor of the Shelter
description: Dear Diary:

title: Valeant Pharmaceuticals Cuts Earnings and Sales Forecasts
description: Valeant Pharmaceuticals said on Wednesday that it had sharply lowered its sales and earnings forecasts for this year as it deals with controversies over its pricing and distribution strategies.

title: A Map of Republican Insults: When Candidates Attack, and Why
description: How the Republican candidates for president are criticizing one another, and what they intend to accomplish with their lines of attack.

title: $1,600,000 Homes in New Jersey, Texas and Illinois
description: TITUSVILLE, N.J.

title: The Fed Machine
description: Getting the economy to change in just the way you want is a very tricky balancing act, even if you have the ability to create money from thin air.

title: Where to Go in Reykjavik, Iceland
description: Grandi, a district in Reykjavik that was until two years ago mainly the province of fishermen, has reawakened with a newfound creative vitality.

title: A Three-Day Trek in the Highlands of Myanmar
description: Wed been walking for hours on a dirt path with no shade when we came to the rice field. In a clearing, half a dozen farmers had set slanting wooden boards on the ground, arranged in a circle. They were hitting bundles of harvested rice plants against the panels so that the kernels broke away and slid down onto a tarp. Oxen waited nearby, hitched to heavy wooden carts.

title: Neu West Berlin
description: The newly opened restaurant, exhibition space and club is a hangout for the citys art crowd.

title: A New All-Purpose Hangout for Berlins Creative Types
description: On one recent evening at Neu West Berlin, a new artist-run restaurant, exhibition space, club, studio and chefs residency in the heart of the citys Kreuzberg creative scene, red and green lasers dashed across the walls as the noise-music group SFX tinkered with cassette players, pedals and mixers, filling the space with a moody soundscape. One musician, Cem Oral, stood on a chair and duct-taped an audio recorder to a wartime fuel tank hanging from the ceiling. This is a jam, said co-founder Patrice Lux, seated in candlelight. Its a different kind of music night.

title: India, Choking on Pollution, Restricts Vehicle Use in New Delhi
description: NEW DELHI  The Supreme Court of India ordered several transportation restrictions in the nations capital on Wednesday to help curb pollution, issuing a temporary ban on the registration of some diesel cars and setting a time frame for all taxis in the region to switch to compressed natural gas.

title: These Star Wars Stormtroopers Aim for the Heart
description: At the Los Angeles premiere of Star Wars: The Force Awakens on Monday, fans, celebrities and droids mingled in celebration of all things intergalactic. But only one fan group was invited to send over 50 costumed fans to the event.

title: Transparent Season 2 Episodes 6 and 7: Motherhood and Making Amends
description: Heres everything you need to know about Pfefferman parenting: when Josh confronts his mother about hiding his child, Shelly is not the least bit contrite. Instead, she immediately justifies her actions, saying they were just trying to protect him and let him move on with his life, consequence-free. She says they didnt beat him and that they gave him a credit card  what else could a good Jewish boy want?

title: A Handwritten Card, Signed and Sealed by the Latest Technology
description: Communication today is faster and more ephemeral than ever. We fire off emails, skip the punctuation in our texts, and watch our photos and messages vanish in seconds on Snapchat.

title: House Hunting in ... Grenada
description: $2.2 MILLION

title: An Art Installation Reflects on the Syrian Crisis and Extinguished Hopes
description: Issam Kourbaj called a friend in New York last week, seeking a ride to Manhattan from Kennedy International Airport after a flight from London. What he got was advice.

title: Pakistan Military Deals a Blow to Jihadists but Not to Ideology
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  All cellphone coverage was blocked by the government for three hours one recent afternoon in the Pakistani capital, and it did not take people long to discover why: Maulana Abdul Aziz, the radical preacher of the Red Mosque, was sermonizing again.

title: Redecorating Androids Quick Settings Box
description: Q. I know Apple will not let you customize the iOS control center screen, but is Android more flexible with its shortcut panel of settings at the top of the screen?

title: Daily Report: The Radio Star Lives
description: The Internet hasnt killed the radio star. On Tuesday, the satellite radio company SiriusXM announced that it had renewed its contract with the popular and puckish radio host Howard Stern.

title: Thousands March in South Africa to Call for Jacob Zumas Resignation
description: JOHANNESBURG  Thousands of people marched in major cities across South Africa on Wednesday to demand the resignation of President Jacob Zuma after an important government appointment last week that raised concerns about his handling of the nations economy.

title: Britain Pushes to Revive Fracking, Possibly Under National Parks
description: LONDON  The British government is once again trying to revive its flagging effort to extract the countrys natural gas and oil from shale rock.

title: Oddsmakers View Panthers as Vulnerable to Giants
description: The Carolina Panthers are 13-0 and closing in on the fifth perfect regular season in N.F.L. history, with quarterback Cam Newton making a strong case for the Most Valuable Player Award.

title: Bloomberg to Buy Barclays Index Business for $787 Million
description: LONDON  Barclays said on Wednesday that it had agreed to sell its risk analytics and index solutions business to Bloomberg L.P. for 520 million pounds, or about $787 million.

title: British Court Rejects Donald Trumps Attempt to Block Wind Farm
description: LONDON  Britains highest court unanimously rejected on Wednesday an attempt by Donald J. Trump, the real estate developer and Republican presidential candidate, to block the construction of a wind farm near his luxury golf resort in northeast Scotland.

title: Volkswagen Loans Investigated by E.U. Anti-Fraud Office
description: FRANKFURT  European anti-fraud investigators said on Wednesday that they were looking into whether Volkswagen misused hundreds of millions of dollars in low-interest loans  threatening a significant source of funding for the crisis-struck automaker.

title: Laughter and Exasperation as Democrats Take In Republican Debate
description: Eight miles away from where Republican presidential candidates clashed over their stances on national security and terrorism policies Tuesday, a crowd of mostly Democratic Las Vegas residents responded with bewilderment, skeptical laughter and mostly exasperation.

title: New York State Agrees to Overhaul Solitary Confinement in Prisons
description: New York has agreed to a major overhaul in the way solitary confinement is administered in the states prisons, with the goal of significantly reducing the number of inmates held in isolation, cutting the maximum length of stay and improving their living conditions.

title: After Shingles, Higher Risk of Heart Attack or Stroke
description: Shingles infections are very painful. They may also increase the risk of heart attacks and strokes in the weeks after an outbreak, a new study reports.

title: Artistic Furniture of the Gilded Age Recalls Rockefeller and Worsham
description: In 1881, Arabella Worsham, mistress and later wife of the railroad tycoon Collis P. Huntington, commissioned the cabinetmaker and interior designer George A. Schastey to decorate her home at 4 West 54th Street. A product of Schasteys work was a private dressing room for Worsham done in the fashionable style of the Aesthetic movement. It was a fully integrated chamber featuring a built-in wardrobe, full-length mirrors, delicate tables and chairs, and intricate marquetry rendered in satinwood and purpleheart with mother-of-pearl inlays. In 1884, Worsham sold the house and its furnishings to John D. Rockefeller, who left it to the Museum of the City of New York after his death in 1937.

title: 2015 in Mens Fashion
description: Instagram peacocks and upscale underwear were but two phenomena from 2015, as guys seemed to be paying special attention to how they looked.

title: The Obsessions of Douglas Sirk
description: Few Hollywood directors have undergone the kind of renovation of reputation experienced by Douglas Sirk (1897-1987), whose career is surveyed in a far-reaching retrospective presented by the Film Society of Lincoln Center, Wednesday, Dec. 23, through Jan. 6 at the Walter Reade Theater. The titles alone  Magnificent Obsession, All That Heaven Allows, Written on the Wind, All I Desire, Imitation of Life  evoke a hyperemotional soap-opera climate. If this German-born director is best known for his churning domestic melodramas, his output also includes musical comedy (Slightly French), war films (Battle Hymn) and westerns (Taza, Son of Cochise).

title: Parents of Teenagers, Stuck Taking Out the Emotional Trash
description: Psychologists have long observed that teenagers sometimes manage uncomfortable feelings by passing them off to their parents. Remember how your toddler wordlessly handed you her wrappers and empty juice boxes, and you reflexively accepted them, even when both of you stood right next to a wastebasket? In the adolescent equivalent, the trash is emotional, not actual, but the effect is the same: Our teenagers sometimes lighten their loads by passing their problems to us.

title: Great Midweek Recipes
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Lise de la Salle and Emanuel Ax: Affordable Elegance
description: Music lovers in the New York area have long counted on the Peoples Symphony Concerts for excellent, affordable programs. The series continues on the afternoon of Sunday, Dec. 20, when the elegant French-born pianist Lise de la Salle is joined by four instrumentalists from the Knights, the dynamic player-run chamber orchestra, in an enticing program of works by Mozart, Martinu, Takemitsu, Ravel and Judd Greenstein. Her colleagues for the occasion include the violinist Colin Jacobsen and the cellist Eric Jacobsen, the brothers who founded the Knights, along with the violinist Guillaume Pirard and the violist Kyle Armbrust. (2 p.m., Town Hall, pscny.org.)

title: Christmas Events, Traditional and Not
description: Feeling the holiday spirit? This is a good time to catch up to the always impressive Rockettes, high-kicking away in The Radio City Christmas Spectacular. (Through Jan. 3; radiocitychristmas.com.) Or, for something sillier, try Elf the Musical, adapted from the 2003 Will Ferrell comedy. (Through Dec. 27; elftour.com.) Irish Repertory Theaters A Childs Christmas in Wales, based on the prose poem by Dylan Thomas and featuring John Cullum, is a more intimate option. (Through Jan. 3; irishrep.org.)

title: American Dance Machine for the 21st Century Keeps Classic Moves Alive
description: When a Broadway show closes, what happens to the choreography? Dance, not as easily documented as music or dialogue, is at a higher risk of eroding as the production sits in storage. Such is the driving concern behind American Dance Machine for the 21st Century, which keeps musical-theater dances alive and untarnished through exacting reconstructions. Founded in 2012 by Nikki Feirt Atkins, the current incarnation picks up where the 1970s original, established by the dancer and director Lee Becker Theodore, left off a few decades ago.

title: Republican Debate Has Candidates Seeing Red
description: The nine Republicans running for their partys presidential nomination didnt agree on much during Tuesdays main debate (other than the fact that any of them would be a better leader than Hillary Clinton), but on one thing, there was surprising near unanimity: seven of the nine came armed for battle in red.

title: Santas in the Barn, on TruTV, Will Pick a Winner
description: Television is at its most mindless during the last two weeks of the year, but at least TruTV is performing a public service with its mindlessness. On Thursday night, after a grueling month of competitions, its Santas in the Barn will identify the best Santa in the United States.

title: Los Lobos Returns to City Winery
description: A Mexican-American band, a jam band, a roots-rock band, a blues band, a folk-rock band, a band with an arty streak and a band that could easily play a 1950s sock hop or a backyard barbecue in East Los Angeles  Los Lobos is all of those, coherent in its versatility. Now in its fifth decade, Los Lobos has become as much an American band as the Grateful Dead was: still in touch with its heritage but never confined by it. The band returns to City Winery, the club where it recorded its 2013 album, Disconnected in New York City, for its annual Christmastime stint. (Sunday, Dec. 20, with Connor Kennedy opening, and Monday, Dec. 21, with the Jamie McLean Band opening; citywinery.com.)

title: Choosing Antibiotics Over Surgery for Appendicitis
description: Once, appendicitis in a child always meant immediate surgery. But a new study has found that antibiotics may work just as well for children with uncomplicated appendicitis. (That means no ruptured appendix, a relatively low white blood count and no impacted feces.)

title: In a Self-Serve World, Start-Ups Find Value in Human Helpers
description: Its unfashionable to admit this in the age of Expedia, Priceline and other do-it-yourself online tools, but here it is: I miss travel agents.

title: A Houston Marriage Proposal Stops Highway Traffic
description: Since the dawn of time  or at least the dawn of social media  men have been maneuvering themselves and their loved ones into foolish situations to set the stage for jaw-dropping marriage proposals.

title: Video House Tours
description: Surprising and delightful interiors, belonging to the most interesting people in fashion, art, architecture, society and design.

title: Jazz Intuition, American Roots and Double Hybrids
description: LOTUS

title: You Asked, Martin OMalley Answered
description: During a visit to the editorial board, the candidate took a moment to answer a question from a Times reader.

title: Rolls-Royce to Restructure Management in Cost-Cutting Drive
description: Rolls-Royce, the British engineering group, announced a major management restructuring on Wednesday that the company said was aimed at simplifying a byzantine hierarchy and lowering operating costs after a string of profit warnings.

title: At Republican Debate, Straying Into Mideast, and Getting Lost
description: WASHINGTON  In a surprisingly substantive debate on foreign policy Tuesday night, Republican presidential candidates had a chance to present their alternative to what was portrayed as President Obamas failed approach to the upheaval in the Middle East. But in their effort to demonstrate their skills at analysis and leadership, the politics and history of the region often eluded them.

title: Larry Wilmore to Host White House Correspondents Dinner
description: In its search for a topical satirist to fling timely zingers and pierce overinflated egos at its annual dinner, the White House Correspondents Association is keeping it 100: Larry Wilmore, the host of The Nightly Show on Comedy Central, will be the principal entertainer at this annual Washington event on April 30, the association said Wednesday.

title: Judge Leaves Northern Irelands Abortion Laws to Lawmakers
description: DUBLIN  A Belfast judge declined to modify Northern Irelands strict abortion laws on Wednesday, saying that only lawmakers had the authority to bring the current legislation in line with European human rights laws.

title: Jeb Bush Campaign Promotes His Performance in a Call With Donors
description: In the week before Tuesdays debate in Las Vegas, when reporters asked Jeb Bush how he planned to regain control of the narrative in the presidential race, Mr. Bush quipped, Not answer any more questions about Donald Trump.

title: Trifonov Joins Prokofiev Marathon in Brooklyn
description: The marathon concert of all five Prokofiev piano concertos that Valery Gergiev and the Mariinsky Orchestra are bringing to the Brooklyn Academy of Music in February will include some youthful star power: Daniil Trifonov and George Li will join the lineup of soloists, the academy announced on Wednesday.

title: The Red Caboose, a Midtown Hobbyist Shop
description: Since 1970, the hobbyist store has been a paradise for collectors of model trains, cars and buses.

title: 1965: U.S. Launches Sun Satellite
description: CAPE KENNEDY  A drum-shaped interplanetary explorer named Pioneer-6 rocketed into orbit about the sun today [Dec. 16] and radioed back good quality information which may help unlock mysteries of the solar system.

title: Republican Candidates Sparring Resumes Mere Hours After Their Debate
description: Senator Ted Cruz, facing the most aggressive effort yet to sully his reputation with conservatives, absorbed a flood of attacks Wednesday from Senator Marco Rubio over immigration policy and national security, an offensive aimed at halting Mr. Cruzs rise among Tea Party and evangelical voters.

title: A Little Something for Nearly Everyone
description: After much discussion and many delays, White House and congressional negotiators reached an agreement to make permanent more than 50 temporary tax breaks, or tax extenders, that had been repeatedly extended for only short periods to understate their long-term costs.
