Below are some highlights.

title: At a Midtown Shop, Trains, Planes, Buses. And More Trains.
description: Youre either a bus guy or a train guy, Arnold Hochberg said the other day. He has a collection of more than 500 model buses. He is a bus guy.

title: That Brooklyn Look: A Family Business
description: The brothers Robert and Eric Taffera, contractors who specialize in Brooklyn brownstone renovations, have become the de facto caretakers of a neighborhood.

title: The Curators of a Homes Brooklyn Look
description: The stoops and sidewalks of Brooklyn Heights on this November afternoon were napped with gold  drifts of maple, oak and willow leaves  appropriate dressing for the gold coast neighborhood that was the citys first historic district. Its de facto caretaker, Robert Taffera, a mild-mannered contractor from Washington State, walked the fog-slick streets and pointed out his handiwork: nearly 40 houses that have been renovated by his company.

title: The Novels Evil Tongue
description: When the world was just new, Story came into being, and it came with the beguilements of gossip, and talebearing, and rumor.

title: Gingerbread Dream Team
description: When an architect, a pastry chef and a kid decide to build a gingerbread house, who knows what will happen?

title: The Secret of Trumps Success
description: My sense of things, last night and in the cold light of morning, is that yesterday eveningsRepublican debate mostly maintained the primary races status quo  Trump on top, Rubio and Cruz jockeying beneath, and room for maybe one more candidate to work their way into the not-Trump mix. It was an evening when Rubio and Cruz fought one another to a draw on national security and immigration, when Ben Carson continued his slow recessional, when Chris Christie stuck to selling himself as a tough-guy leader (how tough? World War III tough, Wolf) instead of mixing it up with the candidate he needs toeventually fight, when Kasich and Fiorina and Rand Paul were afterthoughts, and when nobody save Paul and Jeb Bush even tried to lay a glove on Donald Trump.

title: Gossip and Scandal Lead Googles Top Searches in 2015
description: Google released the top search terms of the year Wednesday morning, accompanied by a video stitched together from inspiring clips: Frances response to the Paris attacks, refugees navigating their way to safe haven and an adult lion bathing its cub, all of it narrated by Caitlyn Jenners speech at the ESPY Awards calling for harmony and acceptance of one anothers differences.

title: Riverton Housing Complex Is Sold in a Deal Preserving Affordable Units
description: Riverton, a residential complex that has long been a home for Harlems middle class, was one of the first properties to fall victim to speculators during the heady days of the last real estate boom a decade ago.

title: Star Wars Fans, Awakened by The Force, Turn Out in Droves
description: LONDON  In Manila, a 27-year-old ballet dancer named Mika Fabella began weeping as John Williamss orchestral score filled the cinema. In Bangkok, Winyou Sukhumwat, 40, who had made a video of himself posing with a lightsaber, declared, I feel alive again. In Paris, Jrmy Forges, a 32-year-old security guard, took a day off from work so he could stand in line for five hours to catch the 10 a.m. screening at the sumptuous Grand Rex theater.

title: BATS Exchange to Try Again at an I.P.O.
description: BATS Global Markets is making a second attempt at a public stock offering three years after a technology problem forced it to stay private.

title: Teenager Who Used Affluenza Defense in Fatal Crash Is Missing
description: Two years ago, a Texas teenager who killed four people in a drunken-driving crash was given probation after a defense witness suggested he suffered from affluenza, a term used to describe psychological problems that can afflict children from wealthy families.

title: Chris Christie Reminds Voters, Again and Again, of His Prosecutor Days
description: Most governors who seek the presidency promote executive experience as their chief credential, regaling voters with tales of big decisions they have made and budgets they have balanced.

title: Group Backing John Kasich Likens Donald Trump to Hippo in New Ad
description: New Day for America, a super PAC supporting Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio, is aggressively attacking Donald J. Trump, now with a mocking commercial titled Hippo-Crit that suggests Mr. Trump belongs in the White House about as much as he belongs in a zoo.

title: You Asked, Martin OMalley Answered
description: On Monday, we asked you to submit questions for Martin OMalley. During his visit to the editorial board, which was otherwise off the record, he drew one of your questions to answer on camera. Watch his response below:

title: Why Handmade Ceramics Are White Hot
Streaming Comedies Worth a Look
description: The best original streaming series so far are comedies like BoJack Horseman, Catastrophe and Casual.

title: Marco Rubio and Ted Cruz Diverge in Approach to Their Hispanic Identity
description: MIAMI  One candidate, Marco Rubio, nurtured by the sprawling Cuban-American community here, bounces effortlessly between two cultures  fritas and hamburgers, Spanish and English  in a city so comfortably bilingual that news conferences pivot between the languages.

title: Duets That Reflect the World Offstage
description: Ballet exudes tradition, is surrounded by conservatism and still depends on a small core repertory of 19th-century classics. This century, though, its been showing multiple signs of changing its character. Some reforms remain too few: Misty Copelands historic ascent to become American Ballet Theaters first African-American female principal, for example, will dwindle into mere tokenism unless other black ballerinas soon start to make an equal impact. Still, there have been important dances reflecting the racial diversity of the Western world. More generally, ballet has begun to reflect an altered society.

title: Peter Schickele Brings P.D.Q. Bach Back to the Stage
description: Avid P. D. Q. Bach followers, and there were many, knew the routine cold. The stage was set, the orchestra was ready, the announced time for the concert had arrived. But the star of the evening  its perpetrator and host, Peter Schickele  was nowhere to be found.

title: Wheaton College Professor Is Put on Leave After Remarks Supporting Muslims
description: Wheaton College, an evangelical Christian institution, has disciplined a professor who put on a head scarf in solidarity with Muslims and said they worship the same God as Christians.

title: Expected Repeal of Oil Export Ban Unlikely to Have Immediate Impact
description: HOUSTON  Ever since the 1970s, when international oil boycotts threatened the American economy and produced around-the-block waiting lines at gasoline stations, a ban on oil exports has been at the heart of national energy policy.

title: Facebook and Uber Follow Asian Rivals in Plan to Enhance Messenger App
description: For years, Asias technology giants have been one step ahead of Western companies in how they treat messaging apps.

title: Fed Raises Key Interest Rate for First Time in Almost a Decade
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve said on Wednesday that it would raise short-term interest rates for the first time since the financial crisis, a decision it described as a vote of confidence in the American economy even as much of the rest of the world struggles.

title: CNN Says G.O.P. Event Was Third-Highest in Ratings for a Primary Debate
description: More than 18 million people tuned in to CNN to watch the Republican candidates for president on Tuesday, the third-highest viewership in history for a nominating debate, according to Nielsen data provided by the cable network.

title: Ferguson Nears Deal With Justice Dept. to Overhaul Police Force
description: WASHINGTON  Officials in Ferguson, Mo., have reached the outlines of a deal with the Justice Department that would force changes to the citys Police Department and head off a civil rights lawsuit alleging years of unconstitutional policing, local and federal officials said.

title: Streaming TV Isnt Just a New Way to Watch. Its a New Genre.
description: At some point during Netflixs Sense8  a gorgeous, ridiculous series about eight strangers scattered across the world who use a psychic connection to aid one another in fights and at one point have a virtual orgy  I had to ask myself: What am I watching?

title: Los Angeles Schools Reopen With Many Parents on Edge
description: LOS ANGELES  As wary parents dropped their children off at schools here on Wednesday  the day after the entire school system was shuttered by a terrorism threat that turned out to be a hoax  school officials from around the country expressed a good measure of support and very little criticism for the decision by the Los Angeles Unified School District to close all the schools as a precaution.

title: Memory Theater, by Simon Critchley
description: If my dog finds a dead rat in the park, he remembers where he found it for months, if not years. I have no trouble remembering the spot either, perhaps because evolution shaped both my dogs brain and mine to facilitate hunting, and hunters need to be able to recall the lay of the land and salient objects within it.

title: Pakistan Surprised to Be Included in Saudi-Led Alliance It Never Heard Of
description: Officials in Pakistan said Wednesday that they had not been consulted by anyone in Saudi Arabia before their nation was described as a founding member of a new, 34-country Islamic military alliance to fight terrorism announced late Monday night by the Saudi defense minister.

title: Europes Justice Commissioner Prepares for a Difficult 2016
description: By any standard, Vera Jourova has had a busy year.

title: The Mutual Fund Equivalent of Bankruptcy
description: The recent decision by the managers of a fund invested mainly in high-yield, or junk, bonds to put their fund into the mutual fund equivalent of bankruptcy reminds us that mutual funds are like banks in an important way. Namely, both banks and mutual funds invest in long-term assets, yet promise short-term liquidity.

title: Budget Deal Raises Spending, and the Deficit, Through Tax Breaks
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional negotiators introduced a sweeping year-end spending and tax-break package Wednesday that bursts through previously agreed budget limits with $66 billion in new spending for 2016. It also makes permanent an array of tax benefits at a cost of adding more than a half-trillion dollars to the deficit.

title: Ethiopians on Edge as Infrastructure Plan Stirs Protests
description: BURAYU, Ethiopia  There are creeping signs of tension in this small town on the outskirts of Addis Ababa, the capital. Small groups of federal police officers prowl the streets, eyeing taxi stands and coffee shops. On a side road near the town center, a rectangle of black soot and a single burst tire mark the site where a bus recently went up in flames.

title: Pope Francis, Reminding That Salvation Is Free, Warns Against Fraudsters
description: An estimated 10 million Roman Catholics are expected to pass through the Holy Door, a symbol of the threshold to salvation, during a yearlong celebration dedicated to the theme of mercy.

title: Qatari Safari Members, Including Royalty, Are Abducted in Iraq
description: BAGHDAD  Militants in the southern Iraq desert ambushed and abducted at least 26 hunters from a Qatari safari early Wednesday, officials of both countries reported. The kidnapping victims were said to include some members of senior Qatari royalty.

title: San Bernardino Attackers Discussed Jihad in Private Messages, F.B.I. Says
description: The husband and wife who shot and killed 14 people in San Bernardino, Calif., this month used private online messages to express their commitment to jihad and to martyrdom in the years before the attack, but they did not make those communications on social media, the director of the F.B.I. said Wednesday.

title: When it Comes to Terrorism Threat, Republicans and Democrats Go Separate Ways
description: The all-terrorism, all-the-time focus of the Republican debate on Tuesday was not an accident. Democratic and Republican voters give unequal weight to the issue after the attacks in Paris and San Bernardino, Calif., as revealed in polling this week.

title: A Machine to Explain Monetary Policy. Why Not?
description: This year, we knew that big Fed news was on the horizon. The economy was going strong and the Fed was hinting that this was the year it was going to raise rates. If it did, it would be a momentous occasion for American monetary policy. The Fed hadnt raised rates in almost 10 years, and this would signal the beginning of the end of an era of easy money.

title: Advice for Volkswagen: Being Green Is Profitable
description: To the Editor:

title: Yoga Teachers Behaving Badly
description: The opening scene of the fictional web series Namaste, Bitches starts with some very un-yogic behavior. Sabine, a yoga teacher and recent transplant to Los Angeles, is driving on the freeway and is cursing repeatedly at her GPS while smoking a cigarette  hardly a model of Zen healthy living.

title: How to Track Data Use, and Choose the Right Smartphone Plan
description: EVERY week, Matt Spaccarelli, the owner of a heating and air-conditioning business in Savannah, Ga., follows a precise routine with his iPhone: He goes into the device settings to check how much cellular data he has used.

title: For a Shakespeare Anniversary, an Online Re-Creation of a 1796 Show
description: The coming year promises to bring global Shakespeare mania, as the 400th anniversary of his death prompts a cavalcade of performances and exhibitions around the world.

title: A Critique of Saudi Arabia
description: To the Editor:

title: Syrian Child Refugees
description: To the Editor:

title: With Feds Interest Rate Move, a Test of the Stock Markets
description: The extraordinarily low interest rates of the last seven years have stoked a bull market in stocks, fueled a global boom in commodities, prompted a wave of corporate mergers and led companies to borrow trillions of dollars in the markets.

title: Malala Yousafzai, Nobel Winner, Calls Donald Trumps Remarks on Muslims Full of Hatred
description: Donald J. Trumps contentious proposals on Muslims are reverberating around the world. The latest to denounce them is Malala Yousafzai, the youngest winner of the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Classical Playlist: John Scott, Mozart and Ryan Wigglesworth
description: DANCING DAY': Music for ChristmasSt. Thomas Choir of Men and Boys; John Scott, conductor(Resonus Classics)Reminders of the choirmaster and organist John Scott, who died suddenly in August, are all around during the holiday season, a time he and the choir of St. Thomas Church Fifth Avenue did so much to enrich for New Yorkers. This years annual performances of Handels Messiah went by, alas, without him. He would have led Benjamin Brittens A Ceremony of Carols and John Rutters Dancing Day in a concert on Thursday, Dec. 17. (Stephen Buzard, the choirs acting music director, will conduct instead.) And now comes an album of the Britten and Rutter works and a few other carols, the last of Mr. Scotts many recordings, bringing tidings of melancholy and joy. The choir sings wonderfully, whether accompanied by Mr. Buzard or Benjamin Sheen on organ, or Sara Cutler on harp. Several of the boy trebles  some of whom by now, as such things go, may well be baritones  have lovely solo moments. Yet another worthy memorial to a beloved figure on the New York music scene. (James R. Oestreich)

title: Curing Migraines
description: To the Editor:

title: On Carpet-Bombing
description: To the Editor:

title: Mistrial Declared in Case of Officer Charged in Freddie Grays Death
description: BALTIMORE  The trial of the first Baltimore police officer in the death of Freddie Gray ended in a hung jury on Wednesday, an unexpected twist that complicates the cases against five other officers facing charges in a fatal police encounter that prompted violent unrest here last spring.

title: Raouls, a Discreet Celebrity Hangout in SoHo, Turns 40
description: That was Robert De Niros booth, Al Pacino would sit here, Johnny Depp and Kate Moss sat there.

title: Women Who Play Games Shun Gamer Label
description: Like men, about half of all women play video games. But men are far more likely to call themselves gamers.

title: Yemeni Sides Agree to Prisoner Swap, as Peace Talks Begin in Switzerland
description: AL MUKALLA, Yemen  Warring parties in Yemen agreed on Wednesday to release hundreds of prisoners as the Yemeni government and Houthi rebels sat down for peace talks in Switzerland aimed at ending the countrys nine-month conflict.

title: App Smart | The Years Standouts
description: After checking out thousands of apps, Kit Eaton describes three that he has kept on his home screen: Prune, Pause and Enlight.

title: Video Feature: Some Favorite Apps of 2015
description: WRITING this feature once a week means I get to experiment with thousands of apps every year. Ive tested around 3,000 apps in the last 12 months, including apps in new categories like video webcasting and Apple Watch apps, and Ive seen a surge in short-term vacation rental apps, plus increasingly minimalist graphics across all categories.

title: A Trio of Art Shows that Inspire Double Takes
description: From quadratura to hyperrealism, artistic movements from the Italian Renaissance onward have recreated reality using trompe loeil (literally deceive the eye) painting techniques. This winter, a trio of European exhibitions make a strong case for a return to the uncanny valley  this time through sculpture and other three-dimensional forms.

title: Warren Buffett Endorses Hillary Clinton and Calls for Higher Taxes on Wealthy
description: Hillary Clinton on Wednesday picked up the endorsement of the billionaire investor Warren Buffett, who gave his backing to her while calling for increased taxes on the countrys highest wage earners.

title: Janet Yellens New Hat: Risk Manager
description: Janet Yellen is many things: an economist, a regulator, the chief administrator of a sprawling government agency. Her decision to raise interest rates Wednesday, however, shows her wearing a different hat: risk manager.

title: A Party Reagan Wouldnt Recognize
description: During Tuesday nights Republican debate, a.k.a. DEFCON 1, Republicans portrayed the United States as a tremulous nation cowering before the threat of Islamic terrorism. In a debate about national security, the field of nine candidates used images of war, death, and enemy infiltration to profit politically from ISIS-related attacks in Paris and San Bernardino. Led by Donald Trump, Ted Cruz, and Chris Christie, the fear-mongers projected an image of a diminished America that is grotesquely at odds with the way Americans have historically viewed themselves.

title: Paul Ryans Beard Triggers a Style Debate
description: In political circles, it was the equivalent of Dylan goes electric  or at least Rose McGowan goes bald.

title: Fed Follies
description: No, I dont mean the decision to raise rates, although nothing Ive seen changes my view that its a bad idea. I mean the desperate efforts to say something new about todays move. I understand that there are strong journalistic incentives here, but it really is trying to squeeze blood from a stone.

title: Portuguese Migrants Struggle to Find Relief in Angola
description: When Portugals economy hit the skids, it sparked a return migration to Angola, its oil-rich former colony. This time, the Europeans are in the subservient role.

title: Gigi Hadid and Tommy Hilfiger Join Forces on a Collection
description: A designer eager to be talked about can typically do one of three things. The first is to anticipate the cultural climate and hit upon something consumers want before they know they want it. The second is to manufacture a controversy. And the third is to mine the spirit and feed off it, often by aligning him or herself with a current celebrity phenomenon.

title: Broadway Is Getting Another Theater, Its 41st
Huge Beer Mergers Cast-Offs Could Attract a Private Buyer
description: Anheuser-Busch InBev has barely concluded its $106 billion deal to buy SABMiller and now is planning its next deal: a sale of Peroni and Grolsch, which it will acquire in the SAB deal. SABs dregs might attract a rival, but a private buyer may find those brands more to its taste.

title: Kobe Bryants Long Goodbye
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Last week, about an hour before the Los Angeles Lakers were to face the Timberwolves here at Target Center, Gary Vitti leaned against a wall outside the visitors locker room and exhaled. Vitti has been the Lakers athletic trainer for 32 seasons, but he has other responsibilities, too. He fields ticket requests. He helps manage the schedule.

title: Steven Spielberg and DreamWorks Studios in Deal to Form New Company
description: LOS ANGELES  Steven Spielberg said on Wednesday that he and his DreamWorks Studios would join Participant Media, Reliance Entertainment and Entertainment One to form an entertainment company called Amblin Partners to produce movies, television shows and digital content.

title: Review: Casey Schwartzs In the Mind Fields Considers the Brain, on the Couch and in the Lab
description: Neuroscience and psychoanalysis are not on particularly good speaking terms at the moment. One is glamorous and cutting edge, attracting all the pretty research grants; the other is old and unfashionable, redolent of Oriental rugs and vanquished by Lexapro. One expresses itself in numbers; the other in words. One strives for predictability and order; the other embraces ambiguities, chaos, mess.

title: A Place to Learn
description: A friend tells the story of a great meatloaf recipe a woman gave her, passed down from the womans own mother. It made two small loaves, baked separately. One day this woman served it to her mother, who was visiting. The mother asked why on earth she made meatloaf in two pans. Because thats how you always did it! the daughter answered. I was following your recipe. The mother explained that she did it that way only because the family had moved into an apartment with a smaller oven, and her old baking pan no longer fit.

title: Peace Reigns in Spain as Prado and a New Museum Settle Dispute
description: The Prado museum has settled a long-simmering duel with a new royal museum in Madrid over the rights to its most famous paintings, including The Garden of Earthly Delights by Hieronymus Bosch and the 15th-century depiction of the descent of Christ from the cross by Rogier van der Weyden.

title: In 2015, European Union Faced Threats From Outside and Within
description: The leaders of the European Unions 28 member states will gather on Thursday in Brussels for their eighth and final summit meeting of 2015. Issues that dominated their agenda at the start of the year have grown more urgent, threatening to undo decades of progress to foster closer ties, more open borders and tighter economic integration.

title: A Debate Focused on National Security
description: To the Editor:

title: How Reed Krakoff Decorates a Room
description: It was kind of a puzzle from the beginning, just bringing all of these things together to create some interesting relationships and interesting ideas, says the fashion designer Reed Krakoff who, along with his wife, the interior designer Delphine Krakoff, curated Alchemy: Art x Design, a part of Sothebys Important Design auction, whose items go on sale today.

title: Love for Sale: The Shopgirl Has a Pop Cultural Moment
description: In the 1939 George Cukor classic, The Women, Crystal Allen is the ultimate spritzer girl. A perfume vendor by any other name, as portrayed by Joan Crawford shes a mantrap in a black sheath and pearls, as fetching a commodity as the amber-tinted potions that she sells.

title: How Many Scripted TV Shows in 2015? A Precise Number, and a Record
description: There is finally a definitive answer for the number of shows on television, in a year in which television executives have debated whether the industry has reached Peak TV.

title: Pictures of the Day: Paraguay and Elsewhere
description: Paraguay and Elsewhere: Pictures of the Day

title: Girl, 16, Attacked by Man With Box Cutter in Queens
description: An assailant wearing medical garb and wielding a box cutter attacked a 16-year-old girl who was walking to school in Queens on Wednesday morning, the police said.

title: Trade War Escalates Between Russia and Ukraine
description: MOSCOW  Ukraine and Russia on Wednesday escalated their trade war after a series of energy and air travel disruptions.

title: Bartolo Colon and Mets Said to Agree on One-Year Deal
description: Bartolo Colon, who has become a favorite of Mets fans for his astonishing success on the mound and at the plate, will return next year.

title: At U.N., China Tries to Influence Fight Over Internet Control
description: Over the last six months, United Nations diplomats have negotiated over the text of a document set to define the policies and frameworks of how the Internet is governed in the future, and who has a role in the process.

title: Dec. 16, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Paraguay, Kenya, Greece and Belgium.

title: Military Operation With Mouse Ears: Inside the Star Wars Premiere
description: I was fortunate enough to attend the world premiere of this little film you may have heard of  Star Wars: The Force Awakens.

title: Ted Cruzs Call to Carpet-Bomb the Islamic State Draws Scrutiny
description: Earlier this season in the hit Showtime series Homeland, Peter Quinn, the elite black-ops C.I.A. agent, briefed a room full of top spies and military officials on what could be done to make a difference in the fight against the Islamic State.

title: Jerusalem Attacks Subside,but Not Palestinian Ire, as Israel Clamps Down
description: JERUSALEM  When the latest Palestinian uprising erupted in early October, set off by increasing fears that Israel was seeking to take over Al Aqsa Mosque compound, its locus was Jerusalem. The city was also home to the young men and women who carried out the attacks, stabbing, shooting and trying to hit Israelis with their cars.

title: Teen Marijuana Use Holds Steady Despite Legalization
description: People who oppose the legalization of marijuana argue that changing the law will encourage more teenagers to try the drug and will lead them to more dangerous substances like heroin, ecstasy and amphetamines. But a new study provides fresh evidence that contradicts both of those assertions.

title: Making Porcelain Replicas of Sticks
description: The forager-artist Katie Ridley Murphy shares her process.

title: Italian Mens Tailoring That Screams Sexy
description: Now that what was once a radical movement is just simple marketing, its safe to admit that #menswear  the early-2010s Tumblr-driven spread of male sartorial aspiration  was always a boys game.

title: The Chicest Sticks
description: Long before the forager-artist Katie Ridley Murphy began sculpting sticks from porcelain, she sketched them from her own Atlanta backyard  and sold the resultant works as original drawings and prints. And each piece, regardless of the medium, was modeled after a real stick she found in nature.

title: Nicki Minaj Concert in Angola Draws Human Rights Complaint
description: The Human Rights Foundation is asking Nicki Minaj to reconsider her scheduled performance in Angola on Saturday, citing a list of abuses committed by the president of the oil-rich African nation.

title: Malcolm Gladwell Hands Out Book Blurbs Like Santa Does Presents
description: When Malcolm Gladwell was asked to write a blurb for the 2005 book Freakonomics,  he did not explain that it explored the dynamics of the Ku Klux Klan or the impact of naming a child Loser. Instead, the New Yorker writer and best-selling author of The Tipping Point and Blink simply wrote, Prepare to be dazzled.

title: 3 Men Imprisoned in 1980 Brooklyn Arson Case Are Exonerated
description: Three men were cleared on Wednesday of setting a 1980 fire in Park Slope, Brooklyn, that caused the death of a mother and her five children, after the sole eyewitness was deemed unreliable and new understanding of the evidence fires leave behind was applied.

title: Scent Without a Sex
description: For a new generation of consumers, the traditional notion of gendered fragrances is starting to go a little stale. The days when floral notes were exclusively for women and musks were solely for men are all but gone, and mass-market brands that peddle colognes and perfumes are starting to catch on.

title: California D.M.V. Stops Short of Fully Embracing Driverless Cars
description: SAN FRANCISCO  California is not quite ready to let self-driving cars hit the road on their own.

title: Donald Trump Says He Doesnt Want Jeb Bushs Endorsement Anyway
description: Donald J. Trump responded with a familiar refrain to reports that Jeb Bushs aides had researched the legal implications of saying that Mr. Bush wouldnt support the real estate developer should he become the Republican nominee.

title: Review: Jane Glover Conducts the New York Philharmonic in Messiah
description: Some conductors, determined to bring a jolt of freshness to Handels Messiah, opt for bracing tempos and extra incisive execution. Not Jane Glover, the respected British conductor, in a long-overdue debut with the New York Philharmonic on Tuesday night at David Geffen Hall. Using no conductors stand, no score and no baton, Ms. Glover led a flowing, elegant and subtle Messiah.

title: Lovers Rock, a Reggae Bar in Bedford-Stuyvesant
description: A great new neighborhood bar slides in seamlessly, filling a hole without unraveling the local fabric. Lovers Rock, a mellow reggae-themed bar that opened in Bedford-Stuyvesant over the summer, is this rare kind of place.

title: Review: Making a Murderer, True Crime on Netflix
description: Making a Murderer fairly bursts at the seams. You get the feeling that the filmmakers Laura Ricciardi and Moira Demos, after spending 10 years working on it, couldnt bear to part with a single jailhouse phone call or videotaped interrogation. Their documentarys 10 episodes, which will be available on Netflix on Friday, often push past an hour, clocking in at 64 or 66 minutes. If youre planning to binge, clear some extra time.

title: Review: Cage the Elephants Tell Me Im Pretty Edges Toward Darkness
description: Tell Me Im Pretty

title: Review: Code Red Is Monica at a Turning Point
description: Code Red

title: Holiday Pop-Ups Multiply, and Other Shopping Events
description: As many of us get set to travel, holiday pop-ups continue apace. From Thursday to Saturday, Tatiana Santo Domingo and Dana Alikhani will have a pop-up for Muzungu Sisters, their ethical luxury-fashion website that sells products sourced from local artisans around the world. A beaded coin necklace ($225) and Sicilian basket with pompoms ($413) are among the goodies available. At 402 West 13th Street.

title: Judge Is Eager to Move the FIFA Case to Trial
description: As United States prosecutors delivered updates on Wednesday in their unfolding corruption case against global soccer officials and business executives, a federal judge expressed eagerness to move the case toward trial.

title: Review: Willow Smiths Ardipithecus, Teen-Speak on Astral Planes
description: Ardipithecus

title: Older Actors Are Having an Awards Season Moment
description: Most actors would yip with joy if an Oscar-winning director were to ring them up offering a starring role. But not Michael Caine, whose first thought  so he said  when he found himself in that very spot last year was that the director, Paolo Sorrentino, had gone a bit barmy.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: Republicans, Star Wars, Congress
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: In the Kitchen with Barbara Lynch
description: Barbara Lynch is a gritty Boston restaurateur whose home kitchen is the height of industrial chic.

title: Musicians Redefine Long Play in 2015
description: This was a year of muchness.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: A Quick Look at the Feds Interest Rate Increase
Chokers, the Wrap Coat and Bold Stripes
description: Accessories with a hint of kink, a relaxed robe coat looks refined over everything and chromatic stripes.

title: Bernie Sanders Warns of Demagogues and Division in Mosque Visit
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont joined members of three faiths  Christianity, Islam and Judaism  around a table at the Masjid Muhammad mosque in Washington on Wednesday to discuss racial and religious tensions in national politics and the national mood.

title: Review: The Creation of Meaning Views an Economically Torn Italy in Echoes of Earlier Days
description: Shot in the Tuscan Alps, the documentary-fiction hybrid The Creation of Meaning moves between suspending us in timeless nature and listening to the echoes of the past. A mountainside farmer, Pacifico Pieruccioni, clad in shorts, is one of the last men standing (for a few miles, at least) in an area wracked by Italys economic dysfunction and still touched by the memories of the Germans in World War II. The setting is an idyll fading before our eyes (with a bit of secret).

title: Donald Trump Finds a Receptive Audience in Arizona
description: MESA, Ariz.  The Boeing 757-200 taxied outside a private airport hangar here on Wednesday to thunderous cheers, as well as boisterous chants of We love you, Mr. Trump by three men in cowboy hats. The hangars owners had lent the space to Donald J. Trump, the billionaire running for president, an easy in-and-out arrangement the day after the last Republican debate of the year, in Las Vegas, a short flight away.

title: Mariano Rajoy, Spanish Prime Minister, Punched in Face by Teenager
description: A young man punched Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy of Spain in the face during a campaign event on Wednesday, leaving the stunned leader with broken glasses and bruises.

title: Belgium Says Law Limiting Raids May Have Allowed Suspect in Paris Attacks to Escape
description: PARIS  The authorities in Belgium said on Wednesday that one of the Paris attackers may have been holed up in a house in Brussels two nights after 130 people were killed and hundreds more injured  but that he could have escaped because of a law banning police raids on private homes from 9 p.m. to 5 a.m., according to the countrys justice minister.

title: How I Escaped Vietnam
description: The images accompanying this article are a combination of drawings from memory and the new artwork based on our recent trip back to my homeland.

title: Fact-Checking Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio on Immigration
description: The two Hispanic senators in the Republican presidential race  Ted Cruz of Texas and Marco Rubio of Florida  battled over immigration in the debate on Tuesday, competing to show who is tougher on border security. Mr. Rubio is vulnerable with conservatives on the divisive issue because of a bill he sponsored in 2013 that would have given people in the country illegally a pathway to citizenship.

title: The Dizzying Circular Logic of Donald Trump
description: Shortly before Tuesday nights Republican debate, Showtime announced it would be starting a new political documentary series in January called The Circus. The creation of the Republican media consultant Mark McKinnon and the Bloomberg political journalists Mark Halperin and John Heilemann, the show will chronicle the presidential campaign as it unfolds behind the scenes. It is the latest event horizon in the history of campaigns being covered as reality-show entertainment pieces  the next logical look into the fun-house mirror of our meta-driven political culture.

title: Virginia to Replace Guardrails With Others Deemed Safer
description: Virginia has decided to begin replacing certain roadside guardrails, including some made by Trinity Industries, a company that has been accused of making a defective rail.

title: Panthers Coach Ron Rivera Praises Giants and Odell Beckham Jr.
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Carolina Panthers Coach Ron Rivera, whose team is 13-0, spent several minutes Wednesday in a conference call heaping praise on the 6-7 Giants. Most notably, Rivera compared wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. to Jerry Rice, widely considered the greatest receiver in N.F.L. history.

title: Tampa Bay Buccaneers (6-7) at St. Louis Rams (5-8)
description: 8:25 p.m., NFL Network

title: Argentina Set to Devalue Its Currency
description: BUENOS AIRES  Argentines were bracing themselves for a substantial devaluation of their currency, the peso, as the new president, Mauricio Macri, rushed to execute sweeping market-oriented changes intended to revive an ailing economy.

title: Streaming Royalties Rise, but Not as High as Music Industry Wanted
description: A panel of federal judges on Wednesday increased the royalty that free Internet radio services like Pandora will pay record companies for the next five years, a decision that has been closely watched in the music industry and on Wall Street.

title: Literary Group Asks Obama to Intercede for Condemned Writers in Saudi Arabia
description: A petition from dozens of authors was sent to President Obama on Wednesday asking him to press Saudi Arabia to pardon a prominent poet condemned to beheading and a blogger punished with prison and flogging.

title: In Likely Spending Plan, Congress Readies Blows to Obamas Health Care Law
description: WASHINGTON  In a big package of tax and spending legislation that Congress is likely to approve this week, Republicans have forced President Obama to swallow three changes that undermine his signature health care law, including a two-year delay of a tax on high-cost insurance plans provided by employers to workers.

title: Governor of Puerto Rico Warns of Looming Default Without Bankruptcy Plan
description: The governor of Puerto Rico redoubled threats on Wednesday of a major bond default, as an effort to help the struggling commonwealth use bankruptcy to shed debt headed for defeat in Congress.

title: Chattanooga Attack Victims to Be Awarded Purple Hearts
description: Five months after the shooting rampage last summer at two Navy facilities in Tennessee, five service members who were killed and one survivor will be awarded Purple Heart medals, the military said on Wednesday.

title: Strike Tests Kohler, Wis., and the Company Sharing Its Name
description: KOHLER, Wis.  Highland Drive unfurls like a ribbon through this photogenic village near Lake Michigan. One side of the street is a tableau of leisure: a Tudor-style luxury resort, a spa, shops and a four-star, jackets-required restaurant that serves venison loin and foie gras.

title: Junk Bond Fund That Barred Investors Reaches S.E.C. Deal
description: Third Avenue Management reached an agreement with its regulator on Wednesday over its abrupt move last week to bar investors in a stricken bond fund from taking their money out.

title: Year After Cuba-U.S. Thaw, Obama Says Change Will Take Time
description: WASHINGTON  As the anniversary neared of President Obamas announcement of a historic dtente with Cuba, Representative Ileana Ros-Lehtinen of Florida, who was born in Havana and fled with her family to Miami decades ago, gave him a reality check. The policy change had done little to improve life for the Cuban people, she told the president at the White House last week, and had actually made their human rights situation worse.

title: Dave Duersons Family Says Concussion Film Smears Him
description: In Will Smiths new movie, Concussion, the former N.F.L. player Dave Duerson confronts the films protagonist, the pathologist Bennet Omalu, whose findings of chronic traumatic encephalopathy in pro football players shook the league. Duerson blocks the Nigerian-born Omalu from entering a medical conference, calls him a quack, and tells him to go back to Africa and to get away from our game.

title: Sheldon AdelsonSaid to Be Buyer of Las Vegas Review-Journal
description: The billionaire casino magnate and Republican donor Sheldon Adelson is behind the mysterious purchase of The Las Vegas Review-Journal for $140 million, according to two people familiar with the matter who spoke on condition of anonymity.

title: Transfers Could Reduce Guantnamo Detainees to 90
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration appears to be on the cusp of the largest round of transfers of Guantnamo Bay detainees in a single month since 2007, a move that could reduce the detainee population there to as low as 90 by mid- to late January, according to officials familiar with internal deliberations.

title: Syrian Families Look Through Photos of the Dead for Relatives Lost in Government Custody
description: While the spotlight of international attention remains firmly fixed on the brutalities of Islamic State militants in Syria, the families of thousands of Syrians who vanished into government detention facilities after protesters first took to the streets in 2011 have been confronted with graphic evidence of what President Bashar al-Assads security forces are capable of.

title: G.E. Expects Growth in Its Earnings in an Uncertain 2016
description: General Electric, the nations largest industrial company, expects next year to be one of economic uncertainty, geopolitical turmoil and slow growth.

title: Metro-North Crash Inquiry Delves Into Behavior of Woman Killed on Tracks
description: As federal investigators have sought to determine what led to a fatal crash on the Metro-North Railroad this past winter, they have focused considerable attention on understanding the actions of the woman whose sport utility vehicle was struck by the train and who was killed, along with five passengers aboard the train.

title: Defense Secretary Conducted Some Official Business on a Personal Email Account
description: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter relied on a personal email account to conduct a portion of his government business during his first months at the Pentagon, according to White House and Defense Department officials and copies of Mr. Carters emails obtained by The New York Times.

title: Walter J. Leonard, Pioneer of Affirmative Action in Harvard Admissions, Dies at 86
description: Walter J. Leonard, the chief architect of an admissions process at Harvard that has been emulated across the United States, opening colleges and universities to more women and minorities, died on Dec. 8 in Kensington, Md. He was 86.

title: Venezuela May Have Indirectly Aided U.S. Inquiry of Official
description: For five long years, American investigators have suspected that Nstor Reverol, the former head of Venezuelas antidrug unit, was working as a kind of double agent.

title: Alfred C. Snider, Who Promoted Healthy Debate as Just That, Dies at 65
description: Alfred C. Snider, a scholar, rhetorician and evangelist who sought to heal the world through debate  and who in the process turned bucolic Vermont into the argumentative center of the world  died Friday in Burlington, Vt. He was 65.

title: Direct Flights to Cuba and Other Rule Changes Explained
description: Nearly a year after the United States announced it would be loosening travel restrictions to Cuba, the two countries have reached an agreement on regularly scheduled commercial flights to the island, the Associated Press has reported. Coupled with the previous rule changes for travelers, commercial flights to the island from the United States would make it possible for practically anyone who wishes to visit Cuba to do so. Here is what you need to know before you go:

title: Officers May Face Discipline in Overlooked Killing of Brooklyn Woman
description: The New York Police Department said on Wednesday that officers might face discipline after they failed to realize that an 82-year-old Brooklyn woman had been killed.

title: U.N. Council to Adopt Sanctions Against ISIS
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United States and Russia have joined forces to draft a legally binding Security Council resolution to strengthen sanctions against those who do business with terrorist groups, chiefly the Islamic State.

title: Success Academy Schools, in Shortening Their Day, Shed a Distinction
description: Among the things that set the Success Academy charter schools apart from public schools is the length of the school day: eight hours 45 minutes for elementary students, nine hours 15 minutes for middle schoolers.

title: California Rebukes Rural Prison for Racism
description: Guards at a rural California prison use other prisoners possessions to reward inmates who assault each other, discriminate against black and Latino inmates, and routinely engage in unnecessary force, according to a California inspector general report released Wednesday.

title: First to Break the Tape
description: Administrivial Updated Re-Set My Streak Please Alert! If you solved the Thursday, December 17 puzzle by David Kwong and were marked incorrect as a result of the late error caught last night, please go to our main Puzzle Page on the web and finish the puzzle in order to have your streak re-set. Im told that you must be logged into your nytimes.com account and complete the puzzle in order for our team to be able to re-set streaks.

title: Judge Faults Firms Failure to Keep Notes in Christie Bridge Investigation
description: A federal judge on Wednesday harshly criticized the internal investigation that cleared Gov. Chris Christie of any wrongdoing in the George Washington Bridge lane-closing scandal, saying it was a calculated strategy of opacity and gamesmanship rather than the thorough and transparent inquiry that the governor promised.

title: Deportation of Former Salvadoran Official Is Upheld
description: An immigration appeals court has upheld an immigration judges deportation order against a former defense minister of El Salvador, Gen. Jos Guillermo Garca, based on his role assisting in the 1980 murders of four American churchwomen and other human rights crimes in that country, according to the Center for Justice and Accountability, which helped bring the case against the general. In his 2014 order, Judge Michael C. Horn found that torture and killings of government opponents were deliberate military policy during three years in the early 1980s when General Garca, a close ally of the United States, led the military. In April another defense minister from that period, Gen. Carlos Eugenio Vides Casanova, was deported to El Salvador on similar grounds.

title: Repaired King Tut Mask Back on Display in Egypt
description: The gold funeral mask of King Tutankhamen has been returned to its home in the Egyptian Museum after eight weeks of delicate surgery to undo damage caused by a botched procedure last year to reattach the boy kings blue-and-gold braided beard to his face, the countrys Ministry of Antiquities said in a statement.

title: Officials Say Boy, 2, Who Died in March Was a Homicide Victim
description: Nearly nine months after a 2-year-old boy was found unconscious in his familys East Harlem apartment, the police said on Wednesday that his death was now being investigated as a homicide, after a lengthy review by the medical examiner.

title: Millions of Babies at Risk, Unicef Says
description: Nearly 16.6 million babies were born in conflict zones this year, Unicef said Wednesday. Its report said newborns and mothers faced particularly acute risks in Afghanistan, the Central African Republic, Iraq, South Sudan and Syria. Every two seconds, a newborn takes its first breath in the midst of conflict, often in terrifying circumstances and without access to medical care, said Anthony Lake, Unicefs executive director.

title: Mexico: U.S. Penalizes Newspaper Executive
description: The United States Department of the Treasury said Wednesday that the vice president of a Mexico City newspaper, Unomsuno, had used the publication to support a drug trafficking gang. The executive, Naim Libien Tella, has had a long relationship with the leader of the gang, Abigael Gonzlez Valencia, who was arrested in February, according to the Treasurys Office of Foreign Assets Control. The Treasury designated Mr. Libien Tella and several businesses connected to him, including Unomsuno, as drug traffickers, barring American citizens from doing business with them.

title: Judge Lets Cooper Union Levy Tuition in Short Term
description: A state judge approved a settlement on Wednesday that ends a bitter legal battle over tuition at the Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art, allowing the college to charge students in the short run while developing a plan for returning to its traditional tuition-free model.

title: Knicks Build Big Lead Before a Tired Team Nearly Lulls Them Into a Loss
description: Hours removed from playing what Coach Sam Mitchell described as their worst game of the season, the Minnesota Timberwolves arrived in New York on Wednesday at 2:30 a.m. Mitchell thought that fatigue might be a factor in his teams game against the Knicks that night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Harassed in Guinea, Homeless in New York and Happy to Be Together
description: When a friend of Mariama Koulibaleys told her about a man who had just graduated from a university in their native Guinea though legally blind and deaf, she was intrigued.

title: New York Officials Defend Affordable Housing Plan to Divided Audience
description: Officials with Mayor Bill de Blasios administration, facing the biggest public forum yet on their affordable housing strategy, defended the plan before a packed hearing on Wednesday, saying it is a game changer.

title: Wi-Fi, A.T.M.s and Turbo-Flush Toilets Highlight Chinas New Public Restrooms
description: BEIJING  Li Wen had heard about the turbo-strength flush power and the lily-scented soap. He knew about the stalls equipped with personal television screens and wireless Internet access, the soothing cello soundtrack and the windows lined with aloe vera plants.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I was locked up in a cage and forgotten. You dont hear any other voices, you speak out loud just to hear yourself. You forget what its like to be human.

title: What to Watch Thursday
description: Hes back: D.C.I. John Luther pulls on his tweed coat once again, and all is right with the world. Sheldon and Amy  finally!  spend the night together. And President Obama battles the elements with Bear Grylls in Alaska.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | fecundity
description: fecundity  \fi-kn-d-te, fe-\  noun

title: How Does Air Pollution Affect Your Daily Life?
description: The New York Times would like to hear from residents living in countries seriously affected by air pollution.

title: Corrections: December 17, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Selects N.W.A and Cheap Trick for Class of 2016
description: Cheap Trick, N.W.A, Chicago, Steve Miller and Deep Purple will join the pantheon of the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame at its 31st induction ceremony at Barclays Center in Brooklyn on April 8.

title: Use by Iraqi Military May Be a Boon for China-Made Drones
description: HONG KONG  After more than a decade of fighting in Iraq, the names of the American-made drones striking targets there have become familiar: Predator, Reaper, Sentinel.

title: A New Budget for a New Year
description: The $1.1 trillion spending bill for the 2016 fiscal year, agreed to by congressional leaders on Tuesday night, is good for what it does not contain.

title: Fear, Loathing and Republican Debaters
description: Well, the big Republican presidential debate is over and the message is clear: Be afraid. Be very afraid.

title: An Appalling Silence on Gun Control
description: It was remarkable that the Republican presidential candidates debate this week, supposedly focused on keeping Americans safe, was devoid of questions and comments about the public health issue of gun violence.

title: The G.O.P. at a Crossroads
description: A long time ago, in the era we now know as B.T. (Before Trump), it was possible to envision a Republican primary campaign that would be a real contest of ideas, a clash of genuine policy visions  and therefore different from the empty Im-not-Obama, no Im-not-Obama contest of 2012. My favored scenario would have pitted Marco Rubio against Rand Paul: The former representing a reform-minded conservatism in domestic policy and a hawkish internationalism abroad; the latter representing a more libertarian domestic agenda and a noninterventionist posture overseas.

title: Toward a Stronger European Border
description: More so even than the euro crisis, the refugee crisis and the threat of terrorism have raised fundamental questions about how much sovereignty European states are prepared to cede for the sake of greater unity and security.

title: Brazils Toxic Sludge
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  JUST after 4 p.m. on Nov. 5, the principals husband ran into the school in the village of Bento Rodrigues, in southeastern Brazil, yelling that the nearby dam had burst and everybody needed to get out of the schoolhouse. Teachers and employees herded about 50 children into buses and cars. Some followed on foot. Minutes later, as the caravan made its way uphill, they saw a 32-foot-tall wave of mud sweeping over their school.

title: Looking for the Perfect Gift? Social Science Can Help
description: ARE you in a panic, not sure what to get that special someone this year? Fear not, because my fellow social scientists have the answer for you.

title: Republican Insecurity
description: I watched, with disenchantment and disquiet, Tuesday nights Republican presidential debate in Las Vegas, as candidate after candidate talked about how he or she would execute a war against the Islamic State, as if such a war was inevitable, if not already underway.

title: My Nutcracker Recovery
description: Its Nutcracker season. Not again, I think. I am a recovering ballerina. I never danced professionally, but I did dream of it. I spent a lot of my childhood and early adolescence changing in and out of tights and leotards in dusty dressing rooms at various New York studios. I carried an oversize LeSportsac bag packed with balled-up tights, stray bobby pins, pointe shoes and even a special flammable shellac for hardening their tips.

title: The Benefits of Black Physics Students
description: LAST week during oral arguments in Fisher v. University of Texas, a case about the constitutionality of race-conscious admissions policies, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. posed two questions: What unique perspective does a minority student bring to a physics class? Followed by: Im just wondering what the benefits of diversity are in that situation?

title: Full N.C.I.S. Investigative Report
description: The New York Times obtained the Naval Criminal Investigative Service report on the detainee abuse episode in Kalach through the Freedom of Information Act. The full document is 129 pages; the following 115 pages do not include photographic exhibits. The report was redacted by the United States Navy. In nearly all cases, the redactions are of the names of American service members.

title: Soldiers Report Abuse by Navy SEALs
description: Four soldiers stationed at an isolated outpost told investigators that they had witnessed members of a Navy SEAL team mistreating Afghan detainees.

title: Navy Witnesses Play Down Events
description: Six Navy service members gave their version of the events that led to the criminal inquiry.

title: The Interpreters View
description: An interpreter for the SEAL unit expanded on his initial account, as evidenced by an interview and written statement in the Naval Criminal Investigative Service report.

title: Local Afghan Witnesses Testimony
description: The Afghan Local Police brought four locals to give sworn statements to investigators.

title: Navy SEAL Captain Closes the Case
description: A letter from the East Coast SEAL command informed investigators that the charges had been dismissed.

title: How a Quiet Corner of Iowa Packs Such a Fierce Conservative Punch
description: ORANGE CITY, Iowa  A century of assimilation has blurred European ethnic heritage in much of the United States, but here in the far northwestern corner of Iowa, people still joke, Youre not mutch if youre not Dutch.

title: Navy SEALs, a Beating Death and Claims of a Cover-Up
description: The three Navy SEALs stomped on the bound Afghan detainees and dropped heavy stones on their chests, the witnesses recalled. They stood on the prisoners heads and poured bottles of water on some of their faces in what, to a pair of Army soldiers, appeared to be an improvised form of waterboarding.

title: A Guide to the N.C.I.S. Investigative Report
description: The findings of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service inquiry into the detainee-abuse case are included in a report, which was redacted by the United States Navy. In nearly all cases, the redactions are of the names of American service members. Links to excerpts from the report appear below.

title: Vladimir Putin Chides Turkey, Praises Trump and Talks Up Russias Economy
description: MOSCOW  With his customary swagger and salty language, President Vladimir V. Putin held forth on a sweeping array of topics in his traditional year-end news conference on Thursday, even throwing in a glowing assessment of Donald J. Trump.

title: News Qs | Fed Raises Key Interest Rate for First Time in Almost a Decade
description: Before Reading Fed Raises Key Interest Rate for First Time in Almost a Decade:

title: AstraZeneca to Acquire Majority Stake in Acerta Pharma
description: LONDON  The British drug maker AstraZeneca said on Thursday that it had agreed to acquire a majority stake in Acerta Pharma, a privately-held cancer drug developer with operations in the Netherlands and in California, for $4 billion.

title: A Missed Opportunity of Ultra-Cheap Money
description: Years of ultralow interest rates engineered by the Federal Reserve may have breathed life back into the economy and buoyed Wall Street. But they have not managed to solve problems like the aging Portal Bridge.

title: The New Attack on Hispanic Voting Rights
description: In September 2000, Oscar Del Toro of Monterrey, Mexico, arrived with his wife and three children at George Bush Intercontinental Airport in Houston to start a new life in the United States. Del Toro, then 38, had spent his whole life in Mexico. His mother and father were naturalized American citizens who lived near Houston and had wanted to bring him to the United States with them. But because he was already an adult, with a wife and a child, he was subject to a long waiting period for a green card. He went on with his life in Mexico, building a business selling laser printers and buying a comfortable four-bedroom house. He had more or less forgotten all about the prospect of moving to the United States when, around Christmas in 1999, his mother told him she had a present for him: an Immigration and Naturalization Service letter inviting him and his family to apply for permanent residency.

title: New York Prisons Take an Unsavory Punishment Off the Table
description: ALBANY  Of all the punishments meted out upon prisoners in solitary confinement, the most unsavory may well be a misshapen one-pound brick of cuisine.

title: Lanvin and Alber Elbaz: The Story of a Breakup
description: Even in a world inured to designer change, no one expected this.

title: Portuguese Migrants Struggle to Find Relief in Angola
description: The Portuguese began migrating to Angola by the tens of thousands, this time around, when Portugals economy bottomed out in 2010, while Angolas, fueled by oil exports, gushed tons of cash. Just two years later, the Angolan government announced it was building a detention center to hold the flood of migrants entering the country illegally. Joan Bardeletti, a French freelance photographer who focuses on documenting the changing dynamics of urban life across Africa, knew the time had come to visit the southwest coast and check out Angolas new settlers.

title: What Kind of Tourist Are You?
description: How do you behave when you travel?

title: When Runners Go the Distance, but Races Dont
description: When we hear about a road-race shortcut, many of us think of Rosie Ruiz, who notoriously cut into the final mile of the 1980 Boston Marathon to win the womens title. But sometimes a racecourse is inadvertently shortened by human error  a misplaced traffic cone, say, or a confused but well-intentioned volunteer.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Police on Trial, Cruz vs. Rubio, Star Wars
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Morning Agenda:  Janet Yellens New Risk Manager Role
description: JANET YELLENS NEW RISK MANAGER ROLE | The Federal Reserve raised short-term interest rates for the first time in almost a decade yesterday, a move that was both widely anticipated yet closely scrutinized, Binyamin Appelbaum reports in The New York Times.

title: Wines of Niagara
description: There is more to this diverse wine region than ice wine.

title: Exploring Canadas Fertile Niagara Wine Region
description: JORDAN, Ontario  Wine country on the Niagara Peninsula of Ontario, Canada, may sound a little incongruous. But the area about a half-hour west of Buffalo is home to a wine region of depth, diversity and distinction.

title: Poll Watch: Americans Fear More Terrorist Attacks but Have Mixed Views on Gun Control
description: Most Americans describe themselves as very concerned about the threat of attacks from terrorists, but considerably fewer worry about a mass shooting taking place in the area where they live, according to the most recentNew York Times/CBS News poll.

title: New York Today: Awakened
description: Updated 6:45 a.m.

title: Court Acquits Journalist Accused of Defaming South Korean President
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A Seoul court found a Japanese reporter not guilty on Thursday of defaming President Park Geun-hye of South Korea, whose government has been accused of using legal channels to try to silence news reports unfavorable to her administration.

title: Spending Bill to Block Limits on Outside Political Groups
description: Senator Mitch McConnell, the majority leader, has failed in his high-profile push to include a change in congressional campaign spending rules in the new budget bill that lawmakers are set to consider on Friday. But to the dismay of campaign watchdogs, the 2,000-page omnibus spending measure would block other significant efforts to force more disclosure of contributors and to limit increasing political activity by nonprofit organizations.

title: Ask Well: Blood Pressure Over Age 70
description: Question:

title: Ted Cruz Begins a Post-Surge, Super Tuesday Tour
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, buoyed by a steady debate performance and a slew of encouraging polls recently in Iowa and beyond, is beginning a seven-day, 12-city, general-election-style tour on Thursday of the so-called Super Tuesday states.

title: Test Your Star Wars Knowledge
description: Before you see Star Wars: The Force Awakens, try your hand at this quiz about the cultural and marketing juggernaut the franchise has become.

title: Early Detection of Ovarian Cancer May Become Possible
description: A new version of a screening test for ovarian cancer may reduce deaths from the disease, but it needs more study to determine whether the benefits hold up, researchers reported on Thursday.

title: Jackson Galaxy Thinks Cats Saved His Life
description: Do you think that the popularity of cats online has had an effect on cats? Do they realize weve come back to worshiping them? I was on the scene back when cats were pariahs, and now that theyre like the Egyptian goddess once again, man, I am not looking that gift horse in the mouth. Its an amazing time; its a renaissance for cats. Lil Bub could run for president right now, and she might have a better chance than Donald Trump. Im all for it.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Joke Dollar
description: Around 10 years ago, on an evening about town, a friend of mine made a remarkable offhand joke about a sexual encounter with a mermaid. It was too crude to reproduce here, and anyway, Ive learned not to try. Its never as funny as it was that night. During the collapse that followed, I summoned just enough motor control to hand her a dollar. Clearly, I figured, she had done work: She surveyed the market, applied her expertise and delivered  on deadline no less. A buck seemed like the least I could do.

title: Review: Amy Poehler and Tina Fey Come Home in Sisters
description: Sisters is a movie to go out and see when youve run out of television to watch. Which could happen, at least theoretically. Directed by Jason Moore (Pitch Perfect) from a script by the longtime Saturday Night Live writer Paula Pell, this raunchy-huggy comedy features, in keeping with Hollywood custom, a gaggle of well-known and well-liked sitcom and sketch-comedy performers being a little less funny than you want them to be. They are allowed to swear more robustly than on network or basic-cable shows, to deliver sentimental speeches along with punch lines and to play with or against type as the mood suits.

title: Aviation Museums Where the Imagination Can Soar
description: Exploring places where globe-trotters, backpackers in Birkenstocks and the all-around curious can rediscover the original, wide-eyed wonder of flight.

title: 19 Coal Miners Trapped in Northeast China Are Presumed Dead
description: BEIJING  Nineteen coal miners trapped for more than 24 hours after a gas explosion and raging fire in a mine in Hegang, in northeastern China, are presumed dead, the state-run broadcaster CCTV reported on Thursday.

title: Debate Brings the Fear of Terrorism and Immigration to Center Stage
description: In the waning days of the 2014 midterm elections, the issues of national security and immigration collided  the rise of the Islamic State and the re-emergence of Ebola created a deep sense of fear in the weeks before voters returned control of the Senate to Republicans. Thirteen months later, after the San Bernardino attacks, those issues are again intertwined.

title: Peggy Noonan: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of The Time of Our Lives isnt impressed with recent books by presidential contenders: They were mostly unreal and insincere.

title: Adele Moves to Stop Scalpers From Reselling Concert Tickets
description: Adele has broken sales records with her new album, 25, but little noticed outside the concert business has been her war against ticket-scalping.

title: 1940: U.K. Dooms Woman Spy to Die
description: LONDON  The forty-two-year-old wife of one of Londons fire-fighting heroes stood up stolidly in court at Winchester, Hampshire, today [Dec. 17] and heard the judge sentence her to death as a spy. Mrs. Dorothy Pamela OGrady, of Sandown, Isle of Wright, is the first woman spy to be condemned to death in Great Britain in this war. Mrs. OGrady posed as a quiet and neighborly proprietress of a small boarding house in Sandown. Under this guise, it was charged, she had secretly made plans to help the enemy, had cut a military telephone wire and collected important defense documents.New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 18, 1940

title: China Protests Sale of U.S. Arms to Taiwan
description: HONG KONG  The Obama administrations announcement that it would sell $1.83 billion worth of arms to Taiwan, including two warships and antitank missiles, has drawn a swift rebuke from China, which threatened to penalize the companies that made the armaments and summoned a United States diplomat to register an official protest.

title: When News Gets (Too?) Personal
description: Arecentarticle in The Times about the flawed way that experts predicted health care costs had an extra element when read online: personalized location.

title: Below the Line: Shooting Beasts of No Nation
description: If directing a movie in the Ghana jungle with the somber subject matter of child soldiers wasnt already difficult work, try also acting as the cinematographer for that film as well. Thats what the filmmaker Cary Fukunaga decided to do for his harrowing West African war drama Beasts of No Nation, in theaters and streaming on Netflix. Why take on both roles? Since Mr. Fukunaga started out in film school at New York University shooting other directors projects, he had the experience with the camera.

title: The Stages Best Moments This Year
description: As a certain popular musical about a certain early Treasury Secretary maintains, we all want to be in the room where it happens. Thats never more so than at the theater, where on stages lavish or bare, every performance is one of a kind. Here, writers and editors for The New York Times recall stage moments worth singing about.

title: Standard Chartered Hires HSBC Veteran to Run Corporate Bank
description: LONDON  Standard Chartered, an Asia-focused bank based in London, announced on Thursday that it had hired Simon Cooper, a veteran banker at HSBC, to lead its corporate and institutional banking division.

title: No Messi or Neymar, but Barcelona Predictably Wins at Club World Cup
description: The Club World Cup sounds like a big, important event, and in a way it is. Virtually every club in the world is technically eligible for the competition, from the mighty teams of Europe to the smallest of the Pacific islands.

title: Drug C.E.O. Martin Shkreli Arrested on Fraud Charges
description: It has been a busy week for Martin Shkreli, the flamboyant businessman at the center of the drug industrys price-gouging scandals.

title: Naked in the East Village
description: Dear Diary:

title: How to Navigate Americas Busiest Airports
description: Pack a portable charger, and your patience. The December holidays are among the busiest for travel across the country, making for lengthy airport security lines, fast food temptations and mass scrambles for open electrical sockets. While many airports have upgraded their concourses with shopping malls, commissioned artwork and even micro-hotels, some of the busiest remain miserable, according to a new study by J.D. Power, which listed Newark, New Yorks La Guardia and Los Angeles International as the bottom three in flier satisfaction.

title: Swiss Regulator Bars 6 Former UBS Workers in Currency Inquiry
description: LONDON  A Swiss regulator said on Thursday that it had barred six former managers and traders at UBS from the financial industry in an investigation into manipulation of the foreign currency markets.

title: Israel Grants Approval for Development of Giant Offshore Gas Field
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Thursday announced final government approval for a long-delayed deal that will let an American-Israeli energy partnership develop an offshore natural gas field.

title: U.N. Rights Council Presses for Inquiry in Burundi
description: GENEVA  Responding to chilling accounts of mass killings in Burundi, the United Nations top human rights body on Thursday called for an international investigation of abuses as part of an effort to curb the violence and prevent a wider regional conflict.

title: Baltimore Wrestles With the Way Forward After a Mistrial
description: BALTIMORE  Armored National Guard trucks were still rolling through the streets last spring when a tough-talking young African-American prosecutor named Marilyn Mosby marched onto the steps of Baltimores grand columned War Memorial, faced a bank of television cameras and vowed to deliver justice on behalf of Freddie Gray.

title: Daily Report: Googles Lousy Time at the D.M.V.
description: Some days, even Google gets frustrated by the D.M.V.

title: Getting Gmail Verification Codes Without a Smartphone, or a Phone at All
description: Q. Is there any way to use Gmails two-step security system if you do not have a working cell signal  or even a mobile phone capable of getting text messages with the codes needed to log in?

title: Avon in Deal to Split Off North American Business
description: Ever since Avon Products rebuffed a $10.7 billion unsolicited offer by Coty more than three years ago, the beauty company has been the subject of takeover speculation.

title: Fretful Backers Push Marco Rubio to Pick a Must-Win Early Primary State
description: WEST DES MOINES, Iowa  A nagging problem hovers over Senator Marco Rubio of Florida as he crisscrosses the country seeking support in the states with the first four nominating contests: With a month and a half until the voting begins, he still has not committed himself fully to trying to win any of them.

title: Neighbor of San Bernardino Attackers Faces Terrorism Charges
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif.  Enrique Marquez, who supplied the assault rifles used to kill 14 people in a massacre in San Bernardino, Calif., this month, was arrested Thursday and charged with crimes including conspiring to support terrorists. Court papers show that he and one of the attackers had steeped themselves for years in radical and violent Islamist propaganda, including the teachings of the extremist cleric Anwar al-Awlaki and bomb-making techniques from an Al Qaeda magazine.

title: 1965: Johnsons French Chef Quits
description: NEW YORK  The French chief hired to add some spice to White House state dinners by President and Mrs. John F. Kennedy in 1961 has submitted his resignation. The chef, Ren Verdon, said today [Dec. 17] he did not like what had happened to the White House cuisine since the Johnsons moved in and that he would be leaving at the end of the year. Mr. Verdon said he did not mind what the first family wanted to eat for their own meals but added: I dont want to lose my reputation. He said it was very lousy to have frozen foods in the presidents house. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 18, 1965

title: Greta Lee On Hollywood Stereotypes and Playing the Lovable Weirdo
description: Greta Lee is a familiar face to fans of Girls, where she played an entitled gallerist; High Maintenance, where she was Heidi; and Inside Amy Schumer, a gig Ms. Lee landed after she and Ms. Schumer met in an elevator after their failed auditions for a Noah Baumbach film. Next up is Ms. Lees scene-stealing turn in Tina Fey and Amy Poehlers raucous new comedy, Sisters, where she plays Hae Won, a nail salon technician and devout partyer.

title: Echoes of the Past as David Cameron Enters Talks on Britains Future in European Union
description: LONDON  The British prime minister holds high-stakes talks before a crucial referendum on whether to abandon European integration. Though distracted by other problems, the German chancellor tries to help him out. Back home, British critics snipe, hoping the negotiations will collapse.

title: Liquor Taxes and Sexually Transmitted Infections
description: Maryland increased its liquor taxes in 2011 and a sharp decrease in the rate of new gonorrhea infections immediately followed. Researchers have determined that the two events are closely linked.

title: Class Differences in Child-Rearing Are on the Rise
description: The lives of children from rich and poor American families look more different than they have in decades.

title: Libyas Rival Factions Sign Deal for Unity Government
description: CAIRO  Representatives of Libyas dueling parliaments signed a United Nations-brokered agreement on Thursday to form a national unity government that supporters said was an important and long overdue step toward ending years of chaos and civil war.

title: Why Giving Back Isnt Enough
description: DURING this season of giving, I will join millions of Americans in volunteering to feed the homeless, contributing to clothing drives and donating to poverty-fighting charities. Yet I worry that through these acts of kindness, I absolve myself of asking deeper questions about injustice and inequality. We Americans are a remarkably bighearted people, but I believe the purpose of our philanthropy must not only be generosity, but justice.

title: Jos Mourinho Is Fired by Chelsea
description: Jos Mourinho is probably the most visible coach in the world of soccer, striking on the sideline in a finely tailored suit and scarf. Admired and disparaged in equal measure, he has brought triumph and controversy to a succession of the biggest teams in Europe.

title: Reporting in a War Zone: Inside the Navy SEALs Story
description: Rail thin and hunched over, Assadullah shuffled into the living room of The New York Timess bureau in Kabul, Afghanistan, on a warm August morning with a story that colleagues and I had been waiting months to hear. His timing could not have been worse.

title: Link to Paris Attack Roils Debate Over Migrants in Hungary
description: BUDAPEST  Three months after throngs of migrants turned the Keleti station in Budapest into a squalid symbol of Europes disarray, the grand 19th-century rail terminus has taken on a no less divisive role in a mounting debate over links between terrorism and the chaotic influx of people fleeing war and poverty in the Muslim world.

title: American Horror Story Season 5, Episode 10: Bless the Child
description: What a child needs from a parent is simple enough: love, safety, comfort. But what does a parent need from a child? Equal measures of love? Forgiveness?

title: Growing Up in a Time of Fear: Confronting Stereotypes About Muslims and Countering Xenophobia
description: Muslims in America are an incredibly diverse group, reflecting the variety inherent in a worldwide religion of over 1.6 billion followers.

title: Vladimir Putin Praises Donald Trump, Sealing a Long-Distance Bromance
description: One is the leader of a declining superpower that is trying to reassert itself militarily. The other wants to make America great again. And the two have a budding bromance that transcends the tense relationship between the two nations.

title: Brazil Restores WhatsApp Service After Brief Blockade Over Wiretap Request
description: WhatsApp, a popular instant messaging service owned by Facebook, was briefly shut down in Brazil on Thursday after the American firm refused to place wiretaps on certain WhatsApp accounts.

title: This Time, Make It Brooklyn
description: Mick Magsino and Cara Barrese met while working at Corbis, the photo agency. Shortly after they married nearly a decade ago, they left their Jersey City rental and moved for work to Santa Monica, Calif.

title: Fantasy Football Week 15: Buccaneers at Rams
description: Fantasy football analysis for Thursday nights game between the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and the St. Louis Rams. Check back Friday for analysis on Sundays games and Mondays matchup between the Detroit Lions and the New Orleans Saints. You can also follow the Sablich brothers on Twitter at @5thDownFantasy.

title: Having Owned Up to Buying Newspaper, Adelsons Go Silent
description: Sheldon Adelson, the billionaire casino magnate and Republican donor, and his family have formally owned The Las Vegas Review-Journal for a week.

title: Marine Le Pen Deletes Tweet With Photo of Slain Journalist
