description: LONDON  Marine Le Pen, the leader of the far-right National Front party in France, deleted a tweet on Thursday that contained a photo of the decapitated body of James Foley, the American journalist who was killed by the Islamic State last year, after criticism from his family.

title: Ashton Carter Emails Sought by Senate Armed Services Committee
description: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter was widely criticized on Thursday for using a personal email account earlier this year to conduct government business as top Republicans on Capitol Hill said they would review his messages to determine whether they had compromised sensitive national security information.

title: Down From the Trees, Humans Finally Got a Decent Nights Sleep
description: Over the past few million years, the ancestors of modern humans became dramatically different from other primates. Our forebears began walking upright, and they lost much of their body hair; they gained precision-grip fingers and developed gigantic brains.

title: Indictment Charges Shkreli With Security Fraud
description: The investigation is related to Martin Shkreli's time as a hedge fund manager and running the biopharmaceutical company Retrophin.

title: British Teeth Arent So Bad, Study Says
description: It would seem that the British public, long the butt of dentistry jokes told by Americans, has now been issued bragging rights by the scientific community.

title: How to Fix Latin Americas Strongman Problem
description: In early December, Ecuadors lawmakers voted to throw out presidential term limits, a divisive move that quickly spurred street demonstrations in the capital, Quito. To appease protesters, President Rafael Correa backed a law making him sit out the next election. He may still find a way to renege on the deal or return early, but regardless, the new law lets him run for office indefinitely after 2021.

title: Introducing Gizmo
description: At The New York Times, our development teams have been adopting the Go programming language over the last three years to build better back-end services. In the past Ive written about using Go for Elastic MapReduce streaming. Ive also talked about using Go at GothamGo for news analysis and to improve our email and alert systems at the Golang NYC Meetup. We use Go for a wide variety of tasks, but the most common use throughout the company is for building JSON APIs.

title: Video Review: The New Audi TT Still a Fun Dash Down the Road
description: WHEN Audi unleashed the production model TT in 2000, it was a Bauhaus sight to behold. Gloriously exposed hex screw heads and aluminum accents were crafted into an instrument that celebrated the raw beauty of machinery. Its design attitude was in stark contrast to Audis modern minimalist approach.

title: Oklahoma Highway Shootings Leave 2 Dead
description: Two people in separate cars were fatally shot by a man who drove along an Interstate highway in Oklahoma while randomly firing at vehicles, an official said on Thursday. The suspected gunman was arrested after a short pursuit.

title: The Jeb Scenario
description: My Campaign Stops column today, looking at the genuinely ideologically-significant choice that G.O.P. voters are likely to face next year,assumes that were headed for a three-man race: Rubio, Cruz and Trump. That assumption is reasonable, but its hardly airtight, which is why earlier this week I considered one alternative scenario, in which Chris Christie shouldered his wayinto the mix as a right-of-center alternative to Rubio (and Trump). But what about Jeb Bush? He still has money and endorsements, after all; he has more support nationally than Christie (well, by a point or so); in New Hampshire hes slipped behind himbut not by much. The race is still fluid, the voting is still more than a month away: If were considering a Christie scenario, it still make senseto ask if theres a Jeb scenario as well.

title: Under Fire From G.O.P., Obama Defends Response to Terror Attacks
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, seeking to counter pressure for a military escalation in response to terrorist attacks, told a group of news columnists this week that sending significant ground forces back to the Middle East could conceivably result in the deaths of 100 American soldiers every month.

title: Britain Offers Licenses for Shale-Rock Exploration
description: LONDON  The British government, in an effort to stoke interest from energy companies in extracting fuels from shale rock, said on Thursday that it was offering licenses for oil and gas exploration on 159 tracts of land.

title: Apple Makes Shifts in Senior Management
description: Apples chief executive, Timothy D. Cook, is continuing to make over the companys executive ranks.

title: Jaromir Jagr Leading Panthers Veterans and Youngsters at 43
description: NEWARK  South Florida is associated with snowbirds  retirees who migrate from the North to spend their later years in the comfort of warm weather  and professional hockey there is full of the N.H.L.s version: The Panthers are one of the leagues oldest teams, averaging 28.5 years.

title: President Obama, Joining Bear Grylls, Tests Survival Skills in Alaska
description: WASHINGTON  He helped make tea from catkins, ate a salmon prechewed by a bear, and discussed why people would drink their own urine.

title: Public Theater Casts Two Transgender Actors in Southern Comfort
description: An invitation by the Public Theater for auditions by transgender actors prompted 130 submissions, and has led to the casting of two transgender performers in a bluegrass musical being staged at the Off Broadway theater this winter.

title: Bernie Sanders Gets Backing From Leading Union and a Liberal Group
description: Senator Bernie Sanders received the endorsement of the Communications Workers of America on Thursday, giving the Democratic presidential hopeful his biggest union nod as he heads into the homestretch before votes are cast in the nominating contests.

title: Drone Maker Lily Announces a Product Delay and New Funding
description: People who order innovative new drones from start-ups without track records have good reason to be nervous.

title: Call Him Trumpevich: Vladimir Putins Presidential Pick
description: There is some big news in the 2016 campaign.

title: Tina Fey and Amy Poehler: Not Exactly Party Animals
description: In Sisters, Tina Fey and Amy Poehler play adult siblings who decide to throw one last wild teenage-style bash in their childhood home. (Cue the dance-offs and cannonballs into the pool.) In real life, Ms. Fey and Ms. Poehler have been to decades of parties together, from wrap nights at Saturday Night Live to awards-show celebrations. Now that their film opens the same weekend as Star Wars: The Force Awakens, they may be reaching for higher marketing powers  to combat the competition. In the meantime, they spoke to Melena Ryzik about their favorite blowouts and what it was like to be uncool kids. Here are edited excerpts from the conversation.

title: Benjamin Genocchio of Artnet to Head Armory Show
description: Ever since Noah Horowitz announced in July that he was stepping down  as head of the Armory Show, the art world has wondered who would replace him at a time when that mammoth fair for Modern and contemporary art faces increasing competition from Frieze New York.

title: Secret Tape, TV Hearings and a Resignation: A Watergate Moment for Indonesia
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  For more than two weeks, Indonesians have been glued to their television sets as one of the biggest political scandals in the countrys history has unfolded before their eyes.

title: The Joy of Reading in the City
description: From the subways to the steps of the public library, readers can be seen enjoying a book, sometimes for the 15th time.

title: The Invisible Democratic Debates
description: The Republican presidential candidates have demonstrated such an appetite for debates that if I set up nine lecterns in my living room on a weeknight around 8 p.m. and chanted carpet bomb and anchor baby, theyd probably materialize en masse, even before I had time to vacuum and put out the artichoke dip.

title: Reading Is About the Lines That Leap Off the Pages
description: I dont mind writing year-end Top 10 lists. As William Styrons Sophie discovered, forced choices can lead to soul-searching.

title: Love on the Hospital Walls
description: The patient I was caring for, a woman in her 40s with leukemia, had been admitted to the hospital for the second of four monthly courses of chemotherapy. She was sitting quietly in a chair by the window of her hospital room, dressed in her street clothes and flipping through some photos on her iPad. The cancer drugs dripped from a clear bag hanging on a nearby IV pole through clear plastic tubing into the catheter in her arm.

title: Lowly Team Turns to a Different 76er (Hes Going on 77)
description: Upon his unanticipated return to the N.B.A., Jerry Colangelo especially enjoyed one Philadelphia news media report noting how the 76ers had not-so-coincidently hired a 76-year-old to restore their credibility.

title: Carolyn Ryan: Unpacking the 2016 Presidential Election
description: Welcome to Times Insider Events  live programming for Times Insiders and their guests.

title: Disney and Other Theme Parks Add Metal Detectors for Holidays
description: As they prepare to host tens of millions of holiday visitors, three of Americas biggest theme park operators  Disney, Universal and SeaWorld  on Thursday reacted to heightened security concerns by installing metal detectors outside their gates.

title: BRICs Spring Season Includes Concert Series and Brooklyn-Centric TV Shows
description: A concert series, a major contemporary art exhibition and new episodes of Brooklyn-centric television shows are the highlights of the spring season at BRIC House, a multimedia arts space in Brooklyn.

title: Under Wire, House Passes Big Package of Tax Cuts
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker Paul D. Ryan expressed annoyance on Thursday at the $1.1 trillion year-end spending bill now on the House floor. You know I dont like this process, right? he told reporters. I mean you know we inherited a process, a cake that was pretty much more than half-baked.

title: A Jimmy Buffett Musical to Set Sail With Broadway in Mind
description: Is Broadway ready for Margaritaville?

title: For the Holidays, Your Folks or Mine?
description: Since my husband and I began dating, deciding whose family to visit for holidays has caused strife. (They live too far to visit both.) This year, our first as a married couple, we settled on Thanksgiving with his and Christmas with mine. We will alternate next year. But now my husband says he cant miss his fathers familys Christmas party  to be held the day after Christmas this year. He proposes spending Christmas Eve and Christmas night together, then visiting his family for the weekend, leaving me with mine. But that wasnt our agreement, and I want us together. Ideas?

title: What the Feds Rate Increase Means
description: To the Editor:

title: HBOs Mike Nichols Documentary to Show at Sundance
description: The HBO documentary Becoming Mike Nichols has been given late clearance into next months Sundance Film Festival, a berth that allows the film to premiere before a rival PBS project arrives on Jan. 29.

title: Ted Cruz, Shunned in the Senate, Plays Unpopularity to His Advantage
description: WASHINGTON  It is the hate that dare not speak its name.

title: Review: Catherine Russell Sings Still-Resonant Standards at Birdland
description: At a moment when the world can seem dangerously out of balance, it is still possible for a musician to convey a groundedness and a joy that dont seem smiley-faced and goody-goody. A fine place to find it is Birdland, where the jazz singer Catherine Russell began a short run  with her sextet on Tuesday evening, projecting a strength, good humor and intelligence that engulfed the room in a mood of bonhomie. She reminded you that even in the most chaotic times, there are oases of calm.

title: Gus Powells Word Play
description: The photographer pairs evocative images with one-liners in an homage to the cartoonist William Steig.

title: An Inventively Designed Photo Book (That You Can Read)
description: The images in the Gus Powell book released this fall, The Lonely Ones, can stand alone: Powell captures orphaned landscapes and quotidian moments that hit on both the poignancy and the absurdity of everyday life. But its the subtle, funny one-liners Powell adds to his photos that elevate the collection of images to something thats part poetry, part comic strip. Taking its name and inspiration from the 1942 classic by the cartoonist William Steig, The Lonely Ones pays homage to the king of cartoons with a book (and upcoming show) that delights in the interplay between language and image. I tried to make a book that did traffic in feelings, Powell says of the body of work, which spans a decade.

title: Review: Antigona Is Noche Flamencas Teeming Take on the Greek Tragedy
First Draft Focus: Throwback Thursday  A Punchers Chance
New York Citys Flu Shot Mandate for Young Children Is Struck Down
description: A judge ruled on Thursday that the New York City health department could not require young children to be vaccinated for the flu to attend city-licensed preschools and day care centers, striking down one of the more ambitious public health initiatives of the Bloomberg administration.

title: Report Criticizes U.N.s Handling of Child Sex Abuse Allegations
description: UNITED NATIONS  An independent panel has concluded in a scathing report issued Thursday that United Nations officials passed allegations of child sexual abuse by peacekeepers from desk to desk, inbox to inbox and failed to meet the organizations core mission to protect the rights of the most vulnerable civilians.

title: The Logic in AstraZenecas Buying Spree
description: AstraZeneca is increasing risk with its merger splurge. The phamaceutical company is spending $4 billion on a stake in the cancer specialist Acerta, taking its total to more than $7 billion this quarter. But while AstraZenecas deals arent cheap, they do seem to clear the value hurdle.

title: Myths and Reality About Gun Violence

description: To the Editor:

title: Security Concerns Force Ben Carson to Cancel Israel-Africa Trip
description: Ben Carson on Thursday canceled a trip to Israel and Africa, which was planned with the intention of improving his credibility on foreign policy, because of what one adviser said were active credible threats from the terrorist group Boko Haram.

title: What Happened When a Teenager Joined Martin Shkreli on a Live Stream
description: About a month ago, Martin Shkreli, the pharmaceutical entrepreneur who was arrested on Thursday, began live-streaming himself on YouTube, sometimes for 10 hours or more at a time, as he worked, played video games, strummed a guitar and, occasionally, while he slept.

title: Is Black Lives Matter Making Police Cautious, Driving Up Crime?
description: Since the shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., last year, police conduct has been under increasing scrutiny at the same time that a bipartisan call for lower rates of incarceration and arrest has gained strength.

title: Melanie Whelan of SoulCycle: Find the Questions in Every Answer
description: This interview with Melanie Whelan, C.E.O. of SoulCycle, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: SoulCycles Dynamic Duo
description: Julie Rice and Elizabeth Cutler are business partners whose enduring friendship fuels the success of the fitness phenomenon SoulCycle.

title: No Diva Drama as Jets Receivers Share the Workload
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Jets wide receiver Brandon Marshall reached into his locker on Tuesday and displayed his Christmas gift for quarterback Ryan Fitzpatrick. It was Just Give Me the Damn Ball!  an autobiography by Keyshawn Johnson, a former Jets receiver.

title: Iran Registers Clerics Seeking to Choose Next Supreme Leader
description: TEHRAN  Iran started a 10-day registration period on Thursday for clerical candidates who hope to be elected to a council that can choose the countrys next supreme leader.

title: My 10 Favorite Books: John Cameron Mitchell
description: For his bookshop and website One Grand, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books theyd take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next in the series is the writer, actor and director John Cameron Mitchell. He shares his list exclusively with T.

title: Room for Debate Podcast: Police, Crime and the Ferguson Effect
description: Heather Mac Donald of the Manhattan Institute and Paul Butler of Georgetown University law school debate whether criticism of police tactics has led to less aggressive policing and higher crime rates.

title: Sheldon Adelson Bought the Wrong Newspaper
description: The mystery of who bought The Las Vegas Review-Journal has been solved.

title: Reining In College Costs
description: To the Editor:

title: House Panel Faults Failure to Review Visa Applicants Social Media Use
description: WASHINGTON  A bipartisan group of lawmakers aggressively questioned Obama administration officials on Thursday about the governments efforts to properly vet visitors and asylum seekers coming to the United States, raising concerns that terrorists could exploit the system to enter and carry out attacks against Americans.

title: The Trend I Skipped This Year
description: Abbi Jacobson, John Slattery, Marcus Samuelsson and others on what big thing they chose to pass over in 2015.

title: Star Wars Takes In $14.1 Million Abroad
description: Star Wars: The Force Awakens took in $14.1 million in 12 foreign markets where it rolled out on Wednesday, an opening day that was very strong but did not set many major records, perhaps because of the midweek arrival.

title: A Solution to Obesity
description: To the Editor:

title: A Campaigning Marco Rubio Misses a Chance to Object to a Spending Bill
description: Senator Marco Rubio says he wants to slow down and amend the $1.1 trillion spending bill that is making its way through Congress.

title: A Culture Gap the Size of an Ocean, Bridged by Facebook
description: A few months ago, my 75-year-old technophobic father, who still works full time as a big-city mail carrier, asked me to sign him up on Facebook, leaving me nearly speechless with surprise. When he added that he was doing it to keep in touch with a 26-year-old Saudi Arabian woman he had met on his mail route, I was even more stunned.

title: Leaders at E.U. Summit Vow to Regain Control of Borders
description: BRUSSELS  European leaders vowed on Thursday to regain control of the Continents external frontiers at their final summit meeting of 2015, a tumultuous year bracketed by lethal terrorist attacks in Paris and convulsed by destabilizing blows to Europes common currency and to its faith in a common destiny without borders.

title: A Report Peppered with Questions and Sticky Notes
description: Lorenzo Davis, a former police commander, wrote this 2014 report recommending that the officer who shot Cedric Chapman, Kevin Fry, be fired. This copy of the report shows, with handwritten notes and sticky notes, where supervisors questioned or disagreed with Mr. Davis's findings.

title: Use of Force Was Justified
description: In this final report, the Independent Police Review Authority in Chicago found that Officer Kevin Fry followed departmental guidelines about the use of force when he fatally shot Cedric Chatman.

title: Breaking the Code of Silence
description: In Chicago, police have shot and killed more people in recent years than in any of the 10 largest cities in America. Yet officers are rarely disciplined. A retired officer who investigated excessive force complaints explains why.

title: Chicago Pays Millions but Punishes Few in Killings by Police
description: CHICAGO  The gunshots blasted on and on, 45 in all, until Calvin Cross lay dead in a vacant lot. Mr. Cross, 19, had run away after three Chicago police officers pulled alongside him on a South Side street near his house. Bullets hit his chest, arm, back, face and the little finger on his right hand.

title: VW Names Kenneth Feinberg to Oversee Fund for Claims on Emissions Deception
description: Volkswagen has hired Kenneth R. Feinberg, a prominent specialist in compensation funds, to devise and administer a program to address claims related to vehicles that have been affected by the companys admitted use of deceptive software to cheat on emissions tests.

title: Wrestlings Daily Struggle in Guatemala
description: Although the golden age of professional wrestling has faded in Guatemala, on weekends some hard-core devotees don masks and meet at a garage turned arena.

title: I.M.F. Chief Faces Trial in Case Dating to Time as French Finance Minister
description: PARIS  A special French court on Thursday ordered Christine Lagarde, the managing director of the International Monetary Fund, to stand trial on charges of negligence that date back to when she served as Frances finance minister, the second time in five years that a top French I.M.F. official has faced legal scrutiny.

title: Smithsonian Announces Gift of David Smith Sculpture
description: Describing it as the most important sculpture gift it has received in decades, the Smithsonian American Art Museum said it has been given an important work by the American sculptor David Smith, an artist who conjured welded iron and steel shapes from tools, metal plates and other industrial objects.

title: Two 9/11 Artifacts, a PATH Car and an Antenna Mast, Get New Homes
description: Hangar 17 at Kennedy International Airport, which for years was as close as New York City had to a Sept. 11 memorial museum, now stands almost empty of the monumental artifacts of the attack on the World Trade Center 14 years ago.

title: For Chicago Police, Many Complaints but Few Consequences
description: Most complaints by residents against the police do not result in discipline against officers.

title: LifeLock Agrees to Pay $100 Million Fine in Settlement With F.T.C.
description: LifeLock, an identity protection service, agreed to a $100 million settlement with the Federal Trade Commission for failing to deliver on promises it would guard personal data and inform users when their information was breached.

title: Conflicts Complicate Duties of Viacoms Philippe Dauman
description: Philippe Dauman, now 61, has been the president and chief executive of Viacom since September 2006. He has received $336 million in total compensation, as of the end of the companys 2014 fiscal year. Some of that was paid to him in the form of Viacom stock, and his stock holdings are now worth nearly $200 million.

title: 16-Year-Old Sprints Right Into Professional Track
description: ATLANTA  When Candace Hill became the fastest teenage girl the United States has ever clocked, sprinting 100 meters in 10.98 seconds in June, she was suddenly good enough not only to qualify for next summers Rio Olympics, but also to potentially win a medal there. Now, at age 16, she has become the youngest track athlete in the United States to turn professional.

description: Photos from the United States, Greece, France and Russia.

description: Political editor Carolyn Ryan and national political correspondent John Martin chat about the Republican field after the partys final debate.

title: An Old Word of Rapture for Broadways New Theater
description: The old Hudson Theater is a bit hard to spot these days, sandwiched between two hotel towers on West 44th Street, still handsome but a bit of a quiet presence on a noisy block.

title: 1920 | Why So Hard on Harding?
description: When The Gun Epidemic was printed Dec. 5, The Times noted that 95 years had passed since the last Page 1 editorial, which scorned the nomination of Senator Warren G. Harding of Ohio as the Republican presidential candidate.

title: Former Chief of BTG Pactual, Andr Esteves, Is Freed From Jail
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  Brazils Supreme Court released Andr Esteves, former chief executive of the Brazilian investment bank BTG Pactual, from jail on Thursday, but the fallen banking star is far from a free man.

title: Israel and Turkey Agree to Restore Diplomatic Ties
description: JERUSALEM  Israel and Turkey have reached a preliminary agreement to begin restoring full diplomatic relations after years of deep freeze, Israeli officials said on Thursday.

title: Navigation Systems Still Show the Way, but Also Make the Route Safer
description: WHEN Gary Kaye, an editor and former television producer in Connecticut, bought his 2005 Volvo XC90, it had an in-dash navigation system. But he says the company wanted an astonishing amount of money to update the maps every year.

title: Review: Sancho: An Act of Remembrance, Recalls a British Pioneer
description: Sancho: An Act of Remembrance, which was originally presented at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, has reopened at the National Black Theater, 2031-33 5th Ave, Manhattan; 866-811-4111. Here is the original review, which appeared on Dec. 18, 2015.

title: Mayor de Blasio, Facing Homelessness Crisis, Issues Plan to Fight It
description: Vowing that he would never return New York City to the bad old days, Mayor Bill de Blasio on Thursday unveiled a newly muscular plan to monitor and combat street homelessness, seeking to retake control of a problem that has emerged as a full-bore political crisis for his administration.

title: U.S. Airlines Preparing to Offer Flights to Cuba
description: The United States and Cuba agreed today to restore commercial flights between the two countries for the first time in more than a half century, and several United States airlines announced plans to request approval to begin flying.

description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

description: As a professional basketball player, Cleveland Cavaliers guard Iman Shumpert has experience performing under pressure. But few high-pressure situations on the basketball court could compare to the one he dealt with early Wednesday morning.

description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Podcast: A G.O.P. Debate Wrap-Up
description: The Republicans fifth and final presidential debate of 2015 was full of bluster and insult. And questions about fear and security and which candidate can keep the country safe from the Islamic State  and Hillary Clinton.

title: The Junk Bond Rout That Wasnt
description: After seven years of rock-bottom interest rates, it should come as no surprise to see excessive risk taking on Wall Street. Investors have long been trying to identify the next bubble, and last Friday Carl Icahn, the billionaire activist investor, weighed in.

title: Review: Son of Saul Revisits Life and Death in Auschwitz
description: The shape of the screen is unusually narrow in Son of Saul, the 38-year-old Hungarian filmmaker Laszlo Nemess debut feature. Nearly square, it evokes an earlier era, when all movies looked this way, and also emphasizes the claustrophobia of the story and the setting. We are in a Nazi death camp, and really in it, to a degree that few fictional films have had the nerve to attempt. The camera doesnt just survey the barracks and the guard towers, the haggard prisoners and brutal guards. It takes us to the very door of the gas chambers, in the close company of Saul Auslander (Geza Rohrig), a Jewish inmate who is a member of the camps Sonderkommando (special commando) unit.

title: Martin Shkreli on Skype With Teenager
description: During a live stream, Mr. Shkreli discussed rap, high school and a friend of his who is in jail.

title: Facts & Figures: Guns Now Kill as Many as Cars
description: The death rate from car accidents has fallen since 1950, while the death rate from gunshots has risen and in 2014, the two rates were the same, according to recently released CDC data. In 21 states and the District of Columbia, guns killed more people than cars.

title: This Weeks Movies | Dec. 18, 2015
description: The New York Times film critics review Sisters, Star Wars: The Force Awakens and Son of Saul.

title: Crimes Against Muslim Americans and Mosques Rise Sharply
description: WASHINGTON  Hate crimes against Muslim Americans and mosques across the United States have tripled in the wake of the terrorist attacks in Paris and San Bernardino, Calif., with dozens occurring within just a month, according to new data.

title: New Orleans City Council Votes to Remove Confederate Monuments
description: The New Orleans City Council voted 6 to 1 to remove four Confederate monuments after a heated monthslong debate, declaring the Civil War-era statues and an obelisk to be public nuisances.

title: Thursday N.F.L. Game Has Running Backs to Savor
description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers and the St. Louis Rams are long shots to make the playoffs this season, but there are a pair of players having All-Pro caliber seasons worth watching Thursday night.

title: A test for future podcats
description: this is a test for future podcast links

title: Enrique Marquez Criminal Complaint
description: In a federal complaint released Thursday, officials charged Enrique Marquez with conspiring to give material support to a terrorist plot.

title: Review: Variety and Risk in Trinity Wall Streets Messiah
description: Alongside its mighty choruses, Handels Messiah features a string of solo recitatives and airs for soprano, alto, tenor and bass. As such, it is usually performed by a choir and four soloists representing each of those voice types. But Trinity Wall Street, which presented the first of its three concerts of the oratorio on Wednesday at Trinity Church, adheres to a different practice. Drawing on a deep pool of talent among its 28-member chorus, it fields a whole flock of soloists: 13 at the initial presentation.

title: Police Officer Accused of Sexually Abusing a Family Friends Daughter
description: A New York police officer was arrested in Brooklyn this week and charged with sexually abusing the daughter of a family friend, the authorities said.

title: In Handels Messiah, the Trumpet as Divine Agent
description: COMING late in Handels Messiah, the glittering instrumental solo in The Trumpet Shall Sound is one of the most recognizable trumpet parts in music. This time of year, its rousing opening fanfare and serenely gleaming lyrical passages can be heard in concert halls and churches all over the country, part of a bass aria that becomes one of this beloved oratorios emotional highlights, charged with hope, mystery and awe.

title: Once Naughty, Now Masterpieces
description: During the culturally repressive late-16th and 17th centuries, Spanish kings often secreted away their nude paintings in rooms known as salas reservadas, where they could enjoy them in private.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Spotlight
description: Tom McCarthy narrates a sequence from Spotlight.

title: Tom McCarthy Narrates a Scene From Spotlight
description: The movie Spotlight looks at a team of journalists at The Boston Globe who investigated a sexual abuse scandal within the Roman Catholic Church.

title: Igor Levit Discusses Goldberg, a Project With Marina Abramovic
description: Since Dec. 7, the pianist Igor Levit has been playing Bachs Goldberg Variations in Goldberg, a collaboration with the performance artist Marina Abramovic at the Park Avenue Armory. In her staging, audience members sit, wearing headphones, for half an hour as the pianist and piano progress slowly and silently on a moving platform down a runway into the center of a circle of deck chairs. As the work is then played, the piano makes a single revolution while the lighting steadily dims.

title: Mens Wear that Finds Beauty in Contrast
Review: Alvin Ailey, at City Center, Maintains Polished Approach to Familiar Footwork
description: Under the leadership of Robert Battle, Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater has expanded and updated its repertory, mostly for the good. But as the dancers take on new challenges, how do they handle the perennial task of making old material look fresh? The All Ailey program at City Center on Wednesday night was as good a test case as any.

title: Dennis Hastert, Former Speaker, Hospitalized Since Having Stroke
description: CHICAGO  J. Dennis Hastert, the former speaker of the House who pleaded guilty in October to trying to evade federal banking laws, has had a stroke and remains in a hospital, his lawyer said Thursday.

title: Movie Review: Sisters
description: The Times critic A.O. Scott reviews Sisters.

title: Lace With a Grimace: The Quirky Dresses of Rooney Mara
description: A Golden Globe nominee for Carol, she favors undone gowns, mostly in black and white.

title: Movie Review: Son of Saul
description: The Times critic A.O. Scott reviews Son of Saul.

title: Review: Adding the Womens Side to the Diner Menu
description: WILMINGTON, Del.  Ah, remember the women of Diner, Barry Levinsons priceless 1982 movie about being young and lost in Baltimore? O.K., you can be forgiven for thinking that I have asked the wrong question.

title: Movie Review: The Force Awakens
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews Star Wars: The Force Awakens.

title: Ted Cruz Escalates Attack on Marco Rubio Over Immigration
description: LAS VEGAS  Senator Ted Cruz of Texas ratcheted up his attack on Senator Marco Rubio of Florida on Thursday by insinuating that Mr. Rubio had broken his promise to voters who elected him to fight amnesty for undocumented immigrants. Mr. Cruz also challenged his Republican rivals to declare their position on whether people who are in the country illegally should be granted citizenship.

title: Review: In The Great Divorce, Searching for Greener Pastures
description: Here are some things C. S. Lewis wanted you to know about heaven. Walking on the grass hurts your feet at first. Waterfalls talk. Murderers can be friends with their victims. Nobody is famous  or rather, everybody is. (The glory flows into everyone, a resident explains.)

title: Desertions Slow Progress of Afghan Air Force Training in U.S.
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A chronic problem with desertions among airmen sent to the United States for training is adding to the woes of the Afghan Air Force, which has been stretched thin during a difficult fighting season and is struggling to build itself up to strength.

title: Review: Ed Reed Pours Out His Feelings at Dizzys Club Coca-Cola
description: Every jazz singer who reaches a certain age is granted a turn as the voice of experience. Ed Reed, who will be 87 in February, takes that covenant more seriously than most. I spent so many years being unhappy, he said, confidingly, early in his first set at Dizzys Club Coca-Cola on Wednesday night. He waited a beat. Anybody out there read my bio?

title: Your Thursday Evening Briefing:Martin Shkreli, Vladimir Putin, Star Wars
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Art of Politics, in Agitprop! at the Brooklyn Museum
description: Most art is political, whether it means to be or not. In Agitprop! at the Brooklyn Museum, politics is the whole point. Content is didactic; the creative part lies in how efficiently and effectively its delivered. Photography, prints and performance are favored media because they are, in different ways, portable, readily legible and easily reproducible. In general, monuments aside, political art isnt made to last; its made to work. And it has to be ready to change as the news changes.

title: Review: The Barber of Seville, Truncated and Energetic
description: Fast-paced doesnt do it justice. Scarcely have you eased into the familiar overture to Rossinis The Barber of Seville in the Metropolitan Operas holiday family presentation of the work than it is over  and on to the action. That skips about, too, but the big tunes are all there, in at least some of their glory.

title: Review: Bread and Puppet Theater Takes Up the Cause of a Puerto Rican Nationalist
description: Oscar Lopez Rivera, the imprisoned Puerto Rican nationalist, may be an unusual subject for a show deemed appropriate for all ages. But Bread and Puppet Theater, formed in 1963, is an unusual kind of troupe. Its politically oriented shows have routinely considered issues like affordable housing, rats and police conduct. (Times, it seems, havent changed.)

title: Review: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip Features a Trip to Miami
description: Now would be an excellent time for parents of young children to invest in earplugs. A new Alvin and the Chipmunks movie has landed. This ones called Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip, the fourth in the series, which began in 2007 and mixes live-action and computer-generated characters.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: Plaid Tidings Brings Back the Forever Plaid Crew
description: I hadnt seen the Forever Plaid guys in decades, and Id completely forgotten they were dead.

title: Jeb Bush, Sensing Momentum After Debate, Zeroes In on Donald Trump
description: Buoyed by an aggressive performance in Tuesdays Republican debate, Jeb Bush is intensifying his strategy of attacking Donald J. Trumps fitness for the presidency, which his aides believe is setting him apart from the sprawling field just as voters begin to make up their minds in early voting states.

title: The Short Life and Long Legacy of Black Mountain College
description: BOSTON  In school I had issues with structure. I wanted to study everything that involved words and images, which meant literature, art, language, philosophy, psychology and religion, among other subjects. Declaring a major was like self-censorship. The ivory tower felt tight. Street politics, travel and transcendental substances were all in my curriculum. What I was after was education as an open category, an end in itself, an adventure that aimed at being something instead of at getting something.

title: Review: Bajirao Mastani, a Bollywood Forbidden Romance
description: At the beginning of Sanjay Leela Bhansalis Bajirao Mastani, a Bollywood romance set in 18th-century India, theres much talk of planting saffron (that is, Hindu) flags in Delhi, the heart of the Mughal (that is, Muslim) empire. Is this going to be an unpleasant India-for-Hindus epic? On the other hand, the movie seems to have some feminist bona fides: Mastani (Deepika Padukone) is an impressively fierce woman warrior, who saves the life of the equally fierce Bajirao (Ranveer Singh) on the battlefield as arrows whiz by her head. Mastani writes her own destiny, she says. Well, O.K.

title: Theater Listings for Dec. 18-24
description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: Little Dreams in Glass and Metal Spotlights Enameling
description: Few museums reserve gallery space and budgets for enameled objects. Bernard N. Jazzar and Harold B. Nelson, curators and collectors in Los Angeles, set out to rectify that by creating the nonprofit Enamel Arts Foundation in 2007. It owns about 1,000 of these works  from specks of jewelry to panels as tall as six feet  made of colored glass fired onto metal.

title: Martha Wilson, Dressing Up and Poking Fun, in Mona/Marcel/Marge
description: With life, sometimes you just have to laugh, which Martha Wilson learned long ago. In the early 1970s, she dressed up for the camera and portrayed herself as several things she wasnt  a glamour girl, a housewife, a guy, a goddess  and at least one thing that she was: a feminist, trying on for size every off-the-rack social role she could lay her hands on.

title: Review: The Genital Warriors Revisits Bygone Romances
description: The worst thing about The Genital Warriors is the title of this would-be absurdist contemplation on the lifelong need for love. The competition was pretty fierce, though.

title: Fernando Bryce Explores Midcentury Cultural Ideas
Saloua Raouda Choucair, a Modernist Explored
description: This sparkling exhibition gives New York its first in-depth look at the wide-ranging activities of Saloua Raouda Choucair, a pioneer of Lebanese modernism who spent four years in Paris after World War II, has worked most of her life in Beirut, and will turn 100 in 2016. It reminds us that modernism proceeds at different speeds not only around the globe but also within the efforts of individual artists.

title: Pop & Rock Listings for Dec. 18-24
Review: In He Never Died, Mastering Longevity if Not Social Skills
description: Performances dont come more deadpan than the one Henry Rollins gives in He Never Died, an enjoyably strange horror film directed by Jason Krawczyk. Though perhaps deadpan is a poor choice of words, given that Mr. Rollinss character, Jack, seems unable to die.

title: Friday File: An Early Admirer of Star Wars
description: The story of Star Wars could be written on the head of a pin and still leave room for the Bible.

title: Cary Smiths Paintings Riff on Modernist Conventions
Holiday Outings (That Dont Include Star Wars)
description: This weekend two very different groups of people will be walking the streets of New York City: Those planning to watch Star Wars: The Force Awakens and those hoping to steer clear of theaters during its opening weekend. For the second group, the Miser has some options with a holiday vibe.

title: Graphic Passion: Matisse and the Book Arts at the Morgan Library
description: In Paris during 1946, Henri Matisse made a series of portrait drawings of a notoriously splenetic theater critic named Paul Lautaud. One of the images was to be made into a lithograph for the frontispiece in a book of Lautauds writings. Over a number of days that August  a dozen, in Lautauds probably exaggerated estimate  the critic sat for the artist, and the two chatted amiably during the sessions.

title: Review: Mojin: The Lost Legend, in Search of a Burial Ground
description: Chinese cinema has become so reliably engaging that its a genuine surprise when a clunker shows up on American screens. Mojin: The Lost Legend seeks adventure blockbuster status like Raiders of the Lost Ark, Lara Croft: Tomb Raider, The Mummy or other action flicks that spend a lot of time underground. But it gets no traction whatsoever.

title: Review: Inside the Chef Ren Redzepis World in Noma: My Perfect Storm
description: In the combat sport of haute cuisine, few recent careers have intrigued as much as that of Ren Redzepi, the head chef of Noma, in Copenhagen, which has topped a list of the worlds best restaurants four of the last six years. Mr. Redzepi co-founded Noma first on the principle of resurrecting Nordic cuisine, and then on the idea of time and place  intricately preparing dishes using only local and seasonally appropriate ingredients.

title: Humbug as a Holiday Enhancer
description: HOLIDAY cheer can have its limits  by late December, you might be looking for a night out with entertainment thats a little less wholesome. Luckily, some of New Yorks finest comedians are putting a twist on the classic wintertime fare with a mix of stand-up, sketch, storytelling, improv, music and other nonsense to tickle the Grinch in all of us.

title: Review: Polyfaces, a Documentary About Sustainable Agriculture
description: Granted, you dont watch a documentary about sustainable agriculture for Star Wars-type thrills. Yet you may still find yourself quietly cheering for the low-key rebels of Polyfaces.

title: Mars Rover Finds Changing Rocks, Surprising Scientists
description: As NASAs Curiosity rover treks up a three-mile-high mountain on Mars, the rocks are changing. That says something about how the planets climate and environment changed more than three billion years ago  but scientists are not sure what.

title: Review: Those Who Feel the Fire Burning, a Documentary About the Refugee Experience
description: Those Who Feel the Fire Burning, a nervily abstract vision of refugee life in Europe from Morgan Knibbe, a first-time feature filmmaker, arrives at a moment when Syrian refugees are a major topic in the news.

title: F.D.A. Allows Maker of Just Mayo to Keep Products Name
description: Sometimes, semantics can make a difference.

title: Super PAC Supporting Jeb Bush Attacks Donald Trump in New Ad
description: Right to Rise, the super PAC supporting Jeb Bushs campaign, moved quickly to capitalize on Mr. Bushs well-received exchange with Donald J. Trump in Tuesdays debate with this ad, titled Tough Enough.

title: Proposed Extension of Tax Credits for Renewable Energy Would Have Uneven Effect
description: After months of taking a beating in the markets, renewable energy companies suddenly seemed to be on firmer footing this week, as lawmakers proposed extending important tax credits in exchange for lifting the decades-old ban on exporting American crude oil.

title: Calm Acceptance as Fed Enacts Its First Interest Increase in Seven Years
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserves much-anticipated liftoff, its first interest rate increase since the financial crisis, unfolded as quietly and smoothly as Fed officials could possibly have wished.

title: United Nations: Sanctions Against ISIS Adopted
description: The United Nations Security Council on Thursday unanimously adopted alegally binding resolutionaimed at preventing banned terrorist groups from making money and using the international banking system, with an emphasis on the Islamic State group. The resolution builds on previous Council measures, also legally binding, that make it illegal to donate money to terrorist groups, trade in oil and antiquities or make ransom payments. Those prohibitions are sometimes ignored, and the new resolution, drafted by Russia and the United States, is intended to strengthen it.The resolution calls on countries to describe what steps they are taking toprevent terrorist organizations from making money, including interdicting oil sales.The effects may be limited: The Islamic State group draws a large share of its revenues from taxes imposed on the people who live in its territories. Perhaps the most incongruous element of the resolution is that one of its sponsors is the government of Syria.

title: ISIS Carries Out First Serious Attack in Northern Iraq in Months, U.S. Says
description: ERBIL, Iraq  Islamic State fighters conducted their most significant military operation in northernIraqin more than five months when they mounted a three-pronged attackon Wednesdaynight north and east of Mosul, American officials saidThursday.

title: Obama Reaches Out to New Audience for News
description: Over the course of seven years in office, President Obama has periodically invited columnists and other opinion leaders to the White House for off-the-record discussions that sometimes do not stay all that off the record.

title: Anthony Marshall, Brooke Astors Son, Experienced Atrocious Treatment at Rikers, His Family Says
description: Anthony D. Marshall spent only a few days at Rikers Island in 2013 before being transferred to an upstate prison to serve his sentence for stealing tens of millions of dollars from his mother, the philanthropist and socialite Brooke Astor.

title: Freddie Gray and the Meaning of Justice
description: On Wednesday, a judge in Baltimore declared a mistrial in the case of the first of six officers charged in the death of Freddie Gray, a 25-year-old man who died of a spinal cord injury sustained in police custody.

title: Shkreli Indictment Portrays Small-Time Fraud
description: Martin Shkreli told investors that his hedge fund had an auditor, that it had posted a 36 percent return since its inception and that it had $35 million in assets under management.

title: Canada: Monument Re-evaluated
description: The new Liberal government said Thursday that a monument to the victims of Communism proposed by a private group would not be built next to the Supreme Court. Mlanie Joly, the minister of Canadian heritage, also announced that a national competition would be held to pick a design to replace the current plan, which includes concrete structures dotted with pixels that, in renderings, form an image of a mass grave. Many architects, Ottawas mayor and the chief justice of the Supreme Court were among the opponents of the original plan. The design and site were selected largely without public review. The new government said that it would provide only a fraction of the money promised by the Conservatives for the project.

title: Integrity Takes a Toll at the Port Authority
description: Two years ago this month, Patrick J. Foye, a middle-aged, white-bearded, bespectacled government official little known beyond his workplace and family, arrived at a legislative hearing in Trenton. Under oath, he told a story that provided the first clear view of near-gangsterism at the top levels of one of the regions most powerful agencies, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: Cam Newton and Eli Manning Love to Lead, Though Only One Can Really Dance
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Eli Manning made a rare departure from his script with reporters Wednesday when asked about Carolina Panthers quarterback Cam Newtons post-touchdown dance called the dab.

title: House Approves Bill to End Tax-Free Real Estate Spinoffs
description: Wall Street may have to come up with a new strategy to replace a type of deal that has been popular among activist investors and companies.

title: Martin Shkrelis Arrest Gives Drug Makers Cover
description: During his three months as a household name, Martin Shkreli has been a walking, talking (incessantly) personification of one of the pharmaceutical industrys worst nightmares  the greedy drug company executive.

title: M.L.B.s Good-Will Tour of Cuba Is Hardly the Last Word
description: HAVANA  Clayton Kershaw stood on the lawn outside the Hotel Nacional, his profile set against a pink sky as the sun set over the Florida Straits behind him. Kershaw stretched; first his arm, then his back. Baseball in hand, he called to Jose Cruz Jr., a former big leaguer who now works for Major League Baseballs players union, that he was ready to throw. A throng of Cubans watched Kershaws every move.

title: Britain Considers Deflating Power of House of Lords
description: LONDON  Few dispute the need for changes to the House of Lords, Britains unelected and scandal-hit upper parliamentary chamber, which is the worlds largest legislative assembly outside China. Most critics complain about the chambers increase in number in the past 15 years, now with close to 800 voting members.

title: Kaiser Permanente Plans to Open a Medical School
description: WASHINGTON  Kaiser Permanente, the health system based in California that combines a nonprofit insurance plan with its own hospitals and clinics, announced Thursday that it would open its own medical school in the state in 2019.

title: Police Seek Murder Charges After 2 Dead Children Are Found in California
description: A woman and her teenage companion will face charges of first-degree murder and torture in California after the bodies of two children entrusted to their care were discovered stuffed inside a storage locker over the weekend, law enforcement officials said on Thursday.

title: Baltimore Is Quiet, but Residents Are Pensive
description: BALTIMORE  The Rev. C. D. Witherspoon, minister at the Judah Worship Center, paced a West Baltimore street corner late Wednesday night, imploring a small group gathered around him to stave off a feeling he believed city leaders wanted residents to have: apathy.

title: New York City to Pay $2.75 Million in Wrongful-Conviction Settlement
description: New York City has agreed to pay $2.75 million to settle a wrongful-conviction lawsuit, the citys Law Department said on Thursday, in a case that prompted philosophical questions about the meaning of a guilty plea.

title: Tag Line
description: Administrivial Will Shortz Sighting Alert! Tune in to tonights episode of Jeopardy! to watch Will Shortz read clues in a special New York Times Crossword category. All of the clues are drawn from puzzles youve solved this week, so if you were ever going to put money on your ability to answer the questions, this would be a good time to do it.

title: Apple Pay Is Set to Arrive in China
description: Apple is introducing its mobile payments platform, Apple Pay, in China early next year, a move that will significantly broaden the services audience.

title: Peter Dickinson, Author, Dies at 88; Master Plotter Relished a Good Puzzle
description: Peter Dickinson, an award-winning British mystery writer whose books for adults and children often crossed the boundaries separating the genres of crime, adventure, science fiction, fantasy and suspense, died on Wednesday, his 88th birthday, in Winchester, Hampshire, England.

title: Voters Could Decide Next Year on Allowing Casinos in North Jersey
description: Voters in New Jersey may get to decide next year whether to allow two casinos to open in the northern part of the state, 40 years after legalized gambling was limited to Atlantic City.

title: At Prestigious Rhode Island School, an Investigation Into Sexual Abuse
description: BOSTON  The prestigious St. Georges School in Rhode Island has been investigating what it says are multiple credible reports of sexual abuse of students in the 1970s and 80s by three former employees, and said in a statement that its investigation was nearing an end.

title: F.C.C. Asks Comcast, AT&T and T-Mobile About Zero-Rating Services
description: The Federal Communications Commission said on Thursday it was exploring whether new services from Comcast, T-Mobile USA and and AT&T violate net neutrality rules.

title: Nancy Spector Joins Brooklyn Museum as Chief Curator
description: The Brooklyn Museums new director, Anne Pasternak  who has been rapidly shaking up its galleries and programming in the four months since she took over  announced on Thursday that Nancy Spector, the longtime chief curator at the Guggenheim Museum and a highly respected voice in contemporary art, would become her new chief curator.

title: Beijing Issues a Second Red Alert on Pollution
description: BEIJING  The Chinese capital issued a red alert for air pollution on Friday morning, saying it was enacting for the second time the highest-level emergency pollution plan in advance of a prolonged spell of smog that is predicted to smother Beijing and elsewhere in northern China this weekend. The crisis measures were expected to start Saturday and last for four days.

title: Ted Cruzs New Data Strategy: Here Comes Santa Claus
description: ST. PAUL  The Cruz campaign is making a list.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | peon
description: peon  \pe-n, -n \  noun

title: Letting Go of a Job to Take Control of Her Sons Well-Being
description: Tawana Gilbert knew why her son Naquon Dawsons eyes were bloodshot when he came home late from school.

title: Suspect Escapes From Police Custody in Lower Manhattan
description: A suspect escaped from police custody in Lower Manhattan on Thursday and ran into a subway station, prompting the authorities to temporarily halt train service as they searched for him, officials said.

title: Putting Her Son's Well-Being First
description: Many people feel the tug between family and work. Tawana Gilbert left her job as an accounting supervisor and spent her retirement savings to help keep her teenage son from slipping into drug addiction.

title: What to Watch Friday
description: The comedian Bill Burr remembers when nothing could come between a man and his TV in Netflixs new animated comedy. Lady Gaga is named Billboards woman of the year. And Thackery bucks the system on The Knick.

title: Editors Note: December 18, 2015
description: A front-page article on Sunday, based on accounts from law-enforcement officials, reported that before entering the United States, Tashfeen Malik, one of the San Bernardino attackers, had talked openly on social media about her support for violent jihad.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: For us, shes a Halleys comet of sport, a teenager whos tremendously gifted in both mind and body. With that talent and drive, were betting that she can be the fastest woman in the world someday.

title: A Theater in China That Brings Art, and Dwarfs, Out of the Shadows
description: BEIJING  Devil monkey! Where are you escaping to?!

title: Democrats and Bernie Sanders Clash Over Data Breach
A Pause to Weigh Risks of Gene Editing
description: The technology for altering defects in the human genome has progressed so rapidly in the last three years that it has outstripped the ability of scientists and ethicists to understand and cope with the consequences. An international panel of experts has wisely called for a pause in using the technique to produce genetic changes that could be inherited by future generations. That would allow time to assess risks and benefits, they said, and develop a broad societal consensus on the work.

title: The 2015 Sidney Awards
description: It is time once again for the Sidney Awards, when I pick out some of the best long-form essays that you might download for your holiday reading pleasure. This year there were so many fine pieces its impossible to read them all without totally ignoring your family.

title: What Went Wrong With Navy SEALs
description: The mission of the American military in Afghanistan was always devilishly complex: a combination of guerrilla warfare, social outreach, military training and institution-building in a forbidding and often hostile land. But it was criminal and inexcusable that Navy SEALs assigned to train Afghan police officers in the village of Kalach joined the police in viciously beating detainees who had been taken into custody after a bomb blast killed a policeman. One was assaulted so badly that he died.

title: Haunted by Waters
description: You stand in the mist and roar of Snoqualmie Falls, more than 100 feet higher than Niagara, and feel the liquid power of the Cascade Mountains crashing down. Its been raining, seemingly nonstop, for at least a month in the Pacific Northwest, and this is the payoff. Hope is 4,000 cubic feet of water per second, going off a cliff.

title: The Big Short, Housing Bubbles and Retold Lies
description: In May 2009 Congress created a special commission to examine the causes of the financial crisis. The idea was to emulate the celebrated Pecora Commission of the 1930s, which used careful historical analysis to help craft regulations that gave America two generations of financial stability.

title: The Problem With Focusing on Childhood Obesity
description: THERE is good news in the fight against obesity: Rates are finally falling in young children. The bad news? Theyre continuing to rise to new heights in adults.

title: Horror Stories From New York State Prisons
description: The Justice Department hauled New York City into court last year when it failed to curb the wanton brutality that has long been a hallmark among guards at the Rikers Island jail complex. The same culture of violence infests the sprawling state prison system, where guards batter inmates for sport knowing that their union will protect their jobs and that district attorneys in small towns dominated by prisons will not prosecute them. Sustained and vigorous federal pressure will be needed to change this deplorable system, and even then, it wont be enough without leadership and commitment from New Yorks top political figures.

title: News Qs | Britain Prunes Silly Laws on Salmon Handling and Armor Wearing
description: Before Reading Britain Prunes Silly Laws on Salmon Handling and Armor Wearing:

title: After Years of War in Syria, U.N. Passes Resolution on Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS  For the first time since the nearly five-year-old Syrian civil war began, world powers agreed on Friday at the United Nations Security Council to embrace a plan for a cease-fire and a peace process that holds the distant prospect of ending the conflict.

title: Zurich Insurance to Pay Up to $1.05 Billion for Crop Insurer
description: LONDON  Zurich Insurance Group said on Friday that it had agreed to pay as much as $1.05 billion to buy the United States agricultural insurer known as Rural Community Insurance Services from Wells Fargo.

title: Mapping Saturns Moons
description: NASAs Cassini spacecraft will make its final flyby of Saturns Enceladus moon on Saturday.

title: ISIS Building Little Nests in Afghanistan, U.S. Defense Secretary Warns
description: OPERATING BASE FENTY, Afghanistan  The Islamic State is establishing little nests in Afghanistan, adding to the complex array of threats confronting Afghan forces and their international partners as they try to reverse a serious decline in security, Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter said Friday.

title: In New York, the Fireplace Flickers
description: In New York, an apartment fireplace evokes an escape from the bustling streets, the comforting after-work notion of settling into a high-back chair with a snifter of brandy  even if the chimney was sealed long ago.

title: Wrestlings Daily Struggle in Guatemala
description: Everyone loves a winner. But as everyone knows, somebody has to lose. Indeed, for Guatemala Citys wrestlers, life itself is a daily struggle against defeat on all of lifes fronts. That realization came to Jorge Luis Chavarra when he started photographing the masked luchadores who grappled more for love than for money. If anything, he found himself wondering about the losers right at the moment of defeat.

title: Fashions Gaze Turned to Joan Didion in 2015
description: The most discussed fashion model of 2015 did not, like some of her colleagues, earn $44 million or shave her head. She did not even leave her apartment.

title: Whats in a Name
description: Elise Morrisseys mother is called Alyce Morrissey. This confused Joe Russo IV when he tried to ask Ms. Morrissey out for a drink via a Christmas card.

title: Me or My Mother? A Romantic Message Goes Astray
description: Neither rain, nor snow nor a misaddressed Christmas card could keep Joe Russo IV from the woman he was certain would be his wife.

title: What Were the Best and Worst Things About 2015 for You?
description: As December winds down and the 2015 retrospectives begin to roll out, we thought wed ask you for your own lists.

title: Ask Well: Are Avocados Good for You?
description: Question:

title: Japan Earmarks Billions to Help Prod Its Companies
description: TOKYO  Japans central bank announced a small but perhaps symbolically significant change to its stimulus efforts on Friday, earmarking 300 billion yen a year, or $2.4 billion, to buy shares in companies that expand the economy by investing in their factories or by raising workers pay.

title: Morning Agenda: Shkreli Indictment Portrays His Small-Time Fraud
description: SHKRELI INDICTMENT PORTRAYS HIS SMALL-TIME FRAUD | Martin Shkrelis busy week of live-streaming on YouTube, goading hip-hop groups and threatening to raise drug-prices was topped with a 6 a.m. arrest by F.B.I. agents yesterday,Julie Creswell, Stephanie Clifford and Andrew Pollack report in The New York Times.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Your Friday Briefing:Martin Shkreli,San Bernardino, Star Wars
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New Yorks Week in Pictures: Dec. 18
description: Photographs include images of a former inmate now with a second chance and young Muslims in New York City.

title: New York Today: A Little History of Christmas
description: Updated at 10:15 a.m.

title: Martin OMalley and Bernie Sanders Bristle at Holding Debates on Weekends
description: If a presidential debate is held and nobody watches, does it really happen?

title: Scarred Riverbeds and Dead Pistachio Trees in a Parched Iran
description: POUZE KHOON, Iran  The early-morning sun meagerly brightened the gloom of this sad township, a collection of empty, crumbling houses along a highway through the dusty desert landscape in southeastern Iran.

title: Jebi and Other Star Wars Fans Lament Being Stuck on the Campaign Trail
description: They may be stuck in rope lines rather than movie-ticket lines, but some 2016 presidential candidates certainly have Star Wars on the mind.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz: Presidents, Preventing Colds and Liquor
description: Take the Quiz

title: Qihoo 360 Technology to Be Taken Private in $9.3 Billion Deal
description: HONG KONG  The Qihoo 360 Technology Company, a Chinese Internet security firm, said on Friday that it had agreed to be taken private and bought by a consortium of investors for about $9.3 billion.

title: Congress Hopes to Tie Bow on Spending Bill
description: Congress hopes to wrap up its work for the year on Friday with final passage of a $1.1 trillion spending bill that will fully fund the government through September.

title: GlaxoSmithKline to Buy Raft of H.I.V. Drugs in Development
description: LONDON  GlaxoSmithKline said on Friday that it had agreed to acquire a pipeline of H.I.V. drugs in development from Bristol-Myers Squibb, in two deals that could be worth as much as $1.46 billion.

title: Shift to Security Disrupts U.S. Presidential Race
description: WASHINGTON  Suddenly, the biggest year-end development in the race for the White House is no longer Donald J. Trumps bombast. It is the reshaped agenda facing every candidate.

title: How to Eulogize Someone Youve Never Met
description: All people have a story, Chris Ponnet says. Its your job to find it. For more than a decade, Ponnet, the director of spiritual care at the Los Angeles County-U.S.C. Medical Center, one of the largest public hospitals in the country, has been leading the annual memorial service for many hundreds of people who die in Los Angeles County whose remains go unclaimed. He eulogizes immigrants, homeless people, AIDS patients, young men killed in gang shootouts, sometimes babies who die before being named.

title: Preserving David Irelands Home in All Its Marred Glory
description: SAN FRANCISCO  As the host of an unorthodox dinner party, Carlie Wilmans held a red Bic lighter up to a pair of propane canisters hanging on stiff wires from the ceiling until one ignited.

title: The 12.6.15 Issue
description: RE: WHITE DEBT

title: The Identity Thief
description: When my best friend and I go to our favorite cafe in the Cihangir neighborhood near Taksim Square, in Istanbul, I usually get tavsan kan. Known as rabbits blood, its just watered-down Turkish tea, served in a small tulip glass. I quit coffee and cigarettes a year ago, and generally I dont feel the need for them anymore. But then one beautiful day this summer, we came across a certain family of beggars in the square.

title: Poetry Pairing | Mistletoe
description: This month we pair Walter de la Mares poem Mistletoe with Olivia Judsons 2014 Opinion essay, The Hemiparasite Season.

title: Pope Francis Clears Mother Teresas Path to Sainthood
description: LONDON  Pope Francis has recognized a second miracle attributed to Mother Teresa, the Roman Catholic nun who was awarded a Nobel Peace Prize for her work helping the poor of Kolkata, India, clearing the way for her canonization next year, the Vatican announced on Friday.

title: Democrats Prepare for a Potential Saturday Night Fight
description: The week before the last Democratic presidential debate of the year began with Senator Bernie Sanderss campaign pulling a negative digital ad it was running against Hillary Clinton after reporters caught wind of it.

title: Grandson of Modern Irans Founder Seeks to Join Council That Picks Supreme Leader
description: TEHRAN  A moderate Iranian cleric, the grandson of the founder of the Islamic Republic, registered on Friday as a candidate in elections for the council charged with picking the countrys next supreme leader, whenever that time comes.

title: From Jazz to Legos, Toasts To Life
description: One of the most crowd-pleasing musical numbers in the Broadway revival of Fiddler on the Roof is To Life, a celebration of the agreement that Tevyes daughter Tzeitel will marry the butcher Lazar Wolf. (Spoiler alert: she doesnt.) The uptempo song famously culminates in a big dance number featuring high kicks and eye-catching leaps. A musicalization of the Jewish toast Lchaim, the joyfully wishful song translates across barriers of culture, language, geography and even gender. Below are some video clips that demonstrate how this tradition-embracing song has been interpreted in very non-traditional ways over the years.

title: Spare Times for Dec. 18-24
description: Information on events for possible inclusion in Spare Times should be sent to weekend@nytimes.com by Friday at 5 p.m. for publication that week. Longer versions of Around Town and For Children listings are in a searchable guide at nytimes.com/events.

title: Anger: An American History
description: WHERE, many have asked these last weeks, do the rhetorical fireballs  the raging suspicion and rabid xenophobia  come from? Barring people from our shores, Paul Ryan reminds us, is not what this country stands for. Emma Lazarus would have agreed. But while the demonizing may sound un-American, it happens also to be ur-American.

title: A Half-Century of Fiddler on the Roof Memories
description: So many Velcro-affixed bottles. So many fake beards (plus a few real ones). And so, so many daughters. As the sun rises Sunday, Dec. 20, on the latest Broadway Fiddler on the Roof revival, this one starring Danny Burstein as the beleaguered milkman Tevye, we look back at 51 years in Anatevka. The original leading man (Zero Mostel) and director (Jerome Robbins) were often barely on speaking terms, but that 1964 Harold Prince production went on to a record-setting run. We asked veterans of that Fiddler and of the incalculable number of professional, amateur and student productions that followed to recall their experiences. Here are edited excerpts. ERIC GRODE

title: For Children Listings for Dec. 18-24
description: Daisy, never mind that bicycle built for two. At the New Victory Theater, you can look awfully sweet on a bicycle built for 11.

description: There are a lot of places to go  and these were the ones you most enjoyed reading about this year.

title: Can Hotels Keep Millennials Booked?
description: When it opened last summer, the AC Hotel Miami Beach drew the architect Rem D. Koolhaas and the fashion photographer Nigel Barker, among other luminaries. Celebrity appearances at hotel openings arent new, but rarely do they happen at a limited-service hotel a block from the beach with rooms available in the low season for just above $100.

title: On Newport Beach, Seafood Flavor Without the Fuss
description: In a mixed metaphor befitting a restaurant owner, Thos Carson likes to say that seafood is our bread and butter.

description: OTTAWA  BlackBerrys plan to revive its fortunes by becoming more of a software and service company gained some legitimacy on Friday when it reported a 119 percent rise in revenue over last quarter from that segment.

description: Dear Diary:

description: The Federal Reserve said this week that it would raise interest rates for the first time since the financial crisis.

title: N.F.L. Playoff Picture: Your Guide to Watching Week 15
description: Weve built an N.F.L. simulator to let you explore every playoff possibility, with the ability to choose the outcome of any game and see how it affects a teams chances. And for those who want a basic overview of the games this weekend  Week 15 of the season  we offer one here.

title: Long-Term Care Insurance Can Baffle, With Complex Policies and Costs
description: INSURING for long-term care is a lot like trying to cover the future financial impact of climate change. Its a universal problem that looms large, is hard to predict and will be costly to mitigate.

title: Trash Never Looked So Stylish
description: At one West Village co-op, the multitude of trash bins for waste and recycling had become so unsightly that some residents had given the whole arrangement a nickname  Garbagehenge.

description: SEOUL, South Korea  WHEN she published her book about Korean comfort women in 2013, Park Yu-ha wrote that she felt a bit fearful of how it might be received.

description: Quickly bone up on the films leading up to The Force Awakens.

title: 1940: U.S. Eyeing Danish Ships
description: WASHINGTON  As the first step in a shipping program designed to provide Great Britain with fast cargo carriers, the United States, it was learned in an authoritative quarter tonight [Dec. 18], is seeking a way to take over thirty or more Danish-flag vessels which have been tied up in American ports since the German occupation of that country. The question of legal authority to take over the ships and pay for them is still under discussion.

title: Lesson on Islam Shuts Down Virginia School District
description: A Virginia school district closed its schools on Friday amid an angry backlash, including a possible risk of harm to school officials, over an assignment that asked high school students to copy a Muslim creed in Arabic calligraphy.

title: Congress Passes $1.8 Trillion Spending Measure
description: WASHINGTON  After years of dysfunction and abysmal public approval ratings, a chastened, even beaten-down Congress on Friday passed a $1.8 trillion package of spending and tax cuts with remarkably little rancor.

title: Opening .Zip Files on an iPhone
description: Q. In iOS 9 on an iPhone, is it possible to see what is inside a .zip file attached to a Mail message, or do I have to wait and open the file on my computer?

description: Is Netflix TV?

description: This article was initially published as a letter to subscribers of The Upshots newsletter. You can sign up for the email here to get this and all of the best of The Upshot.

title: Lead Belly Tribute Concert Coming to Carnegie Hall in February
description: Lead Belly Fest, a tribute concert to the folk and blues musician Lead Belly, is heading to Carnegie Hall on Feb. 4 after a sold-out performance at the Royal Albert Hall in London.

title: Playoff Picture: How the Patriots Can Clinch the A.F.C.s No. 1 Seed
description: Our N.F.L. simulator gives the Patriots an enviable 84 percent chance of getting the No. 1 seed in the A.F.C., which comes with home-field advantage until the Super Bowl. They have a 98 percent chance of finishing as one of the top two seeds, which comes with a first-round bye

title: Star Wars Opens Amid Hype and Nostalgia
description: Was Star Wars: The Force Awakens the most anticipated movie of all time? It cant quite compare with the hoopla when Gone With the Wind arrived in 1939 and an estimated 300,000 fans flooded Atlanta, many in antebellum outfits. Georgias governor declared a state holiday.

title: Courtside Seats Dont Carry a Warning Label, but the Risk Is Real
description: PHILADELPHIA  The basketball court is a confined space, measuring 94 feet by 50 feet, but the ball does not always obey these restrictions. It can fly into the stands, and there are moments when players must make an all-important, split-second decision: Try to leapfrog a row of fans sitting courtside or, as the Knicks Lance Thomas put it, hit the brakes.

title: Get Me Rewrite!
description: Ive never liked calling what I do rewrite. Its a misnomer, one that conjures fedoras, cigarettes, typewriters and Preston Sturges dialogue. But theres a long tradition in newspapers that involves someone at a desk, taking information from reporters in the field, and shaping it, at the home office, into an article. Thats what rewrite is, and thats a big part of what I do.

title: Whats on This Week Around the World
description: Munich

title: Broncos Playoff Picture: How They Could Win Top Seed, or Lose the Division
description: The Broncos face perhaps the widest array of plausible playoff scenarios of any N.F.L. team. They have an 11 percent chance of getting the No. 1 seed in the A.F.C. and having home-field advantage until the Super Bowl, according to our playoff simulator. But they also have a 20 percent chance of failing to win their division  and probably not having a single home playoff game.

title: How to See Eternity in a Pile of Rocks
description: The delusion of permanence is one theme of a stately exhibition of stone works at the Noguchi Museum.

title: Popcast: Best Albums of 2015
description: Music critics for The New York Times discuss the years highlights.

title: Another Delay for an Upstart Stock Exchange
description: Scores of investors, in a fistful of comments, have told the Securities and Exchange Commission that they want to be able to trade stocks on a more level playing field. So why hasnt the commission, known as the Investor Advocate, given the green light to an operation that would enable it?

title: Donald Trump Returns Vladimir Putins Admiration, Looking Past His Darker Side
description: Donald J. Trump welcomed the kind words he received this week from Vladimir V. Putin on Friday, praising the Russian presidents leadership and brushing off concerns that his regime kills journalists and political opponents.

title: The Costly Conditions of Zero-Interest Credit Cards
description: AS shoppers rush to finish their holiday gift buying, theyre likely to encounter enticing offers to purchase goods with so-called zero-interest credit cards. But theres good reason to be cautious about signing up.

title: Chinas Renminbi Declines After Being Named a Global Currency, Posing Challenges
description: HONG KONG  At the end of last month, the Chinese renminbi was anointed as one of the worlds elite currencies, a first for an emerging market and a widely hailed acknowledgment of Chinas rising financial influence and economic might.

title: Joel Edgerton on His Suit of (Beige) Armor in Black Mass
description: This fall, Oscar predictions were running high for Joel Edgerton. His swaggering, cock-of-the-walk depiction of the F.B.I. agent John Connolly was one of the high points of Black Mass, starring Johnny Depp as Whitey Bulger, the murderous Boston gangster who spent 16 years on the lam before being convicted in 2013 of 11 murders and other crimes.

title: Demands to Rename Donald J. Trump State Park Gain Ground
description: YORKTOWN, N.Y.  Donald J. Trump, who is the leading Republican contender for president, is known for splashing his name across everything: casinos, office buildings, golf courses, apartment towers and hotels.

title: Bolshoi Babylon Explores a Secretive Ballet Troupe
description: Nearly three years ago, a real-life horror story struck the Bolshoi Ballet: Sergei Filin, the artistic director of the Bolshoi, was attacked with acid by a masked man outside his home. Pavel V. Dmitrichenko, a Bolshoi soloist, was eventually arrested and charged with ordering the attack. He was upset, prosecutors said at his trial, about Mr. Filins casting decisions  namely that his girlfriend wasnt given the role of Odette-Odile in Swan Lake.

title: Maria Alexandrova on the Bolshoi: We Still Dont Know the Truth
description: Maria Alexandrova, a principal at the Bolshoi Ballet since 2004, rarely grants interviews.
