description: AS we celebrate the holidays, lets remember that this is one of those savage epochs when some families must choose between their faith and their lives. It is an echo of when Nero burned Christians alive, or when self-described Christians unleashed pogroms against Jews.

title: In His Little Corner, Larry Holmes Is the Greatest
description: EASTON, Pa.  Throughout his boxing career, Larry Holmes was something of an afterthought. He was the heavyweight champion whose reign came after the fall of Muhammad Ali, the toughest of all acts to follow. He was the fighter who almost broke Rocky Marcianos record for consecutive wins. He possessed one of the greatest jabs in boxing history, but it was still only a jab. It is the knockout punches  the hooks and uppercuts  that sell tickets and inspire fearsome nicknames.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Ready for Patriots Trickery, Eagles Turn Their Focus to an Unlikely Berth
description: PHILADELPHIA  Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver Seyi Ajirotutu has caught only one pass for 4 yards this year and become a forgotten man in the teams offense. But if it werent for his smart, athletic special-teams performance earlier this month, the Eagles may be wondering how their season went wrong instead of contending for an unlikely playoff berth.

title: Inside the Billion-Dollar Battle for Puerto Ricos Future
description: The money poured in by the millions, then by the hundreds of millions, and finally by the billions. Over weak coffee in a conference room in Midtown Manhattan last year, a half-dozen Puerto Rican officials exhaled: Their cash-starved island had persuaded some of the countrys biggest hedge funds to lend them more than $3 billion to keep the government afloat.

title: Silencing the Inner Torment, a Brooklyn Man Finds a Way Forward
description: Tyson Fabers started hearing voices after he learned that his girlfriend was cheating on him.

title: Struggles With Depression Help Strengthen a Familys Bond
description: Melinda Gomezs son, Michael, repeatedly said he wanted to kill himself. He was 9.

title: Sidetracked by Schizophrenia, a Former Film Student Plots a New Path
description: Step into Ariel Moraless shoes, and life exists in an elevated state defined by a series of destructive behaviors and dreams with hidden messages that demand hours of obsessive dissection.

title: Suffering, Often in Silence, But Determined to Move Forward
description: One in five New Yorkers experiences a mental health disorder in any given year, city officials say. These are the stories of three people fighting to overcome such challenges.

title: James Blumenfeld of the Met Opera: The Delight Is in the Details
description: James Blumenfeld, 55, is property master for the Metropolitan Opera in New York.

title: Panthers Arrive With Masterpiece, but Giants Know How to Smudge
description: Perfection in sports tickles the imagination because perfection is so hard to accomplish in any other walk of life.

title: Anthony Muto, Designer Who Dressed Three First Ladies, Dies at 81
description: Anthony Muto, a fashion designer of the 1960s, 70s and beyond who dressed several American first ladies, died on Wednesday in Manhattan. He was 81.

title: Getting Untracked: A Term as Enigmatic as How to Escape a Slump
description: PHILADELPHIA  Early this month, as the Eagles sought to end a three-game losing streak and remain in contention to win the N.F.C. East, the Fox announcer Charles Davis said of Philadelphias struggling quarterback, running backs and receivers, You have to find ways to get them untracked.

title: Horse Festivals With a Political Goal
description: Chinese officials stage these events to signal to the countrys critics that Tibetan culture is thriving.

title: Young Ohio State Team Reverses Its Fortune and Tops No. 4 Kentucky
description: Ohio State inbounded the ball with five seconds left in the first half, up an unlikely 9 points against No. 4 Kentucky. Buckeyes guard JaQuan Lyle  one of six freshmen on the 12-man roster  received the ball around his own free-throw line, rushed up the court, pulled up about 30 feet out and made the shot.

title: A Spaniard Selling Lottery Fortune
description: SORT, Spain  Xavier Gabriel is not taking part in Tuesdays El Gordo, or the Fat One, Spains immense Christmas lottery drawing. But that is because he feels he has already won it, as the owner of the most popular lottery office in the country of the biggest lottery players in the world.

title: A Showcase of Tibetan Culture Serves Chinese Political Goals
description: BATANG GRASSLANDS, China  Women came in finery, wearing bright silk dresses, silver belts and necklaces with turquoise and coral. Men sauntered across the field in boots and cowboy hats. Some nomads had ridden motorcycles for days from valleys in Sichuan Province.

title: Panthers at Giants Matchup
description: 1 p.m., Fox

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Turning to Medical Professionals for Treatment of Migraines

title: Norway Offers Migrants a Lesson in How to Treat Women
description: SANDNES, Norway  When he first arrived in Europe, Abdu Osman Kelifa, a Muslim asylum seeker from the Horn of Africa, was shocked to see women in skimpy clothes drinking alcohol and kissing in public. Back home, he said, only prostitutes do that, and in locally made movies couples only hug but never kiss.

title: Russia May Aid Comrade Tourists Who Were Really Soldiers
description: MOSCOW  The soldiers were told to grow their hair long and were given civilian clothes. From then on, their superiors said, they would be addressed  and were to address one another  as comrade tourist as they sailed aboard a cruise liner to Syria.

title: The Knick Season 2 Finale: Heal Thyself?
description: Is Thack alive? Its up to Cinemax. And probably Steven Soderbergh. And maybe Clive Owen.

title: Rebranding
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Were word lovers, arent we, so when those words are in the wrong order or perhaps written incorrectly according to the rules of grammar, it makes us stop, at the very least, and take a second look. Some people even break their pencils in half.

title: Senate Votes to Overhaul Chemical Safety and Ban Beads in Beauty Products
description: WASHINGTON  In a flurry of year-end legislative activity, the Senate last week approved a bill to overhaul the nations chemical safety system, and a separate measure to ban the use of tiny plastic beads in beauty products that can pollute waterways and harm marine life.

title: Turkey to Continue Withdrawal of Troops From Northern Iraq
description: ISTANBUL  Turkey announced on Saturday that it would continue to withdraw its troops from a military base in northern Iraq, saying that there had been miscommunication with Baghdad regarding the deployment of the forces, sent as part of a mission to train Kurdish and Sunni Arab forces in the fight against the Islamic State.

title: U.S. and Cuba at Odds Over Exodus of the Islands Doctors
description: As he came of age in Cuba, Jos Angel Snchez enrolled in medical school for the usual reasons: to help the sick and to make a better living than most in his destitute eastern town. But he had another motive, too.

title: Who Made the Most Ridiculous Comment of the Democratic Debate?
description: When the Republican presidential candidates gathered for their third debate, we asked you which of them made the most ridiculous comment of the evening. Now its time to answer the same question for the Democrats. Hear something especially absurd tonight? Use the form below to tell us about it, and well publish a selection of your comments in a future post.

title: Democratic Party Defends Actions Over Data Breach as Bernie Sanderss Campaign Suspends Two Aides
description: The Democratic National Committee laid out a detailed timeline Saturday of what happened when Senator Bernie Sanderss campaign aides gained access to and copied Hillary Clintons proprietary voter data during a technological glitch, revealing new details to explain why it had blocked Mr. Sanderss team from seeing its own data.

title: In ISIS Strategy, U.S. Weighs Risk to Civilians
description: WASHINGTON  For months, the United States military has known that the Islamic State uses the city hall in Raqqa, Syria, as an administrative center and a dormitory for scores of fighters. Some American officials even believe that Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the groups leader, may have been in the building at times.

title: Third Democratic Debate Highlights
description: Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders and Martin OMalley had heated exchanges on issues such as foreign policy on Saturday in Manchester, N.H., during the third Democratic presidential debate.

title: The Third Democratic Presidential Debate
description: The Third Democratic Presidential Debate

title: With Bulls Depleted by Marathon, the Knicks Take Advantage
description: As the final buzzer sounded in the Bulls four-overtime loss to the Detroit Pistons late Friday night, it was almost as if Chicago was losing two games in the standings at once.

title: Dickie Moore, a Feisty Piece of a Canadiens Dynasty, Dies at 84
description: Dickie Moore, a Hockey Hall of Famer who played on six Stanley Cup championship teams with the Montreal Canadiens and won two straight N.H.L. point-scoring titles, died on Saturday in Montreal. He was 84.

title: Bernie Sanders Falls Behind in a Race Centered on Security
description: GOFFSTOWN, N.H.  In his opening remarks at the Democratic presidential debate on Saturday, Senator Bernie Sanders railed against establishment politics and establishment economics and then the nations rigged economy. He moved on to the corrupt campaign finance system, then the planetary crisis of climate change. Only after that did he say he wanted to destroy the Islamic State.

title: Stephanie Guzzo, Andrew Filauro
description: Stephanie Lauren Guzzo, a daughter of Carlene E. Guzzo and Joseph G. Guzzo of Bel Air, Md., was married Saturday evening to Andrew Donald Filauro, a son of Susan Hunt Filauro and Alan Filauro of Denville, N.J. The Rev. William Spacek, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Alphonsus Roman Catholic Church in Baltimore.

title: Emily Myers, Steven Danford
description: Emily Vale Myers, a daughter of Nancy L. Holland of Akron, Ohio, and John F. Myers, also of Akron, was married Saturday to Steven Philip Danford, the son of Gail M. Danford and Philip J. Danford of Akron. The Rev. Ralph Sean led the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Cathedral of St. John the Evangelist in Cleveland.

title: Julia Bottiny, Hampton Barclay
description: Julia Elizabeth Bottiny and Hampton Sutphin Barclay were married Saturday evening at the Torpedo Factory Art Center in Alexandria, Va. Andrew Holbein, a Universal Life minister and friend of the couple, officiated.

title: Carly Olsman, Jason Bradford
description: Carly Grossman Olsman, the daughter of Barbara L. G. Olsman and Jules B. Olsman of Huntington Woods, Mich., was married Saturday evening to Jason Michael Bradford, the son of Lisa A. Bradford and Darryl M. Bradford of Northbrook, Ill. Rabbi Paul Cohen officiated in the Art Institute of Chicago.

title: Kate Ortbahn, Luke Pettyjohn
description: Kate Marie Ortbahn, a daughter of Jule N. Ortbahn and Mark D. Ortbahn of Chandler, Ariz., is to be married Sunday to Luke Michael Pettyjohn, a son of Theresa J. Pettyjohn and William B. Pettyjohn of Evans, Ga. The grooms father, a Baptist minister, is to officiate at the Fort Frederica National Monument in St. Simons Island, Ga.

title: Cynthia Sheps, Laurence Golding
description: Cynthia Sheps and Laurence Richard Golding were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Eric Gurvis at the Harvard Club of Boston.

title: Kimberly Daly, Christopher Bruno
description: Kimberly Anne Daly and Christopher Martin Bruno were married Friday afternoon at Cur of Ars Church in Merrick, N.Y. The Rev. Henry Leuthardt, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Elizabeth Fialkowski, Clinton Stieff IV
description: Elizabeth Mary Fialkowski, the daughter of Deborah J. Fialkowski of Timonium, Md., and the late Norbert S. Fialkowski, was married Saturday to Charles Clinton Stieff IV, a son of Ann B. Stieff and Mr. Stieff III of Brooklandville, Md. Paul Weber, a Roman Catholic deacon, performed the ceremony at St. Ignatius Church in Baltimore.

title: Marya Khalil and Dylan Otto: Autocorrect Stood Between Him and Destiny
description: Marya Raushanna Khalil, a daughter of Maria-Eugenia Muoz of Miami and the late Dr. Abdala F. Khalil, who also lived in Miami, was married Saturday evening to Dylan Richard Otto, the son of Harriet S. Otto of Stanford, Conn., and the late Richard A. Otto, who lived in New York. Jonathan W. Knipe, who is married to the grooms sister and is an ordained minister with American Marriage Ministries, officiated at the Vizcaya Museum and Gardens in Miami.

title: Nicolette Fedorov, Joshua Llewellyn
description: Nicolette Suzanne Fedorov, the daughter of Amy L. Fedorov and Anton A. Fedorov of Suwanee, Ga., was married Saturday to Ensign Joshua Michael Llewellyn, a son of Keri R. Llewellyn and Tim J. Llewellyn of Oakley, Kan. The Rev. Paul A. Flood, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the United States Naval Academy Chapel in Annapolis, Md., with Chaplain Lt. Cmdr. P. O'Flanagan, also a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

title: Amy Torpe, Alexander Ciucci
description: Amy Monica Torpe, a daughter of Ellen V. Torpe and James N. Torpe of Manhasset, N.Y., was married Saturday to Alexander Stephen Ciucci, a son of Rebecca L. Ciucci and John A. Ciucci of Richland, Wash. The Rev. Richard Baker, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of St. John Nepomucene in New York, with Daniel J. Ciucci, a brother of the groom and a Roman Catholic seminarian, taking part.

title: Magdalen Reeder, Joseph Borstein
description: Magdalen Suzanne Gardiner Reeder, a daughter of Susan Stevens Reeder and Charles G. Reeder of Laurel, Miss., was married Saturday to Joseph Isaiah Borstein, the son of Carole Neukrug Weisner and Leon B. Borstein, both of New York. The Rev. Jeffrey W. Reich, an Episcopal priest, officiated at St. Johns Day School in Laurel, with Rabbi Barry Altmark participating.

title: Elissa Farkas, Benjamin Halperin
description: Elissa Wertheim Farkas and Benjamin Samuel Halperin were married Saturday evening by the Rabbi Todd Chizner at Carlyle on the Green, an events venue in Farmingdale, N.Y.

title: Kiersten Salander, Alex Barnet
description: Kiersten Tyler Salander and Bruce Alexander Barnet were married Saturday at Central Congregational Church in Providence, R.I. The Rev. Rebecca L. Spencer, the churchs senior minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Stymied and Error-Prone, Jets Secure Winning Record
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Here came the Jets, soaring, striving, believing. The playoffs beckoned, if they could just get there.

description: It was also a way out of Cuba.

description: FRONT PAGE

description: Heres what you need to know about the weeks top stories.

title: U.S. Support of Gay Rights in Africa May Have Done More Harm Than Good
description: LAGOS, Nigeria  Suspicious neighbors and landlords pry into their private lives. Blackmailers hunt for victims on the social media sites they use to meet others of the same sex. Police officers routinely stop them to search for incriminating images and chats on their cellphones.

title: An Old-Media Empire,Axel Springer Reboots for the Digital Age
description: BERLIN  When Mathias Dpfner, chief executive of Axel Springer, and a handful of his top managers first set their sights on the United States three years ago, it was with notebooks in hand, rather than checkbooks.

title: Governing Party in Spain Loses Majority in Parliamentary Election
description: MADRID  The conservative governing party won the most votes on Sunday, but lost its majority in parliamentary elections that underlined the fragmentation of Spanish politics and left the countrys future leadership unclear.

title: A Stepmother, Losing Her Marbles
description: The game was simple. Two clay jars rested heavy atop our bedroom dresser, one loaded with marbles, one empty. Every time we have sex, I said, Ill move a marble to the empty jar.

title: 1940: Extreme Cold Weather in Shanghai Claims Hundreds of Lives
description: SHANGHAI  A homeless, elderly Chinese beggar who made his bed last night [Dec. 19] in an empty coffin in the French Concession was found dead this morning as a result of exposure. Every night since the arrival of cold weather recently the bodies of Chinese dead of starvation or cold have been picked up in the streets and alleyways where they were forced to sleep because of the desperate plight of Shanghais thousands of poor.

title: 1965: Fighting Continues in Dominican Republic
description: SANTO DOMINGO  Gunmen today [Dec . 20] machine-gunned the residence of civil war rebel leader Col. Francisco Caamano Deno as automatic arms fire continued to crackle throughout the city after weekend fighting that claimed at least nine lives. The new fighting raised fears that the shaky peace agreed to in September could blow apart, plunging this tense Caribbean island republic back into the chaos of this years four-month civil war.

title: Air France Flight Makes Emergency Landing in Kenya After False Alarm
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  An Air France jetliner flying over the Indian Ocean made an emergency landing in Kenya on Sunday after a suspicious device found in a bathroom turned out to be constructed of cardboard and made to look like a bomb.

title: Las Vegas Meets the Met, to the Distress of a Lifelong Opera Buff
description: So Barbara Leder did not close her eyes after all.

title: Commander of Hezbollah Freed by Israel Is Killed in Syria
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  A Hezbollah commander whom Israel reluctantly released in 2008  nearly 30 years after he took part in a notorious terrorist attack  was killed in an airstrike in Syria, Hezbollah and his family said on Sunday.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Hip-Hop Stars Support Mississippi Rapper in First Amendment Case
description: WASHINGTON  Musical tastes at the Supreme Court run toward opera. On Monday, a glittering array of hip-hop stars will try to expand the justices musical horizons.

title: New York State Prisons Take Steps to Track Complaints About Guards
description: Speaking from a Brooklyn courtroom in 2010, a federal judge delivered a rebuke to New York State corrections officials. The state had just agreed to pay $300,000 to settle the case of a former inmate who said a guard at Arthur Kill Correctional Facility, which has since been closed, had squeezed his testicles so hard while frisking him that he defecated on himself.

title: Bigger Tasks Are Looming for House Speaker
description: Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin is riding high.

title: Star Wars: The Force Awakens Breaks Box Office Records
description: Conventional wisdom holds that mass moviegoing is the pastime of another era. The cultural heat emanates from television now. Hollywood only churns out banal sequels and forgettable action films. Netflix is the new multiplex.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: Season 2 sinks back into the ocean, but its not the end of The Affair. Cant stand all that drama? Sing along to The Sound of Music, or tour some of Britains stately homes with Julian Fellowes, the creator of Downton Abbey.

title: Michael Moore on His Movie, Where to Invade Next
description: Its been almost 13 years since the bombastic film documentarian Michael Moore was booed at the Oscars for slamming the Bush administrations invasion of Iraq. He promptly found his Oscar statue keyed (hed won for Bowling for Columbine), and became the target of attempted assaults, death threats and a few truckloads of manure dumped at his Michigan home.

title: Landslide Hits Southern City, Sending Hundreds Fleeing, China Reports
description: HONG KONG  A landslide in the southern Chinese city of Shenzhen sent a sea of earth crashing into an industrial district on Sunday morning, sending hundreds of people fleeing and destroying at least 33 buildings, including three dormitories for workers, the local government said. Scores of people were feared buried under the rubble and mud.

title: Paul Ryan Defends Compromise in Passing Spending Deal
description: WASHINGTON  Speaker Paul D. Ryan said on Sunday that, through compromise, Republicans had advanced key priorities since he took office just a month and a half ago and readied themselves to reopen contentious fights over the Affordable Care Act and funding for Planned Parenthood when Congress returns early next year.

title: Cartoon: Heng on Arms Sale to Taiwan
description: The Obama administrations announcement that it would sell $1.83 billion worth of arms to Taiwan drew a swift rebuke from China.

title: Fiddler on the Roof
description: Scenes from the new Broadway revival.

title: Finally, an Explanation for Hillary Clintons Long Bathroom Break
description: GOFFSTOWN, N.H.  As the third Democratic debate faded to a five-minute commercial break, Hillary Clinton had exactly one minute and 45 seconds to walk out of the gymnasium at St. Anselm College to the ladies restroom and one minute and 45 seconds to return to her place on stage.

title: Bernie Sanders Campaign Says It Is Outpacing Obamas Record for Donations
description: Shortly after the Democratic presidential primary debate on Saturday night, Senator Bernie Sanderss campaign announced that he had outpaced Barack Obamas record for the number of contributions in a presidential race, with more than 2.2 million donations.

title: Rates Are Going Up. What Could Go Wrong?
description: Fire or ice?

title: Panthers Withstand Giants Rally to Stay Undefeated
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  On the third play of the Giants game with the Carolina Panthers on Sunday, wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. dropped a near-certain touchdown pass. It seemed a premonition for the browbeaten Giants, and Beckham, the focus of the teams offense, did not catch a pass in the first half.

title: Dance Machine of the 21st Century Imparts Vintage Broadway Steps to a New Generation
description: Gemze de Lappe clapped her hands in frustration, and the piano went silent. She walked to the center of the studio, which overlooks 42nd Street, and demonstrated to a dancer how to properly swoon over a man. Its, Oh my God, hes so beautiful, she said, clutching her heart and then spreading her arms. This time, dont be fancy. Another attempt, another correction, and then Ms. de Lappe walked away, satisfied for the time being.

title: Review: Berlin Philharmonics Pellas et Mlisande Boldly Stretches Boundaries
description: BERLIN  After a long tour with the complete cycle of Beethoven symphonies, which took in Paris and Vienna on its way to five largely sold-out nights at Carnegie Hall in November, the Berlin Philharmonic and its conductor, Simon Rattle, have returned to normal scheduling.

title: SEC Turns to Footballs Deep Pockets to Help Shallower Basketball League
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala.  Avery Johnson, Alabamas new basketball coach, lapsed into the local dialect last month while answering a question about who would start at point guard in the season opener the next week.

title: Behind Making a Murderer, a New Documentary Series on Netflix
description: In 2003, Steven Avery, a Wisconsin man who had served 18 years in prison for sexual assault, was exonerated through DNA evidence. The victim in the original crime apologized to Mr. Avery and a state bill devised to minimize such wrongful convictions took his name. The high-profile case became a calling card for the Wisconsin Innocence Project, a local version of the national nonprofit devoted to helping those wrongly accused.

title: Review: A Grand Tribute to the Little Sparrow dith Piaf
description: The Little Sparrow dipped and soared through Town Hall on Saturday evening, as a roster that included many downtown performers sang the praises of the French chanteuse dith Piaf in a swift, dramatically charged centennial celebration. You may not have known, because the deafening clamor surrounding Frank Sinatras 100th birthday has largely drowned out appreciations of Piaf, who was born in Paris seven days later, on Dec. 19, 1915, and is as important a figure in popular music in France as Sinatra is in the United States. In their ability to convey the raw essence of experience, both had the instincts of wild animals.

title: In Paris, Archivists Preserve Tokens of Grief
description: PARIS  On a recent afternoon in the storage room of an imposing gray building in northeastern Paris, Mathilde Pintault cut open a sheet of clear plastic and pulled out a childs drawing, its colors blurred by water. She carefully placed it on special moisture-absorbing paper and put it on a shelf to dry.

title: Review: The Point of Vanishing, Howard Axelrods Memoir About Solitude
description: Howard Axelrod was a junior at Harvard in 1994, chasing a basketball during a pickup game, when another players finger accidentally hooked deeply into his right eye. His retina was detached and, worse, his optic nerve severed.

title: Unnamed Object
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  There comes a time in everyones life when you start to forget the, um, WHATCHAMACALLITs for things. Oh right, the names for things. Also, the reason you came into the room in the first place.

title: Egypt Releases Student in a Rare Bow to Public Pressure
description: CAIRO  The Egyptian government took the unusual step on Sunday of releasing a 23-year-old student held on charges of belonging to a banned Islamist movement, in a rare bow to public pressure after photos of the student sobbing and hobbling on crutches went viral on social media.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Dec. 21
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Review: Meredith Monk and Anne Waldman, in Playful Collaboration
description: Though Meredith Monk is often spoken of as if she were a soloist, shes very often a collaborator, and a marvelous one. On Friday, she shared a program at Danspace Project with the poet-performer Anne Waldman and three other female colleagues. The evenings sole soloist was Ms. Waldman, in the long opening number, Entanglement Variations, a work in progress.

title: Review: Bolshoi Babylon, Russias Famed Ballet Troupe in a Scandals Glare
description: In its Soviet years and after, the Bolshoi Ballet earned a reputation for valuing spectacle over substance, offering heroic force in place of refined artistry. Bolshoi Babylon, a documentary about the Moscow troupe that has its debut on HBO on Monday at 9 p.m., upholds that reputation without fully exploiting it. The film, directed by Nick Read, is full of sumptuous images  its more attractive than illuminating  yet despite the tabloid-bait subject matter provided by recent scandals, its surprisingly short on drama.

title: Hungarys Migrant Stance, Once Denounced, Gains Some Acceptance
description: BUDAPEST  Like most members of Hungarys liberal intellectual elite, George Konrad, a distinguished novelist, loathes his countrys stridently illiberal prime minister, Viktor Orban.

title: A Commander's Descent Into ISIS
description: The crucible of irregular war in Syria allowed Hassan Aboud to flourish as a rebel leader, and eventually become a commander for ISIS. He was killed in March 2016.

title: Disdain In Spain
description: Defenders of austerity have lately taken to citing Spain as a success story; actually, as I and others have argued, Spains recent growth reflects the combination of a leveling off of austerity and the slow effects of very painful internal devaluation. David Rosnick and Mark Weisbrot offer further analysis here.

title: Hospitality and Gambling Interests Delay Closing of Billion-Dollar Tax Loophole
description: WASHINGTON  In the span of a mere 11 days this month, $1 billion in future federal tax payments vanished.

title: Regulations, Doubts and Concerns May Thwart Railway Mergers
description: When it comes to railroad consolidation, most opponents hark back to the mid-1990s, when a series of mergers at the time were blamed for lost cargo, derailments, death and billions of dollars lost by businesses and taxpayers.

title: Donald Trump: Having Putins Respect Is Good for Me and the Country
description: Even the day after a Democratic debate, the presidential candidate holding the spotlight was Donald J. Trump, who took to the Sunday talk shows to defend his praise of the Russian president, Vladimir V. Putin, and his call for a Muslim ban, as well as to respond to Jeb Bush calling him a jerk.

title: As Downloads Take Over, a Turning Point for the Video Game Industry
description: SEATTLE  This holiday season could be remembered as a digital watershed for the games business, the moment when the old way of selling video games  on discs in boxes  finally gave way to downloads.

title: Da Vinci and The Simpsons
description: Dear Diary:

title: Behind the Black Flag: The Recruitment of an ISIS Killer
description: Hassan Abouds practiced baritone belied the malevolence in his words.

title: Police Say Bronx Father Choked Baby and Disposed of Body Upstate
description: A Bronx womans conversation on Friday with a hospital employee about the death of her son led to the discovery of the 2-month-olds body in a wooded area in Dutchess County  and the arrest of his father on murder charges, the police said on Sunday.

title: New York Sheet Metal Workers Case Highlights Persistence of Workplace Discrimination
description: The black, white and Hispanic craftsmen toil amid the bones of New York Citys unfinished office towers, threading air-conditioning ducts through ragged walls and ceilings, guiding the gleaming metal tubes from one set of hands to another.

title: Afghan Government Faces New Set of Rivals
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A political opposition of sorts to the Afghan government announced its presence last week, with warnings that President Ashraf Ghanis struggling administration would lose its legitimacy if it failed to hold long-delayed local elections within the next nine months.

title: A Plan to Rank Just Companies Aims to Close the Wealth Gap
description: Paul Tudor Jones II, the hedge-fund billionaire, has a plan to reduce income inequality. He wants to rate companies on their probity, not their profits.

title: Yemen Peace Talks End With No End to Conflict
description: CAIRO  Days of negotiations in Switzerland to halt the war in Yemen ended on Sunday with no sign of a resolution to the conflict and with the combatants engaged in some of their fiercest fighting in months, according to negotiators and diplomats.

title: Have Your Goose and Afford to Roast It, Too
description: Those who fret about the cost of holiday gift-giving can take some comfort this year that the prices of the fanciful presents, starting with a partridge in a pear tree, tracked annually as a humorous gauge of inflation have risen a scant 0.6 percent from last year.

title: Key to Opting Out of Personalized Ads, Hidden in Plain View
description: It has been seen countless times, yet it may be the advertising industrys best-kept secret. What exactly is that small turquoise triangle, often in the upper right corner, that appears in many online ads?

title: Welcome to Provincetown. Winter Population: Dwindling.
description: PROVINCETOWN, Mass.  This resort town at the tip of Cape Cod is such a popular destination, its promoters like to say, that even the Pilgrims landed here before they settled in Plymouth.

title: Cuomo Moves to Pardon Former Youthful Offenders
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York said on Sunday that he would seek out and pardon thousands of people who were convicted of nonviolent crimes as teenagers but have since led law-abiding lives.

title: The Years Biggest Social Justice Stories
description: I have always been interested in social justice, and it has always been an integral part of this column. But from the time, nearly three years ago, that I first spoke with Sybrina Fulton, mother of Trayvon Martin, I knew that the tenor of the column was forever altered. I am still haunted by the ache in her voice on that first phone call, by the first time I interviewed her in person and saw how the grief draped over her body, and bent it.

title: At 6 Feet 1, Hes Raising the Art of the Dunk to Another Level
description: With all due respect to the reigning N.B.A. dunk champion, the Minnesota Timberwolves Zach LaVine, the best dunk of 2015 was performed not at Barclays Center during Februarys All-Star festivities, but in a near-empty gym in Sudbury, Ontario, by a 23-year-old professional dunker from Canada.

title: Drone Registration, a Fight for Movie Screens and New-Home Sales
description: Heres what to expect in the coming week in business news.

title: French Ship Commands Naval Task Force in Strikes Against ISIS
description: ABOARD THE CHARLES DE GAULLE  This nuclear-powered aircraft carrier, bristling with modern warplanes, also offers a hint of old-world ambience.

title: Unwrapping the Mythos of Mast Brothers Chocolate in Brooklyn
description: The integrity of a cherished Brooklyn-based brand of craft chocolate bar has been called into question after a food blogger published a four-part series of posts this month that accused the two brothers who founded it of faking how they learned to grind their cacao beans, the ingredients in their candy and even their beards.

title: Ted Cruz Sharpens Tone While on Tour, in Nod to Donald Trump
description: KENNESAW, Ga.  He arrives on his own plane, dropping in for a stemwinder before jetting off again.

title: Josh Normans Defense Uncovers Odell Beckham Jr.s Dark Side
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Odell Beckham Jr. wowed fans last year as he compiled a record-setting rookie season despite having missed the off-season and the first four games of the regular season with a hamstring injury. Appreciation for his brilliance increased as his speed, elusiveness and penchant for photogenic one-handed grabs allowed him to stitch together six consecutive 100-yard receiving games, two shy of the N.F.L. record set by Calvin Johnson of the Detroit Lions in 2012.

title: Relishing a Respite in Hawaii, but Reality Is Never Far Away
description: HONOLULU  As President Obama left Washington for his annual year-end beach getaway with his family here, he had one last duty to attend to.

title: Abandoned Baby Found at Queens Church Inspires Adoption Campaign
description: After a newborn was abandoned by his mother and discovered in the crche of a Roman Catholic church in Queens last month, calls and emails offering help poured into the parish and to New York Citys child welfare agency. Many people, including members of the churchs own congregation, asked whether they might be able to adopt the child.

title: A Spirit Unbent Through Loss of Health and Home
description: When Margaret Macaluso speaks of her illness and losses, her voice is unwavering. She is resolved in the face of what cannot be changed.

title: After Cecil Furor, U.S. Aims to Protect Lions Through Endangered Species Act
description: Five months after a lion named Cecil was shot and killed in Zimbabwe by a Minnesota dentist, the Obama administration has decided to place lions in Africa under the protection of the Endangered Species Act, an action that will set a higher bar for hunters who want to bring lion trophies into the United States.

title: Austrias Biggest, and Only, Basketball Star
description: Jakob Poeltl is a standout in a country where the sport has little visibility.

title: Review: A Fiddler on the Roof Revival With an Echo of Modernity
description: The sorry state of the world gives us new reason to appreciate the depth of feeling so powerfully, so ingeniously embedded in Fiddler on the Roof, the much-loved and much-revived 1964 musical comedy that has returned to Broadway at a time when its story of the gradual disintegration of a family, and a community, strikes home with unusual force.

title: Jakob Poeltls N.B.A. Dreams Began in an Unlikely Place: Austria
description: VIENNA  In February 2010, at age 14, Jakob Poeltl attended an N.B.A. game, his first, between the Knicks and the Washington Wizards at Madison Square Garden.

title: Mondays Matchup: Lions (4-9) at Saints (5-8)
description: 8:30 p.m., ESPN

title: A Profitable Benefit  Left Open a Bit Longer
description: Since 2010, at least 15 companies  like Simon Property Group, the shopping mall giant, and Darden Restaurants, the owner of the Olive Garden chain  have taken advantage of a federal tax loophole allowing them to do a tax-free spin off of real estate into new corporate entities. Congress on Friday moved to shut that maneuver down.

title: Henrik Lundqvist Is Pulled Again as Capitals Bombard Rangers
description: Rangers goalie Henrik Lundqvist peered through his mask, decorated with a glittering kings crown, midway through what would be a harrowing second period for him on Sunday. He saw the Washington Capitals ever-dangerous Alex Ovechkin, unguarded and unhurried, measuring up his torpedo of a wrist shot.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: Oklahoma City Thunder at Los Angeles Clippers
description: Every week, The New York Times will choose one essential game to watch, highlighting hot teams, winning and losing streaks and statistical intrigue in the N.B.A.

title: The Wrong Miss Universe Is (Briefly) Crowned
description: For one brief, shining moment on Sunday night in Las Vegas, Miss Colombia, Ariadna Gutirrez Arvalo, was crowned Miss Universe.

title: Scout Leader Is Attacked by a Bear
description: A Boy Scout troop leader was attacked and injured by a bear on Sunday afternoon during a hike at Split Rock Reservoir in Rockaway Township, N.J., officials said.

title: The Affair Season 2 Finale: Youll Have to Choose
description: As promised, the season finale of The Affair solved the shows two-season-long mystery  Who Killed Scotty Lockhart? And in the ripely melodramatic spirit of the show, one killer wasnt enough. The two central female characters, Helen and Alison, unknowingly joined forces to do away with the shows most disruptive male force. (Noah is a disruptive male force too, but at least he changes diapers.)

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | sloth
description: sloth  \slth, slth also sloth\  noun

title: ISIS Territory Shrank in Syria and Iraq This Year
description: The Islamic State has lost 14 percent of the territory it held in January, according to a new analysis.

title: How Ted Cruz Connects
description: Senator Ted Cruz of Texas, a Republican presidential candidate, peppers his stump speech with pregnant pauses and energizes supporters by offering rhetoric about redemption for a country in crisis.

title: What to Watch Monday
description: The show must go on at the Bolshoi Ballet, even after the 2013 attack on its artistic director. James May of Top Gear finds unusual uses for classic toys. And A Place to Call Home, an Australian soap resurrected from cancellation, begins a new season.

title: The Best of Week 15 in the N.F.L.
description: As the Falcons won for the first time since Oct. 25, Julio Jones ended a long drought of his own, scoring his first touchdown since Nov. 1. He finished with nine receptions for 118 yards, giving him 118 catches for the season, a franchise record. The old mark (115) was set by his teammate Roddy White in the 2010 season. Roddy has been like a mentor to me, Jones said. Records are made to be broken. One of these young guys will probably break mine.

title: Driver on Las Vegas Strip Who Hit Crowd, Killing 1, Faces Murder Charge
description: A woman who drove her car onto a crowded sidewalk on the Las Vegas Strip, killing one person and injuring at least 35, will be charged with murder, but investigators are unsure of her motive, law enforcement officials said Monday.

title: A Guide to Fund-Raising, Tea Party Style
description: It seems Representative Ral R. Labrador has a considerable view of his singular ability to oust a speaker, tame federal spending and decapitate special interests. We know this, because he is trying to raise money by saying so.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: If we are funded for it and Congress says you are going to have a ninth cutter, I guess that is how it goes. But we are good with eight.

title: A New Cuban Exodus
description: Tens of thousands of Cubans have taken to the seas and embarked on perilous journeys by land this year, headed to the United States. The new exodus, the largest wave of Cuban migrants since the 1990s, is driven by hopelessness at home and fear that the unique treatment Cuban immigrants receive from Washington could end, now that diplomatic relations have been restored.

title: The Donald and the Decider
description: Almost six months have passed since Donald Trump overtook Jeb Bush in polls of Republican voters. At the time, most pundits dismissed the Trump phenomenon as a blip, predicting that voters would soon return to more conventional candidates. Instead, however, his lead just kept widening. Even more striking, the triumvirate of trash-talk  Mr. Trump, Ben Carson, and Ted Cruz  now commands the support of roughly 60 percent of the primary electorate.

title: The Missing Black Millennials
description: THE Democrats need young black voters. But the political party of our parents doesnt seem to know how to reach us  the black millennials they cant afford to lose  this time around.

title: Missteps in Europes Online Privacy Bill
description: The European Union could soon adopt a law that would strengthen online privacy protections for consumers, but it would come at a cost to free expression and leave a redacted history for Internet users.

title: A Medieval Antidote to ISIS
description: ISTANBUL  THE recent massacres in Paris and San Bernardino, Calif., demonstrated, once again, the so-called Islamic States ability to win over disaffected Muslims. Using a mixture of textual literalism and self-righteous certainty, the extremist group is able to persuade young men and women from Pakistan to Belgium to pledge allegiance to it and commit violence in its name.

title: From Farm to Table, via the Bronx
description: The huge Hunts Point produce market that stretches across more than 100 acres in the Bronx is the largest such food exchange in the world. The stalls that are loaded with fruits and vegetables from around the globe have sales of more than $2.4 billion a year. But only a small fraction of that produce comes from New York and New Jersey, which makes no sense when many local midsize and small farms are struggling to stay in business and consumers want fresh, local food.

title: Were Doomed. Now What?
description: The time weve been thrown into is one of alarming and bewildering change  the breakup of the post-1945 global order, a multispecies mass extinction and the beginning of the end of civilization as we know it. Not one of us is innocent, not one of us is safe. The world groans under the weight of seven billion humans; every new birth adds another mouth hungry for food, another life greedy for energy.

title: Should It Be Illegal to Declaw Your Cat?
FIFA Committee Bars Sepp Blatter and Michel Platini for 8 Years
description: With white whiskers sprouting from his chin, a bandage across one cheek and his tie slightly askew, Sepp Blatter, the longtime president of FIFA, appeared slightly unkempt on Monday morning. When he spoke at a news conference in Zurich, however, Mr. Blatter was simply unbowed.

title: Shenzhen, Embodying Chinas Growth, Falls Risk to It
description: SHENZHEN, China  Rescuers searched for survivors in a sea of red mud on Monday, a day after dirt and construction debris engulfed dozens of buildings in this city in southern China, the latest of several man-made disasters in recent years to lay bare the perils of the nations rapid growth.

title: Homeless Veterans Surviving Rape and Indifference
description: Mary Calvert has made it her mission to document the traumas encountered by female veterans, a group she said was the fastest-growing segment of the homeless population.

title: Homeless Veterans Surviving Rape and Indifference
description: Mary Calvert has deep ties to the military: Her grandfather was John F. Kennedys commander during his famed service on PT-109, and her parents met in the Army during the Korean War. For the last 19 years, Ms. Calvert has taught a workshop for military photographers at Fort Meade.

title: Obama Accuses Trump of Exploiting Working-Class Fears
description: HONOLULU  President Obama said in a radio interview that began airing on Monday that Donald J. Trump, a leading contender for the Republican presidential nomination, was exploiting the resentment and anxieties of working-class men to boost his campaign. Mr. Obama also argued that some of the scorn directed at him personally stemmed from the fact that he is the first African-American to hold the White House.

title: Higher Interest Rates Lower Expectations in Emerging Economies
description: PANGKALAN KERINCI, Indonesia  In this company town where acacia and palm oil trees stretch for miles, the Indonesian conglomerate Royal Golden Eagle is bracing for impact.

title: What Was the Biggest Trend of 2015  and Did You Embrace It or Skip It?
description: As we look back at 2015, trends came and went, but many stuck around long enough for people to talk  and blog and post on social media  about.

title: Do We Need a Safe Space from Donald Trump?
description: LONDON  Donald J. Trump and Maryam Namazie are divided by more than the width of the Atlantic. One is a reactionary, with bigoted ideas seemingly about everyone from Mexicans to Muslims. He is also currently a leading candidate to be the next president of the United States. The other is an Iranian feminist, living in exile in Britain, a fierce critic of Islamism and a defender of equal rights.
Melissa Clark

title: Germany, Refugee Nation
description: Theres a new can-do nation. Its called Germany. The United States, fear-ridden, has passed the torch.

title: Ted Hughes: The Unauthorised Life, by Jonathan Bate
description: Biography is a seers business, uncannily knowing, weird. Wyrd in the ancient sense, the Fate sense, its workings in thrall to a tale foretold. The early life points forward, the late life harks back, and every hour, day, year of the life in question seems to shudder with meaning, as if a soul has come in death to accept a new thesis, and must numbly play it out.

title: A Language for Grieving
description: On a hot May afternoon in Wallace, La., a friend and I visited Whitney Plantation, the countrys first historical plantation to focus on the lives of the enslaved. Our tour didnt take us down the oak-lined path to the great house as at neighboring plantations where you can hold your antebellum Gone With the Wind-themed wedding. Instead, we went from the memorial yards  one for those who lived on the plantation, another listing names of Africans and their descendants enslaved throughout Louisiana  to the sleeping quarters, past the jail into the kitchen. Last, we walked through the back door of the big house. Inside the house, it was hard to breathe. Before leaving we slipped back into the memorial yard and left a pebble on one of the carved granite slabs.

title: 12 Minutes of Yoga for Bone Health
description: Yoga enthusiasts link the practice to a long list of health benefits, including greater flexibility and range of motion, stronger muscles, better posture and balance, reduced emotional and physical stress, and increased self-awareness and self-esteem.

title: 12 Travel Apps Worth Keeping in 2016
description: Recently I deleted dozens of travel apps from my iPhone. Many are great. They allowed me to research unfamiliar places, listen to audio tours and turn my photos into postcards. But travel is about tapping the world, not a screen, so Im ending the year with an app purge. Ive kept only what I use often. An app didnt have to be new (most werent) to make the cut, but it had to make travel easier or significantly more enjoyable. Below are a dozen that have earned a spot on my smartphone heading into 2016.

description: California has billions of dollars to use on a new water supply infrastructure, but is so far unable to agree on the best way to store water.

title: California Wants to Store Water for Farmers, but Struggles Over How to Do It
description: FRIANT, Calif.  Californians suffering through the fourth year of a punishing drought have a new worry. With fierce storms predicted for the winter, they are bracing for floods by stockpiling sandbags and rushing to buy insurance.

title: Morning Agenda: Regulations Create Obstacles for Railway Mergers
description: REGULATIONS CREATE OBSTACLES FOR RAILWAY MERGERS | In the mid-1990s, a wave of mergers was blamed for lost cargo, crashes, derailments, death and billions of lost dollars. The move to consolidate had shrunk the number of major railroad operators in North America to seven from 56 and new rules came in 2001 making potential acquisitions harder. Now, those rules are being tested,Leslie Picker reports in DealBook.

title: Europes Small Banks Should Be Exempt From Some Bonus Caps, Regulator Says
description: LONDON  Small banks and some other financial institutions in Europe should be exempt from some of the limits on bankers bonuses, the European Unions banking regulator said on Monday.

title: Drink to Your Health (in Moderation), the Science Says
description: Over the past year, Ive tried to clear up a lot of the misconceptions on food and drink: about salt, artificial sweeteners, among others, even water.

title: 1915: Britain Asks for More Men
description: LONDON  In the House of Commons this afternoon, Mr. Asquith moved a supplementary army vote for the addition of 1,000,000 men to Britains armed forces. The Premier stated that Great Britain had at the present time a fighting force in the various theatres of war of more than 1,250,000 men. The wastage of men was enormous, and they should aim potentially at securing every man of military age who was physically qualified. Commenting upon the recent recruiting campaign, the Premier expressed his great appreciation and admiration of Lord Derbys efforts and added that the response from all parts of the Empire had been a magnificent exhibition of patriotism and self-denial. The New York Herald, European Edition, December 22, 1915

title: Portugal to Rescue Banco Internacional do Funchal
description: LONDON  The Portuguese lender Banco Internacional do Funchal will be split into a good and bad bank, with its healthy assets sold to Banco Santander of Spain as part of a state-backed rescue, Portugals central bank said on Sunday.

title: 6 American Soldiers Killed in Taliban Attack in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  In one of the deadliest attacks against American forces in Afghanistan this year, a Taliban suicide bomber on a motorcycle drove into a military convoy near Bagram Air Base on Monday, killing six American service members, United States officials said.

title: Oil Prices Slump to 11-Year Lows in Asia and Europe
description: LONDON  Oil prices hit 11-year lows in Asia and Europe on Monday, as a glut of crude on world markets and the recent global climate accord continue to depress fossil-fuel prices.

title: How Star Wars Could Figure Into the Oscar Race
description: Were in the home stretch before the holidays, that welcome respite before the awards machine cranks back into frenetic gear in the new year, and, as youve probably heard, a potential spoiler might have inserted itself late in the race. Spoiler isnt the right term, given that it was impossible not to be aware of the 8,000-pound gorilla that is Star Wars: The Force Awakens.

title: The Nerdiest Looks in Mens Fashion This Year
description: From bucket hats to braces, geeky staples re-emerged  better than ever.

description: LONDON  Standard Chartered said on Monday that it would make additional changes to its board of directors, with another director following several others out the door by the end of January.

title: A look at ZDDZ Londons spring/summer 2016 collection
description: The designer Dasha Selyanova united her designs under the banner of depression.

title: A Fashion Designer Finds Inspiration in Her Troubled Past
description: The designer Dasha Selyanova remembers being an angry child. Born in Saint Petersburg, Russia, in 1985, she was kind of dissatisfied with everything from the very beginning, she says. This later manifested itself as typical teenage rebellion (dyeing her hair), but by her early 20s, it had become an extreme  a drug addiction. I only understood what I wanted to do when I was 25 or so, Selyanova says. Before that I collected experiences. I have a lot of baggage to work with.

title: The Year in Pictures 2015
description: A selection of the years most riveting photographs.

title: Star Wars Exerts Force on Catwalk
description: Now that our year-in-review extravaganza has been published, and we have all digested the events and individuals that shaped our world and wardrobes in 2015, it is time to look forward. And even though its not yet January, I already have one prediction: Come February womens wear, the Force is going to be felt in fashion.

title: On a Mediterranean Island, but Far From a Mediterranean Diet
description: VALLETTA, Malta  The Mediterranean has long been known for its mix of sun, sea, fish, nuts and olives, a combination considered an elixir of health and fitness. An entire industry has emerged to promote a Mediterranean diet that promises to unlock the secrets of Greek and Italian islanders who stay active into their 100s.

title: Daily Report: The Video Game Industry Reaches a Digital Tipping Point
description: The video game industry has been in flux for years, evolving from people buying shrink-wrapped boxes of games that are played mainly on personal computers and consoles like the PlayStation and Xbox, to using digital downloads and online and mobile games.

title: Ex-Police Officer Held After Air France Bomb Scare
description: PARIS  A French passenger on an Air France flight that made an emergency landing in Kenya over the weekend because of a bomb hoax was arrested upon arrival in Paris on Monday, according to prosecutors here.

title: Lindsey Graham Halts His Bid for the Presidency
description: Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina suspended his presidential campaign on Monday, saying he had concluded that this is not my time, while arguing that his mix of hawkishness on foreign policy and pragmatism on immigration and the economy had made a difference in the race.

title: Court Reduces Ex-Traders Sentence in Libor Case
description: LONDON  A British appeals court on Monday declined to overturn the conviction of Tom Hayes, a former trader at Citigroup and UBS, for conspiring to manipulate a global benchmark interest rate known as Libor, but it did reduce Mr. Hayess sentence.

title: Eight Gifts for Family Game Night
description: Board and card games are among my absolute favorite holiday gifts  Christmas gifts, yes, but Christmas Eve, Hanukkah and New Years Eve gifts as well. Not that the New Years Eve gift is traditional, but maybe, when it comes to family games, it should be. Because games are not best given as one of multiple presents, nor, in a family, are they best given to one individual (although Ill forgive Santa his contributions in that regard).

description: For National Reviews 60th anniversary issue last month, instead of my usual movie review I did a short piece on what Back to the Future daythe arrival of the date, 10/21/2015, to which Marty McFly leaps forward from the Reagan 80s in Back to the Future 2 tells us about decadence. Not the decadence of orgies and debauchery, but the decadence of drift, stagnation and repetition, as defined by Jacques Barzun:

title: Obama Praises Zaevion Dobson, Slain Football Player: Hero at 15
description: New details emerged Monday about a night of violence in Knoxville, Tenn., last week that led to the death of Zaevion Dobson, a 15-year-old who was fatally shot as he tried to shield his friends from gunfire. The case had drawn the attention of President Obama, who called the teenager a hero on Sunday.

title: Hoverboards, Man Buns and Contouring: Readers Share The Trends They Skipped in 2015
description: As part of The Year in Style, we asked prominent personalities to tell us which cultural trend they skipped this year. In response, readers offered their own omissions.

title: Spanish Election Marks Another Rejection of Austerity
description: MADRID  European leaders and economists are still locked in a heated debate about whether austerity policies have done more to help or hurt people in the region, particularly in Europes heavily indebted south.

title: Chinese for Christmas, and Other Recipes
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: In Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, a Black Actress Will Play Hermione
description: LONDON  What do Harry Potter, Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger look like 19 years after Lord Voldemort has been vanquished? In Harry Potter and the Cursed Child, a play based on J.K. Rowlings novels about the wizarding world that is to open July 30 in the West End, they will look like Jamie Parker (Harry), Paul Thornley (Ron) and Noma Dumezweni (Hermione), who were announced as the lead actors in the two-part production on Monday.

title: In Missouri, Fewer Gun Restrictions and More Gun Killings
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Jean Peters Baker, the county prosecutor here, stood at her desk poring over Facebook photographs of young men posing with guns. One wore a grinning mask and pointed his gun at the camera. Another clasped guns in each hand. A third was laughing uproariously, his finger on the trigger of an assault rifle.

title: Hotel Reservations Are Becoming More Complicated, and Costly to Cancel
description: The deal on the website of Hilton Hotels & Resorts seemed like a good one to Jeffrey Buszkiewicz: A 72-hour online sale after Thanksgiving showed a $129 room at a Hilton Garden Inn in Manhattan for Christmas night. Two subsequent nights cost more.

title: The Financial Benefits of Buying What You Love
description: Eleven years ago, I needed a new bike. At the time, I rode a lot. I was in a big group of relatively competitive riders, and wed often put hundreds of miles on our bikes each week. I agonized over what bike to buy, but I kept coming back to one made by a company called Moots, a Colorado company that builds titanium road and mountain bikes by hand.

title: Tuscan Beans and Farro in a Hearty Soup
description: I went crazy for beans when I was in Tuscany in October. Theres a store in Lucca called Prospero, famous for its selection, where along with over two dozen varieties of legumes I found several soup mixes made up of different beans and grains.

title: Hindering the S.E.C. From Shining a Light on Political Spending
description: Lucian A. Bebchuk, a professor at Harvard Law School, and Robert J. Jackson Jr., a professor at Columbia Law School, served as the principal drafters of the rule-making petition submitted to the S.E.C. by the Committee on Disclosure of Corporate Political Spending and are the co-authors of the study Shining Light on Corporate Political Spending.

title: No Lightspeeding: Safe-Driving Messages Get Star Wars Twist

title: Carl Icahn Raises Offer for Pep Boys
description: Manny, Moe and Jack  and now Carl.

title: Times Music Critics SurveyBoxed Sets of 2015
description: THE mythology of a boxed set is often one of completion  it provides framework and boundaries to an artist, or a scene, or a sound. And these days compilations of this sort tend toward two directions  omnibus releases of an artists full catalog or ever-more-obscure digs into regional subcultures and other short-lived styles lost to time. In both cases, what seems like a full picture is often just a steppingstone to broader inquiry. A great boxed set doesnt end conversations; it begins them. Here, the pop and jazz critics of The New York Times spotlight the most provocative and curiosity-inducing collections from this year. More detailed information is at nytimes.com/giftguide. JON CARAMANICA

title: Aix Festival Director to Step Down
description: Bernard Foccroulle, the general director of the Aix-en-Provence Festival, plans to step down from his position at the end of 2017, the festival announced on Friday.

title: Toshiba Plans to Cut 7,800 Jobs as It Warns of Huge Loss
description: TOKYO  Toshiba warned on Monday that it would incur its largest net loss ever as it tries to restructure a stable of unprofitable businesses.

description: New York University is known for bestowing lavish perks on its leaders. Its new president, Andrew Hamilton, will be no exception.

title: Adeles 25 Is Now the Best-Selling Album Since Adeles 21
description: In the days before Christmas, not much is changed in the music charts  which, once again, means that Adele is No. 1 and everybody else is just lining up behind her.

title: Timeline on Lindsey Grahams Presidential Campaign
description: Senator Lindsey Grahams presidential bid started on a hot June day in his hometown, Central, S.C., but fizzled before the first day of winter, as Republican voters were seemingly swayed more by outsider candidates vowing to shake up Washington than a veteran foreign policy hawk known for working well with Democrats. Mr. Graham will resume waging his war against terrorists  armed with a quick wit and a sharp tongue  from the Senate floor, not from the White House.

title: Too Few Employees Monitoring New York Citys Nonprofit Shelters, Audit Finds
description: The New York City Department of Homeless Services, under review after a leadership shake-up last week, has too few employees to oversee the nonprofit organizations that operate its shelters, which house 12,000 families with children, according to a new audit.

title: At Muji on Fifth Avenue, Baking Dishes and Snacks to Go
description: The new Muji store on Fifth Avenue is the Japanese chains largest in North America and its flagship, too. On the ground floor are household goods including brightly glazed terra cotta baking dishes, casseroles, bowls and pitchers, exclusive to the store. There is an assortment of cookbooks and food, mostly packaged Japanese snacks like chocolate-covered puffed wheat, rice crackers, yuzu hard candies and raisin biscuits, with tea and latte mixes: Muji, 475 Fifth Avenue (41st Street), 212-447-1690, muji.us.

title: 1940: British Hold U.S. Citizen as Spy
description: ABOARD S.S. EXCAMBION  Oscar Stabler, thirty-six years old, the ships barber, a German-born naturalized American citizen, was taken off the American Export liner Excambion at Bermuda early this morning [Dec. 21] by British naval control officials who found a map on him. Reporting the facts to Capt. W.W. Kuhne, master of the Excambion, the British naval control officials took Stabler into custody for incriminating evidence.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 22, 1940

title: A Chimneys Poignant Surprise: Letters Santa Missed, Long Ago
description: Last week, Peter Mattaliano, 66, an acting coach and screenwriter, put up Christmas decorations in his Hells Kitchen apartment and laid out presents for the children: Mary and Alfred.

title: After Victory in Myanmar, Aung San Suu Kyi Quietly Shapes a Transition
description: NAYPYIDAW, Myanmar  Since her partys thumping election victory last month, Myanmars democracy leader, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, has said little and made few public appearances. So when she emerged recently in her constituency, she was mobbed by reporters and photographers, eager for some hint about how her party will govern after the new Parliament is seated next month.

title: Democratic Committee Digs Deeper Into Opposition Research
description: The Democratic National Committee, which considers opposition research it obtains on Republicans as a core function for the Democratic campaigns, has been buying reams of material from an outside group started by a close ally of Hillary Clinton.

title: Tall, Thin and Expensive
description: The slender skyscraper era dawns in New York in a billionaires row taking shape south of Central Park. (Source: The Municipal Art Society of New York)

title: As a New High Society Climbs in Manhattan, Its a Race to the Top
description: As recently as two years ago, only five towers in New York City topped 1,000 feet. Now, there are that many supertall towers in the works on 57th Street alone, and roughly two dozen either under construction or on the drawing boards across Manhattan and in Brooklyn.

title: British Authorities Accuse 11th Person of Rigging Benchmark Interest Rate
description: LONDON  British authorities said on Monday that they had begun criminal proceedings against a former Socit Gnrale employee in a continuing investigation into the manipulation of a global benchmark interest rate.

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch This Week
description: If you took vacation this week, lucky you. Your first present arrives on Monday afternoon, gift-wrapped by your friends at NBCSN.

title: F.D.A. Ends Ban, Allowing Some Blood Donations by Gay Men
description: Following up on a preliminary recommendation it made a year ago, the Food and Drug Administration said on Monday that the agency would scrap a decades-old lifetime prohibition on blood donation by gay and bisexual men.

title: Rap Stars File a Supreme Court Brief
description: An array of leading hip-hop artists, including T.I., Big Boi and Killer Mike, filed a Supreme Court brief in support of a high school student punished for posting a rap song that drew attention to complaints about sexual harassment.

title: Schools in Nashua, N.H., to Reopen After Threat
description: NASHUA, N.H.  Schools here were scheduled to reopen on Tuesday under a heightened police presence after being closed on Monday while law enforcement officials investigated a detailed threat that warned of violence to students and staff members at the districts two high schools.

title: Most New York City Elementary Schools Are Violating Disabilities Act, Investigation Finds
description: A two-year federal investigation has concluded that 83 percent of New York Citys public elementary schools are not fully accessible to children with disabilities, in violation of the Americans With Disabilities Act.

title: In Shkreli Case, a Company Lawyer May Have Crossed the Line
description: The indictment of Martin Shkreli, the widely reviled head of a pharmaceutical company that secured the rights to a decades-old drug and then increased its price more than fiftyfold, was described by a F.B.I. official as the securities fraud trifecta of lies, deceit and greed  nothing particularly new when it comes to defrauding hedge fund investors.

title: Weinstein Company Reaches Deal to Produce TV Shows
description: LOS ANGELES  The Weinstein Company continued the expansion of its television business with the announcement on Monday of a deal to produce and distribute shows in partnership with American Media, known for tabloid publications like The National Enquirer and Star, and Jupiter Entertainment, a producer of reality shows.

title: Shenzhen: The City Where Chinas Transformation Began
description: When China was opened to capitalism and foreign investment in 1979 by Deng Xiaoping, then the Communist Party leader, he chose to start with Shenzhen, a poor village in the Pearl River Delta near Hong Kong.

title: Donald Trump Wants Apology From Hillary Clinton Over Lies
description: Donald J. Trump embraced the part of political victim on Monday, accusing Hillary Clinton of lying about him and demanding that she apologize for saying that terrorists were using him as a recruiting tool.

title: Transparent Season 2 Finale: Its a Boy
description: After the intense end of Episode 9, the season finale feels a bit like a hangover: a slow, slurry reckoning with all of the pleasures, prejudices and pain the long weekend bore out. As Leslie tells Ali, sometimes the Idyllwild hangover lasts for days; sometimes for weeks. One has a feeling that for the Pfeffermans, the fallout is going to last significantly longer than that.

title: Spring 2016 Student Council Application
description: Are you interested in joining our Student Council this spring? Fill out this application by Jan. 12, 2016.

title: Casting a Black Hermione Granger Underscores a Key Harry Potter Theme
description: In the Harry Potter universe, wizards teleport through fireplaces, people hold conversations with paintings, and characters fly on brooms in a sport won by capturing a winged golden orb. Yet, apparently, its a stretch too far for some fans, who are responding on social media, that a character in an adaptation be played by a black woman.

title: When a Visit to Santa Touches Thousands of Hearts
description: As children across the United States have made the annual pilgrimage to meet Santa Claus in their local malls, every so often he has made a special effort or gesture that no one could have expected.

title: The Most Ridiculous Comments of the Democratic Debate: Readers Weigh In
description: When we asked who made the most ridiculous comment of the Democratic debate on Saturday, many readers pointed the finger at Hillary Clinton. But others offered criticism for Bernie Sanders, Martin OMalley, the moderators or Taking Note.

title: Theranoss Wounded Credibility Hurts Other Start-Ups
description: Theranos, a privately held blood-analysis company that is valued by investors at $9 billion, faces new charges of finagling with its herpes test, a product essential to its success, according to The Wall Street Journal.

title: Retrial for Officer Charged in Freddie Grays Death Set for June
description: WASHINGTON  A Baltimore police officer whose trial in the death of Freddie Gray ended with a hung jury will be retried in June, court officials said Monday, creating questions about whether the state would offer him a deal to testify against other officers in the racially charged case.

title: Domesticated Dogs Lag in Reproduction
description: Domestication of dogs has made them less able to reproduce, according to a new genetic study. Small population sizes and breeding for certain traits has led to an increase in amino acid variants, or changes to DNA that alter proteins, in dogs. Most of these changes to proteins reduce reproductive fitness, said Kirk Lohmueller, a population geneticist at the University of California, Los Angeles, and one of the studys authors. He and his colleagues compared the genome sequences of 19 wolves, 25 village dogs descended from indigenous dogs, and 46 domesticated dogs belonging to 34 breeds. Village dogs were more genetically diverse than domesticated dogs, and wolves were the most diverse of all. Domesticated dogs had roughly 115 more deleterious genetic variants that altered proteins than wolves. Dr. Lohmueller and his colleagues reported their findings in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences.

title: Obama to Appear on Jerry Seinfelds Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee
description: First he sat between two ferns to be interviewed by Zach Galifianakis, then he ran wild with Bear Grylls. Now President Obama is riding in a car and getting coffee with Jerry Seinfeld.

title: If Hillary Clintons Campaign Had Breached Data, Shed Be Forced Out, Aides Say
description: Aides to Hillary Clinton have expressed a range of emotions since it was revealed Friday that members of Senator Bernie Sanderss campaign had obtained access to a database of information about her supporters.

title: A Year of Disasters in China
description: A landslide in Shenzhen, China, which destroyed 33 buildings and buried dozens of people under excavated dirt and construction waste, was the latest in a string of deadly disasters linked to human error or activity in China this year.

title: Iran Says New U.S. Visa Rule May Violate Nuclear Pact
description: TEHRAN  A new United States visa restriction that applies to Europeans and others who have visited so-called high-risk countries has led to angry reactions in Iran, where some leaders say the decision is a violation of the nuclear agreement reached in July.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Re A Lost Species Crawls Back (Dec. 15):

title: The Great British Baking Show Is the Key to Understanding Todays Britain
description: It is becoming increasingly clear that Britain no longer really exists. Im not sure exactly how long this has been going on. Last year, for instance, the nation formed from the 1707 Act of Union between the English and Scottish crowns very nearly tore itself apart de jure, holding a nervous and fractured referendum on Scottish independence. The vote was eventually won by the No camp, preserving Britain as a political entity, but it was clear the moral victory had been lost regardless. The Yes campaign made an exciting and convincing case for an independent Scotland, to which people could be proud to belong. The No campaign, by contrast, utterly failed to make anything like a case for Britain as a concept  only a case that it was safer financially to preserve it. (For the time being, anyway: With our government apparently engaged in the project of extracting as much short-term value from the nations assets as possible, you worry that the very ground beneath your feet might vanish the moment it ceases to help some banker in Londons spreadsheet add up.)

title: Oberlin Students Take Culture War to the Dining Hall
description: Some students at Oberlin College are taking their demands for diversity and racial inclusion to the dining hall, asking for more traditional meals and criticizing what they consider poor efforts at multicultural cooking.

title: Reliability of Steelers Antonio Brown Is a Game Changer
description: Third down, 5 yards to go.

title: Peter Blake, Sgt. Pepper Artist, Still Going in and Out of Style
description: LONDON  At an age when many artists have seen their creative output slow, Peter Blake says he has never felt less constrained  and, at 83, he considers himself fortunate to have good eyesight and a steady hand.

title: Review: Philip Sparrow Tells All Paints a Samuel Steward Portrait
description: While reading about the peculiar life of Samuel Steward (1909-1993), it is almost impossible to believe that he was an actual man, rather than an operatic figment of John Waterss imagination.

title: Odell Beckham Jr. Suspended for One Game

But in the past two days, the incandescent Beckham has, at least, temporarily fallen back to earth with a stain on his shimmering image.

title: Slovenians Deliver Major Setback to Same-Sex Marriage in Referendum

title: Wheres The Rubiomentum?

So I paid a lot of attention when Marco Rubio was elevated to perceived front-runner status for the GOP nomination, basically because on paper he seemed like the natural replacement for the fatally charisma-lacking Jeb!

title: Warren the 13th and the All-Seeing Eye, by Tania del Rio
description: In the world of childrens literature there exists a well-established tradition of innocent, put-upon orphans suffering the cruel care of their over-the-top evil aunts and uncles. James, he of giant peach fame, endured the harsh attention of Aunts Spiker and Sponge; Harry Potter spent his pre-Hogwarts days locked in his tiny room beneath the stairs at 4Privet Drive by his Uncle Vernon and Aunt Petunia. The eponymous hero of Warren the 13th and the All-Seeing Eye is the latest entrant to this club.

title: A Classical Christmas, Across the Centuries

title: Review: Baroness, Rebuilt Without Edges, Plays at Saint Vitus
description: In the early aughts, the near-metal band Baroness was fully part of alternative culture, back when people still talked about edginess in music and could expect grave nods of understanding. Its first EPs were trippy and severe and grooving, alternately music for deep concentration or thrashing or long-division exercises. All in all, this felt like a new position.

title: Review: Michael Feinstein, Strolling Down Broadway and His Own Memory Lane
description: Thirty years: Thats how long Michael Feinstein, the astutely nicknamed ambassador of the Great American Songbook, has been performing in New York City. This former boy wonder, who once worked as Ira Gershwins assistant, recently turned 59. And on Sunday evening, he began a new chapter of his career with his triumphant opening-night performance at the club that now bears his name, Feinsteins/54 Below.

description: Goldman Sachs has named three partners of its investment banking division to its management committee, the latest round of promotions to this senior executive group after a few departures.

description: A former top trader at the Royal Bank of Scotland pleaded guilty in federal court in Connecticut on Monday to one count of conspiracy to commit securities fraud as part of the governments investigation into Wall Street bond sales practices.

title: Review: Darkness Laced With Sentiment in A Wilder Christmas
description: Thornton Wilders haunted little worlds seem so comfortable and familiar that its easy to ignore their ghosts and the specter of death that is never far away. Come in, sit down, have a bit of Christmas dinner, and pay no mind to the portal over there  the one that whisks people from this plane forever.

description: On Sunday afternoon at Town Hall, members of the Knights performed works by Judd Greenstein, Toru Takemitsu and Ravel without taking a break to highlight the three pieces similarities. When the lights dimmed after the violinist Colin Jacobsen played Mr. Greensteins lyrical, lilting Be There (2008) with the pianist Lise de la Salle, he barely paused before walking across the stage to perform Takemitsus Rocking Mirror Daybreak (1983) with the violinist Guillaume Pirard.

Muammar el-Qaddafi, was arrested in Lebanon last week in connection with the unsolved disappearance of Moussa al-Sadr, an exalted Lebanese Shiite cleric who vanished while visiting Libya in 1978, speculation sprouted about new information concerning one of the biggest whodunits in the treacherous politics of the Middle East.

title: Beckham Was Taunted With Baseball Bat, His Teammates Say
