title: Judge Rules Against Petition Seeking Sumner Redstone Interview
description: A California judge on Monday rejected a petition to have the 92-year-old media mogul Sumner M. Redstone interviewed by a geriatric psychiatrist as part of a legal battle over his mental capacity, calling the procedure an unnecessary invasion of his privacy.

title: Apple Pushes Against British Talk of Softening Encryption
description: WASHINGTON  With governments threatening crackdowns on encrypted communications after the jihadist-inspired attacks in San Bernardino, Calif., and Paris, Apple on Monday pushed back hard, arguing that lawmakers who talk about gaining court-ordered access to iPhone communications do not understand the technology.

title: Brazil: Fire Destroys So Paulo Museum
description: A major fire gutted one of Latin Americas most popular and respected museums on Monday afternoon and killed a firefighter on duty there. The cause of the blaze at the Museum of the Portuguese Language in So Paulo  or theMuseu da Lngua Portuguesa  an important landmark and cultural resource for the region, has not been determined. So Paulos governor, Geraldo Alckmin, told reporters that the firefighter, Ronaldo Pereira da Cruz, had died at a hospital. The museum is closed on Mondays, a fact that probably averted additional casualties. The museum, in a building in the historic city center that is more than 100 years old, is considered a trove of information on the history and evolution of the Portuguese language. Early signs suggest that the cultural loss may be minimized. We probably have many things backed up, Isa Ferraz, a curator at the museum, told the Brazilian television station Globo. Mr. Alckmin, who visited the scene on Monday, pledged his support, saying of the museum, It will be rebuilt.

title: Tennessee: Fallen Tree Causes Injuries at Vanderbilt
description: As many as 10 people were injured on Monday when a tree fell at Vanderbilt University in Nashville. The university said the victims, at least four of whom were taken to Vanderbilts hospital, were about to start a campus tour when a hackberry tree fell about 11:15 a.m., after an admissions office session for prospective students and parents. A tour guide was among the injured, a university spokeswoman said, and three of the victims were in stable condition on Monday afternoon. Vanderbilt said the accident appeared to have been caused by the weight of the rain-soaked tree.

title: Cuomos Pardon Plan for Youthful Offenders Draws Praise, Questions and Concerns

title: Rev. Rick Curry, 72, Dies; Used Stagecraft to Help the Wounded and Disabled

description: NEWARK  Few people are more excited about the emergence of Kristaps Porzingis than the proprietors of a mattress factory here by the murky waters of the Passaic River.

title: Robert Kobayashi, Artist of Whimsy, Dies at 90
description: Robert Kobayashi, who delighted and mystified passers-by for decades with the whimsical displays of his art in the window of Moes Meat Market on Elizabeth Street in the NoLIta neighborhood of Lower Manhattan, died on Dec. 14, at his home in Honolulu. He was 90.

title: $1.5 Million State Grant to Pay for Triangle Fire Memorial
description: For months, a group of labor advocates and victims descendants have been racking their brains about how to raise the $1.5 million needed to build a memorial to the Triangle fire of 1911 in which 146 garment workers died.

title: Trinity Church Campaigns Against Some Gun Sales at Cabelas
description: After pushing Walmart to remove high-capacity weapons from its shelves, Trinity Church on Wall Street is turning its attention to the sporting goods retailer Cabelas.

title: With Beckham Suspension, N.F.L. Belatedly Acts to Cover Itself
description: The N.F.L. did as expected Monday and suspendedGiants receiver Odell Beckham Jr. for one game.

title: SpaceX Successfully Lands Rocket After Launch of Satellites Into Orbit
description: People living along the central Atlantic coast of Florida have for decades enjoyed the spectacle of rockets headed for space. On Monday night, they were treated to a new sight that may become common: a rocket coming back down to a gentle landing.

title: A Working Mother Fights a Chronic Illness
description: Eight years ago, an inexplicable rash developed on Katerin Dones body. Swaths of her skin resembled misshapen continents on a warped world map.

title: Nigeria: Strife Puts Education at Risk for a Million Children, Unicef Says
description: Violence and attacks against civilians in northeastern Nigeria and neighboring countries have forced more than one million children to abandon school, the United Nations Childrens Fund, Unicef, said in a report issued Monday. The report said the conflict in the region, where the militant Islamist group Boko Haram has targeted educational institutions, has kept many children out of classes for more than a year, putting them at risk of dropping out of school altogether. The report said that more than 2,000 schools in Nigeria, Cameroon, Chad and Niger remain closed because of the violence and that hundreds have been attacked, looted or set on fire.

title: Chasing a Playoff Spot, the Jets Must Win and Hope
description: Instead of going Christmas shopping, as he thought he might wind up doing, Todd Bowles spent much of Sunday at the Jets complex. He and his staff analyzed film from the Jets 19-16 victory over the Dallas Cowboys and then started to prepare for their rematch with the New England Patriots.

title: Atypical
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Its almost Christmas, so it should come as no surprise that we have a relevant hidden message in todays puzzle by Tom McCoy. Its a jovial one, but its the puzzle itself that should put you in a good mood.

title: Obama Plans Summit on Migrant Crisis
description: HONOLULU  President Obama plans to host a United Nations summit meeting next year on the global migrant crisis and to spend his final year in office working to spur other countries and the private sector to contribute more humanitarian aid, his United Nations ambassador said Monday.

title: Flimsy Defense Leaves Knicks Fighting Uphill and Sinking Below .500
description: Despite playing lackluster defense and leaving the 3-point line vacant for the Orlando Magic for much ofMondaynight, the Knicks had opportunities at Madison Square Garden. Opportunities to improve their defense. Opportunities to take the lead. Opportunities to leave the building with a winning record.

title: Grand Jury Declines to Indict Anyone in Death of Sandra Bland
description: CHICAGO  Grand jurors in Texas declined on Monday to indict anyone in connection to the July death of a Chicago-area woman, Sandra Bland, who was found hanged in her cell at the Waller County jail, one of the special prosecutors assigned to the case said.

title: New York Detective on 3rd Tour of Duty Is Among Dead in Afghanistan
description: A New York City police detective who was among six American service members killed in a suicide bombing on Monday in Afghanistan was on his third tour of duty in the Middle East, officials said.

title: The Democrats Database Fight
description: The Democrats have finally landed on a bit of thrilling intraparty intrigue of their own. While Donald J. Trump has squarely occupied the role of supervillain in the Republican primary, crushing news cycles left and right like a mango-haired Godzilla, the biggest Democratic squabble so far has been over the role of the Democratic National Committee in its party primary.

title: The 2015 Sidney Awards, Part 2
description: This second batch of Sidney Awards, given for some of the years best long-form essays, congregate, coincidentally, around a theme: the excessive individualism of American society, and the ways human beings try to create community for good or ill.

title: Parents, Stop Obsessing Over Concussions
description: St. Louis  EARLIER this year, Jeanette, a 17-year-old high school senior, came to my office after her third concussion in three years.

title: Animated Life: The Living Fossil Fish
description: Imagine walking in the forest, and abruptly stumbling into a lumbering Brachiosaurus. That was effectively what happened on this day 77 years ago, when a South African museum curator discovered a coelacanth fish, seemingly unchanged from its prehistoric form, plucked live from the ocean. It was like finding a living fossil.

title: Limit State Access to Federal Court
description: NEXT month, the Supreme Court will decide whether to hear a case challenging an Obama administration policy that would give permission to millions of undocumented immigrants to stay and work in the United States.

title: The Security Council Wakes Up on Syria
description: After nearly five years and more than 250,000 lives lost, the major world powers have now agreed on a plan for ending the civil war that has torn Syria apart and allowed the Islamic State to greatly enlarge its regional foothold. A resolution approved unanimously by the United Nations Security Council on Friday puts the Council formally behind a plan negotiated over many months that calls for a cease-fire, talks between the Syrian government and the opposition and a two-year timeline to create a unity government and hold elections.

title: A Step Forward for Juvenile Offenders
description: New York is one of the most backward states in the union in the way it treats juvenile offenders, and it will remain so without fundamental reforms. But Gov. Andrew Cuomo took a bold step forward this week when he announced that his administration would seek out and pardon thousands of people who were convicted of nonviolent crimes while they were 16 or 17 years old and have stayed out of trouble with the law for a decade.

title: Congress Gets Out of the I.M.F.s Way
description: After five years of Republican foot-dragging, members of Congress last week ratified an agreement that will increase the capital of the International Monetary Fund and give developing countries like China and India a greater say in the organization. This should strengthen the fund at a time when its expertise is needed to help revive a slowing global economy.

title: The Charm in Our Stars
How Smart Animal Shelters Aim for Zero Kill
description: When Tracey Durning first met her dog, Fred, in an animal shelter in New York City in 1995, he looked underfed and was shaking uncontrollably. A five-year-old terrier mix with wiry hair, Fred had been given up by his previous family. Durning adopted him, set him up in a warm bed, smothered him with affection, and fed him well. The transformation was amazing, she said.

title: How Marco Rubio Could Lose All the Key Early States and Still Win
description: People who make bets on the presidential election give Marco Rubio a slight edge for the Republican nomination. But theres a catch: The same betting markets show that hes an underdog in all of the early states, and not favored in any of the Super Tuesday states.

title: Prison Psychotherapy
description: The curious thing about my sessions with Balsam was that I kept imagining her wearing a backpack, sandwiched between herself and the plastic chair where she sat. I was working as a psychologist at a maximum-security prison, and Id seen other inmates traveling the walkways with prison-issue clear plastic backpacks. But Balsam was in the therapeutic behavioral unit, for inmates with mental illness who had been placed in solitary confinement. Because they were rarely permitted to leave the unit, these inmates didnt need backpacks.

title: Japanese Human Resources Company in Deal for Bigger European Presence
description: HONG KONG  The Japanese human resources company Recruit said on Tuesday it would buy USG People, a Dutch competitor, for 1.61 billion euros in a move to get a firmer foothold in Europe.

description: On a warm Saturday night in November, about 800 gay men wearing harnesses and other items made of leather gathered at Brut, a party held at Santos Party House in Lower Manhattan.

title: Turkey Moves to Clamp Down on Border, Long a Revolving Door

title: Whats Your Favorite Poem?
description: JULIAN BARNES: A.E. Housmans The Laws of God, the Laws of Man, otherwise known as Last Poems XII. This poem, written circa 1900, is about independence of mind and independence of spirit. It acknowledges, while also undermining, the powers that seek to control the individual. I particularly admire, and am moved by, that final, ironic, defiant sub-clause in the penultimate line: if keep we can. Julian Barness new novel, The Noise of Time, will be published in 2016.

title: Courage on Trial in China
description: BERLIN  In April 2011, I was kidnapped by the Chinese undercover police at a Beijing airport and detained at a secret location for 81 days. After my release, the government charged me with tax evasion, even though most of the questions during my confinement centered on my political activities. They demanded that I pay back taxes and a fine totaling $2.4 million, and when I asked why the shakedown, one official replied, If we dont penalize you, you wont give us any peace.

title: Ted Cruz Presses Donald Trump in New National Poll
description: Ted Cruz is strongly contesting Donald J. Trump nationally, according to a new Quinnipiac University poll that shows the Texas senator essentially deadlocked with real estate mogul and front-runner in the race for the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Finding a Christmas Spirit Amid Deployment Blues
description: Its the most wonderful time of the year, until youre hanging a stocking that wont be filled, taking packages that belong under your tree to the post office, and sitting at your childrens school pageants by yourself. For someone who loves Christmas, my seasonal spirit has felt about as far away as my husband, a Navy helicopter pilot currently deployed. How do you find the wonder of the holidays when youre simply wondering how to get through them?

title: Focus of Criminal Justice Efforts Shifts to States
description: While much of the news media attention on a criminal justice overhaul has been focused on Congress, states have been the real incubators of proposals to trim sentences for nonviolent offenders and to ease their transition out of prison. Now, even as advocates for criminal justice change await action in Washington, they said they would be expanding their efforts in the states this year.

title: Crash Near New Delhi Airport Leaves 10 Dead
description: NEW DELHI  An aircraft carrying a team of technicians from Indias Border Security Force burst into flames after crashing near an airport boundary wall here on Tuesday, killing all 10 on board.

title: 1965: Belgium Protests Acquittal
description: BRUSSELS  Belgium officially told Austria today that it disapproved of the acquittal in Vienna yesterday of a former Nazi accused of murdering seven Belgian resistance fighters during World War II. Foreign Minister Paul Henri Spaak told the Austrian embassy of his governments surprise and emotion over the acquittal of Robert Jan Verbelen, a former major in the Belgian SS branch who became a naturalized Austrian after the war. Belgium had convicted him in absentia and sentenced him to death in 1947.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 23, 1965

title: What Do Jane Austens Novels Have to Tell Us About Love and Life Today?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Adam Kirsch and Anna Holmes discuss what Austens work says now, 200 years after Emma was published.

title: About That Bear: Alejandro G. Irritu Discusses Making The Revenant
description: A hellbent quest for authenticity produced some indelible on-set moments for Alejandro G. Irritu as he directed The Revenant, his two-and-a-half-hour opus of death, love and improvised surgery in the American West of the 1820s. But only one of those moments, thankfully, involved a bison liver.

title: Finding a Warm Welcome in the Elqui Valley
description: The hand-painted sign posted next to a rickety wooden footbridge signaled that we had found the home of Hermano Pacho, the best-known mystic in Chiles very mystical Elqui Valley. Loosely translated from Spanish, it said: My mission is to capture with science mankinds new humanity. I am grateful to serve everyone. Hermano Pacho.

I love the idea of gorgeous skin and an outfit that you wouldnt normally wear. I think every woman can relate to that. Heres how she gets the look.

title: Transgender Muslims Find a Home for Prayer in Indonesia
description: YOGYAKARTA, Indonesia  As the call to prayer boomed over this midsize university town on a recent Sunday evening, rows of conservatively dressed Muslim women laid out their prayer mats, bowed toward Mecca and murmured prayers in Arabic. As dusk fell, it was a ritual being carried out in mosques and prayer academies across the city.

title: British Forces Rush to Help Afghans Hold Off Taliban in Helmand
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Besieged Afghan forces were struggling to head off a complete Taliban takeover of the critical southern district of Sangin on Tuesday, and a new deployment of British troops was rushed in to help direct an increasingly pressed battle across the surrounding province of Helmand.

title: Locating Missing Mac Mail
description: Q. I seem to be missing some messages in the OS X 10.11 Mail app that I know I didnt delete, and they show up when I look for them with the main Mac search box. Where are these messages, and is there a way to get them back in the inbox?

title: 1940: British Flyers Blast 6 Nations
description: LONDON  From Norway to Italy, Royal Air Force bombers blazed a trail of fire and destruction last night [Dec. 21] as they ranged across the Continent to strike at oil supplies and war industries of Germany and her Axis partner. While some of the large forces taking part in the nights work attacked targets in the industrial Ruhr, central Germany and German-occupied countries, including Norway, France, Belgium and the Netherlands, others flew to Venice for the first time in the war and raided docks and factories at near-by Port Malghera. According to the Italian high command the British raided also the Adriatic port of Fiume, at the Italo-Yugoslav border.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 23, 1940

title: $16 Million for Brain Research, but $0 from N.F.L.
description: Researchers at several universities and research institutes were awarded almost $16 million Tuesday to find a way to diagnose, while victims are alive, chronic traumatic encephalopathy, a degenerative brain disease linked to repeated head hits in contact sports.

title: Celebrating Kwanzaa in New York
description: Doug E. Fresh recalled how incredible it was to go on field trips to the American Museum of Natural History when he was growing up in Harlem. He also has wonderful memories of his last performance at the museum eight years ago when he and Jamie Foxx took the microphone at a gala attended by Bill Clinton.

title: Nicolas Cage Agrees to Return Stolen Dinosaur Skull to Mongolia
description: Eight years ago, the skull of a Tyrannosaurus bataar was the star artifact in a natural history-themed luxury auction in Manhattan. It sold for $276,000 to an anonymous buyer.

description: Back in October we challenged teenagers to go out and experience works of culture that were new to them, then write about it for our first Review Contest.

title: Further Talks on Syria Are Planned for January
description: GENEVA  A new round of talks on ending the conflict in Syria will convene in Geneva near the end of January, the head of the United Nations in Europe said on Tuesday, as negotiators try to make further progress after the Security Council approved a diplomatic road map last week.

title: Artist-Run Gallery Finds a Home on Miami Dade College Campus
description: The wary tango between Miami artists and its real estate developers has welcomed a new dance partner. Dimensions Variable, a highly regarded artist-run alternative exhibition space, has ended its search for a fourth location in six years.

title: With In Vitro Fertilization, Persistence Pays Off, Study Suggests
description: In their quest to become parents, most infertile couples undergoing in vitro fertilization must grapple with a tough decision: when to call it quits. After three or four unsuccessful embryo transfers, doctors have long assumed that the chances of eventually bringing home a child were dismal.

title: The Rich Are Fighting the Superrich Over Britains Manicured Lawns
description: LONDON  The seasonal lights are strung along the main street. Vendors offer scarlet poinsettia and white-berried mistletoe and trees to be decked for a cozy English Christmas  hardly the front-line emblems of a war against the encroachment of the superrich.

title: $40 Million MoMA Gift from Kenneth C. Griffin Brings Naming Rights to Johnson Wing
description: The Museum of Modern Art has announced one of the largest monetary gifts in its history, a $40 million unrestricted donation from the Chicago hedge-fund billionaire Kenneth C. Griffin, whose name will now adorn one of the museums best-known buildings, the 1964 black steel-and-glass East Wing, designed by Philip Johnson.

title: Facts & Figures: The Embarrassing Donald Trump
description: Fifty percent of Americans would be embarrassed to have Donald Trump as president, according to a new Quinnipiac University poll. Only 23 percent would be proud.

title: U.S. Muslims Reach Out to Address Questions on Islam and Violence

title: U.S. Pours Millions Into Fighting Poachers in South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG  The Obama administration is stepping up efforts here to combat wildlife poaching, an expanding criminal enterprise in South Africa that has driven several animal species toward extinction and fueled the growth of international gangs.

title: New York Detective Killed in Afghanistan Is Mourned as an Unassuming Hero
description: Neighbors recalled his return after the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks, a New York City police officer back home in Nebraska to speak to high school students about life in his adopted city, after an unfathomable tragedy.

description: Mayor Bill de Blasio, opening a new front in his quest to expand workers rights, said on Tuesday that he would offer six weeks of fully paid parental leave to 20,000 public employees, making New York City among the most generous municipal family-leave providers in the nation.

title: Texas Reels After Teenager in Affluenza Case and His Mother Disappear
description: It was a case that captivated the nation, prompting a discussion about wealth and power: A white teenager from a well-off family killed four people in a Texas suburb in June 2013 while driving drunk. At trial, a judge gave the teenager probation after a witness testified that he had suffered from too much privilege  an affliction the witness called affluenza.

description: New construction in White Plains could help revitalize the citys downtown by adding about 2,000 units of housing.

title: In White Plains, New Places to Live and Linger

description: LBECK, Germany  The nearly one million asylum seekers arriving in Germany this year must navigate a complicated and uncertain bureaucracy that is struggling to accommodate migrants from cultures very different from Europes.

title: Juman Maloufs The Trilogy of Two and Edwidge Danticats Untwine
description: What kid doesnt go through a phase of wanting to be a twin? There are the possibilities of cute matching outfits and endless openings for pranks, and the whole mysterious psychic connection thing seems fun. Twindom also presents an appealing solution to the first existential crisis a sensitive child may face: Were born alone, we die alone, and  if you really think about it! were always alone. Not so for twins.

title: On the Trail of Kafka in Prague
description: When I awoke one recent morning in Prague from unsettling dreams, I found myself changed into a tourist on a mission. Changed, anyway, from the traveler I had been when I lived in Prague for three years in the 1990s.

title: What The Big Short Gets Right, and Wrong, About the Housing Bubble
description: The Big Short, the movie version of the Michael Lewis book about a bunch of misfits who foresaw the housing and mortgage bubble a decade ago and profited handsomely from its popping, is to be released widely Wednesday.

title: Prison Brutality at Clinton Correctional: Getting the Story
description: From our earliest visits to Clinton Correctional Facility, we heard stories from inmates about a fellow prisoner they claimed had been murdered. They didnt have a name for him, or even a year, and the details differed in parts. But the central narrative was always the same: An inmate was pushed down a flight of stairs by guards and then so savagely beaten he died.

title: Wassail
description: Food with a focus on vegetables at this cider bar on the Lower East Side.

title: At Wassail on the Lower East Side, in Praise of Smashed Apples
description: You can tell when restaurateurs choices are based on cold market calculus and when theyre driven by passion. If the passions are good ones, they can become contagious. Wassail is a Lower East Side restaurant that is deeply devoted to hard cider. After circling back again and again since it opened early this spring, Ive fallen under ciders spell, and Wassails, too.

description: A man was shot and wounded during a robbery of a luxury watch retailer at a crowded Long Island shopping mall on Tuesday afternoon, sending hundreds of holiday shoppers running in panic, the police said.

description: The Mets are close to completing a one-year deal with Alejandro De Aza, who will split time with Juan Lagares in center field, according to a person in baseball with knowledge of the situation.

title: Danish at Home: The Easier Way
description: Practically every bakery, supermarket and gas station in America sells Danish. Some are ethereal, flaky magic, puffed and browned from the oven; others are leaden, dull impostors. Either way, they have most likely been sitting around for some time.

title: Syrian Peace Talks Planned for January, U.N. Official Says
description: GENEVA  The United Nations special envoy for Syria, Staffan de Mistura, expects to convene a new round of talks sometime towards the end of January aimed at ending the Syrian conflict, Michael Moller, the head of the organizations Geneva office, told reporters on Tuesday.

title: Eli Kulps High Street on Hudson Opens in the West Village
description: High Street on Hudson The chef Eli Kulp and his partner, Ellen Yin, have created a version of one of their popular Philadelphia restaurants, High Street on Market, for New York. The outlines are the same: breakfast, lunch and dinner in a low-key, no-frills West Village setting with a retail nook for breads, pastries, sandwiches and other takeout. There are rye breads from an in-house bakery run by Alex Bois, as well as a malted sausage sandwich. Mr. Kulp, who was paralyzed in the Amtrak derailment last spring, has strong ideas about how his restaurant will function. In the evening, breakfast, lunch and the retail area will go away completely, and there will be a different menu, he said. And even though the restaurant has a liquor license, there is no bar. Theres an area where the staff mixes drinks, he said. It works for us not having a full bar setup. The room has big windows and is fitted mostly with bare tables and some counter seating at the open kitchen: 637 Hudson Street (Horatio Street), 917-388-3944, highstreetonhudson.com.

title: U.S. Imposes Sanctions Over Russias Intervention in Ukraine
description: HONOLULU  The Obama administration on Tuesday sought to tighten economic pressure on Russia for its intervention in Ukraine, imposing sanctions on dozens of individuals and companies it said were circumventing American and international restrictions.

title: Hillary Clinton Proposes Doubling Spending on Alzheimers Research
description: This past fall, Hillary Clinton met Keith F. Thompson, a librarian in New Hampshire who explained that he couldnt afford full-time care for his 84-year-old mother who has Alzheimers. Grasping Mrs. Clintons hands, Mr. Thompson said that he had to take his mother to work with him.

description: BEIJING  In convicting one of Chinas most prominent rights lawyers, the Chinese government has struck a body blow at an independent legal movement that until recently had managed to take root despite numerous obstacles, legal rights advocates say.

description: BERLIN  With the results of Spains election on Sunday, a tumultuous 2015 for Europe is ending on a stinging note that underscores Germanys increasing isolation and Europes deepening division.

title: As TV Ad Rates Soar, Super PACs Pivot to Core Campaign Work
description: WASHINGTON  Soaring advertising costs in early primary states are compelling major super PACs to realign their tactics, de-emphasizing costly broadcast commercials in favor of the kind of nuts-and-bolts work that presidential candidates used to handle themselves.

title: Once Praised as Role Model, Suspect in Las Vegas Crash Fell on Hard Times
description: The woman accused of driving her car into a crowd of pedestrians in Las Vegas Sunday night, killing one person and injuring dozens more, had been repeatedly chased out of parking lots where she and her 3-year-old daughter were attempting to sleep, according to a police report.

title: New Finance Minister in Brazil Seeks to Counter Pessimism
description: Brazils new finance minister sought to assure skeptics on Tuesday that the countrys economy, the largest in Latin America and seventh largest in the world, would reverse a slide that has been complicated by an enormous corruption scandal and impeachment proceedings against the president.

title: Dutch Old Master Paintings Exposed (in More Than One Sense)
description: LOS ANGELES  The 17th-century Dutch painter Isack van Ostade has long seemed tame, compared with his older brother, Adriaen, who is known for rowdy, sometimes cheeky scenes of peasants in everyday activities  often in the tavern. But recently, a painting in the British Royal Collection was cleaned, revealing the younger van Ostades own lowbrow humor in the figure of a man urinating in front of a dog. Now the Norton Simon Museum in Pasadena is sharing a similar discovery: Its newly restored 1641 Isack van Ostade painting of peasants butchering a pig shows a man defecating in the corner.

title: Netflix Increasingly Threatens TV Powerhouses
description: Netflix will be recast in the role of the bad guy next year. The video-streaming service was once derided as the Albanian army by the Time Warner boss Jeff Bewkes, but now is worth roughly the same $50 billion as his company. It may be too late for media bosses to do much about this beast, with some 69 million subscribers worldwide, that they helped create.

title: Songkick Sues Live Nation, Saying It Abuses Its Market Power

description: Athevening, graphic prints and layering at Carolina Herrera, Michael Kors and more.

title: Review: Men of Letters, John Updike and Jim Harrison, and Their Poems
description: John Updike and Jim Harrison are an odd couple to bring together in a review. Updike, who died in 2009, was a finicky and cerebral writer, fundamentally a neatnik. Mr. Harrison is backwoodsy and satirical. The shirt of his prose is perpetually untucked and perhaps stained with a splash of red wine.

title: Review: Where to Invade Next, Michael Moores Latest Documentary
description: Michael Moores latest documentary, Where to Invade Next, is a sprawling, didactic polemic wittily disguised as a European travelogue. Watching it made me feel like a deprived child with my nose pressed against the glass of a magical toy store in a faraway land. On one side is a happy, harmonious land of productive people. On the other is a world of misery, anxiety, war and greed.

title: Judge Bars Black Lives Matter Organizers From Mall Protest
description: A judge in Minnesota granted in part a request by the Mall of America for a restraining order against Black Lives Matter activists who have scheduled a demonstration at the shopping mecca on Wednesday, one of the busiest days of the year.

title: Review: In 45 Years, a Dead Flame Threatens a Marriage
description: Film is an art that plays tricks with time. A movie is a fixed, finite, relatively short experience  a hundred minutes or so in a given viewers life  that can span years, even centuries. The phrase real time, sometimes applied to movies that match their internal and external chronologies, expresses a wish and a delusion. In reality, as on screen, time compresses, expands, doubles back on itself and even, now and then, appears to stop.

title: Virginias Wise Move on Concealed Carry
description: In a step toward gun safety, the attorney general of Virginia, Mark Herring, announced on Tuesday that his state would stop recognizing concealed-carry permits from states whose permit laws dont meet Virginias standards.

title: Ford Recalls 313,000 Sedans to Fix Headlight Problem
description: Ford Motor is recalling about 313,000 older Crown Victoria and Mercury Grand Marquis sedans because the headlights may fail, the automaker said on Tuesday.

title: Ted Cruz Agrees With Donald Trump: Its Turning Into a Two-Man Race
description: NASHVILLE  Senator Ted Cruz said Tuesday that Donald J. Trump may well be right that this is turning more and more into a two-man race  delivering an unsubtle elbow to Senator Marco Rubio, who trails the two men in most polls, without naming him.

title: Sandra Blands Family Calls for Criminal Charges Against Texas Trooper
description: CHICAGO  A day after grand jurors decided not to issue indictments in connection with the death of Sandra Bland in a Texas jail, lawyers for her family urged prosecutors to press for criminal charges against the state trooper who arrested Ms. Bland.

title: In Make Music Winter, Critics Find Their Inner Yodelers and Pilgrims
description: If you ever teach a yodeling class, the comedian Jack Handey reflected in one of his Deep Thoughts segments on Saturday Night Live, probably the hardest thing is to keep the students from just trying to yodel right off. You see, we build to that.

title: A Conversation With Michael J. DeMarco
description: Mr. DeMarco, 56, is president and chief operating officer of Mack-Cali Realty Corporation, a real estate investment trust in Edison, N.J., specializing in office and multifamily properties. He and Mitchell Rudin succeeded Mitchell Hersh in June.

title: For Larry Wilmore, a Wagging Finger Replaces a Wink on The Nightly Show
description: This month, the Republican presidential candidate Donald J. Trump proposed a total and complete shutdown of Muslims entering the United States, the sort of outsize incendiary proclamation thats typically manna for the news-mockery industry.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing: Taliban, SpaceX, Donald Trump
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Mariah Careys List Is Short: All She Wants Is Immortality
description: If the forces of commerce havent completely secularized Christmas, Mariah Carey seems ready to finish the job. I, at least, can imagine a Nativity scenario in which the wise men reach Bethlehem and find Ms. Careys face glowing in the manger. Right now her 21-year-old Yuletide jam All I Want for Christmas Is You stands atop Billboards Holiday 100 chart, where its been, on and off (but mostly on), since the chart appeared in 2011.

title: Jeb Bush Says He Was More Successful as Governor Than Chris Christie
description: BERLIN, N.H.  Jeb Bush took a direct jab at Gov. Chris Christies economic stewardship of New Jersey on Tuesday as he campaigned in New Hampshire, a sign of Mr. Bushs growing anxiety about the rising stature of a rival whose campaign once seemed doomed.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Holiday on Friday: Christmas
description: GOVERNMENT OFFICES  Closed.

title: Unseasonable Greetings in a New York Searching for Jack Frost
description: Christmas, like other winter-solstice holidays, evolved in part as an antidote to the darkest, deadest time of year. What happens, then, when the weather outsides delightful and the carbon implications of a cozy fire are frightful, when there is no point in putting fresh-baked Christmas cookies out on the fire escape to cool?

title: Criminal Complaint Against Alonzo Knowles
description: Federal prosecutors charged a man from the Bahamas with stealing unreleased television and movie scripts, personal identification information and at least one sexually explicit video from the email accounts of a slew of celebrity actors, radio hosts and professional athletes.

title: Baby Avery Comes Home
description: Samantha Delgado's youngest son, Avery, was born prematurely and is often in the hospital. As a single working mother, in school full-time, she needed a little help setting up a stable home for him.

title: A Child, Born Prematurely, Who Fights Because He Wants to Be Here
description: Avery Salas was born after 24 weeks of gestation and weighed 1 pound 13 ounces. Given a 15 percent chance of survival by doctors, he has become his mothers miracle child.

title: U.S. Says Hacker Stole IDs and Unreleased Scripts From Host of Celebrities
description: An email popped into the inbox of a famous radio host this month, sent by a young man from the Bahamas, with an offer he hoped would turn the head of even an industry veteran: scripts for the first six episodes of a coming season of a hit television drama, the last of which was currently being filmed.

title: In Latest Mishap, Secret Service Agent Is Robbed of Badge and Gun
description: WASHINGTON  A Secret Service agent was robbed of his gun, badge, radio and handcuffs near the agencys headquarters, according to a police report, the latest in a string of embarrassments for a law enforcement agency charged with protecting the president. The report also lists a flash drive among the items stolen from the agents car.

title: New Plan to Fight Tuberculosis
description: The White House on Tuesday released a national plan to combat drug-resistant tuberculosis. Annual deaths from tuberculosis recently surpassed those from AIDS, according to the World Health Organization. The plan calls for more emphasis on fighting the disease overseas, and sets targets for the number of people worldwide who should be on treatment. But it includes no specific commitment of funds. David Bryden, an advocacy officer with Results, a nonprofit group focused on poverty, nonetheless called the plan the first clear commitment from the U.S. government to dramatically scale up treatment. The American Thoracic Society urged Congress to fund it.

title: The Year of the Toilet
description: THERE was, of course, the terrorism, and talk of immigration, and guns. But 2015 has emerged as the Year of the Toilet, when private business became part of a public debate about acceptance, inclusion, double standards and equality.

title: John Smoltz Named Lead Baseball Analyst for Fox
description: Fox Sports named John Smoltz, the Hall of Fame pitcher, its lead baseball analyst on Tuesday, replacing the team of Harold Reynolds and Tom Verducci after only two seasons.

title: 1950s U.S. Nuclear Target List Offers Chilling Insight
description: WASHINGTON  Target category No. 275 from the nuclear target list for 1959 may be the most chilling. It is called simply Population.

title: Ex-Brooklyn Teacher, Accused of Abusing 7 Girls, Pleads Guilty to Kidnapping
description: Sean Shaynak, a former teacher at an elite Brooklyn public high school accused of abusing seven of his female students, pleaded guilty on Tuesday to several crimes, the most serious of which was kidnapping. Under the terms of his plea, he will be sentenced to five years in prison.

title: Charles F. Harris, 81, Dies; Led Effort to Publish Work by Black Writers
description: Charles F. Harris, an editor and publisher who pushed commercial and academic presses to embrace black writers, explore black issues and court black readers, died on Dec. 16 in Manhattan. He was 81.

title: As Documents Show Wider Oil Industry Knowledge of CO2 Climate Impacts, a Take it Back Proposal
description: There are new revelations from the continuing InsideClimate News investigation of what the oil industry knew about the potential climate impacts of carbon dioxide from fuel burning even as it sought delays in related national and international policies.

title: Bedtime Reading, Written by a Robot Just for You
description: One of the best presents that Asi Sharabi ever got was a bad book.

title: New York Officer Is Charged in Arrest of Man Who Tried to Film Him
description: A New York City police officer who arrested a man as he tried to film him and other officers with a cellphone camera was charged on Tuesday with official misconduct and lying on a criminal complaint.

title: Christmas Around the World
description: Decorations and festive lighting for the holiday in cities around the world.

title: Saudi-Led War in Yemen Frays Ties With the U.S.
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United States on Tuesday sponsored a United Nations Security Council session intended to draw attention to the dire consequences of the war in Yemen, but the meeting also raised questions about potential crimes committed by a Saudi-led military offensive that the Pentagon actively supports.

title: Swimmer Rethinks Her Course After a National Breakthrough
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Like other fourth-grade girls, Courtney Bartholomew practiced a signature that reflected her future aspirations. But her mother recalled that while her friends scribbled the surnames of boys they had crushes on, Bartholomew, already hopelessly devoted to swimming, wrote U.S.A. at the end of her name.

title: Patricia Elliott, 77, Tony Winner and Soap Opera Star, Dies
description: Patricia Elliott, who auditioned for the role of Maggie in Cat on a Hot Tin Roof on a whim when she was 20 and went on to become a Tony Award-winning Broadway actress and a soap opera star, died on Sunday at her home in Manhattan. She was 77.

title: Disney Eyes Fusion Exit as Venture Struggles
description: The Walt Disney Company is in talks with the Spanish-language broadcaster Univision to sell its stake in Fusion, the joint venture started by the two companies two years ago, a person with knowledge of the discussions said Tuesday.

title: Leaks in Instrument Force NASA to Delay Mars Mission Until 2018
description: NASAs next Mars mission will remain earthbound for at least two years.

title: U.N. Wants Sexual Abuse Reported Immediately
description: UNITED NATIONS  Stung by a scandal at the United Nations over its failure to promptly protect child victims of sexual abuse by peacekeepers, the organizations top human rights official said Tuesday that he had ordered subordinates to inform him immediately when allegations of such abuse first arise.

title: Ruling Could Help Washington Redskins in Trademark Case
description: In a ruling that could bolster the Washington Redskins legal case to keep the registered trademarks to their name, a federal appeals court struck down part of a law Tuesday that let the government reject trademarks it deemed offensive or disparaging to others.

title: Accessibility as Challenge in Age of Uber
description: Two years ago, in Michael R. Bloombergs last days as mayor, he promised that by 2020, half of New York Citys yellow taxis would be accessible to people in wheelchairs and motorized scooters.

title: Resolute Obama Marks 5 Years After Dont Ask, Dont Tell
description: HONOLULU  A female Iraq veteran whose children can use her benefits and whose wife can receive her flag at her funeral.

title: Patients Fear Spike in Price of Old Drugs
description: Fred Kellerman, a retired car salesman from Los Angeles, was bedridden with a rare neuromuscular disease when he started taking a drug in the 1990s at Duke University in North Carolina. It changed his life.

title: Israeli Ambassadors Gifts Carry a Message
description: The Israeli ambassador to the United States decided to make a statement with his holiday gifts this year.

title: Concacaf, Embracing Status as Victim, Sues to Recover Travel Money
description: One of the soccer confederations at the center of the United States unfolding corruption case has started playing offense and, embracing the role of victim, has set out to reclaim tens of millions of dollars it says it lost through a kickback scheme orchestrated by its former leaders.

title: The King and I, With Hoon Lee as a More Tragic Monarch
description: New, pyrotechnic sparks are flying from the friction between the title characters of The King and I at the Vivian Beaumont Theater at Lincoln Center. Its as if the spirits of Spencer Tracy and Katharine Hepburn have entered the royal palace in 19th-century Siam, where Bartlett Shers Tony-winning revival of Rodgers and Hammersteins 1951 musical is set.

title: For Martin Shkreli and Others, No Comment Is Not in the Script
description: It used to be that money managers and entrepreneurs charged with a crime or civil securities fraud would keep their mouths shut and routinely refer any questions to their lawyers.

title: In the Dirtiest Cities, Air Pollution Forces Life Changes
description: Thick layers of toxic smog often blanket the skies in Hanoi, limiting visibility to less than a mile away. When the pollution gets really bad in Beijing, children are kept home from school or restricted to classrooms during recess. In Shanghai, a mother says she struggles to get her child to wear a protective mask.

title: New Rules to Eliminate Frustrating Financial Aid Problem
description: AFTER holiday celebrations are over, students who plan on attending college next fall should begin preparing for a looming financial chore: completing the document that is crucial for financial aid.

title: Botched Vote in ArgentinaReflects Trouble in South America
description: BUENOS AIRES  Seventy-five team directors had placed their votes in envelopes, and Argentine soccer was moments from electing its first new leader after 35 years under the rule of Julio Grondona, a strongman of Latin American soccer politics who died in 2014. But hope quickly turned to despair: The 75 votes somehow produced a 38-38 tie, a stunning rejection of basic mathematics.

title: Ban on Microbeads Proves Easy to Pass Through Pipeline
description: The words gridlock and Congress have become predictable neighbors in many a sentence about the federal government.

title: Speaker of the Words
description: and it was always said of him, that he knew how to keep Christmas well, if any man alive possessed the knowledge. May that be truly said of us, and all of us! And so, as TINY TIM observed, GOD BLESS US, EVERY ONE! Stave 5, A CHRISTMAS CAROL, Charles Dickens

title: Odell Beckham Jr. Is Lone Giant Named to Pro Bowl
description: A day after he was suspended for one game by the N.F.L. for unsportsmanlike and dangerous play, Odell Beckham Jr. was the only Giant named to the Pro Bowl. Beckham was also the teams lone representative in the Pro Bowl last season, when he was a rookie.

title: Editor Quits After Sheldon Adelson Buys Las Vegas Review-Journal
description: Michael Hengel, editor of The Las Vegas Review-Journal, announced his resignation on Tuesday, less than two weeks after the billionaire casino magnate Sheldon Adelson bought the newspaper and days after it published an article that was indirectly critical of the new owners.

title: A Waiter Who Serves Up Food, Drinks and a Classic Holiday Song
description: An hour before Broadway theater curtains rose last Saturday, a different kind of production reached its peak. The pretheater rush that typically blitzes Caf Un Deux Trois, a brasserie on West 44th Street, intensified as even more holiday tourists inundated the dining room. Scurrying servers, weaving busboys and whirling line cooks added to the frenzy. Still, one waiter, Michael Pollard, temporarily abandoned his tables to continue the restaurants long-running tradition.

description: As part of the magazines annual The Lives They Lived issue, we invited readers to contribute a photograph and a story of someone close to them who died this year.

title: Family, Football and Quiet Pride Defined Service Members Killed in Afghanistan
description: The six American service members who were killed on Monday by a suicide bomber in Afghanistan were part of a special Air Force team trained in counterterrorism, the military said on Tuesday.

description: The right-handed pitcher Mike Leake and the St. Louis Cardinals agreed to a five-year, $80 million contract.

title: What to Watch Wednesday
description: The Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. marches for voting rights in Selma; Robin Williams gives a final performance in Boulevard; and fans of Mythbusters can stay glued to the couch until the holidays are safely over.

title: Photography Without a Lens? Future of Images May Lie in Data
description: The optics of the camera obscura have faithfully served photographers for ages. The recipe has been simple: a lens, aperture, dark box and something to record the light.

description: The camera as we know it is changing: We are already seeing elements of computational photography, which relies on the idea that if you can capture visual data instead of a true image, the picture can be reconstructed with software.

description: Everybody pees.

title: Trump, Obama and the Assault on Political Correctness
description: Im so tired of this politically correct crap, Donald Trump told a cheering audience of South Carolina business leaders in September. Thats called politicians speak.

title: Seismic Political Shock in Spain
description: The Spanish election on Sunday turned Spanish politics upside down, offering  after Greece and Portugal  the latest striking evidence that voters in southern Europe are sick of austerity and losing faith in their established parties. Two outside parties in Spain captured enough of the vote to prevent the two parties that have alternated in power for three decades from forming a government without coalition partners. It is tempting to welcome this as a youthful challenge to politics as usual and as a fresh start. There is that, but the consequences of the election are too uncertain and the risks for Spain and for Europe too great to celebrate quite yet.

title: How Saddam Hussein Gave Us ISIS
description: WIRRAL, England  WHOM should we blame for the Islamic State? In the debate about its origins, many have concluded that it arose from the American-led coalitions errors after the 2003 invasion of Iraq. In fact, the groundwork for the emergence of the militant jihadist group was laid many years earlier by the government of Saddam Hussein.

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: Bernie Sanders: To Rein In Wall Street, Fix the Fed
description: WALL STREET is still out of control. Seven years ago, the Federal Reserve and the Treasury Department bailed out the largest financial institutions in this country because they were considered too big to fail. But almost every one is bigger today than it was before the bailout. If any were to fail again, taxpayers could be on the hook for another bailout, perhaps a larger one this time.

title: Finally, Urgency on New Yorks Homeless
description: In the final days of his second year in office, Mayor Bill de Blasio has stirred himself to greater action on homelessness. Under fire for months over a problem that he had promised long ago to solve  but one that he seemed inclined to dismiss or play down, or to blame on others  Mr. de Blasio stepped forward last week with a shake-up and a plan.

French Police Make 2,700 Raids in Month, Raising Tension With Muslims
description: The French authorities have conducted more than 2,700 police raids under a nationwide state of emergency instituted after last months deadly terrorist attacks in Paris.

title: A State of Terror
description: Daoud Muradyan, who is blind, was placed under house arrest under France's state of emergency, which was declared after the Nov. 13 terrorist attacks in Paris. The authorities have put 407 people under house arrest since then, requiring them to report to the police three times daily.

title: A Patient Is Sued, and His Mental Health Diagnosis Becomes Public
description: When a New Jersey lawyer named Philip received legal papers last year informing him that his former psychologists practice was suing him over an unpaid bill, he was initially upset they could not work out a payment arrangement outside of court.

title: Touring Europe in the Footsteps of van Gogh
description: A few months ago, I stood at the corner of a busy roundabout called Place Lamartine, across from the Roman gates leading into Arles in southern France, on a spot that was pivotal in the life of Vincent van Gogh. Behind me was the Rhone River, where he painted sparkling reflections from the quay on one particularly memorable starry night. Before me was a run-down commercial strip leading toward vast fields of the sunflowers he painted time and again.

description: SUKRUPASA, Turkey  The small squat structure, a cross between a kiosk and a duck blind, was starkly pale against the brown, soggy hillside a few hundred yards away.

Steve Nelson, who wrote the 1950 holiday song about the jolly snowman with Walter Jack Rollins, often visited the area and later moved there.

title: 13 Migrants Drown Off Turkish Coast
description: LONDON  Thirteen migrants, including seven children, have drowned after their boat capsized off the tiny Greek island of Farmakonisi, less than 10 miles off the coast of Turkey.

title: Fit Body, Fit Brain and Other Fitness Trends
description: The most persistent theme in exercise science in 2015 was that to live long, age well and maintain both a nimble mind and shapely brain, we must be physically active, but not for as long as many of us might fear or in the ways that many of us might guess.

title: Ted Cruz, at Rally, Recognizes Pastor He Says Changed His Fathers Life
description: NASHVILLE  The pastor looked out over the hundreds gathered here at a faith-based skate park, imploring them to follow. Most were strangers. Two knew him well.

description: While the default clock ticks on Puerto Rico and Congress races to come up with a last-minute financial lifeline, the frustration felt by many with ties to the island has a familiar face: that of Senator Marco Rubio.

title: 1940: Churchill Addresses Italians
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Winston Churchill, in a radio speech addressed directly to the Italian people, appealed to them tonight [Dec. 23] to realize that, as he declared, one man and one man alone  Premier Benito Mussolini  was responsible if they found themselves now at war and facing the armed might of all the British Empire. In an evident attempt to detach the Italians from loyalty to Mussolini, Churchill asserted that King Victor Emmanuel III, Pope Pius XII, the Catholic Church and the Italian people all had opposed Italys entry into the war.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 24, 1940

title: Which Senators Were Busy, and Who Stayed Out of Sight?
description: Senators who run for president are often criticized for letting their time on the campaign trail distract them from doing their day jobs. Missed hearings and skipped votes are par for the course.

title: Death and Shopping
description: During the months following my fathers diagnosis, I accumulated a trove of black dresses suitable for any season: a stretchy cotton knit tailored twice to achieve a respectable, but un-dowdy, hemline; a cap-sleeved wool blend trimmed in wayward chiffon; a flouncy crepe with a peekaboo keyhole sewn solemnly shut; a strait-laced lace, finished flawlessly at the neck, cuff and knee; a slouchy shift, gathered at the shoulders.

description: Secondhand boutiques and eclectic design shops share streets with kebab vendors in a part of the city favored by the creative elite.

description: Silicon Valley luminaries are easily mocked as having a precious, narrow take on the world. People in the tech industry cant see past themselves, critics often charge; they act as if the products they build sit at the center of everything.

title: Iraq Sends More Troops to Fight ISIS in Ramadi
description: BAGHDAD  Iraq sent battalions of reinforcements on Wednesday to secure neighborhoods in Ramadi recaptured from the Islamic State, as soldiers continued an offensive for a second day to try to take full control of the city.

title: Which Way Does the Wind Blow in the Republican Primary?
description: With just over 40 days before the Iowa caucuses, it is impossible to predict how the presidential race will shake out. But it is not hard to tell which way the wind is blowing.

title: Stephon Marbury Gains Museum, and Green Card, in China
description: BEIJING  This year is ending on an especially high note for Stephon Marbury, the former N.B.A. point guard who came to China five years ago in hopes of a new start and rocketed to fame and favor, leading the Beijing Ducks to three Chinese Basketball Association championships.

title: Below the Line: Editing Room
description: When making a film with a child actor, things can get unpredictable. Thats why strategic editing can be so important. That was the case with Room, Lenny Abrahamsons film about a woman (Brie Larson) and her 5-year-old son, Jack (Jacob Tremblay), held captive in a shed for years. The director worked, for the third time, with the editor Nathan Nugent to put Room together. The film, the first half of which takes place in a confined space that is roughly 150 square feet, maintains a sense of intimacy throughout.

title: The Greatest Beauty Tips of the Year
description: Pink cheeks look sweet, but theyre as erotic as they are innocent. For the flushed effect the makeup artist Lucia Pieroni gave models in Chlos spring 2015 fashion show, use an oversize brush to dust M.A.C.s blush powder in Just a Wisp around the face. It will look, Pieroni says, as though the glow comes from within the skin. Read more: A Rosy Glow

title: Highlights of Times Reader Response in 2015
description: Its been an eventful year at The Times. The paper hit the milestone of one million digital subscribers. It made great strides toward presenting the news more effectively on smartphones. And it introduced cutting-edge virtual reality journalism to considerable acclaim.
