title: Our Misplaced Nostalgia for Cassette Tapes
description: Los Angeles  EARLIER this month the Canadian singer Nelly Furtado, who has sold more than 20 million singles worldwide, released an album that almost no one could find, and even fewer could listen to. Thats because the recording, Hadron Collider, which she made with the musician Blood Orange, was presented in a format once thought long relegated to the trash heap of tech history: the cassette tape.

title: Ghosts in the Machine
description: After my father died unexpectedly in 2011, I went home to Virginia to help my sisters attend to his personal effects. His 60 years of life were soon dismantled with startling and mind-numbing speed. We sold his green truck, emptied his apartment, sorted through his things and then packed those up and sold them too. We had a to-do list, and we completed it. But when it came time to share the news beyond my immediate circle of friends and family, I froze. Social media seemed to be the quickest way to let people know why I had disappeared and why I would continue to be a ghost in my own way. But it felt wrong, even ghoulish, to announce the death of a parent in the same venue I might a new job. At that time, at least on my Facebook feed, people were rarely morose  at the worst, posting links to emo songs to hint at a breakup.

title: Migrant Workers in Shenzhen Bear Brunt of Landslide
description: SHENZHEN, China  When she heard the news, He Daxia rushed to Shenzhen, hoping some miracle had spared the lives of 11 members of her extended family who had disappeared after a cascade of mud from a collapsed mountain of building debris.

title: N.B.A. Lends Its Name and Its Stars to Campaign Against Gun Violence
description: The National Basketball Association, alarmed by the death toll from shootings across the country, is stepping into the polarizing debate over guns, their regulation and the Second Amendment with an advertising campaign in partnership with one of the nations most aggressive advocates of stricter limits on firearm sales.

title: Donald Trump Is Atop New Poll, Outpacing Nearest Three Challengers Combined
description: Donald J. Trump is heading into 2016 with a commanding lead atop the field of Republican presidential candidates, according to a new national CNN/ORC poll that shows him widening his advantage about six weeks ahead of the Iowa caucuses.

title: Banks Reject New York City IDs, Leaving Unbanked on Sidelines
description: Nearly a year ago, Mayor Bill de Blasio proclaimed that a new municipal identification card would help thousands of New Yorkers lead fuller lives, better lives, lives full of respect and recognition.

title: What You Get for  $1,700,000
description: A contemporary in Atlanta, a Spanish revival in California and an old farmhouse in Virginia

title: $1,700,000 Homes in California, Virginia and Georgia
description: ATLANTA

title: Extreme Santa
description: Ahead of the holiday, Santa Claus or his doppelgngers are spotted in helicopters, surfing and swimming with sharks.

title: Ad Portrays Marco Rubio as an Action Hero on Health Care
description: The main super PAC supporting Senator Marco Rubios campaign, Conservative Solutions PAC, is focusing a new ad, titled Some Republicans, on a cornerstone of his campaigns argument to the Republican base: his legislative efforts to trip up the Affordable Care Act.

title: Daily Report: Improving the Understanding of Tech in 2016
description: The last year has revealed a big problem in tech: A lack of understanding of it.

title: Fact Check: Marco Rubios Claim on Putins Acts
description: Candidate: Marco Rubio

title: Moving Old Programs to a New PC
description: Q. It has been a while since I bought a new Windows laptop. Is there a way to transfer over programs from my old laptop, or do I have to reinstall from the original discs? Whats the best way to transfer over the files?

title: Syrian Migrants in Istanbul Confront Choice: Stay or Move On
description: ISTANBUL  At Pages, a bookstore and cafe in a three-story wooden house in a tidy cul-de-sac up a hill in this citys oldest quarter, a literary refuge has blossomed for young Arabs in exile  mainly Syrians but also Iraqis, Libyans and Yemenis who have fled the troubles of home and taken up residence here.

title: A House South of Lisbon on Portugals Coast
description: The richly tiled home in the city of Setbal, inspired by 18th-century architecture, is on the market for $1.853 million.

title: House Hunting in ... Portugal
description: A HOME SOUTH OF LISBON ON PORTUGALS COAST

title: How Far to Moms House?
description: The distance between mothers and their adult children.

title: Barring of British Muslim Family Flying to Disneyland Touches Nerve
description: LONDON  An uproar grew in Britain on Wednesday over what many saw as an unspoken new American policy to bar British Muslims from visiting the United States, after revelations that a large Muslim family, including young children, bound for a Disneyland vacation was inexplicably stopped from boarding a London flight to Los Angeles last week.

title: When a Unicorn Start-Up Stumbles, Its Employees Get Hurt
description: On Sept. 4, employees of Good Technology, a mobile security start-up in Sunnyvale, Calif., awoke to discover that their company was being sold to BlackBerry, the mobile device and software maker.

title: The Typical American Lives Only 18 Miles From Mom
description: The popular perception of Americans is that they are independent and rootless, but the reality is that people tend not to move very far from their parents.

title: At Vigil for Brooklyn Crash Victim, a Call for Tougher Traffic Laws
description: It was the same sidewalk on which Victoria Nicodemus, a 30-year-old woman from Brooklyn, had been killed by a swerving driver about two weeks earlier.

title: Morgan Library & Museum Plans Old Masters Exhibition
description: Old Master works by artists including Durer, Raphael, Rembrandt, Rubens and Franois Boucher will be coming to New York in 2017, some for the first time, in an exhibition of paintings and drawings from Swedens Nationalmuseum, the Morgan Library & Museum announced.

title: Tamir Rices Family Clashes With Prosecutor Over Police Killing
description: The Cleveland grand jury has been conducting its work in private, investigating the police shooting of a 12-year-old boy named Tamir Rice that set off protests nationwide. But a steady stream of evidence has been trickling out to the public.

title: Icahn Vows to Outbid Bridgestone for Pep Boys
description: Carl C. Icahn plans to top any counteroffer from Bridgestone to acquire Pep Boys, up to $1 billion, although time is running out for the tire company.

title: A Fitting End for the Hottest Year on Record
description: With some help from El Nio, 2015 will almost certainly finish out its run as the hottest year on record with temperatures on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day predicted to be well above average across much of the United States.

title: Five Sculptural  and Unusual  Pearl Rings
description: This holiday season, the dainty accessory gets an architectural upgrade.

title: New Ads in Iowa Attack Ted Cruz Over Ethanol Stance
description: An Iowa Republican group will begin airing a tough ad that is aimed at Representative Steve King of Iowa and his endorsement of Senator Ted Cruz, pointing out that the Texas legislator is against the ethanol-supporting renewable fuel standard.

title: New Music From Mansion, Nadia Reid and Heather Leigh
description: EARLY LIFE

title: Jeremy Strong of The Big Short, Acting and Chewing Gum at the Same Time
description: On his first day of filming on The Big Short, about the buildup to the financial collapse of 2008, Jeremy Strong sought some finishing touches for his role. Right up until shooting a scene in which his character, Vincent Daniel, confronts a Standard & Poors executive, Mr. Strong was texting with Mr. Daniel, a real-life financial research specialist.

title: Frenchman Held in Jihadist Killing Commits Suicide
description: LONDON  A 35-year-old French deliveryman who beheaded his boss and then set off an explosion at an American-owned chemical plant near Lyon in June killed himself in his prison cell, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Written and Drawn by Henrietta and The Wonderful Fluffy Little Squishy
description: WRITTEN AND DRAWN BY HENRIETTABy Liniers60 pp. Toon Books. $12.95. (Picture book; ages 4 to 8)

title: Trinity Wall Streets Post-Christmas Musical Rush
description: Tempting performances fill the lineup at Trinity Wall Streets annual post-Christmas bonanza. On Sunday, Dec. 27, the program includes Brittens Ceremony of Carols and St. Nicolas; theres Bach at lunchtime on Monday, Dec. 28, and Christmas music from Latin America on Tuesday, Dec. 29.

title: 1965: Play May Cost Teacher Her Job
description: SAN DIEGO  A Mission Bay, Calif., high school teacher disclosed today [Dec. 23] that the California Credentials Committee has challenged her qualifications because of a one-act play she wrote entitled A Cat Called Jesus. Mrs. Geri Turner Davis, 31, a drama instructor, said the committee had told her to consider resignation or a hearing. The play deals with the friendship between a Negro held in a Southern jail on a charge of murder and the white daughter of the sheriff. Critics charged that a situation in the play  in which the daughter helps plot the escape of the murder suspect  is immoral and sets a bad example for youth.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 24, 1965

title: The 12 Recipes of Christmas
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Small Businesses Get a Permanent Tax Break on Buying Equipment
description: Tucked inside the mammoth tax and spending bill passed by Congress this month is a much-anticipated provision that will lock in a large tax break for small-business capital investments that has been temporary until now.

title: Ted Cruz Cartoon Is Pulled by Washington Post
description: The Washington Post pulled a cartoon from its site on Tuesday that depicted Senator Ted Cruzs young daughters as monkeys.

title: Alvin Aileys Less Traditional Spiritual Works
description: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater performs more than ever  the group now appears at Lincoln Center every spring  but theres something comforting about watching the company at City Center. Its home. The season winds down Sunday, Jan. 3, with a special finale program featuring Aileys Revelations. But as wonderful as that 1960 classic is, it can feel a little like The Nutcracker around this time of year  used and abused.

title: China Landslide: Man Pulled Alive From Shenzhen Debris After 67 Hours
description: A young migrant worker who spent days trapped under mud and debris from building collapses caused by a landslide remains the only survivor pulled from the wreckage of the latest man-made disaster in China, the official Xinhua News Agency reported on Wednesday.

title: Indiana Allows Christmas Alcohol Sales, but Many Arent Celebrating
description: MERRILLVILLE, Ind.  It is still illegal to buy alcohol at a liquor store on Sunday in Indiana, a red state holding fast to an old blue law.

title: Where We Shopped in 2015
description: Highlights from a years worth of Critical Shopper columns.

title: Shenzhen Landslide Casts Shadow Over Chinas Success Story
description: SHENZHEN, China  With little more than an architects drawing and a sales pitch to go by, Tim Chen paid around $500,000 last month for a small apartment being built above a shopping mall on the outskirts of this southern Chinese metropolis.

title: Jeb Bush Acts Very Merry About a Certain Holiday
description: ALTON, N.H.  Jeb Bush just wants to say Merry Christmas.

title: Living With Cancer: Shedding Tears
description: At times, I was so encased in the stoicism needed to endure cancer treatments that I could not feel much of anything unless someone else felt sorry for me.

title: In The Wild Bunch, Outlaws Cast a Long Shadow on Culture
description: It stands to reason that Sam Peckinpahs classic 1969 western The Wild Bunch would be presented in conjunction with the exhibition Walkers: Hollywood Afterlives in Art and Artifact at the Museum of the Moving Image in Queens. The show (running through April 10, movingimage.us) examines the influence cinema exerts on artists, and the shadow cast on culture by The Wild Bunch (screening on Sunday, Dec. 27) is vast.

title: James E. Hansen and Peter Sarsgaard on Climate Change and Karma
description: During the holidays, the art world is not exactly the gift that keeps on giving. True, there are wonderful exhibitions all over town continuing into January, but finding new ones is as tough as finding a taxi on New Years Eve.

title: Thrse Raquin Is Among Plays Facing Final Curtains
description: Last call! The January doldrums usually translate into a culling of Broadway shows that havent caught on, and shows both Off Broadway and on that are sagely ending limited runs.

title: Jimmy Buffett and the Coral Reefer Band, for New Years Eve in Brooklyn
description: Perhaps the best way to begin a new year is inside the amnion, a place of warm embrace and sensory calm, a place where fear is remote. If its your inclination to be so soothed, then spend New Years Eve with Jimmy Buffett and the Coral Reefer Band, headlining the Barclays Center with their feather-light island folk.

title: Mozart in the Jungle Returns
description: So are the rumors true? When the New York Symphony goes on strike, hell move to Los Angeles? A producer asks Rodrigo DeSouza that as he prepares to go onstage at the Hollywood Bowl. You have to come here, he adds. Save us, please. We hate our conductor.

title: Carmelo Anthony Tries to Drown Out the Din of Gunshots
description: Carmelo Anthony carries an often unfair reputation as the jejune hoop star, the man with a smile almost too soft and a manner too easy.

title: A Month to Embrace Unpredictability in Dance
description: Paul Taylor might seem like an odd way to get into a discussion of avant-garde dance. But once upon a time, he was at its forefront. In the documentary Dancemaker, theres a still image from Mr. Taylors 1957 Duet, in which, for four minutes, he did nothing more than stand behind a woman seated on the floor with her skirt draped over her legs. This work and others in Seven New Dances made history  as did Louis Horsts review in the magazine Dance Observer: four inches of blank space.

title: Heres a Brand Name: Scooter Braun
description: LOS ANGELES  On a recent morning, Scooter Braun, the talent manager and aspiring media mogul, arrived at the converted West Hollywood home that contains his company, SB Projects, in jeans and worn-in Vans. Cruising by his young staff, past walls of toy figures and a Ping-Pong table in the courtyard, he cracked jokes and grabbed a basketball from his office before being presented with paperwork. I just invested in an app! he announced after a few pen strokes.

title: A Trillion Here or There: The Details Arent What Matter in Trumps Tax Plan
description: On Tuesday, another think tank issued another analysis of Donald Trumps tax plan, which calls for a very large tax cut that mostly benefits the wealthiest Americans. The new report, from the Tax Policy Center, found the plan would lose $9.5 trillion in revenue over a decade.

title: This Seasons Breakout Star: The Border
description: Bud Buckwald and Ernesto Gonzlez are neighbors. They live side by side in a small Southern California city perched along the border with Mexico: Mexifornia. Bud is a disgruntled midlevel Border Patrol agent (think Archie Bunker on desert foot patrol), and Ernesto is a plucky Mexican immigrant who runs a successful landscaping business. Bud looks at the changing demographics of America and doesnt see a place for himself. His American dream is slipping away as Ernestos is coming true.

title: Father of Drowned Syrian Boy Delivers Christmas Message to Britons
description: After Queen Elizabeth delivered her annual Christmas speech Friday on the BBC, television viewers in Britain had the opportunity to change the channel and listen to an alternative message from Abdullah Kurdi, the father of the 3-year-old Syrian boy whose lifeless body washed up on a Turkish beach in September, prompting an outpouring of sympathy for refugees.

title: L.G.B.T. and Superpowered
description:
Its a golden age for queer characters in comic books. Some popular figures, like Iceman, have finally come out of the closet.
Others are being brought to life as lesbian or transgender.

title: Six Video Frames at the Center of the Tamir Rice Case
description: Six frames of security footage in the fatal shooting of Tamir Rice, a 12-year-old boy who was carrying a realistic-looking pellet gun in a Cleveland park, are in dispute.

title: Rand Paul Spreads Holiday Gloom With Assist From Seinfeld
description: It doesnt take a holiday for Senator Rand Paul to dish some snark to his opponents on social media, but in the spirit of Festivus, the Republican from Kentucky has stepped up his game.

title: Hillary Clinton Seizes on Donald Trumps Remarks to Galvanize Women
description: After Hillary Clinton attacked Donald J. Trump for proposing to bar Muslims from entering the United States, calling him ISIS best friend, Mr. Trumps response Monday night was angry and vulgar. He said her bathroom break during Saturdays Democratic debate was disgusting, and he used a crude sexual reference to describe her defeat by Barack Obama for the 2008 nomination.

title: Which Candidates Holiday Gear Should You Wear This Season?
description: With about 15 presidential candidates still in the race, the electoral landscape is awash in enough made-in-U.S.A. merchandise to revive American manufacturing. Retail analysts (this reporter) estimate that 14 million Iowans and New Hampshirites will receive gifts of campaign merchandise this holiday season. Roughly 70 percent of the rest of the nation is still getting Fitbits, because they dont care about the election yet.

title: Honda and Takata Discussed Faulty Airbag at 2009 Meeting
description: Explosions in Takatas airbags raised alarms at the highest levels of the airbag manufacturer and its biggest customer, Honda, more than five years ago, according to internal documents unsealed by a Florida court on Wednesday.

title: Art in Bristol, England, Moves Beyond Museum Walls
description: I was standing in front of Jesus. And he appeared to be break-dancing. Not only that, he was 28 feet tall.

title: 36 Hours in Warsaw, Poland
description: The city is positioning itself as Eastern Europes chic cultural capital with thriving art and club scenes and serious restaurants.

title: Brain Cancers Reveal Novel Genetic Disruption in DNA
description: Scientists who scoured the DNA of brain tumors, searching gene by gene for bad actors, were puzzled. The cancers had none of the mutations in growth-causing genes that are typical of other tumors, yet they grew quickly, with no brakes. The question was why  what had altered their genetic instructions to lead to runaway cell division?

title: Today in Trumpenfreude
description: You know what Im talking about, of course  that feeling of glee mixed with fear as one watches the cynical race-baiting of the Republican establishment finally come home to roost, confirming that you were right to be shrill (and the centrists were naive), but with the slight admixture of panic because one of these guys might actually become president.

title: Higher One, a Financial Aid Provider, Ordered to Repay Fees
description: Two federal agencies have ordered a major marketer of student debit cards to pay millions of dollars in restitution to users of its services for failing to disclose details about fees.

title: Popcast: Best Songs of 2015
description: Music critics for The New York Times discuss their favorite songs.

title: Popcast: Best Singles of 2015
description: Listen to this weeks podcast | Subscribe: iTunes | RSS | Stitcher| Audioboom

title: Israeli Veterans Criticism of West Bank Occupation Incites Furor
description: JERUSALEM  A few years after Avihai Stollar had completed his obligatory army service  which coincided with the second intifada  he was approached by a member of Breaking the Silence, a leftist organization of combat veterans that says it aims to expose the grim reality of Israels occupation of the West Bank.

title: Santa calls his son for Christmas
description: Mr. Riesers father once called him from work pretending to be Santa.

title: Checking Up On Obamacare
description: One of the remarkable aspects of the politics of health reform is the way conservatives  even relatively mild, seemingly informed conservatives  have managed to keep believing that Obamacare is unraveling, despite the repeated failure of disaster predictions to come true. Part of the way this works is that captive media and the rights pet experts hype every bit of bad news, but go silent when the news is good (and, often, when the bad news turns out to have been a false alarm.) How many will even hear about the news that enrollments are once again running above expectations, and the pool is getting younger?

title: Indian Regulators Suspend Facebooks Free Basic Services
description: Telecommunications regulators in India have ordered the suspension of Facebooks controversial program to bring free basic Internet services to mobile phone users in the country.

title: A Place for Comedians to Experiment
description: Union Hall in Park Slope, Brooklyn, has welcomed established comics as well as newcomers to perform offbeat shows in its basement.

title: Comedy Lab in a Bars Basement
description: On a recent Tuesday night in Brooklyn, the comedian Chris Gethard took the stage in the basement of Union Hall. Narrow and with low ceilings, the room filled up quickly, with people lining the wall and crowding the bar in the back. The show would be dark, warned Mr. Gethard, 35, before adding, Well get through it. It was his twice-a-month Career Suicide night  an hour of comedy about suicide, depression, alcoholism and all the other funniest parts of life, as the bars website put it. Taking the stage before Mr. Gethard that night would be the comedic juggler Marcus Monroe, who tells jokes between moments of juggling knives.

title: In New Hampshire, Jeb Bush and Chris Christie Add Guilt Trips to Campaign Stops
description: PETERBOROUGH, N.H.  The two leading Republican candidates not named Donald J. Trump who most need a victory in the New Hampshire primary have wooed voters here by promoting their experience, their tough-mindedness and their seriousness.

title: Queens Man Charged in Connection With 2012 Killing in Midtown Manhattan
description: The scheme involved pounds of cocaine shipped via United Parcel Service from dealers in Los Angeles to traffickers in Queens, and cash payments, arranged for by a California middleman on the streets of New York, ferried back.

title: Two Israeli Jews Stabbed, One Fatally, by Two Palestinians in Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEM  Two Palestinian assailants stabbed two Israeli Jews, one fatally, near a normally bustling entrance to the Old City of Jerusalem on Wednesday, and were shot by Israeli border police officers at the scene, the police said.

title: Turning Into Dwelling, by Christopher Gilbert
description: One of the few career advantages that a poet has over a tax attorney  the only one, maybe  is that the poets work has a greater chance of being remembered. Or so, at least, the thinking has traditionally gone. The sonnet, for instance, is practically built on the idea of poetrys unfading presence, from Petrarchs assertion that our art is that/Which makes men immortal through fame to Shakespeares claim that Not marble nor the gilded monuments/Of princes shall outlive this powerful rhyme. Similar rhetoric tends to appear whenever a critic is doling out high praise, whether its Randall Jarrell announcing in 1947 that some of Robert Lowells poems will be read as long as men remember English, or Jason Guriel writing in Poetry magazine in 2010, pretending to review Kay Ryan from a distant future in which shes become an inescapable literary influence. Poetry, we suppose, is like papyrus: It may be delicate, but it lasts and lasts.

title: In Brazil, 99Taxis Start-Up Jockeys to Stay Ahead of Uber
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  How does an aspiring entrepreneur navigate the economic and political crises dogging Brazil? Build a growing taxi-app start-up, naturally. The financing will come.

title: Backstage on Broadway With the Holiday Spirit
description: Like the Rockettes and strip clubs, Broadway theater is a New York entertainment that doesnt stop for the holidays. So how do the cast and crew of a Broadway show, having to stick to a typical eight-(or more)-shows-a-week schedule, make their theater a home worthy of the season?

title: 15 of the Best Journals by Our Reporters Around the World
description: Journals, a fixture of the international section, allow correspondents to step back from the news and write about places that intrigue them. We hope you enjoy our choices.

title: Looking Back at 2015 in Book Publishing
description: Audiobook sales soared, while e-book sales tapered off. Harper Lee came out with a second novel, 55 years after To Kill a Mockingbird, and a long-lost Dr. Seuss book was published posthumously. Millions of adults bought coloring books.

title: The Best Poetry Books of 2015
description: The poetry books published in a given calendar year usually take up about 18 cubic feet of space, and would thus fit comfortably into the average refrigerator. But if youre a book critic, you probably cant afford to decrease your living quarters by the volume of a major appliance every year for decades. So at the close of each December, the difficulty lies, as Kenny Rogers once put it, in knowing what to throw away and knowing what to keep.

title: Goals for the New Year
description: Three apps designed to help you pursue your 2016 resolutions.

title: Video Feature: Apps for Keeping New Years Resolutions
description: ITS that special time of year again  a new year  where resolutions to celebrate the arrival of 2016 will be coming thick and fast. To prevent those promises from promptly being forgotten, many smartphone apps can help people stick to their new years goals of saving money, getting fit, losing weight and more.

title: Coming Out as Gay Superheroes
description: When the mutant superhero Iceman came out last month  thanks to a one-two punch of his prying telepathic teammate and a time-travel visit from his younger self  he immediately became the most prominent gay comic book character. But his revelation was far from the only story line involving gay, lesbian and transgender characters in the fast-evolving world of comic-book narratives.

title: Handful of Plays May Keep Playoffs Out of Jets Grasp
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Brandon Marshall has never been to the N.F.L. playoffs, and he may not go this season even if the Jets win their final two games. But Marshall, perhaps more than any Jet, understands the fine line that separates success and failure in the league  and what it feels like to be on the wrong side of it.

title: Truck Driver in Tracy Morgan Crash Is Charged With Manslaughter
description: A Walmart truck driver who crashed his tractor-trailer into a vehicle carrying the comedian Tracy Morgan, critically injuring Mr. Morgan and killing another passenger, was indicted on Wednesday by a New Jersey grand jury on charges of manslaughter, vehicular homicide and aggravated assault.

title: Fantasy Football Week 16: Chargers at Raiders
description: Fantasy football analysis for Thursday nights game between the San Diego Chargers and the Oakland Raiders. Check back Friday for analysis of Sundays games and Mondays matchup between the Cincinnati Bengals and the Denver Broncos. You can also follow the Sablich brothers on Twitter at @5thDownFantasy.

title: Joe Jamail, Flamboyant Texas Lawyer Who Won Billions for Clients, Dies at 90
description: Joe Jamail, a celebrated Texas lawyer who had flunked civil negligence in law school and barely passed the bar exam but went on to dazzle his profession by winning gargantuan judgments  including Pennzoils $10.5 billion award against Texaco in 1985, then the largest in history  died on Wednesday in Houston. He was 90.

title: For Christmas Eve, Stop Shopping, Start Celebrating
description: We have enough stuff.

title: Arthur Miller Centennial Celebration Will Feature Stars and Readings
description: Celebrations for the centennial of Arthur Millers birth are not over yet.

title: Fernande Grudet, 92, Dies; Ran High-Society Call-Girl Ring as Madame Claude
description: Fernande Grudet, who under the name Madame Claude operated a deluxe call-girl ring in Paris in the 1960s and 70s that attracted the patronage of world leaders, business executives and playboys and made her a byword for sophisticated sex, died on Saturday in Nice, France. She was 92.

title: On the Road: Political Reporter Finds Salvation in Audiobooks
description: Gary Shteyngart got me through a miserable downpour in New Hampshire. Ta-Nehisi Coates entertained me on a late-night sojourn through South Carolina. And thank God for Truman Capote or I most certainly would have fallen asleep and driven off a desolate farm road in Iowa.

title: Palantir, a Silicon Valley Start-Up, Raises Another $880 Million
description: Palantir Technologies, a provider of powerful data analysis tools for government and business, has raised $880 million in its latest round of financing, according to people familiar with the transaction.

title: Parental Controls for Smartphones
description: While it may be tempting to save money by buying cheaper Android devices for children, parents who want tight control over their childrens activities on smartphones will be better off buying iPhones for the family. Apples parental controls were detailed and took a while to set up, but they accomplished all of the restrictions that I wanted. The Android system was sorely lacking in features for regulating minors and offered only incomplete solutions for a small number of restrictions.

title: For Parental Controls, iPhones Beat Androids
description: CHILDREN who were on the nice list this year may soon unwrap smartphones as holiday gifts. But parents may be wary of the naughty things that children can do with the devices  and with good reason.

title: Review: Musica Sacras Messiah, Buoyant and Burnished at Carnegie Hall
description: With an excellent chorus and reliably top-notch soloists, the annual performances of Handels Messiah by Musica Sacra, under the direction of Kent Tritle, command a loyal following. Some of those soloists, too, are loyal to Mr. Tritle, and return to perform with him year after year.

title: Review: Norm Lewis on Peace and Joy in Swingin Christmas
description: The exceptional dramatic power of the Broadway baritone Norm Lewis could be measured by his volcanic performance of Bring Him Home, that semi-operatic war horse from Les Misrables, on Sunday evening. In the wrong hands, this stentorian plea to heaven can sound like bleating melodramatic kitsch. But as Mr. Lewis sang it in his new show, Norm Lewis Wishes You a Swingin Christmas, at Feinsteins/54 Below, the histrionic showpiece became a thunderous howl of anguish. It gave me chills.

title: Hillary Clinton Is Not My Abuela, Critics Say
description: Hillary Clintons campaign for president has been savvy about talking to young voters in the parlance of the social web, using emojis, sleek graphics and other formats. But the list 7 things Hillary Clinton has in common with your abuela seemed to backfire this week.

title: The Nutcracker Gives Young Dancers a Spotlight Role
description: It was like a Sugarplum Fairy assembly line. As soon as one pink-tutu-clad dancer finished her variation at a stage rehearsal on Monday, Peter Martins, New York City Ballets ballet master in chief, offered notes or pointers, smiled and called out, barber-like, Next!

title: Tensions Rise Over U.S. Visa Measure That Could Affect Iran Nuclear Accord
description: Tensions mounted between Iran and the United States on Wednesday over a new American law that limits visa-free travel, which the Iranians regard as a sanction and a violation of the recently completed nuclear accord.

title: Who Runs Algeria? Many Doubt Its Ailing President Abdelaziz Bouteflika
description: ALGIERS  A power struggle within the closed circle that has ruled Algeria for decades has spilled into the open in recent weeks, with accusations of a soft coup, as questions intensify about the health of President Abdelaziz Bouteflika.

title: Canada May Miss Goal to Admit 10,000 Refugees by Years End
description: OTTAWA  John McCallum, Canadas immigration minister, acknowledged Wednesday that his government was likely to miss its target of admitting 10,000 Syrian refugees by the end of the year.

title: Suspect in Colorado Shooting Wants to Be His Own Lawyer
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  Robert L. Dear Jr., the man accused of a deadly shooting rampage at a Planned Parenthood center here, tried to wrest control of his criminal defenseon Wednesday, telling a judge that he wanted to represent himself and did not trust his public defender.

title: Spains 2 Top Political Leaders Meet After Inconclusive Elections
description: MADRID  The leaders of Spains two largest parties met Wednesday for the first time since inconclusive parliamentary elections on Sunday, and confirmed just how difficult it will be to form a new government.

title: New Jersey School District Rejects Claim of Anti-Muslim Firing
description: A New Jersey school district on Tuesday rejected accusations by a Muslim teacher that she was fired because of her religion as brazenly false and frivolous.

title: The SoHo Restaurant Costata to Close
description: Costata, the chef Michael Whites Italian-style steakhouse in SoHo, will close after dinner service on Dec. 31, its parent company, the Altamarea Group, said Wednesday. Olivia Young, the companys spokeswoman, said Altamarea was looking for an uptown location.

title: Video: Snow in San Diego, for the Polar Bears
description: For certain four-legged residents of San Diego, the year-round warmth is not the citys best feature.

title: Photos of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Germany and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Dec. 23, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Turkey, Germany, China and Nepal.

title: Norfolk Southern Rejects Canadian Pacifics Third Offer
description: Canadian Pacifics third proposal to acquire Norfolk Southern received the same response from its fellow railroad operator as the first two: No, thank you.

title: Assignment America
description: A series that explores changes in American politics, culture and technology, drawing on the reporting and personal experiences of New York Times journalists around the country.

title: Review: Elaine Sciolino Blends Past and Present in The Only Street in Paris
description: Paris is a factory for requiems.

title: Review: The Last Noel, Anonymous 4s Farewell
description: The long, lovely career of Anonymous 4 ended on Tuesday the way it began: modestly, even austerely  without ostentation but with lots of thoughtful beauty.

title: Review: Mr. Six Is a Guan Hu Character Study
description: Mr. Six is a grumpy old fixture on his Beijing back street, ready to scold or shoot a withering look. But as we are frequently reminded in the director Guan Hus character study Mr. Six, he was one bad dude back in the day. That was before the money-obsessed modern age in China gave rise to spoiled rich kids, fancy modified cars and a general lack of decency. All these problems bedevil Mr. Six, whose estranged son is held captive by a wealthy, speed-racing brat named Kris.

title: Protesters Blocked From Mall of America
description: Police officers in riot gear stopped Black Lives Matter protesters from entering the Mall of America, in the city of Bloomington near Minneapolis.

title: Rights Group Says Russia May Have Directly Attacked Civilians in Syria
description: A new human rights report said that at least 200 civilians had been killed by Russian airstrikes in Syria over a two-month period, and it suggested Moscow had in some cases specifically targeted noncombatants.

title: Odell Beckham Jr. Apologizes After Ban Is Upheld
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Odell Beckham Jr. entered the N.F.L. offices in Manhattan around midday Wednesday, hoping to get his one-game suspension for unsportsmanlike and dangerous play overturned. About 90 minutes later, Beckham left the building looking unsettled, his right hand stretched across his brow.

title: Scary Holiday Movies: See You When Youre Sleeping
description: Horror fans cherish Christmas, too. Its just that their holiday cheer comes from watching deranged maniacs dressed as Santa going nuts with an ax.

title: Bronx Man Charged With Killing His 2-Month-Old Son
description: A Bronx man accused of strangling his 2-month-old son was charged with murder on Wednesday as prosecutors recounted his confession.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing: Black Lives Matter, the Beatles, China
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: The Obamas Holiday Playlist Is Posted on Spotify
description: You are not invited to Christmas at President Obamas house. But now, thanks to social media, you can listen to some of his favorite holiday songs on your own.

title: Ben Carson to Keep Advisers, Despite Hints of a Shake-Up
description: Ben Carson, whose campaign has come under increasing stress as his polling numbers have declined, suggested on Wednesday a major shake-up was coming, only to seemingly reverse himself hours later.

title: Review: American Dance Machine Offers 70 Years of Steps
description: The 22 performers of American Dance Machine for the 21st Century are an exceptional crew. You get to know them as vivid individuals, with different strengths, and you see them as a powerfully skilled ensemble that can bring life to one shared style and then another. Leafing through the program afterward, you wish that it had photographs to help you identify them all more easily.

title: The 12.13.15 Issue
description: RE: PURGATORY

title: Readers Respond:The Top Social Justice Stories of 2015
description: In a recent column, Charles M. Blow asked Henry Louis Gates Jr., Michelle Alexander and Dan Savage what they thought the biggest social justice stories were this year. Their wide-ranging responses included Black Lives Matter, the refugees crisis and minimum wage increases.

title: Conflict Between Turkey and Kurds Clouds the Life of a Michigan Cafe Owner
description: After 25 years in the United States, Ibrahim Parlak, a Kurdish restaurant owner in Michigan, is fighting to keep the Department of Homeland Security from deporting him to Turkey. On Wednesday he got a break, winning a 90-day stay on any deportation proceedings from the immigration authorities.

title: Afghan Suicide Bomber Puts a Tragic End to a Life Spent Seeking Dignity
description: Five years ago, Adrianna Vorderbruggen was forced to keep her relationship with another woman secret. Only after the repeal of the militarys Dont Ask, Dont Tell policy in 2011 could Maj. Vorderbruggen, an Air Force officer, even acknowledge her identity as a lesbian, let alone marry her partner and raise a child with her.

title: The Las Vegas Review-Journal Is in Upheaval After a Sale to Adelson
description: Shortly after 5 p.m. on Tuesday, Michael Hengel, the editor of The Las Vegas Review-Journal, instructed staff members to gather in the newsroom and bring their cellphones. As reporters tweeted and recorded the meeting, Mr. Hengel shocked his employees by telling them he was resigning.

title: Skelos Conviction Leaves Key Vacancy in Nassau County Senate Seat
description: The corruption trials of Dean G. Skelos and Sheldon Silver, the former leaders of New Yorks Legislature, deepened voters distrust of state government, and prompted public demands for root-and-branch ethics reform when lawmakers return to Albany next year.

title: Snuff Garrett, Record Producer Who Made a String of Hits, Dies at 77
description: Snuff Garrett, a former Texas disc jockey who was forsaken by his own music teachers but became a millionaire by the time he was 30 producing records for Bobby Vee, Del Shannon, Gary Lewis & the Playboys and other artists, died on Dec. 16 in Tucson. He was 77.

title: Severe Weather Across South and Midwest Kills at Least 6
description: ATLANTA  At least six people were killed on Wednesday as the South and Midwest faced severe weather that prompted tornado warnings in more than a dozen states and caused significant damage in some areas.

title: Transit Group Wants a Bus Route to La Guardia to Be Labeled a Free Ride
description: It is a frustration shared by many New Yorkers, not to mention many visitors to the city: You cannot take the subway to La Guardia Airport.

title: Venezuelas Departing Legislature Approves 13 New Justices
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Days before a new National Assembly was to be sworn in with an overwhelming opposition majority, the countrys current legislature, dominated by the Socialist party of President Nicols Maduro, voted Wednesday to approve 13 new judges for the Supreme Court in what critics say is an attempt to stack the court in the executive branchs favor.

title: Illinois Says Daily Fantasy Sports Are Illegal
description: The Illinois attorney general said Wednesday that daily fantasy sports constituted illegal gambling under the states laws, adding to growing opposition to a pastime that has been embraced by professional sports leagues and has become a ubiquitous advertiser on broadcast television.

title: Black Lives Matter Protesters Gather; Mall Is Shut in Response
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn.  They marched into the countrys largest mall, hoping to draw attention to a killing last month of an unarmed black man by the police in North Minneapolis.

title: Inquiry Shows Struggles of Disabled New York Students and Their Families
description: Rebecca Kostyuchenko carries her 75-pound daughter, who has difficulty walking, up two flights of stairs every Wednesday to her computer class at Public School 321, in Brooklyn, so she can work on her coding skills with the other fifth graders.

title: Thursdays Matchup: Chargers (4-10) at Raiders (6-8)
description: 8:25 p.m. Eastern, NFL Network

title: Plagued by Illness, a Man Braves the World With His Dog
description: It was a good time for the dog to go out. The mans home health aide did the walking, and sometimes he liked to go too. So he did, rolling along in his wheelchair in his Brownsville, Brooklyn, neighborhood. A man and a tiny dog. Frank Joseph and Chucky.

title: Traditional Toys May Beat Gadgets in Language Development
description: Baby laptops, baby cellphones, talking farms  these are the whirring, whiz-bang toys of the moment, many of them marketed as tools to encourage babies language skills.

title: Holiday on Friday: Christmas
description: GOVERNMENT OFFICES Closed.

title: Angela McEwan, Late-Blooming Actress in Nebraska, Dies at 81
description: Angela McEwan, whose late-in-life acting rsum included a brief but memorable turn as the former flame of a hapless old man played by Bruce Dern in the Oscar-nominated 2013 film Nebraska, died on Sunday in Long Beach, Calif. She was 81.

title: Antigone and Others
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  First, Wordplay wishes all who celebrate a very Merry Christmas. If you, like me, will be spending Christmas Eve at a Chinese restaurant and cant decide what to order, you really cant go wrong with the General Tsos chicken. It is, after all, the official deep-fried food of crossword puzzles. And you can even make your own, if you are so inclined.

title: Man Charged With Hacking Stumbled by Taking Scheme Offline, Experts Say
description: He had stolen a trove of gossip-page trophies: unpublished movie and television scripts, as well as sex tapes and nude images of celebrities, all by hacking their computers or cellphones, the authorities said.

title: Without Carmelo Anthony, Knicks Put Up Fight but Fall to Cavaliers
description: CLEVELAND  Carmelo Anthony positioned himself in front of a television on Wednesday and settled in for a long night of solitude inside the visitors locker room at Quicken Loans Arena. Relegated to the role of spectator by a sprained right ankle, Anthony watched the Knicks play the Cavaliers without him.

title: Illinois: Rapper Is Among Six Shot in Chicago
description: A rising Chicago rapper was among six people wounded in shootings across the city on Wednesday, the police said. The Chicago Police Department said two victims were killed and four others were being treated at hospitals in conditions ranging from good to critical. The rapper, known as King L, was shot in the head as he sat in a vehicle, according to The Chicago Sun-Times. He was hospitalized in stable condition, the police said. King L, who has been credited with coining the term Chiraq, helped popularize the drill rap sound and appeared on Kanye Wests Yeezus album.

title: Ex-News Executive in China Gets 4-Year Sentence for Extortion
description: HONG KONG  A court in Shanghai sentenced a prominent former news executive on Thursday to four years in prison for extortion, Chinese state news media reported.

title: Remembering a Christmas When Love, and Neighbors, Came Through
description: Whats your favorite Christmas memory? I asked my oldest son, Judah.

title: What to Watch Thursday
description: Harold and Kumar ring in the holiday on a high note, on an evening with something festive for just about every persuasion.

title: Puerto Rico Utility Reaches Deal With Bond Insurers in Effort to Avoid Default
description: Puerto Ricos beleaguered electric utility announced new progress late Wednesday in its continuing efforts to avoid a default on as much as one-eighth of the islands total debt of $72 billion.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: We know far too many people who have been caught up in gun violence in this country. And we can do something about it.

title: Corrections: December 24, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Christmas in America: Over the Top, Close to the Heart
description: A chance meeting with a synthetic, 40-foot-tall, somewhat disturbing Santa guarding a Christmas tree lot made Jesse Rieser realize the strange ways Americans show their love for the holiday season. Since that fateful encounter in Glendale, Ariz., in 2010, Mr. Rieser has dedicated himself to finding the most over-the-top home light displays, outlandish Santas and overworked elves, as well as sincere displays of religious devotion.

title: Christmas in America: Over the Top, Close to the Heart
description: Since 2010, Jesse Rieser has been photographing people fiercely devoted to their Christmas displays, along with their works.

title: Happy Holidays
description: Merry Christmas, happy Hanukkah, joyous Kwanzaa and happy new year.

title: The Republican Fear of Facts on Guns
description: The three rivals for the Democratic presidential nomination showed enough sense of responsibility in their debate on Saturday to freely discuss the nations epidemic of gun violence. Unfortunately, this was only half the debate voters deserve. The Republican candidates are callously ducking the issue. Among the recent casualties of such silence was a bill in Congress that would have lifted a ban on basic federal research into gun violence and its toll on public health.

title: The Donald Trump Days of Christmas
description: Happy holidays! I say this with some trepidation, because Donald Trump has vowed that when he is president, Were all going to be saying Merry Christmas again. That was a while ago, during his war on the Starbucks coffee cup design. So very much water has run under the Trumpian bridge since then.

title: The Supreme Courts Diversity Dilemma
description: Justice Antonin Scalias musings from the bench about whether affirmative action might hurt rather than help African-American students received most of the attention following the Supreme Court argument in the University of Texas case earlier this month. By contrast, a question posed to the universitys lawyer by Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. was largely overlooked. What unique perspective does a minority student bring to a physics class? the chief justice wanted to know.

title: Travel Agents Touch
description: To the Editor:

title: One Way to Unrig Stock Trading
description: AMERICAS equity markets are broken. Individuals and institutions make transactions in rigged markets favoring short-term players. The root cause of the problem is that stocks trade on numerous venues, including 11 traditional exchanges and dozens of so-called dark pools that allow buyers and sellers to work out of the public eye. This market fragmentation allows high-frequency traders and exchanges to profit at the expense of long-term investors.

title: Paid Parental Leave Comes to New York City
description: The United States is one of just a small handful of countries that do not provide paid leave for new mothers and fathers  and the only major industrialized nation that does not. On Tuesday, Mayor Bill de Blasio took a smart, if modest, step to counter this shameful fact by giving 20,000 non-unionized public employees six weeks of fully paid parental leave starting in 2016.

title: Taking On My Moms Christmas
description: Houston  I REMEMBER the year my mother ceded the holidays to me. I was still in my 30s, with a new baby, and a new house, and in-laws who had decided to come down from Virginia and, in my mother-in-laws always guileless words, help out.

title: Albany Lawmakers Pay
description: To the Editor:

title: Learning a Few Things From Scottish Police Officers
description: To the Editor:

title: Should Race Be a Factor in College Admissions?
description: To the Editor:

title: Chinas Tantrum on Taiwan Arms Deal
description: China predictably and vociferously complained when the Obama administration announced plans last week to sell $1.8 billion in arms to Taiwan. Zheng Zeguang, Chinas vice foreign minister, said the deal violates international law, the basic norms of international relations and the principles of three joint communiqus with the United States, while severely damaging Chinas sovereignty and security interests.

title: Dear White America
description: In 2015, I conducted a series of 19 interviews with philosophers and public intellectuals on the issue of race. My aim was to engage, in this very public space, with the often unnamed elephant in the room.

title: 2 Sentenced to Death in Killing of British Tourists in Thailand
description: BANGKOK  A Thai court sentenced two men from Myanmar on Thursday to death for the murder of two British tourists last year, ending a high-profile trial shadowed by allegations that the police had mishandled the investigation.

title: A Christmas Economy Thrives All Year in the Mountains of Mexico
description: TLALPUJAHUA, Mexico  In the land of the forever Christmas, there are no elves, no reindeer and no snow. And the creepy wooden Santa that sits outside one of the stores here confronts shoppers with a gigantic beard and not an ounce of cheer.

title: Westerners in Beijing Are Warned of Possible Threats
description: Several foreign embassies in Beijing, including the American and British ones, warned on Thursday of possible threats against Westerners in a shopping district on or around Christmas Day, urging their citizens to exercise heightened vigilance.

title: Hiding in Plain Sight as Beijing Disappears Into Blanket of Smog
description: BEIJING  As Beijing disappeared into the heavy smog shrouding the region in recent days, an artist covered seven models with body paint until they, too, faded against a desolate grove of trees on the eastern outskirts of the city.

title: Leave Your Holiday Heartbreak at Home
description: I am 23. This month, my boyfriend of one year broke up with me. I was totally surprised, and am still devastated by it and in love with him. I have asked a few times about getting back together, but he is not interested. So I am trying to move on, which isnt easy. Its even harder when we both turn up at the same holiday parties. Im scared (but also sort of hoping) that we will be at the same New Years Eve party. But I dont want to stay home alone. Help!

title: Review: The Revenant Welcomes You to Paradise. Now Prepare to Fall.
description: In The Revenant, a period drama reaching for tragedy, Leonardo DiCaprio plays the mountain man Hugh Glass, a figure straight out of American myth and history. He enters dressed in a greasy, fur-trimmed coat, holding a flintlock rifle while stealing through a forest primeval that Longfellow might have recognized. This, though, is no Arcadia; its 1823 in the Great Plains, a pitiless testing ground for men thats littered with the vivid red carcasses of skinned animals, ghastly portents of another slaughter shortly to come. The setting could not be more striking or the men more flinty.

title: For Mixed-Income Bronx Towers, a Fifth Avenue Holiday Look
description: It has been more than 20 years since Emily Brown, a retired social worker in the Bronx, has seen the holiday lights and decorations at Rockefeller Center, Bergdorf Goodman, Saks Fifth Avenue and Cartier. It would just be too much trouble and too many people.

title: Russia Rearms for a New Era
description: Russia has asserted itself on the world stage with a forcefulness not seen since the Cold War, increasing tensions with the West. Here is what it has been doing to reclaim its influence.

title: Reindeer for Hire Work Hard All Christmas Season
description: Santas reindeer had a relatively easy time of it, compared with their earthbound counterparts. While Dasher, Dancer and company put in some frantic hours of work Thursday night, the holiday season started in early November for Yukon, Blizzard, Tundra and their 17 herdmates at California Reindeer Rentals.

title: Americans Held Hostage in Iran Win Compensation 36 Years Later
description: WASHINGTON  After spending 444 days in captivity, and more than 30 years seeking restitution, the Americans taken hostage at the United States Embassy in Tehran in 1979 have finally won compensation.

title: Review: Quentin Tarantinos The Hateful Eight Blends Verbiage and Violence
description: Quentin Tarantino is a scholar of old movies with a particular antiquarian fetish for the ways they used to be made and consumed. His eighth feature, The Hateful Eight, was shot on film with antique lenses and is being projected at some theaters in sumptuous, wide-screen 70-millimeter Panavision.

title: A Bed-Stuy Rental, Dishwasher Included
description: Christine Amorose and David Merrill both lived in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, sharing apartments with friends.

title: Letters: The Death of Cancer
description: To the Editor:

title: Fire in Saudi Hospitals Maternity Unit Kills at Least 25
description: LONDON  Fire ravaged the maternity and neonatal intensive care unit of a hospital in Saudi Arabia early Thursday, killing at least 25 people and injuring more than 100 in the third mass calamity to hit the desert kingdom in the past four months.

title: The Doctor as Moonlighter
description: Three or four nights a month, I work as a moonlighter in an intensive care unit.

title: Paperback Row
description: EMPIRE OF COTTON: A Global History, by Sven Beckert. (Vintage, $17.95.) With gathering force in the 19th century, as plantations proliferated across the American South, the production of cotton has linked millions of people to the slave trade, fueled the Industrial Revolution and shaped the modern economy. Beckert illuminates this commoditys violent history in his study, one of the Book Reviews 10 Best Books of 2015.
