description: Packers (10-4) at Cardinals (12-2)

title: China Passes Antiterrorism Law That Critics Fear May Overreach
description: BEIJING  Chinas legislature approved an antiterrorism law on Sunday after months of international controversy, including criticism from human rights groups, business lobbies and President Obama.

title: How Hillary Clinton Went Undercover to Examine Race in Education
description: DOTHAN, Ala.  On a humid summer day in 1972, Hillary Rodham walked into this towns new private academy, a couple of cinder-block classrooms erected hurriedly amid fields of farmland, and pretended to be someone else.

title: 1940: England Seeks U.S. Accord on Orient Defense
description: LONDON  While defending these islands from German air attacks, hunting submarines in the Atlantic and hammering Italy in the Mediterranean, the British are not abandoning hope that the United States will be able to take effective but nonmilitary action in the Pacific, which the British could reinforce for the defense of Anglo-American interests against Japanese encroachments.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Teaching Young People in the South Bronx to Heal One Another
description: Half a lifetime ago, Dr. Edward Eismann walked down Fox Street in the South Bronx and found a world that was unraveling. Buildings burned and crumbled, their residents sent into exile or oblivion. Those left behind had to confront the wave of poverty, gangs and drugs that swept through.

title: Tornadoes Leave Paths of Rubble and 11 Dead in the Dallas Area
description: GARLAND, Tex.  Travis Koscheski said he was alone in his apartment here when he was first alerted to the approaching danger by the classic train sound.

title: 1965: Egypt Feels the Economic Pinch
description: CAIRO  Unheard of things are happening in Egypt. For the first time in 13 years since the revolution, there is no talk of pie in the sky and a glorious socialistic future just around the corner. Instead, the masses are being told to tighten their belts today and that tomorrow may be grimmer, not better.

title: Peyton Manning Rejects Report Linking Him to Doping
description: Mounting an aggressive campaign against a report that linked him to performance-enhancing drugs, Denver Broncos quarterback Peyton Manning said Saturday night that he was treated at an anti-aging clinic in Indianapolis in 2011 while recovering from a neck injury but that the treatment was prescribed by his physician and did not involve any banned substances.

title: Rahm Emanuel, Under Siege in Chicago, Shows Contrite Side
description: CHICAGO  GQ, the mens magazine, just named Mayor Rahm Emanuel to its list of The Worst People of 2015. In Springfield, the Illinois capital, a fellow Democrat is pressing for a measure to permit Mr. Emanuels recall from office. And here, demonstrators bearing thousands of signatures last week demanded Mr. Emanuels resignation, then blocked traffic on Christmas Eve along the citys glittering North Michigan Avenue shopping district, chanting, Rahms got to go in 2016!

title: British Army Is Deployed as Flooding Submerges Northern England
description: LONDON  The British Army stepped in on Sunday to help evacuate hundreds of people from waterlogged homes across the country, as swollen rivers and heavy rainfall brought misery to parts of the north and unleashed a spate of political recriminations.

title: A Manhattan Theft Rooted in a Tale of Songwriting, Sinatra and Cigars
description: The story of the thief who walked out of an expensive Manhattan cigar store with four boxes of medium-blend Dominicans last month actually begins decades earlier, before he was born. It starts in the 1960s, with an encounter between two men that would change both their lives. One of those men was Avo Uvezian, an Armenian jazz musician living in New York City. The other was also a musician, from New Jersey, named Frank Sinatra.

title: Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Tilt Kids Festival Announces Lineup of Arts Events for Children
description: Five premieres spread across a variety of disciplines, from theater to dance, are in store for the inaugural Tilt Kids Festival, a collaboration between the French Institute Alliance Franaise and Cultural Services of the French Embassy.

title: What to Watch Sunday
description: Should old television be forgot and never brought to mind? Not in what our critic James Poniewozik calls, if not the best, the most TV year ever. Enjoy the lull before New Years Eve by watching a few of our critics year-end top television picks.

title: Vichy Yearns to Shed Heavy Yoke of Past Shame
description: VICHY, France  Perhaps this small city could be forgiven for thinking, 70 years after the end of World War II, that it might be thought of as something other than the capital of the collaborationist government of Marshal Philippe Ptain.

title: Desperate Gaza Escape Attempt Leads to Death, and Recriminations
description: GAZA  Something drove Ishaq Khalil Hassan, 28, into the Mediterranean last week, to walk naked in the shallow surf, to attempt what has become all but impossible for Palestinians: an escape from the Gaza Strip.

title: Star Wars Dominates Box Office But Daddy Shows Strength, Too
description: LOS ANGELES  Seven major movies braved wide or limited releases against Star Wars: The Force Awakens over the Christmas weekend, and all but one  Point Break  found initial success, even if several prestige films still have a lot to prove.

title: Obama The Job-Killer
description: Given the GOP fields collective decision to go for Bushonomics squared, it seemed like a good time to update this chart.

title: Major Roles Cast in Secret Garden Concert
description: Ramin Karimloo (Les Misrables) and Cheyenne Jackson (Finians Rainbow, TVs American Horror Story: Hotel) will play brothers looking after an orphaned Sydney Lucas (Fun Home) in an upcoming concert performance of the 1991 musical adaptation of The Secret Garden.

title: Last Refuge From Taliban for Afghans May Prove No Refuge at All
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Fleeing the encroaching front line in the embattled southern Helmand Province, Haji Abdul Qudus has moved his family many times this year, ending up at a rented home in Lashkar Gah, the provincial capital.

title: With Flip of Fortune, Jets Top Patriots and Inject Life Into Playoff Hopes
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Jets captains strode to midfield, listened to the rules of overtime and waited for the vagaries of a flipped coin to determine their season.

title: Panthers, Leading League in Wins and Dances, Have Their First Misstep
description: ATLANTA  It was a long way down for the Carolina Panthers on Sunday. Carolina, a team that routinely, some say excessively, prances about the sidelines in celebration, finally felt the sting of a loss after 14 straight wins this season. Losses are not taken easily around the N.F.L., but the Panthers locker room was unusually subdued, as if the music were accidentally halted at the height of a party.

title: Presidential Primaries May Hold Key in Senate Races
description: In 2014, Democrats, the majority party in the Senate, had to defend most of the seats up for election, more than a few in unfriendly territory. That year, Republicans took back control of the chamber, picking up nine seats.

title: Haskell Wexler, Oscar-Winning Cinematographer, Dies at 93
description: Haskell Wexler, who was renowned as one of the most inventive cinematographers in Hollywood and an outspoken political firebrand, died on Sunday in Santa Monica, Calif. He was 93.

title: Kinky Boots With Wayne Brady as a Cross-Dresser You Could Take Home to Mother
description: Is it true that drag queens have more fun? On the evidence of Wayne Bradys performance these days at the Al Hirschfeld Theater, the answer is yes, to be written in glittery capital letters and perhaps adorned with a special push-up bra for the letter E. And its a lesson that a mainstream American audience seems more than willing to embrace

title: Review: New York String Orchestra Offers Youthful Energy and a Lush Sound
description: For decades now, the influence of the historically informed performance movement has left its mark not just on the tempo and style with which works are performed but on the size of the ensembles, too. When a program includes a concerto from the classical era, most modern symphony orchestras will now send a few rows of string players backstage to sit out the performance.

title: Review: In Feel the Bernhard, Sandra Feels Less Menacing
description: The claws have been retracted, but the attitude remains the same: a complicated mixture of sarcasm, curdled sweetness and contempt. That describes the comedian and singer Sandra Bernhard, now 60 (but looking two decades younger), who opened her annual end-of-the-year engagement on Saturday evening at Joes Pub with a new show, Feel the Bernhard.

title: Review: East of Salinas, on PBS, Tells a Migrant Boys Story
description: At the end of East of Salinas, Monday nights Independent Lens film on PBS, a title card puts the story we have just seen about a migrant boy named Jos Ansaldo into statistical context.

title: Texas Tornadoes Leave Path of Destruction
description: Eleven tornadoes struck North Texas on Saturday, and at least 11 people were killed.

title: Jennifer Jason Leigh Appears on Two Screens With Few Similarities
description: LOS ANGELES  Its hard to imagine two more different roles than the ones Jennifer Jason Leigh takes on in movies closing out 2015.

title: Review: In Ardennes 1944: The Battle of the Bulge, Antony Beevor Is on Familiar Ground
description: For Americans who lived through it or were born in its immediate wake, the Battle of the Bulge was as famous as any event of World War II. It evoked freezing and half-starving G.I.s refusing to surrender a besieged town to an atrocity-prone German army. To younger generations it evokes almost nothing. The British historian Antony Beevors Ardennes 1944: The Battle of the Bulge may return the Bulge to collective memory by democratizing it, adding the feats and sorrows of obscure men and some unseemly quarrels among famous ones.

title: Navy Special Force
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Like most artists, crossword constructors benefit from practice. Constructing as many puzzles as possible in order to improve ones filling and grid design skills is an important part of a constructors evolution.

title: The Year in Music Videos
description: In the beginning, music videos were strictly promotional tools. Then they became the thing itself  a song lacked meaning without an accompanying visual extravaganza. Thats still partly true, especially for the few monoculture superstars and consensus cognoscenti favorites that remain. But video as a medium is now more equal opportunity than ever: Thanks to smartphones, everyone is a director or videographer, and videos can be consumed anywhere, anytime, in six-second loops or two-hour concerts. There are still innovative artist-created music videos, but in the modern age, all the musician can really control is the song  whats done with it once its in the world is anyones guess. Here are critics picks of the best music videos of 2015. Jon Caramanica

title: New Unemployment Data, Deadline for Puerto Rico and Markets Wrap 2015
Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Dec. 28
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Cartoon: Heng on Chinas Priorities
description: Chinas disregard for safety standards is marring the success story of its economic growth.

title: Using Lasers to Preserve Antiquities Threatened by ISIS
description: Only the bas-relief bull and serpent-dragon gods were present to see the two flak-jacketed German surveyors and their security guards painstakingly moving laser equipment through Iraqs most famous archaeological site, the ruins of ancient Babylon.

title: H.I.V. Education That Aims to Empower, Not Shame
description: Thanks to medical advances, a diagnosis of H.I.V., while still very serious, is no longer the death sentence it once was. For organizations trying to communicate information about testing and prevention, though, the devastation the virus has caused over the decades remains ever-present.

title: F.A.A. Drone Laws Start to Clash With Stricter Local Rules
description: MIAMI  Frank Carollo, a longtime member of the City Council here, had worked for several weeks fine-tuning a proposal to limit the use of recreational drones, the increasingly popular remote-controlled flying devices. Minutes before the start of the vote on the rules this month, lawyers from the Federal Aviation Administration called him.

title: Mattel Takes a Risk, With Barbie and Bugs
description: As Gerry Cody, a senior design manager at Mattel, cheerfully loaded a live cricket into the drivers seat of a new toy car, the cricket probably did not have time to wonder how it had gotten to this point.

title: Argentinas New President Moves Swiftly to Shake Up the Economy
description: BUENOS AIRES  Mauricio Macri clinched Argentinas presidency last month by tapping into voters fatigue with a leftist political movement that had governed for more than 12 years. Campaigning on a platform of change, and promising to unite feuding factions while largely dodging specific policy proposals, Mr. Macri took 51 percent of the vote.

title: Customers Mourn Closing of Zaros Bakery in Changing Bronx Neighborhood
description: Neville Livan sat at a table in the window of Zaros Bread Basket on Sunday morning in the Parkchester neighborhood of the Bronx. Looking toward the door as customers streamed steadily in and out, he sipped a cup of coffee and savored the last minutes of a treasured ritual.

title: In Hollywood, a Year of Mining the Past for Box-Office Gold
description: LOS ANGELES  Star Wars: The Force Awakens took in about $153.5 million in North America over the weekend, for an estimated $545 million total since opening in mid-December, putting Hollywood in position to set a full-year domestic box-office record.

title: Tied Vote on Catalan Separatist Leader in Spain
description: MADRID  A year of surprising election outcomes in Spain ended on Sunday with a bizarre result: A far-left Catalan party split evenly over whether to keep Artur Mas as the leader of both Catalonia and its secessionist movement.

title: Families of 2 Fatally Shot by Chicago Police Question Officers Training
description: CHICAGO  Standing outside a home where a man and a woman were shot to death by the police, grieving relatives on Sunday demanded changes to the way the police interact with black residents, more training for officers in how to de-escalate tense situations involving possible mental health issues and meaningful discipline for officers who use excessive force.

title: N.B.A. Game of the Week: Rockets at Spurs
description: Do not write the Houston Rockets off just yet. Widely thought to be a contender after a strong showing in last seasons playoffs, Houston has had a mediocre season, struggling on both sides of the ball. The team was further destabilized by the departure of Coach Kevin McHale in November.

title: New Yorkers for White Sauce
description: Dear Diary:

title: Ellsworth Kelly, Mixing Abstraction With Simplicity
description: Looking back on his life and art.

title: George Clayton Johnson, Science Fiction Writer, Dies at 86
description: George Clayton Johnson, who wrote memorable episodes of The Twilight Zone, the first televised episode of Star Trek and, with William F. Nolan, the novel Logans Run, often addressing aging and mortality in his work, died on Friday in Los Angeles. He was 86.

title: Helping Fliers Avoid Change Fees (for a Modest Fee)
description: Such is the state of air travel these days that even the fees have fees.

title: Kevin Loves Signature Pass Is Inspired by the Past
description: CLEVELAND  Whenever Kevin Love grabs a defensive rebound, he goes through a series of calculations. First, he spins to look toward the opposite basket. Are any of his teammates with the Cleveland Cavaliers ahead of the defense? If LeBron James has his hand up, for example, that is an instant cue for Love to make one of his favorite plays: the long outlet pass.

title: Questions on Direction of a Paper in Las Vegas
description: Until a few weeks ago, Sheldon Adelson, the billionaire casino mogul and Republican party benefactor, was better known for suing newspapers than owning them.

title: Jets Fan in Patriots Backyard Finds Happiness Begins in the Driveway
description: WELLESLEY, Mass.  The provisions  beer, soda, water and munchies  will have been purchased and packed the day before. The folding table with the Jets insignia, the envy of his fellow tailgaters, will also be crammed into the back of Chris Hardings 2010 silver Honda Pilot.

title: Obamas Boots on the Ground: U.S. Special Forces Are Sent to Tackle Global Threats
description: WASHINGTON  They are taking on a larger combat role in Afghanistan, where the war was supposed to be over. They are headed to Syria to help fight the Islamic State in its stronghold. And President Obama recently ordered nearly 300 of them to Cameroon to assist African troops in their battle against a militant group that has pledged loyalty to the Islamic State.

title: Remembering Alan Kurdi: Syrian Familys Tragedy Goes Beyond Image of Boy on Beach
description: ISTANBUL  Friday is the first anniversary of the death of Alan Kurdi, a 2-year-old Syrian refugee whose drowned body was discovered on a beach in Turkey. Photos of the boy shocked the world and put a human face on the refugee crisis. Since then hundreds of children have died in the fighting in Syria and on the refugee trail. Anne Barnard, The Times Beirut Bureau chief who leads our coverage in Syria, reported on Alans death and his sprawling familys attempts to escape worn-torn Syria. This article originally ran on Dec. 27, 2015.

title: Presidential Medal of Freedom Says Something About Presenter, Too
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama was having some fun with Barbra Streisand as he awarded her the Presidential Medal of Freedom at the White House last month.

title: Elections Are Easy for Queens Prosecutor; Critics Call This a Problem
description: The challenger, a former state legislator threatening the party favorite, was kicked off the primary ballot in a district attorney race in Queens after a judge ruled that the signatures he had gathered were not valid. The man, seeking to beat Richard A. Brown, lost an appeal, paving the way for Mr. Brown to easily defeat a Republican in the heavily Democratic borough.

title: Jets, Perpetual Victims of Fate, Finally Seize Control of It
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Jets control their destiny.

title: In the Wake of Addiction, a Life Bright With Purpose
description: Gloria Paiges journey toward redemption has been a long one, and the way has not always been certain.

title: Claims of Peyton Manning H.G.H. Use Raise Nagging Questions
description: Lets back up this garbage truck. In 2011, we had a 36-year-old quarterback who could not grip a football properly. His triceps had withered, and his right arm had turned into a frail reed. He needed spinal fusion surgery, the insertion of a titanium plate in his neck, and that came on the heels of earlier neck operations.

title: Ellsworth Kelly, Who Shaped Geometries on a Bold Scale, Dies at 92
description: Ellsworth Kelly, one of Americas great 20th-century abstract artists, who in the years after World War II shaped a distinctive style of American painting by combining the solid shapes and brilliant colors of European abstraction with forms distilled from everyday life, died on Sunday at his home in Spencertown, N.Y. He was 92.

title: Carson Palmer Cements Comeback in Cardinals Romp Over Packers
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  Less than three hours before Sundays kickoff, Arizona Cardinals quarterback Carson Palmer streaked across the field at University of Phoenix Stadium practically in his birthday suit. Wearing an improvised hula outfit, with kneepads strung together to form a bikini top and a white towel shredded to make a skirt, Palmer made good on a bet he had lost during a weekly postpractice throwing game. The pregame sprint was a prelude to a blissful 36th birthday for Palmer, who led the Cardinals to a 38-8 defeat of the Green Bay Packers.

title: Monday Night Matchup: Bengals (11-3) at Broncos (10-4)
description: 8:30 p.m., ESPN

title: Celtics Attack Leaves Overmatched Knicks Flailing
description: BOSTON  At 5 feet 9 inches, Isaiah Thomas of the Boston Celtics has developed, when driving to the basket, a fail-safe method for scoring over bigger players  in other words, pretty much everyone else in the league.

title: The Best of Week 16 in the N.F.L.
description: The Ravens Ryan Mallett threw for a career-high 274 yards in his first start for Baltimore, leading his team to a victory over the Steelers. Making his seventh career start, Mallett went 28 for 41, with a touchdown and no interceptions. Signed by the Ravens on Dec. 15, Mallett was the fourth quarterback to start for them in six weeks.

title: With No Beckham and No Playoff Hopes, Giants Submit to a Beating
description: MINNEAPOLIS  About an hour before kickoff Sunday night, the Giants spread out across 40 yards, taking up nearly half the field to warm up. Coach Tom Coughlin, as he always does, walked briskly through his teams broad formation, stopping to acknowledge each player individually.

title: What to Watch Monday
description: The networks are showing classics to distract you from the interminable holiday season. There is escapism (The Matrix) and there are escapees (The Shawshank Redemption). On Netflix, the comedian Demetri Martin cracks wise.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: It was dangerous, being outsiders in these rural areas, talking about segregation academies. We thought we were part of the civil rights struggle, definitely.

title: Corrections: December 28, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Meadowlark Lemon Dies at 83; Harlem Globetrotters Dazzling Court Jester
description: Meadowlark Lemon, whose halfcourt hook shots, no-look behind-the-back passes and vivid clowning were marquee features of the feel-good traveling basketball show known as the Harlem Globetrotters for nearly a quarter-century, died on Sunday in Scottsdale, Ariz. He was 83.

title: As China Hungers for Coal, Behemoth Studies the Ravages at the Source
description: BEIJING  The artist and filmmaker Zhao Liang has shed light on some of the darkest corners of Chinese society, filming in locations as obscure as a shantytown here known as the petitioners village and a military police office on the North Korean border.

title: Japan and South Korea Settle Dispute Over Wartime Comfort Women
description: SEOUL, South Korea  More than 70 years after the end of World War II, South Korea and Japan reached a landmark agreement on Monday to resolve their dispute over Korean women who were forced to serve as sex slaves for Japans Imperial Army.

title: Fighting Climate Change With One of the Worlds Largest Solar Power Plants
description: In the spring of 2009, in the depths of the Great Recession, the commercial photographer Jamey Stillings was having a hard time. The work had dried up at his Santa Fe, N.M., studio, so he decided to shift gears and put his energies in a different direction.

title: New York Faces Struggle in Curbing Flophouse Schemes That Victimize Addicts
description: The newly renovated townhouse on Ralph Avenue in Brooklyn was described as being ideal for a family. Be the first to live in this, a rental advertisement says.

title: Fighting Climate Change With One of the Worlds Largest Solar Power Plants
description: A detour past a bridge in Nevada led Jamey Stillings to his latest project, a sleek and sprawling solar energy plant, the kind that will be crucial in averting the effects of climate change.

title: New Tensions Over the Iran Nuclear Deal
description: Newspapers in Tehran have been filled recently with reports of foreigners visiting Iran to discuss the opportunities that will open up once economic sanctions related to the nuclear deal are lifted, presumably early next year. There is a sense of excitement that after years of international isolation, better days await.

title: Costa Ricas Worries About Flood of Cuban Migrants
description: To the Editor:

title: Reducing Adult and Child Obesity
description: To the Editor:

title: Food and Diversity
description: To the Editor:

title: Guns and Mental Illness
description: To the Editor:

title: When Dying Alone in Prison Is Too Harsh a Sentence
description: MY patient, a man in his 60s, whispered Gracias, God bless over and over as I moved his legs during an exam. Our palliative care team had been called in to help manage his pain after his liver cancer recurred. The cancer had already metastasized to his spine, creating pressure on his spinal cord that left him nearly paralyzed from the waist down. He seemed like a felled tree. We found him tearful and scared. But he wasnt alone.

title: Which Democrat in 2016?
description: To the Editor:

title: Doubling Down on W
description: 2015 was, of course, the year of Donald Trump, whose rise has inspired horror among establishment Republicans and, lets face it, glee  call it Trumpenfreude  among many Democrats. But Trumpism has in one way worked to the G.O.P. establishments advantage: it has distracted pundits and the press from the hard right turn even conventional Republican candidates have taken, a turn whose radicalism would have seemed implausible not long ago.

title: $250,000 a Year Is Not Middle Class
description: HILLARY CLINTON has vowed not to raise taxes on the middle class.

title: A Maids Peaceful Rebellion in Colombia
description: MEDELLN, Colombia  The rules for domestic workers were unwritten but clear to everyone back in 1996, when Mara Roa joined the throngs of Colombian women who fled violence in rural areas and set out to rebuild their lives in the relative safety of big cities.

title: The Yellowstone of the Future
description: Bozeman, Mont.  PERHAPS, like me, you were among the tens of millions who visited one of our national parks this year. If you did, you most likely shared my appreciation for the foresight of previous generations to set aside treasures like Yellowstone. This legacy of conservation has long served as a point of pride for our country, and rightly so.

title: New York City Policing, by the Numbers
description: The warnings began even before Bill de Blasio was sworn in as New York Citys mayor in January 2014. A safe New York depended on the aggressive policing tactics that began in the 1990s and flourished under Mayor Michael Bloomberg and his police commissioner, Ray Kelly. Without those tactics, the doomsayers said, the city would be swamped by a 1970s-style crime wave.

title: Guns and Racism
description: Those of us in favor of stronger laws to abate gun violence mostly support our cause by arguing against the claims of the gun lobby (roughly, the N.R.A. and gun manufacturers). It should by now be obvious that this is a waste of time. The case for action is overwhelming, but theres no chance of convincing the entrenched minority who are so personally (or financially) invested in gun ownership. Legislative efforts have failed because the opposition is more deeply committed  more energized, more organized, more persistent.

title: Debates That Got Your Attention
Mayor de Blasio Still Trying, Fitfully, to Promote Himself
description: On his 99th day as mayor of New York, Bill de Blasio was asked how he would improve his fledgling administration. Communicate clearly, the mayor replied. Remembering to communicate early and often is the thing I would tell myself to do.

title: T.S.A. Moves Closer to Rejecting Some State Drivers Licenses for Travel
description: As soon as next year, a drivers license may no longer be enough for airline passengers to clear security in some states, if the Department of Homeland Security has its way.

title: Jane Sanders Knows Politics, and How to Soften Husbands Image
description: Jane Sanders, the wife of Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont, marched with her husband this month through the Baltimore neighborhood of Freddie Gray, the man fatally injured in police custody, and took notes while they met with African-American pastors.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your day.

title: Posture Affects Standing, and Not Just the Physical Kind
description: A distraught wife begged me to write about the importance of good posture. My husband sits for many hours a day slouched over his computer, she said. Ive told him repeatedly this is bad for his body  he should sit up straight  but he pays no attention to me. He reads you every week. Maybe hell listen to you.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Ramadi, Chicago Police, Carolina Panthers
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: On the Clock
description: Updated 12:09 p.m.

title: Science News That Stuck With Us in 2015
description: As the year ends, the Science desk of The New York Times asked its reporters to choose the stories that were the most memorable. These are their selections, with a focus on space, climate change, biology and artificial intelligence.

title: Medical and Health News That Stuck With Us in 2015
description: As the year ends, the Science desk at The New York Times asked its reporters to choose the stories that were the most memorable. These are the selections, with a focus on health and medicine news.

title: How Turkey Vultures Stay Aloft to Focus on Dinner
description: Turkey vultures use small-scale air turbulence to stay aloft at forest edges, according to a new study.

title: Seeking the Gears of Our Inner Clock
description: Throughout the day, a clock ticks inside our bodies. It rouses us in the morning and makes us sleepy at night. It raises and lowers our body temperature at the right times, and regulates the production of insulin and other hormones.

title: Paul Ryan Highlights G.O.P. Victories in Spending Bill to Try to Curb Complaints
description: House Republicans seem a tad defensive about their year-end budget bill as evidenced by their activities over the holiday break, suggesting that they are hearing complaints about the package at home.

title: Iraqi Victory Over ISIS in Ramadi Could Prove Pivotal
description: BAGHDAD  Breaking a seven-month occupation by the Islamic State, Iraqi troops on Monday retook most of Ramadi, the most populous city in western Iraq, overrunning a government compound held by the terrorist group at the city center and dealing a setback to its deadly grip on large parts of the country.

title: China Detains 12 People Over Shenzhen Landslide, Police Say
description: BEIJING  Twelve people have been detained over a debris dumpsite collapse in southern China that left dozens missing, the police there said on Monday. They also said that a former district official whose office approved and oversaw the huge site had committed suicide by jumping from a building.

title: Why Preventing Cancer Is Not the Priority in Drug Development
description: Most people would agree that it would be better to prevent cancer, if we could, than to treat it once it developed. Yet economic incentives encourage researchers to focus on treatment rather than prevention.

title: Cincinnati Bengals at Denver Broncos Preview
description: Bengals (11-3) at Broncos (10-4)

title: Crucial Endorsement in His Pocket, Marco Rubio Hones His Pitch to Iowa
description: In the final days of the year and the first days of the next one, Senator Marco Rubio of Florida and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas will battle for voters in Iowa in the lead-up to the caucuses.

title: Brooklyn Apartment Fire Kills 2
description: A man and a woman were killed in a fire that consumed a four-story, wood-frame apartment building in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, early Monday, the police said.

title: Cruise and Air News: A New Ship for L.G.B.T. Travelers
description: A CRUISE LINE FOR L.G.B.T. PASSENGERS

title: Ten Models We Loved a Lot This Year
description: 1. Binx Walton

title: My 10 Favorite Books: Neil Patrick Harris
description: For his bookshop and website One Grand, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books theyd take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next in the series is the actor and singer Neil Patrick Harris. He shares his list exclusively with T.

title: Valeant Pharmaceuticals Confirms C.E.O. Is on Medical Leave
description: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, a drug company whose business model has been under siege, announced on Monday that J. Michael Pearson, its chairman and chief executive, was on medical leave and that a team of executives would run the company while he was out.

title: Jeb Bush Backers Asked to Write Letters to Undecided New Hampshire Voters
description: Is the art of letter writing really dead? Not if the super PAC supporting Jeb Bush has its way.

title: Daily Report: The Financial Challenge When Free is the Norm
description: India may be the next great frontier for American technology companies.

title: Quashing Clones on Facebook
description: Q. Someone seems to have duplicated my Facebook account and is sending out requests to my friends pretending to be me. I can still get into my page and have warned my friends, but how do I alert Facebook to this scammer?

title: Drinking With the Candidates: Entertain Your Guests With Weird Campaign Swag
description: Why serve your friends and family with ordinary glassware when you could be enraging them by bringing politics to the party? Whether youre hosting an intimate brunch or a New Years Eve party for hundreds, this years presidential candidates have you covered  their online stores promise to keep your beer cold, your coffee hot and your wine whatever temperature its supposed to be, all while sparking the kinds of tense conversations youll continue to regret long after Election Day.

title: 1940: U.S. Warned on Intervention
description: ROME  Virginio Gayda, often a spokesman of Italys foreign policy, warned interventionists in the United States today [Dec. 28] that American violations of neutrality, no matter how disguised, might mean entry into the war. In an editorial, he asserted that very few American politicians wanted open intervention in the war on the side of Great Britain, but that numbers of important people in the United States were trying to hide real intervention behind misleading formalities. These people, Gayda said, seek to intensify American help to England in such a form and in such dimensions as to constitute a real, even though undeclared, intervention in the war. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 29, 1940

title: The California Ranch That Takes Jerry Brown Off the Grid
description: WILLIAMS, Calif.  Four dusty miles off State Route 20, around a curve on a dirt road once used by stagecoaches, a scattering of barns and dilapidated buildings sits hidden among rolling hills speckled with oak trees. There is no electricity or cell service. There is a compact outhouse and a redwood cabin just big enough to hold one air mattress. There is no other sign of civilization for miles.

title: 1965: 3,000 Try to Break Up Mass
description: PRAGUE  Some 3,000 young people, some of them using explosives, tried to break up the midnight mass in the Church of St. James here on Christmas Eve, the Czechoslovak news agency CTK disclosed today [Dec. 28]. It said the crowd tried to incite disturbances, penetrate into the church and stop the service. They even used explosives (apparently firecrackers). Thanks to the intervention of police, two women were saved from being trampled underfoot, the agency said. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, December 29, 1965

title: Expect The Hunger Games in Iowa After The Holiday Break
description: It is winter again in Iowa, which means it has been nearly a year since I arrived in Des Moines as part of a Times experiment to plant a full-time correspondent in the state with the first presidential nominating contest. The corn has sprouted, grown tall and fallen to the combine. The three Democrats and 13 Republicans still running have held 1,200 events in the state, and some days it feels like I have been to most of them.

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch This Week
description: Christmas has come and gone, but Louis van Gaals torment continues unabated.

title: Cardamom Cream Cake
description: This festive layer cake is inspired by the Indian cheese dumpling dessert ras malai.

title: A Layer Cake Gets a Surge From Cardamom
description: Ever since we were in high school, my friend Zoe and I have had a very special birthday tradition.

title: Review: Too Much of a Good Thing Finds a Dilemma in Our DNA
description: We tend to think of good genes as the ones that make us thin, calm, cheerful and healthy. This logical assumption may not be completely accurate: Dr. Lee Goldman suggests that even better genes may be the ones that make us fat, anxious and candidates for the services of a cardiologist like himself.

title: The E.U. Migrant Crisis, Told in 2 Startling Numbers
description: PARIS  The European Unions struggle to deal with migration can be bluntly told in two numbers: More than one million people have made their way to Europe this year, according to the International Organization for Migration, and 190 have been formally relocated.

title: The Best Roast Chickens
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Readers Respond: Seeking Silence Amid the Crowd
description: An article about the use of headphones to block out noise (and pesky co-workers) prompted many readers to share their own stories.

title: Burundi Crackdown Puts Hutus and Tutsis, and the West, on Edge
description: BUJUMBURA, Burundi  A little more than a week ago, Benny Uwamahoro went out for a beer. He met up with some friends, listened to some music and then received a mysterious call around 8:30 p.m. asking him to go to a neighborhood shop.

title: Amy Cuddys Presence and Shonda Rhimess Year of Yes
description: Success doesnt equal happiness. Thats the message coming in loud and clear in this dawning era of transparency, whether its embodied in enraged emails from a powerful movie producer or depressive tweets from a wealthy celebrity. But success without popularity doesnt count, either. Slipping into the shadows in the wake of an achievement is no longer an option; you must re-enact your value in real time, on a world stage, via conferences, TED talks, panels, festivals, radio appearances and podcasts, all the while conjuring a level of poise and grace that was once the sole purview of news anchors and talk-show hosts. This is the paradox of the modern digital world: It demands broadcast-quality demonstrations of social value, even as it steadily erodes our ability to deliver them.

title: The Diet Myth, The Good Gut and The Hidden Half of Nature
description: Sometime before the age of 5 or so my son misheard the term taste buds and imagined, instead, that his mouth was alive with taste bugs. This came in handy for him when under fire for rejecting the variety of new foods we put on the table. It wasnt his fault that he didnt like broccoli and spinach, hed explain, it was his pesky taste bugs.

title: Syrian Journalist Who Documented ISIS Atrocities Is Killed in Turkey
description: ISTANBUL  A Syrian journalist and filmmaker who documented atrocities by the Islamic State in Syria and trained hundreds of citizen journalists has been killed in a Turkish town near the Syrian border, rights activists said Monday, calling the death an assassination.

title: The Gift Exchange
description: This weeks puzzle was suggested by Henk Tijms, a Dutch mathematician and emeritus professor at the VU University Amsterdam.Dr. Tijms, theauthor of the acclaimed Understanding Probability, told me that he is often asked to give a light-heartened presentation on probability to a general audience. Sometimes people in the audience come up themselves with interesting probability questions.

title: Numberplay 2015: A Year in Review
description: Here they are the Numberplay puzzles of 2015, including this weeks Gift Exchange by the Dutch mathematician Henk Tijms. Nearly all these puzzles are original, and many were unveiled for the first time here on Numberplay. All works of art. Thank you to everyone who submitted a puzzle this year, and thank you as well to everyone who participated in the puzzle-solving discussion (where the real fun is, in case you havent tried it!) or shared these puzzles with friends.Math is a highly social activity, and puzzles are a great excuse for fun conversation.

title: Shkreli, Volkswagen and Other Stars in White-Collar Crime
description: White-collar defendants seem to be emerging as the new media stars, generating publicity sometimes rivaling that of social phenomena like the Kardashians.

title: Four Cities That Celebrate New Years Eve in a Big Way
description: New Years Eve is undoubtedly the ultimate reason to give a party, and although many cities in the United States have celebrations, a handful are favorite Dec. 31 destinations. Below are some tried-and-true  and lesser-known  fetes in four cities where ringing in the new year is a major occasion.

title: Learning to Let Go of Financial Peer Pressure
description: Over the years, Ive noticed that moment when each of my children started caring about what other people think of them. One by one, Ive watched as the opinions of others become a big deal in their own decision-making.

title: Severe Weather Aims for New Targets After Pummeling Texas, Midwest and Mississippi
description: After spawning tornadoes in Texas and floods in the Midwest, deadly storm systems continued to drift across the United States on Monday. The severe weather has in the last week led to the deaths of at least 43 people and the injuries of dozens more, according to a count by The Associated Press.

title: 3,988,076: The Number of U.S. Births in 2014
description: The National Center for Health Statistics reports that the number of births in 2014  3,988,076  was 1 percent higher than in 2013.

title: A New Day of the Buttered Bread Has Dawned
description: I recently happened upon a mention of an old Irish custom of celebrating New Years Day as the Day of the Buttered Bread. What a marvelous idea, I thought. Good bread and good butter are two of the best things to eat in Ireland, no matter what the calendar date.

title: Goodbye, Prison Loaf: Reporters Notebook
description: Albany  There are a few words that will set a journalists internal antennae abuzz  federal corruption charges, for example, or confirmed Bigfoot capture  and set him off on a quick journey of discovery, reporting, and hopefully, informed dissemination of his instant expertise.

title: Kentuckys New Governor Takes Back the Vote
description: Matt Bevin, Kentuckys new governor, has only been in office a couple of weeks, but hes already managed to re-disenfranchise tens of thousands of his states residents with the stroke of a pen.

title: Puerto Rican Police Officer Held in Fatal Shooting of 3 Colleagues
description: PONCE, P.R.  A police officer who once had his department-issued firearm taken away while he underwent psychological treatment gunned down two superiors and a third colleague on Monday at a regional headquarters in this southern Puerto Rico city, police officials said.

title: Donald Trump Takes On Bill Clintons Behavior Toward Women
description: Donald J. Trump and Bill Clinton used to be golfing buddies andoccasionaltelephonefriends. Mr. Trump donated to the former presidents charitable foundation. Mr. Clinton attended the billionaire developers lavish third wedding in 2005.

title: No Real Surprise: Arizona Cardinals Are N.F.L.s Most Dominant Team
description: The Carolina Panthers have been the story of the N.F.L. this season, easily surpassing preseason expectations on the way to a 14-0 start. But after Carolinas loss at Atlanta on Sunday, the Panthers are not going to become the first N.F.L. team to finish a season 19-0. Even so, that does not mean there is not a historically dominant team this season. It just happens to be a different N.F.C. team.

title: The Most Commented-On Articles of 2015
description: On the community desk, we like to say that comments enhance the news. But sometimes, the comments are the news. Such was the case this year when an expos became the most commented-on news story in Times history (that story is revealed below). Also this year: One of our top commenters upstaged his famous sibling and another became a celebrity in his hometown. To see which stories resonated most with our readers, you need look no further. These are the five most talked-about stories of the year.

title: Ted Cruzs Rivals Are Hindered by Storm in Trying to Cut His Lead in Iowa
description: With Republican Senator Ted Cruz, the leader in Iowa polls, spending the week effectively off the campaign trail, his rivals seemed to sense an opening: zigzag the state, press the flesh and make an early impression before the field descends on Iowa after New Years.

title: Lara Croft Has Company: More Female Heroes Appear in Big-Budget Games
description: In 1987 the video game Metroid was released in the United States. It featured a masked and armored space adventurer named Samus Aran navigating an alien planet, and it was one of the first games to blend exploration, action and puzzle-solving in a way that has become common. At the end of the game Samus Aran is revealed to be a woman. Her gender surprised gamers, but in some versions this powerful adventurer appeared in a bikini. In games of that era, women were generally damsels, princesses or sex objects, not heroes.

title: Game of Thrones Again the Favorite Among Show Pirates
description: Game of Thrones once again reigned supreme as the most-pirated television show of 2015, according to the news site TorrentFreak, with its season finale amassing 14.4 million downloads via the filesharing system, BitTorrent, an increase of more than six million from the year before.

title: I.P.O.s in U.S. End Weak Year With an Empty December
description: Initial public offerings by companies based in the United States sputtered out in December.

title: Stars of Indias Online Video Scene Struggle to Make a Living
description: Its not just the streaming video services that are struggling to make a profit in India. Even the countrys most popular YouTube stars have trouble making a living from digital video.

title: Clinton and Obama Top U.S. Poll on Most Admired People
description: Americans named President Obama and Hillary Clinton as the most admired man and woman in the world, according to a Gallup poll released on Monday, with Donald Trump tying Pope Francis as the second most admired man.

title: Museum of Writers to Open in Chicago
description: The greats will be there  Ralph Waldo Emerson, Harriet Beecher Stowe, Walt Whitman and many others  when the American Writers Museum opens in Chicago in March 2017.

title: Verbatim: Jeb Bush Wants to Debate Donald Trump One-On-One
description: Jeb Bush, when asked in West Palm Beach, Fla., what he would say to Donald J. Trump if Mr. Trump were to walk into the room just then.

title: In British Columbia, a Stylish Hotel for Adrenaline Seekers
description: From 69 Canadian dollars ($52, at 1.33 Canadian to the U.S. dollar). The lowest-end rooms are quite basic and include bunks and a half-bath, with a shower down the hall. Deluxe rooms (99 Canadian dollars) are the most updated.

title: Wedding Gift Cash Grab. Whats Too Little? Whats Too Much?
description: Carol Dodge of Glastonbury, Conn., was walking with two friends recently when she brought up a nagging question: My husbands partners daughter is getting married. What should I give?

title: Universities Race to Nurture Start-Up Founders of the Future
description: HOUSTON  The original charter of Rice University, drafted in 1891, established a school here dedicated to the advancement of literature, science and art. These days, Rice seems equally dedicated to the advancement of the next Mark Zuckerberg.

title: An Oakland Restaurant With Food That Begs for Beer
description: In 2008, Jay Porter made national news for his then unheard-of decision to ban tipping at his San Diego restaurant, the Linkery. The policy, he recalled recently, made him a lightning rod for peoples opinions.

title: Crisp Plantains for Party Dipping
description: Crisp ribbons of plantains, a munchable staple at Marjories Restaurant in Seattle, are now sold nationwide. You will want them to dip into salsa, avocados mashed with jerk seasonings or even hummus and tzatziki, but they are just as good plain. Watch them disappear: Miss Marjories Steel Drum Plantains, $4 for a two-ounce box from marjorierestaurant.com.

title: Cleveland Officer Will Not Face Charges in Tamir Rice Shooting Death
description: CLEVELAND  A grand jury declined on Monday to charge a Cleveland patrolman who fatally shot a 12-year-old boy holding a pellet gun, capping more than a year of investigation into a case that added to national outrage over white officers killing African-Americans.

title: Jeb Bush Succumbs to Selfie Craze and Offers Tips on Selfie Etiquette
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. Jeb Bush, the man who once promised to run for president joyfully, on Monday added a new social media twist to his campaign Jeb Bush 2.0 will even take selfies joyfully.

title: A Lion Expert Who Isnt Inclined to Turn Tail
description: MINNEAPOLIS  He saw the lioness as he walked back from the rocky outcropping in the Serengeti where, tired of sitting for hours in the car, he had gone exploring on foot.

title: Valeants Latest Fix Underscores Its Challenges
description: Valeant Pharmaceuticals latest fix reinforces its challenges.

title: Iran Hands Over Stockpile of Enriched Uranium to Russia
description: A Russian ship left Iran on Monday carrying almost all of Irans stockpile of low-enriched uranium, fulfilling a major step in the nuclear deal struck last summer and, for the first time in nearly a decade, apparently leaving Iran with too little fuel to manufacture a nuclear weapon.

title: The Plant Had a Lovely Striation. Then They Got the Pruning Shears.
description: Q. Why do some variegated plants grow back without the original patterning after pruning?

title: A New Chapter for Saffron
description: ISFAHAN, Iran  Saffron, an ancient medicinal plant and the most expensive of spices, has always had a magical, addictive power. Cleopatra took saffron-infused baths to enhance her allure. Alexander the Great used it to heal the wounds of battle.

title: David Cameron Defends Flood Record as Northern England Is Drenched
description: LONDON  Prime Minister David Cameron walked the flooded streets of York on Monday as Britains Environment Agency warned that the country needed a complete rethink of its flood defenses.

title: Escaping to a Galaxy Far, Far, Far Away
description: FRANK BRUNI: Its that time of year, Ross: Conservatives grieve the death of Christmas, liberals rue the commercialization of all holidays and the director David O. Russell and the megastars Jennifer Lawrence and Bradley Cooper storm Americas multiplexes with a movie timed for awards-season glory. Three years ago it was Silver Linings Playbook. Two years ago, American Hustle.

title: The Residents of Vanuatu, Then and Now
description: Analysis of skulls in the oldest known cemetery in the South Pacific suggests that the earliest inhabitants of Vanuatu may have descended from Asian and Polynesian populations, while modern residents share more physical similarities with people in Melanesia.

title: Meadowlark Lemon: His Globetrotter Dream Came True
description: Lemons moves were a highlight of the traveling basketball show for nearly a quarter-century.

title: 2015: The Year in Charts
description: The state of the union, for better or worse, in 10 charts.

title: Notes From the Abyss: A Snowboarder Details His Paralyzed Life
description: STOWE, Vt.  About 10 times a day, Jake Burton Carpenter reaches for a note card and jots down thoughts and reminders. The index cards he uses are five inches by eight inches, made with brown recycled paper, and have 15 lines. They are stamped with the logo of Burton Snowboards, the company that Carpenter founded in 1977 and christened with his middle name.

title: Thefts of Baby Jesus Statues Unnerve New Jersey Churches
description: In a holiday season teeming with traditions, the enduring (and illegal) practice of pilfering baby Jesus statues from nativity scenes appears to be alive and well, particularly in northern New Jersey, where at least five churches have reported such thefts since Christmas Eve.

title: Programs Expand Schizophrenic Patients Role in Their Own Care
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The idea was to go out in an emotional swan dive, a lunge for the afterlife that would stretch his 17-year-old imagination. He settled on a plan and shared the details with a Facebook friend: He would drop DMT, a powerful psychedelic, and then cut his throat.

title: Review: Phalariss Bull, or How a Man Comes to Terms With Life
description: Steven Friedman is a lot of things  philosopher, poet, painter, student of medicine and molecular biology  but one thing he is not is a natural performer, which makes his one-man show at the Beckett Theater a bit of a slog.

title: Chita Rivera Postpones Club Engagement After Injury
description: The Broadway diva Chita Rivera has postponed her January residency at Caf Carlyle after suffering an injury over the Christmas holiday. Following a fall, it was discovered that she has a pelvic stress fracture, the venue said in a statement Monday.

title: TasteMasters Tokyo: Video 3
description: Johathan Soble, Yuko Hasegawa and Hiroyuki Sasaki on how craft and fabrication drive exclusivity and creative freedom. Discover other pairings and learn more at nytimes.com/tastemasters.

title: TasteMasters Tokyo: Video 2
description: Johathan Soble, Yuko Hasegawa and Hiroyuki Sasaki on how cultural autonomy is integrated into pop art. Discover other pairings and learn more at nytimes.com/tastemasters.

title: New Type of Rock Is Discovered on Moon
description: A new type of basaltic rock has been discovered on the surface of the moon, according to a report in the journal Nature Communications. The rock is rich in a black mineral called ilmenite, which contains a high percentage of iron titanium oxide and has been found in other lunar rocks. The discovery was made by Chinese researchers operating the Change-3 spacecraft, which landed on the moon in 2013 and was the first unmanned mission there since the Apollo and Luna explorations about 40 years ago. The researchers investigated the surface remotely using spectrometers. Change-5, scheduled to land on the moon by 2017, is expected to bring samples of lunar soil and rock back to Earth.

title: Exit of Freeport Chairman Eases Credibility Problem
description: James Moffett is riding into the sunset. Mr. Moffett, Freeport-McMoRans longtime leader, is resigning as executive chairman of the $9 billion copper, gold and petroleum company facing pressure from the activist investor Carl C. Icahn. Its a needed step to restore confidence after faux pas including an ill-timed, cozy-looking 2012 oil deal. Mr. Moffetts replacement, though, faces serious challenges.

title: Videos and Photos Recall Meadowlark Lemon, an Ageless Court Magician
description: Meadowlark Lemon, who died on Sunday in Scottsdale, Ariz., at age 83, dazzled a generation of basketball fans with his halfcourt hook shots and his wit as a longtime member of the Harlem Globetrotters.

title: Review: In River, Stellan Skarsgard Is a Cop Searching for Answers
description: The cop-with-a-gimmick series and the cop-who-broods series are often different animals. In the first, the lead character has some sort of investigatory superpower  Carrie Wellss total recall in Unforgettable, for instance. In the second, the lead character spends a lot of time brooding, often over a whiskey glass, about an ex-wife, estranged children, a botched case or all three.

title: Saudi Arabia, Squeezed by Low Oil Prices, Cuts Spending to Shrink Deficit
description: Pressured by low oil prices and costly wars in the Middle East, Saudi Arabia announced a sharp reduction in its 2016 budget on Monday to control a worsening deficit, which is steadily draining the kingdoms financial reserves.

title: Christmas Brings Big Sales for Adele, Millions of Streams for the Beatles
description: For the music business, this Christmas was all about the Beatles and Adele.

title: TasteMasters Tokyo: Video 1
description: Johathan Soble, Yuko Hasegawa and Hiroyuki Sasaki discuss whose point of view is privileged when determining consumer taste. Discover other pairings and learn more at nytimes.com/tastemasters.

title: Destructive Long-Termism
description: One of my long-running gripes about much discussion of current economic issues is about what I consider the long-run dodge. By this I mean the attempt to change the subject away from unemployment and inadequate demand toward supposedly more fundamental issues of education and structural reform. Such efforts to change the subject seem to me to be both wrong and, to some extent, cowardly. After all, if the clear and present problem is inadequate demand, then we should have policies to deal with that problem  I dont care how important you think the long run is, we should deal with the crisis at hand.

title: Armory Drops One Fair, Amid Move to Cultural Programs
Milwaukee Art Museum Reinvigorates With Renovations
description: MILWAUKEE  The architect Santiago Calatravas addition to the Milwaukee Art Museum, completed in 2001, quickly became the symbol of this Midwestern city, plastered prominently on the official tourism website.

title: For Many Shows, A Happy Holiday Week at Broadway Box Office
description: Its the most wonderful time of the year  especially if youre a producer on Broadway, where a handful of shows saw record-setting ticket sales last week.

title: In the Twin Cities, Local Leaders Wield Influence Behind the Scenes
description: MINNEAPOLIS  A nondescript conference room on the 38th floor of Minneapoliss tallest skyscraper bears little resemblance to the brick clubhouse a few blocks away where members of the local elite have gathered for more than a century.

title: The Latest in Science Fiction and Fantasy
description: Somewhere during China Mivilles short new novel, THIS CENSUS-TAKER (Del Rey, $24), longtime Miville readers are going to wonder exactly what theyre reading. On the surface this is the story of a troubled boy raised by troubled parents in a troubled town, all very slice of life. The moment readers should realize theyve got something different on their hands comes a little before Page 163, when the census taker of the title shows up. And then theyll be wrong again.

title: Matt Barnes Suspended After Clash With Knicks Derek Fisher
description: The N.B.A. suspended forward Matt Barnes of the Memphis Grizzlies for two games Monday for his role in a physical altercation in October with Derek Fisher, the coach of the Knicks.

title: Review: Douglas W. Shadles Orchestrating the Nation
description: At its Carnegie Hall premiere in 1893, Antonin Dvoraks last symphony was hailed as a new dawn for music in the United States. To W. J. Henderson, the critic for The New York Times, it suggested Manifest Destiny in sound. Dvorak had reimagined Native American and African-American tunes as folk music, creating a symphony that throbs with American feeling, which voiced the melancholy of our Western wastes, and predicts their final subjection to the tremendous activity of the most energetic of all peoples.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: treatment

title: Learning ABCs Under the Trees
description: A school nestled among the towering trees of the University of Washington Botanic Gardens.

title: Yankees Acquire Aroldis Chapman, a Potent Arm With Baggage in Hand
description: When the Yankees acquired the Cincinnati Reds All-Star closer, Aroldis Chapman, on Monday, the cost was rock bottom in baseball terms: four minor leaguers, none of them top prospects.

title: Zika Virus, a Mosquito-Borne Infection, May Threaten Brazils Newborns
description: A surge in the number of infants born with tiny brains has led Brazils health ministry to warn pregnant women to take extreme measures to avoid mosquito bites, which may infect them with a recently arrived virus. Some prominent obstetricians in Brazil now advise women against becoming pregnant at all.

title: An Effort to Give Women a Voice in the Republican Party
description: WASHINGTON  For Sarah Chamberlain, president of the Republican Main Street Partnership, it is lonely at the top.

title: Immigrant Father Hopes to Improve From His Mistakes
description: Nine months after he moved to the United States with his two sons, Henry Casilla called their mother in the Dominican Republic and told her some distressing news: The boys had been taken away by a New York City agency and placed in foster care.

title: Wish List for a New Chairman at Carnegie Hall
description: It could almost be a high-powered personals ad: World-famous concert hall seeking new chairman of the board, someone with a passion for the arts and a love of music who can generate substantial annual revenue and work effectively with a diverse set of stakeholders.

title: Donald Trump Calls Newspaper Publisher a Lowlife and Assails Chris Christie
description: Donald J. Trump unleashed a torrent of criticism at the publisher of an influential New Hampshire newspaper on Monday and at the papers preferred candidate, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey.

title: Review: Saint Nicolas at Trinity Wall Street
description: Audience participation takes an ecclesiastical turn in Brittens sumptuous cantata Saint Nicolas, featured at Trinity Church on Sunday during the first weekend of Trinity Wall Streets annual Twelfth Night Festival. At two key points in the work listeners are asked to become singers and join in traditional hymns inserted into the text, which was written by Eric Crozier, a longtime Britten collaborator.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing: Ramadi, Peyton Manning, Meadowlark Lemon
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York City Ballet Introduces Its Future With a Flurry of Nutcracker Debuts
description: How do you make your debut in roles as exalted as the Sugarplum Fairy and her cavalier in George Balanchines The Nutcracker? And how much does a debut performance count for? The questions recurred this Christmas season at New York City Ballet when the company  investing in its future  gave these parts as opportunities to a series of young dancers from the corps.

title: Ben Carson Chides Bill Clintons Treatment of Women
description: Ben Carson, asked about Bill Clintons treatment of women, on how children were affected by news reports of Mr. Clintons behavior as president.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Pictures of the Day: Spain and Elsewhere
description: Spain and More  Pictures of the Day

title: Dec. 28, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Spain, Syria, Istanbul and England.

title: Blue Man Group Shows a Sense of Fun at Astor Place Theater
description: The lights in the theaters entryway turn us all blue as soon as we walk through the door. Thats kind of charming, and so is the ridiculously upbeat song playing on speakers in the lobby bathrooms. The main lyric is the word bathroom, over and over. And over.

title: Israel and Brazil at Impasse Over Ambassador Appointment
description: JERUSALEM  Israel and Brazil are still engaged in a diplomatic standoff over Israels appointment of a former settler leader as its next ambassador to Braslia, and some Israeli officials signaled recently that they could take action if the appointment was not approved soon.

title: U.S. Attorney Booth Goodwin Steps Down; Prosecuted Coal Executive
description: After a mixed verdict in the criminal case against the former coal mining executive Donald L. Blankenship, the United States attorney in Charleston, W.Va., said on Monday that he would resign.

title: Hedge Funds Struggle With Steep Losses and High Expectations
description: When David Einhorn, the founder of Greenlight Capital, plays host to his investors at the American Museum of Natural History in January, his guests will sip cocktails and dine under a 94-foot blue whale in the Milstein Hall.

title: N.F.L. Playoff Picture: All the Week 17 Games That Matter for Your Team
description: Final week of tree diagrams representing the full range of outcomes for teams that are in or have a shot at the N.F.L. playoffs.

title: Melodies Night and Day in This Columbia Dorm
description: Just inside the entrance to River Hall, a Columbia University dormitory in northern Manhattan, is a suite that on the surface seems like a typical college residence.

title: Sudan Is a Waypoint on East Africans Trek to Europe
description: KHARTOUM, Sudan  He crossed the open plains of the border on foot more than a year ago.

title: Timeline of Tamir Rice Case
description: A grand jury declined on Monday to indict the police officers involved in the 2014 shooting death of 12-year-old Tamir Rice in Cleveland.

title: Suspected Boko Haram Attacks Kill Scores in Nigeria
description: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria  Dozens of people were killed and scores more wounded in bombings and other attacks in northern Nigeria on Monday and overnight Sunday, officials said.

title: Queens Bike Shop Offers Repairs and Camaraderie
description: On Roosevelt Avenue they knew him simply as Mexico. That was what his homemade business cards said, along with a picture of a bicycle and his phone number.

title: In Season of Returning, a Start-Up Tries to Find Homes for the Rejects
description: The Christmas gifts have been delivered, and Secret Santa is done.

title: As Demolition Looms, Slave Theaters Ownership Is Disputed
description: When Clarence Hardy was arrested on Dec. 4 for trespassing at the Slave Theater, where he had climbed atop the marquee above Fulton Street, it was the sixth time he had gone to jail for entering a property he claimed was his, and the Bedford-Stuyvesant communitys. In the 1980s and early 90s, the theater was a touchstone in the second wave of civil rights struggles.

title: 2 Bankers Charged With Creating A.T.M. Cards to Steal From Accounts
description: The 15 JPMorgan Chase bank accounts had a few things in common: They had high balances, there was little activity on them and they belonged to elderly clients  indeed, at least eight were dead.

title: Iran: Deaths From Swine Flu Rise
description: Deaths from a swine flu outbreak in Iran have more than tripled in the past three weeks to at least 112, Agence France-Presse said Monday, quoting the Iranian news media. Mohammad Mehdi Gouya, head of the Health Ministrys communicable diseases department, was quoted as saying the outbreak, which began in November, was under control and likely to diminish in coming days. He was also quoted as saying that nearly 1,200 people had been hospitalized with the sickness caused by the virus, known as H1N1. Iranian health officials said in early December that the virus had mostly affected people in the southern areas of Iran and that they feared it could spread to Tehran and provinces in the north and east. Swine flu is named for a virus that infects pigs, but the H1N1 strain spreads via human-to-human contact and escalated into a global pandemic in 2009 before it was controlled in 2010.

title: Start-Up With Bitcoin in Its DNA Stumbles on Fund-Raising Trail
description: The newest venture from Blythe Masters, until recently a star banker at JPMorgan Chase, appeared to be an overnight success story in the making.

title: John Duffy, a Composer Who Gave His Peers a Platform, Dies at 89
description: John Duffy, the founder and longtime director of Meet the Composer, an organization created to promote contemporary music and place composers in residence with American orchestras, died on Dec. 22 at his home in Norfolk, Va. He was 89.

title: Tom Coughlins Future With Giants Is Questioned After Embarrassing Loss
description: There was a new and palpable uneasiness in the Giants locker room late Sunday after the teams humiliating rout in Minnesota. It was the recognition among the players that they might have sealed the fate of Coach Tom Coughlin.

title: Evacuations Aim to Ease Path to Talks in Syria War
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Several hundred wounded militants and their families, from opposing sides of the war in Syria, were evacuated from besieged areas on Monday in a complex deal that involved busing and flying them to neighboring countries.

title: Captains of Industry, and Otherwise, Breaking Bread
description: Dinner is about to begin. Please take your seats. Lets save the speeches for later in the evening  and were going to keep them brief this year. That includes you, Bill Ackman.

title: Jets Move On to Play the Bills, With Layer Upon Layer of Intrigue
description: The Jets schedule was revealed, perused and then deconstructed, and what seemed predestined back in April  it had to, it had just had to  became undeniable on Sunday: that somehow, some way, a playoff berth would hinge on the outcome of their final game.

title: The Importance of Retaking Ramadi
description: Iraqis were celebrating on Monday and understandably so. After days of heavy fighting, their security troops, backed by American airstrikes, reportedly recaptured central Ramadi, a provincial capital 60 miles from Baghdad that was overrun by the Islamic State seven months ago.

title: Mayor Rahm Emanuel Cuts Trip to Cuba Short After Police Shooting in Chicago
description: Mayor Rahm Emanuel of Chicago, who has faced calls to resign amid an unrelenting outcry about the Police Departments handling of fatal shootings, has cut short a family vacation to Cuba and will return to the city, his office said Monday.

title: Lemmy Kilmister, the Hard-Living, Jagged Voice of Motrhead, Dies at 70
description: Ian Fraser Kilmister, the jagged-voiced heavy-metal singer and bassist known as Lemmy, who led the loud and fast British rock band Motrhead for decades, died on Monday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 70.

title: Maritime Repo Men: A Last Resort for Stolen Ships
description: MIRAGONE, Haiti  In Greece, Max Hardberger posed as an interested buyer, in Haiti as a port official, in Trinidad, a shipper. He has plied guards with booze and distracted them with prostitutes; spooked port police officers with witch doctors and duped night watchmen into leaving their posts. His goal: to get on board a vessel he is trying to retrieve and race toward the 12-mile line where the high seas begin and local jurisdiction ends.

title: Near Dallas, Residents Tally Tornadoes Devastation
description: GARLAND, Tex.  The back part of Stacie and Tony Crawfords house here is simply gone, a gaping wound, open to the elements. The garage roof blew away to who-knows-where. A wall fell on the 67 Mustang that he was restoring, and her assessment of the battered portion of the home that still stands was succinct: Its so bad, theres nothing to do but bulldoze it.

title: Michigan State Quarterback Connor Cook Carves a Legacy With Pluck and Persistence
description: DALLAS  Alabamas defense led the Football Bowl Subdivision with 46 sacks this season, but the Crimson Tide seemed to try to surpass that total in compliments directed at Michigan State quarterback Connor Cook on Monday.

title: Complimentary
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  This one made me laugh. Maybe Im easily amused but in a world with so many cares and worries, is that such a bad thing? Not only is Jeff Stillmans puzzle funny in a punny, hokey way, but its practically designed to make us feel better about ourselves. Where else in the paper can you train your brain and receive positive reinforcement at the same time?

title: Man Is Charged in Murder of Woman Found Stabbed in Queens Park
description: A Brooklyn man was arrested on murder charges on Monday in the slashing of a Queens woman whose body was found in a park in October.

description: For decades to come, Antarctica is supposed to be protected as a scientific preserve. But an array of countries are eager to assert greater influence.

description: Celebrate the slow postholiday return of regular television programming with Almost Genius, Booze Traveler and What Would You Do?

description: NEW YORK

description: The Texas teenager who was given probation after killing four people while driving drunk has been detained by the Mexican authorities after disappearing this month, according to CNN and television and newspaper reports in the Dallas-Fort Worth area.

title: Koreas Comfort Women: The Fight to Be Heard
description: After hearing about Korean women who were forced to serve as sex slaves for the Japanese Army during World War II, Yunghi Kim photographed survivors struggling to get their stories heard.

title: Koreas Comfort Women: The Fight to Be Heard
description: Yunghi Kim was raised by her grandmother in South Korea while the country was still recovering from the Korean War. Her parents moved to the United States when she was a year old in search of better economic opportunities and sent for her a decade later.

title: Keeping the Lights On During a Dark Time
description: In 1989, Michelle Sandy left her home in Trinidad and came to New York in search of better opportunities. Instead, she found closed doors and few options because of her status as an undocumented immigrant. Its very hard not having your green card, said Ms. Sandy, who is now 45. You cant do what you want to do.

title: Verbatim: Expert Witness
description: An ideal system of justice uses evidence to inform decisions  but sometimes, that evidence needs interpretation. In such cases, we call upon people with expertise to offer clarity and context. The key question then becomes What qualifies as expertise? This episode of my Op-Docs series Verbatim, which re-enacts legal transcripts word-for-word, explores one case in which the answer to that question fell particularly short of the ideal.

title: Los Angeles, a City of Better Angels
description: Los Angeles  MANY California winters ago, on a December day in 1870, a lynch mob surrounded the city jail here. Demanding justice, the crowd dragged a man named Michel Lachenais from his cell to a nearby lumberyard, where a noose was fitted around his neck and tied to a crossbeam.

title: Donald Trumps Unstoppable Virality
description: DONALD J. TRUMP has said and done a lot of outlandish, polarizing things in 2015  running for president first among them.

title: Americas Empty Embassies
description: Minneapolis  AS the last year has demonstrated, Americas struggle to defend its national interests cannot be won by military force alone. Even as the campaigns against the Islamic State and the Taliban have faltered, American diplomats have made remarkable progress across a number of fronts, from climate change to checking Irans nuclear ambitions.

title: The Great Christmas Strike of 1906

title: New Yorks ID Card Deserves Respect
description: New York Citys municipal ID card has been a resounding success. More than 700,000 residents have received one since the program began last January. With the card, called IDNYC, as government-issued photo identification, they can open bank accounts, enter schools and other government buildings, use the library and identify themselves to police officers. The card also comes with many side benefits  like free memberships to museums, concert halls and other cultural institutions, and entertainment and pharmacy discounts  that have made it appealing to a wide swath of New Yorkers, rich, poor and in between.

title: Ted Cruzs Simple, Radical Tax Plan
description: Like Rand Paul before him, Ted Cruz is promoting a tax plan that relies heavily on a value-added tax, or VAT. And like Mr. Paul, Mr. Cruz is not calling his VAT a VAT.

title: Are Primary Polls Finally Predictive? No, but This Is When the Fun Starts
description: You have undoubtedly heard that primary polls arent necessarily very predictive far from an election. With just a month to go until the Iowa caucuses, Im writing to tell you that ... its still true.

title: Ehud Olmerts Sentence in Bribery Case Is Cut to 18 Months
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli Supreme Court reduced a prison sentence for Ehud Olmert, a former Israeli prime minister, on Tuesday to 18 months from six years after overturning the main part of his conviction on bribery charges.

title: Investing in Ukraines Future
description: Just over a year ago, President Obama signed into law the Ukraine Freedom Support Act, which provided congressional backing to sanctions on Russia following the Kremlins illegal annexation of Crimea and invasion of eastern Ukraine. Since then, sanctions have hurt Russias economy and prevented individuals in President Vladimir V. Putins inner circle from traveling to the West. The Obama administration should be commended for sustaining a successful sanctions regime.

title: In Guinea, a Hard-Won Victory Over Ebola
description: The World Health Organization announced Tuesday morning that Guinea was free of Ebola virus transmission for the first time since the epidemic was detected there in March 2014.

title: Preschool Without Walls

His classmate Stelyn Carter, 5, likes to be quiet and listen to birds  crows, owls and chickadees, as she put it. And for Joshua Doctorow, 4, the best part of preschool just may be the hat he loves to wear to class (black and fuzzy, with flaps that come down over his ears).

title: Discogs Turns Record Collectors Obsessions Into Big Business
description: BEAVERTON, Ore.  In the beginning, Kevin Lewandowski just wanted a way to keep track of his techno records.

description: WASHINGTON  Even as the Obama administration scrambles to confront the Islamic State and a resurgent Taliban, an old enemy seems to be reappearing in Afghanistan: Qaeda training camps are sprouting up there, forcing the Pentagon and American intelligence agencies to assess whether they could again become a breeding ground for attacks on the United States.

title: Belgium Arrests 2 Linked to New Years Eve Plot to Attack Brussels
description: PARIS  The Belgian authorities have arrested two people in connection with a plot to attack Brussels around New Years Eve, prosecutors said on Tuesday.
